description:
If you love the idea of making your living by crunching data to get amazing client outcomes, then come join us. We're not ashamed to admit that we're data geeks. Everyone from the CEO to our consultants and admin staff live and breathe data. Plus, we offer a really cool space to work in, great benefits and rewards ... and most importantly an awesome team with more talented data and analytics people than you can point an algorithm at.
We are looking for Business Analysts with a strong background in Business Intelligence and Data Warehousing to liaise with all business units and stakeholders to provide direction in determining specific area and/or departmental BI needs. You will require a mix of proven business acumen and sound technical abilities, and the ability to lead users in an information exchange that captures information in business terminology and translates to drive technical design.

Essential Skills and Experience

At least 5 years of experience in business intelligence with sound understanding of the concepts of business intelligence including data warehousing.
3 years’ experience working with business units determining BI and reporting needs.
Demonstrated technical aptitude for working with BI software packages and data sources.
Excellent consulting and internal customer service skills.
Solid knowledge and minimum of 2 years’ experience with SQL.
Skilled strategic communicator to present and explain concepts and ideas, build strong linkages with team members using various vehicles of communication to share information, write/edit business cases/briefing notes and technical reports on recommendations related to technology solutions and plans; present recommendations to managers and directors.

Infoready Consultants have the opportunity to deliver Data and Analytics solutions for tier one clients that include some of Australia's leading enterprises across the Financial Services, Utilities, Telco, Retail and Government sectors. With offices in Melbourne, Sydney and Brisbane we specialise in making organisations smarter by transforming data into actionable intelligence through our unique application of our expert team, processes and technology.
We would consider contractor opportunities if you have a strong skills match.

title: Data Analyst

description:
Do you thrive in a hyper-growth environment that challenges a wide array of professional skills? Do you want to make a difference by uncovering strategic information that will influence business decisions? If so, come join our team.
Marketing Evolution is the recognized leader (as confirmed by Forrester in March 2018) in measuring and optimizing media strategies and plans. With an impressive list of blue-chip customers, the company has a stable base, and significant growth. We are growing at double-digit rates, and raised capital earlier this year to accelerate growth to triple digits.
We’re looking for a Business Analyst who thrives in a start-up culture and loves critical thinking. This role is about providing the metrics and analysis that will help guide strategic business decisions for customers.
Successful Business Analyst characteristics include:
Strong quantitative skills, with an ability to analyze and interpret complex sets of data and information
Solid communication (both verbal and written) and interpersonal skills.
Relentless attention to detail and accuracy.
A sense of urgency in executing work, sometimes under tight deadlines, and the ability to manage multiple projects.
Strong interest in marketing analytics, and in using technology to make the best use of the analytics.
Willingness to find and develop efficiencies in process and data delivery; when a repeatable task arises, contribute to building a system that efficiently improves the process.
An ongoing desire to go beyond project-specific work, be creative, and bring new ideas to the table to improve the overall data management and analytics process.
Strong desire and appreciation for being part of a growing team that:
Strives to go the extra mile and over-achieve.
Recognizes and rewards outstanding performers.
Is committed to company and personal growth and development.
Responsibilities:
Manage and develop reporting and insights that drive executive marketing dashboards and read-outs used for marketing optimization, and the execution of ad-hoc analytics and reporting projects of varying size and scope with quick turnaround
Ensure that other teams in Marketing Evolution as well as external suppliers deliver their contributions in time and meet the quality specifications.
Make sure all deliverables meet or exceed the customer’s expectations; be an internal ambassador for the customers.
Support Value Stream Managers in the Project management for preparing dashboards and read-outs, amongst others through project administration in Jira.
Support the Value Stream Manager in all communication with customers (including project updates, dashboard contents and read-outs)
Requirements
We’re looking for an intelligent, highly-motivated individual, who is able to succeed in a fast-moving company and industry. The candidate must be a self-starter who can see the goal and execute against it.
Bachelor's degree required.
Extremely flexible, motivated, proactive, highly organized, ability to shift priorities, and able to multi-task.
Team player with a high sense of urgency.
Eager to learn and build a strong foundation for long-term career growth and success
Solid communication (both verbal and written) and interpersonal skills
Strong quantitative skills, with an ability to analyze and interpret complex sets of data and information accurately
Advanced Microsoft Excel and formatting skills.
Experience with state of the art analytics, documentation and communication tools
Affinity with marketing and media
Experience with customer facing roles
title: Business Analyst

description:
Overview of job
This role sits at a pivotal cross roads of client and product solutions. As a Data Analyst you will be responsible for leading a team of experts in developing award winning business and marketing data solutions for some of Australia’s most recognised businesses. This will involve the management of both your team and client relationships to drive maximum value of your clients media mix and new insights developed for smarter planning and business management.
Reporting of the role
This role reports to the Advanced Analytics Director
3 best things about the job:
A client & product leadership role in one of Sydney’s most successful agencies
Entrepreneurial role, focused on both efficiency and growth
A truly supportive culture, with fantastic people focused on success
Measures of success –
In three months:
Have developed senior relationships with the client and be seen as a trusted advisor and the ‘go to’ person for advice and support on their business.
Clearly articulate and understand the clients business and their needs in relation to advanced analytics.
Identified areas of product development to continue the success of our advanced analytics team.
Developed strong relationships with all team members and outlined a future development plan for individuals.
Have begun to take senior level responsibility for the delivery of the team’s projects
In six months:
Be able to work independently and in collaboration with your team on new business pitches, developing key learnings and insights for future clients.
Be confident in identifying and converting strategically relevant revenue opportunities for MediaCom and our clients.
In 12 months:
Proven success in delivering efficiencies and growth for our clients using advanced analytics and data science techniques
Positively evolved the team and ensured that their professional development needs are met
Demonstrably improved the Advanced Analytics operations of the agency as a whole through commercial or product success.
Responsibilities of the role:
Run the operations of your Advanced Analytics team – managing a team of 3-4 specialists
In collaboration with the Director, develop a vision, roadmap and deliver effective advanced analytics for our clients.
Understand the role of a media and advertising agency and explicity understand the role of MediaCom as a business partner for our clients.
Be a leader for your team and guide the rest of the agency in the evolution of our analytics solutions for clients
Provide training, support and direction for your team
Act as thought leader in the data science and analytics space to sense check viability of ideas/innovations and also identify opportunities with our existing clients for greater data and analytical innovation.
Develop and maintain positive relationships with key personnel internally and externally for the benefit of your team, clients and the development of our product.
Own your teams work and develop action plans across your clients’ projects that work to continuously improve performance.
Ensure the team are delivering quality work and respecting deadlines.
Manage the resource of your team and its profitability against each client scope.
Be curious and constantly seek to improve
What you will need:
4+ years’ experience in data modelling/Visualisation across a range of industries
Knowledge of 1 or more of: Python, R, SQL, JavaScript
Experience in predictive modelling, testing and communicating results.
Be an effective presenter. Have well-developed written and verbal skills.
Have a proven track record in developing solid relationships with clients
Have a proven track record for delivering ROI for clients
Hands on implementation and optimisation experience
Project management and product development experience
Business development experience – upsell, cross sell, new business
Ability to build strong partnerships with stakeholders (internal and external)
Previous experience of managing a small to medium sized team
Ability to train and develop others
A passion for continual learning
About MediaCom Australia
MediaCom is the “The Content + Connections Agency”, working on behalf of its clients to leverage their brands’ entire system of communications across paid, owned and earned channels to step change their business outcomes. MediaCom is one of the world’s leading media communications specialists, with billings exceeding US$33 billion (Source: RECMA 2015). It employs 6,500 people in 125 offices across 100 countries around the globe. Its client roster includes P&G, VW Group, Dell and Universal. In 2015, MediaCom was recognised by RECMA as the leading global agency network in its Network Diagnostics report, and also was the first agency network to top all 3 key RECMA reports across EMEA. Also in 2015, MediaCom has been awarded Media Agency of the Year

About GroupM Australia

GroupM leads and shapes media markets by delivering performance enhancing media products and services, powered by data and technology. Our global network agencies and businesses enable our people to work collaboratively across borders with the best in class, providing them the opportunity to accelerate their progress and development. We are not limited by teams or geographies; our scale and diverse range of clients lets us be more adventurous with our business and talent. We give our talent the space, support and tools to innovate and grow.

Discover more about GroupM at www.groupm.com
Follow @GroupMAPAC on Twitter
Follow GroupM on LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/company/groupm

GroupM APAC is committed to fostering a culture of diversity and inclusion. Our people are our strength so we respect and nurture their individual talent and potential.

Airtasker is a fast-growing online and mobile marketplace for local services and temporary labour.
We are revolutionising the way people and businesses get more done by connecting real time labour requirements with one of the world's most under-utilised assets - people power.

Airtasker has big ambitions and recently raised $33M worth of funding as we go international , with UK being the first country to plant our flag! We are building a talented team with opportunities to make a real impact in a hyper-growth and solutions-oriented start-up workplace.

description:
If you love the idea of making your living by crunching data together to get amazing client outcomes, then come join us. Infoready are part of Arq Group and we deliver insights for many of Australia’s leading organisations across a diverse cross section of industries. What You Get To Do. From design thinking, leading mobile apps, cloud and analytical insights, digital marketing, to web design.

Arq Group is Australia’s leading digital partner. #LifeatArq Our people are our greatest asset. Curiosity is in our DNA. Courage is in our hearts.

And collaboration is at our core. “Our Ways” set us apart from others in how we deliver to our customers and work together. From wellness programs, learning and development, social calendars to coffee machines, and more. We've got something for everyone to be themselves.

Did we also mention how much fun it is to work with other Arqadians? And yes, it is true; we love what we do. Join Arq Group and find your space to (change). At Arq Group, we unleash the possibilities between business and people.

#Infoready
title: Data Analyst Infosphere

description:
Job no: FMG-941205 Work type: Full time, Fixed term Location: Sydney Group: Financial Management Group Division: Finance

Join our team as a Data Analyst and help us deliver on a significant book of work that is crucial to the Group. The role will reward you if you can use your initiative to help drive maturity into the reporting functionality and deliver improvements within that space. This is a unique opportunity for you to help us make better data-driven decisions and deliver a more informed, more agile Finance function.
You will develop an intimate understanding of the flow of data through the organisation and contribute to the design of the Macquarie Corporate data model and framework having regard for business and regulatory drivers. You will also work with IT to on-board and embed tools that enable an analytical approach to data and lead efforts to continually improve the quality of data across Finance platforms. In addition, you will interrogate and investigate the Data Warehouse to deliver an improved reporting & analysis toolkit, supporting strategic decision- making across the broader organisation.
You will have an ability to manage your workload to effectively deal with competing demands along with strong technical skills including relational databases, data modelling, data warehousing , SQL, Excel, data lakes and further exposure to Alteryx &/or PowerBI ( or other ). You will also have an ability to concisely share data insights in both the spoken and written form, along with a proven ability to work across all levels of stakeholders and build relationships quickly. Your strong analytical, problem solving and solution design skills, coupled with your experience within Finance and/or product knowledge of financial instruments, will ensure you are successful in this role. An understanding of Enterprise Data Management and data quality concepts would be desirable but not a necessity for this role.

The Financial Management Group provides financial, tax and treasury services to all areas of Macquarie. The group is focused on providing strategic analysis and advice to Macquarie's businesses and senior management, managing Macquarie's funding, liquidity and capital position, ensuring Macquarie continues to meet regulatory and compliance obligations and managing Macquarie's corporate communications and investor relations.
Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.
We facilitate a range of flexible working arrangements within our teams. Talk to us about what flexibility may be available.
title: Data Analyst

description:
PMO Financial Analyst -Project


Sydney CBD Location
3 Month Contract
Government Department

The role:
The PMO Financial Analyst will provide the overall management and governance of all the financials relating to the projects within the Major Projects Portfolio. This includes managing the portfolio and project budgets with appropriate forecasting. There is also a need to ensure there is an appropriate financial model that shows the forecasts as the projects progress and adherence to budget for each of the projects.

Responsibilities


Financial Analysis – Provide solid financial analysis, planning and performance tracking for the projects within the portfolio of Major IT Infrastructure projects, including;
Prepare the detailed processes for receiving the financial inputs from the teams.
Coordinate the preparation, collation and submission of project forecasts and budgets each month.
Review the monthly expenditure tracking reports and prepare executive analysis
Follow up on cost centre/project manager queries (both dollars and effort), and prepare adjustment journals where required
Review / Prepare month end journals such as Group IT accruals and journal adjustments as well as change requests for the projects when required and report for the Board.
Stakeholder Management - Engage with key stakeholders across the organisation to ensure business requirements, objectives and key deliverables are met

Required Skills


Finance Analyst experience in a major end-to-end business process re-engineering or transformation initiative.
Similar role in major Information Technology delivery projects ensuring solution enables business processes.
5+ years of Data Modelling, Finance Experience.
State Government experienced is an advantage.

If you are interested, please APPLY NOW!

With offices in Melbourne, Sydney and Brisbane we specialise in making organisations smarter by transforming data into actionable intelligence through our unique application of our expert team, processes and technology.
We would consider contractor opportunities if you have a strong skills match.
#Infoready
title: Data Business Analyst

description:
Business Analyst

Be part of an industry leading organisation that spans multiple locations and market sectors
Identify opportunities to build new and innovative technology solutions for the organisation
Work within a geographically dispersed IT team
The Opportunity

For this exciting newly created role we are looking for a proactive, analytically and solutions focussed Business Analyst to analyse the current state and help create innovative, highly usable solutions by bridging the gap between internal clients, technology enabled process change and solution delivery. You will join our National Information & Digital team working in close partnership with our Technology Solutions Lead and Platforms/Development teams.

About You

As the Business Analyst, your responsibilities will include:

Detect gaps in processes, identify innovation and optimisation opportunities to facilitate and lead process change meetings with key stakeholders
Effectively gather and document requirements, design business processes, align solutions to business objectives and support the delivery of the change through the project lifecycle
Facilitate relationships between Business and Technology teams to identify opportunities for improvement in business operations and processes
Review and manage business test lifecycles from User Acceptance through to Post Implementation
Manage the work stream requirements, project inter-dependencies, risks and issues
Be in involved in the design or modification of business systems or IT Systems
Interact with the business stakeholders and subject matter experts to identify gaps then gather, document and analyse business needs and requirements to design technical solutions
Document the functional and, as needed technical design of the solutions
Interact with system architects and developers to ensure the system is properly implemented
Coordinate testing of solution system and create system documentation and user manuals
The successful candidate will have at least 5 years’ experience in a Business Analyst role, and will possess a combination of the following technical skills, attributes and experience:

Bachelor’s Degree or Equivalent experience
Start-up or Consulting experience highly preferred
Expert level process diagramming and understanding of ITIL processes
Have deep experience in change process and stakeholder alignment
Intermediate knowledge of SQL schemas, queries and data dictionaries
Intermediate usage of Excel including Macros, VLookups, Index Lookups
Intermediate to advanced design experience with SharePoint, OneDrive, Workflows, and Flow
Ability to utilise Microsoft Project to create project plans and linked projects
Exposure to JIRA for work management
Ability to prioritise work and deliver to tight deadlines
Ability to create end to end process flows and identify key areas of optimization and inefficiencies.
Effective communication with project stakeholders
Ability to engage with stakeholders and work with SME's on detailed requirements and business process design
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Who We Are

Urbis is a market-leading built environment consultancy that shapes the cities and communities of Australia for a better future. Drawing together a network of the brightest minds, Urbis consists of practice experts, working collaboratively to deliver fresh thinking and independent advice and guidance – all backed up by real, evidence-based solutions.
Why Urbis?

Urbis is a firm that truly values its people and provides a broad range of benefits which include a competitive remuneration package, salary continuance insurance, regular social activities, health and wellbeing programs and ongoing training and professional development opportunities. To find out more about us visit our website at www.urbis.com.au/careers.

Urbis is committed to fostering a work environment that is inclusive, supports flexibility, and welcomes diversity.
title: Business Analyst

description:
About us:

Alinta Energy supplies natural gas and electricity to 1 Million homes and businesses throughout Australia. Our mission of ‘keeping it fair’ is underpinned by its values of affordability, simplicity, efficiency, and environmental friendliness. With a focus on providing exceptional customer service, and reducing energy expenses, Alinta Energy continues to grow.

The Role:

We are looking for a Business Analyst based out of Sydney for a 6 Months Max Term Contract. The primary objective of the role is to liaise with multiple business units (including East Coast, West Coast, Wholesale, Retail, Finance) to understand, gather and document requirements for financial forecasting models, and to re-design the models in Excel to a standard and replicable format.

In parallel to this program of model re-design, this position is responsible to trace all data inputs and outputs from the forecasting models to their source with definitions agreed and documented to ensure standardisation of terms and calculations across Alinta. This position will then work closely with Solution Architects / BI Developers / Analysts to transfer these models into an online forecasting tool to deliver efficient, effective, sustainable and valuable outcomes for the business.

Candidates with expertise using complex Excel models would be highly regarded.

The key responsibilities would include:

Actively gather, elicit, analyse and understand business requirements for forecasting model solutions, from both end-user/consumer and data/developer perspectives
Translate and document business requirements into technical specifications and modelled solutions
Capture, document, analyse and revise (where appropriate) current and proposed high level business processes related to the requirements
Estimate timing of tasks required to complete the solution, and develop project plan(s) accordingly
Co-ordinate all facets of user acceptance testing, including test cases and test plans
Facilitate the acceptance process, ensuring the deliverables are built and delivered according to the agreed requirements
Engage and manage stakeholders and related communications throughout the delivery cycle, including regular status updates
With reference to the ‘as-is’ model, identify gaps that limit or constrain the ability to deliver forecasting solutions & map out a plan of action for improvement opportunities
Core Competencies:

Tertiary level qualification in finance, business, IT, information management or similar
Proven stakeholder management capability
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, directed to end-users/consumers, technical teams or management at all levels in the organisation
At least 3 years of experience in a Finance or Business Analyst role
Technical knowledge of requirements gathering, process documentation, project planning, testing methodologies, change management methodologies
Technical expertise of complex Excel models and best practice
Sound technical specification writing/documentation skills
Strong problem solving, decision making and analysis skills
Highly developed critical thinking, with ability to distil complex information into clear and concise concepts
Proven customer service focus
Working knowledge of forecasting processes (e.g. data acquisition and input, driver identification, output extraction, integration etc.)
Ability to deal with ambiguity and changing priorities; resilience
What’s in it for you?

It’s an exciting time to join Alinta, we are growing fast and need people who want to grow with us. This role will offer you a foot in the door to a meritocratic culture that could lead down various career paths building an extremely bright future for yourself!

Work with people that know success first hand, that share your passion. The energy is infectious as new growth lands and ideas flow. There are many new directions we are taking and it’s exciting. Choose this path and know your career will accelerate at Alinta Energy.

Let’s spread the positive energy together…

Click “APPLY” to submit your application. Closing Date:
title: Business Analyst

description:
At HP our vision is to make life better for everyone, everywhere. Our mission is to create experiences that amaze—through the people we hire, the technology we create and enable, and the lasting impact we have on the communities we serve. We are a proven leader in personal systems and printing, delivering innovations that empower people to create, interact, and inspire like never before.
We’re looking for visionaries who are ready to make an impact on the way the world works. At HP, the future’s yours to create!
As our Business Analyst for the Enterprise Personal Systems group, you will have the opportunity to:-
Work closely with our business leaders to develop business plans based on both historical and forecasted data and reports
Manage complex data and business analyses to develop business plans and make recommendations
Construct models to deploy sales quota effectively
Revenue, GM and Sales Metric tracking files and complex analyses
Define the metrics required to measure business performance, comparing actual data to forecasted values, and developing processes for identifying and addressing performance gaps
Manage complex compensation research requests and synthesize data and information to identify relevant issues and actions
Work with cross-functional teams across the entire span of business planning activities
Contribute to priority projects with complex analyses and assist in developing recommendations
Identify cutting-edge analytical tools, models, and methods for making key business decisions
Contribute to proactive and reactive business planning activities
Make decision-making implications which may extend beyond immediate function and may impact the business directly
To be successful in this role you should have:-
University degree in Business Management, Accounting, Economics or Commerce
Related work experience
In-depth knowledge of operational processes, industry trends, and customer/partner requirements
Strong business experience in multiple process areas with excellent project management and process development skills; ability to drive process improvements using industry standard quality improvements tools and concepts.
Strong project management skills such as planning, execution and implementation
Demonstrated knowledge of research methodology and the ability to manage complex data requests
Excellent analytical thinking, technical analysis, and data manipulation skills
Extensive knowledge of Excel, and financial modelling
Extensive knowledge in creating Power BI reports
Ability to identify and summarize relevant trends from market and industry data
Self-motivated, resilient and results driven
title: Enterprise PC Business Analyst

description:
Job no: FMG-941576 Work type: Full time, Fixed term Location: Sydney Group: Financial Management Group Division: Finance

Join our team as a Data Analyst working on business as usual tasks to help us drive data quality in a high-profile, change-oriented team. As part of our Financial Management Group, you will be working closely with senior members of Finance team, the “Data Provider” business teams and the “Data Consumer” reporting teams to drive data quality and timeliness in the corporate data warehouse.
In this role you will be cooperating with all stakeholders including Data Integrity Officers operating group and their support teams, and collating data quality issues and driving remediation with DIO, business teams and data users. This role will provide a fantastic opportunity by working on data projects and coordinating business engagement, assisting the project team with business data processes, understanding and assessing impacts of proposed changes to systems, as well as products and processes all relating to data “Provider” or “Consumer” or central data warehouse.
This role will suit you if you have a strong desire to work with business and technology teams, coupled with the ability to work across all levels of stakeholders and build networks fast. You are analytical, able to solve problems quickly, as well as logical and efficient with keen attention to detail. You possess excellent written and oral communication, have an organised and focussed work ethic and experience working in team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Your technical skills and qualifications will include tertiary degree and experience within the financial services industry, an understanding of Enterprise Data Management and data quality concepts and prior exposure to Business Intelligence tool such as Alteryx and PowerBI will be an advantage.
If this sounds like the opportunity you have been waiting for, please apply today.
The Financial Management Group provides financial, tax and treasury services to all areas of Macquarie. The group is focused on providing strategic analysis and advice to Macquarie's businesses and senior management, managing Macquarie's funding, liquidity and capital position, ensuring Macquarie continues to meet regulatory and compliance obligations and managing Macquarie's corporate communications and investor relations.
Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.
We facilitate a range of flexible working arrangements within our teams. Talk to us about what flexibility may be available.
title: Data Analyst

description:
About the Company
Since the late 1980s, NetStrategy has cemented our position as Australia’s leading technology specialists in the education sector. As Australia’s largest, most comprehensive education consulting and managed services practice, we have unmatched specialist knowledge of the sector from thousands of engagements over three decades.

About the Role
We are looking for an Application Support & Data Analyst with an interest in development, who is process driven, yet adaptive and flexible, to support a range of challenging client facing applications.
You would need to be familiar with ITIL processes and competent in both T-SQL and procedural programming. You would be working as part of a small but very focused and committed team responsible for delivering high quality and very responsive work in a large organization. Your communication skills, your commitment to quality, and your responsiveness must all be excellent.

Key Responsibilities:
Management and resolution of Level 2 and some level 3 support tickets
Maintaining application support documentation and knowledge bases
Liaising with system owners to resolve and/or develop solutions to technical and business issues
Liaising with software vendors to escalate issues and coordinate implementation of platform version upgrades as required
Monitoring the performance of the systems and databases and addressing issues raised or risks identified
Identifying reporting needs and building reports using SQL, Crystal Reports or SSRS to simplify and enhance the business operational procedures
Maintaining awareness of the potential impact of project work on the application environment, conducting comprehensive system testing prior to release and provision of impact assessments as required
Participating in software selection process, planning and implementation of any new solutions

Essential Requirements:
Strong ITIL incident, request and problem management skills
Experience with development and maintenance of Crystal Reports, SSRS and SSIS packages and ETL data integration
Experience with writing, maintaining and understanding complex SQL queries and stored procedures
Experience in extracting and analyzing data, and developing reports to communicate key insights

Beneficial Experience but non-essential:
Experience / Familiarity with multiple development environments and ability to read and understand code in any language (development skills not necessary)
Experience with SharePoint site management
Experience with working large volumes of data e.g in Datawarehouses or DataLakes

We enjoy the trust and confidence of our clients and as such we are seeking a motivated, confident individual with a high degree of personal integrity.

Note:
Applications only open to those with full Australian Work Rights. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
title: Application Support & Data Analyst

description:
Use your technical skills to increase funding for childhood cancer research
Independent national charity entering an exciting period of growth
Based in Rosebery, competitive salary + access to NFP salary packaging


Benefits & Culture

Generous salary packaging provisions
Flexible working arrangements
Professional development opportunities
Passionate team who love their work
Close to public transport
Based in a new upcoming area of cafés, dining and fashion outlets


The Role

You will develop and execute a strategic approach to the analysis and interpretation of data, contributing to the achievement of fundraising, marketing and communication initiatives for The Kids’ Cancer Project. In addition to providing high level data analysis and reporting, you will implement an effective data strategy and facilitate best practice data and donor relationship management including:

Ensuring the Raiser’s Edge CRM system is leveraged to its fullest potential
Developing processes and procedures to ensure all staff are trained and using Raiser’s Edge effectively
Working collaboratively with team members to identify and respond to all analytic reporting needs
Reviewing campaigns and ensuring accurate tracking and data capture
Extracting segmentation queries for all fundraising channels as required
Data modelling and predictive analysis to drive decisions relating to fundraising and communications
Identifying growth areas for the business and providing recommendations


Skills Required

You have a strong background in data analysis and data-driven marketing. Ideally you have previous experience in a fundraising environment with a good working knowledge of Raiser’s Edge or similar CRM software. Additionally you will have:

High level database administration – including data imports, exports, complex queries, data segmentation
Experience using and applying data modelling, analytics and visualisation tools
Working knowledge of SQL, Access, and advanced Excel techniques for data manipulation and extraction
Demonstrated ability to drive innovation
A ‘can do’ and collaborative approach
Experience working across multiple projects and project teams concurrently
Strong communication skills and the ability to build effective working relationships with internal and external stakeholders


About the Organisation
Organisation Name : The Kids' Cancer Project - via NGO Recruitment

The Kids’ Cancer Project is one of the largest funders of childhood cancer research in Australia. Since 1993, with strong community support, The Kids’ Cancer Project has been able to contribute tens of millions of dollars to scientific studies to help children with many types of cancer.

The organisation is now embarking on a new 5 year strategic plan which includes ambitious plans to significantly increase revenue streams and income to support bold science to improve childhood cancer treatments. The Kids’ Cancer Project’s vision is to see a one hundred per cent survival rate for children with cancer while eradicating the harmful impacts treatment can bring.
Apply for this Job

APPLY FOR THIS JOB

title: Data Analyst

description:
The Data Analyst, Systems and CRM Administrator is responsible for the provision of business analytical services to support the development and continuous improvement of stakeholder engagement and customer solutions. These activities include development and implementation of use training frameworks, customer service models and user tools in support of and to inform fundraising, engagement and relationship management initiatives of the Foundation.

Key Relationships:

CEO
Head of Fundraising
POWHF staff


Core Company Values

DEDICATION – committed to what we do and why we do it
ASPIRATION – seek to achieve the highest possible outcomes
RESPECT – treat each other with honesty and respect
TEAMWORK – support each other and work together to achieve common goals
PROFESSIONALISM – act ethically and professionally in all that we do
ACCOUNTABILITY – be accountable to each other, our donors and our supporters –
RECOGNITION – recognising those who support our vision.


Key Accountability Areas: Position Dimension and Relationships

Reports to CEO and HoF and involves all Foundation staff. This position is responsible for the provision of business analytical services with respect to training and stakeholder solutions for the Foundation’s CRM systems. This includes, but is not limited to, analysis, design, documentation and training; defining and managing solution scope; developing business cases and driving and fostering a culture of continuous improvement and benefits management. They will play a key role in collaborating with key stakeholders and refining the strategic direction of activities relating to the CRM system. They are responsible for establishing and maintaining effective customer focused working relationships, and will work proactively to identify and understand requirements, develop optimised solutions, and to effectively communicate and present these solutions.

Role Statement:

Under the broad direction of the ACEO and HoF they will:

Engage collaboratively with stakeholders to understand their relationship management needs as they relate to the use of the CRM system; review, identify, plan, document and execute the development of technical improvements to the system design and business processes to define the solution scope that meet these needs and align business with technology and the University’s strategic goals.
Review the proposals for Salesforce and Implementation Partners with a view of managing the implementation process
Review and identify improvements to the business processes and provide strategic advice that enables alignment of the system
Oversee the development and deployment of a training framework and stakeholder solutions appropriate to the needs of various stakeholders.
Supervise and provide effective leadership and guidance to team members, ensuring that all objectives and deadlines are met, supporting career development and knowledge sharing. Identify and contribute to the continuous improvement of team processes and practices to ensure that a consistent level of service quality and deliverables are provided in all aspects of work.
Undertake all business analysis activities to ensure deliverables are produced and delivered on time, developed according to defined standards whilst ensuring that chosen approaches, methodologies and recommendations are appropriate and cost effective.
Maintain technical knowledge and actively participate in CRM system user communities to ensure that knowledge of system functionality and the development pipeline is current and relevant to business needs.
Conduct workshops, focus groups, deliver presentations and provide training and advice to stakeholders and users with respect to business analysis and project coordination services as required.
Provide regular progress reports on all assigned work, advice on effort estimation of analysis activities and resource requirements.
Contribute to the development, review and implementation of strategic planning, best practice policy development and decision making processes.
Maintain knowledge of data privacy legislation and compliance with University policies relating to information/data management, and be responsible for applying this knowledge to system administration functions of the University’s CRM system.
Comply with all POWHF policies and procedures, and in particular those relating to work health and safety and equal opportunity.
Perform other duties consistent with the classification of the position, and in line with the principles of multiskilling


Skills and Attributes:

Two or more years’ experience working data analytical and CRM systems management role
Experience working on data migration, CRM implementation and systems management (preferred)
Demonstrated project management skills and the ability to work in a high performance environment, managing multiple tasks with defined budgets and conflicting deadlines
Demonstrated experience in budget management with a target driven approach Be able to work unsupervised and be an active team member
Well-developed written and interpersonal skills
Experience of working to tight deadlines and budgets
Ability to show innovative tactics in achieving goals
Genuine interest in the charity sector
A sense of Donor care and service
About the Organisation
Organisation Name : Prince of Wales Hospital Foundation

Prince of Wales Hospital Foundation Ltd (POWHF) is the established health promotion charity
supporting the Prince of Wales Hospital Randwick (POWH). Since 2004, POWHF has raised more than $30 million in cash and kind to advance the health of Australians by connecting generosity to innovation and excellence in patient care, research, education and health promotion at The Prince of Wales Hospital.

Led by Founding CEO, Associate Professor of Industry Leanne M Zalapa (Lulu), an engaged and involved Board of Directors and POWHF’s dedicated team work to build community and private partnerships, to raise vital funds and awareness for the continued development of health promotion, research, education, equipment and facilities and special projects at POWH.
Apply for this Job

APPLY FOR THIS JOB

Wendy Farrow; Director of Generosity (Head of Fundraising); 02 9382 4036; wendy@powhf.org.au

Please quote in application: Data Analyst, Systems and CRM Administrator via Pro Bono Australia.

description:
Government Department - Parramatta
Large Scale Finance Transformation Project
Excellent Pay Rate

A large Government department requires a Senior Finance Business Analyst to join their Parramatta based team. You will work within the Corporate Finance unit on an initial 6-month contract.

The Senior Finance Business Analyst will work with several diverse stakeholders across the department to document the Corporate Finance Optimisation Project (CFOP) initiation document. The CFOP project is the design and implementation to improve budget and financial management processes across the department.

To be considered for this exciting opportunity, you must be degree qualified and have experience working on large scale Finance projects.

Key Responsibilities:

Work end to end from project initiation, scoping, documenting all processes, tasks, data, gaps right through to vendor selection, implementation and working towards development of support structure

Provide value add Financial Analysis while adhering to tight deadlines

Undertake monthly performance reporting to the business reflecting the actual progress against targets

Prepare modelling, sensitivity analysis and "what if" scenario modelling

Documenting and modelling business processes (current and future state)

Liaise effectively with both IT and business stakeholders

Key Requirements:

Degree qualified in Commerce, Accounting or Finance

CA or CPA qualified advantageous

Demonstrated experience working on large scale Finance projects

Proficient in large ERP systems (SAP highly regarded)

Advanced documentation skills, ability to use Visio to document end to end processes, business requirements, problem statements and end user communications

If this sounds like the role for you or you would like further information, please apply now or contact Niall O'Connell on 02 9269 8831 for a confidential discussion.

be part of a large and growing organisation; true ownership and support focus, play a pivotal role in shaping and developing the key projects.

description:
Provide business and initiative support to TAL’s Group Life Stakeholders
Subject Matter Expert

Welcome to This Australian Life.

From the millions of Australians we protect, to those that make it happen every day at TAL, people really are what we’re all about.

TAL needs people who represent our diverse Australian community. People who embrace our spirit and inspire confidence in their colleagues, customers and community. People who are passionate about making the most of the choices and options we provide. People who do what’s right, aim high, and work smart.

About the Opportunity
We currently have two Business Analyst positions available in the Digital Services team (12 month FTC & Permanent). This role is accountable for providing business and initiative support to TAL’s Group Life Stakeholders by developing innovative and proactive business and digital solutions, managing system changes, daily support activities and detailing documentation on new or changed processes and technologies.

In this role you will be responsible for:
Collaborating with stakeholders (IT, Administration, Product) on delivering value to our joint clients, being seen as a subject matter expert and valued consultant.
Recommending and developing system improvements, articulating the commercial benefits to the business and estimated time / effort / cost of delivering the improvements
Developing and maintaining Business Requirements, Process Design document with all requirements being clearly and specifically documented and traceable through the Development Life Cycle
Analysing current business practices and processes, identifying improvement and transformation opportunities to improve customer service, reduce operating costs, speed of implementation, elimination of waste
Ensuring initiative risks and issues are current and clearly identifiable and traceable
Coordinating, executing and participating in workshops (both internally and externally)
Coordinating/Implementing digital initiatives according to agreed timeframes and business requirements
Developing, maintaining and executing Test Strategies and Test Plans, and Test cases as part of User Acceptance Testing.
Developing and implementing change management plans
Providing management status reporting, as agreed, against tasks or objectives on a regular basis, highlighting exceptions, risks and / or issues
Developing and providing communications strategies / plans, including implementation or release management documentation for end user groups with the provision of training and assistance prior to and post implementation
Assisting the Group Life Services operational teams with system and process issues
Managing incidents impact the teams owned digital assets for example Member Online, Web Services, Administration Portals

About You
To be successful in this role you will have:
An understanding of what delivering value means
Well-developed analytical and problem solving skills, with a particular focus within Group Life Insurance – Claims, Underwriting and Administration
An ability to translate business requirements into technical specifications, and articulated solutions
Good self-management, planning, organising and time management skills
Superior communication skills with an ability to relate well with others and explain complex problems in a simple manner
An ability to develop and execute test cases based on business requirements
Proven ability to assess financial, process and technology impacts of decisions or requirements during analysis (desired)
Experience in maintaining web based systems particularly in a B2B context (desired)
Experience in electronic data standards such as Acord (desired)
Report writing experience (SQL, BI) (desired)

Work is a big part of this Australian life, and we work hard to make it one of the best parts. We want our employees to work in ways that suits their life and the nature of their role, so they feel able to meet their work life commitments and support their wellbeing. Everyone’s welcome to work for us – regardless of their age, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, intersex status or any disabilities they might be living with.

We know it’s the people we work with and experiences we share that make work meaningful and fulfilling, and we’d love for you to be part of it.

You don’t have to be an artist, adventurer, doer or dreamer, but it really helps.

If you would like to apply or refer a friend please click on the relevant button below and follow the instructions. Alternatively, if you would like further information please contact Kirsty Donnelly on Kirsty.donnelly@tal.com.au
title: Business Analyst

description:
Business Analyst
Deliver accurate and timely reporting & analysis for business customer processes
Use your analysis skills to identify process and business improvements
11 months fixed term role
Help shape the lifestyle of greater Sydney
Parramatta
At Sydney Water, we’re passionate about making a difference to the lives of our customers and communities
About us
We have a proud heritage and a progressive future, providing world class drinking water and beautiful waterways from the mountains to the sea. We see the world is changing so we are changing too. Our people and their jobs are as diverse as the communities we serve.
About the role
The Business Analyst is responsible for the delivery of reporting and analysis relating to business customers, process reporting and analysis, including:
Business Customer Services monthly reporting – data extraction, analysis, KPI generation and report preparation
Maintain the customer segmentation spreadsheet
Compliance reporting relating to backflow device management and trade waste permits and agreements for Sydney Water’s industrial and commercial customers
Reporting on trade waste, sewer mining and other indicators for the Annual Performance Indicators report
Responding to ad-hoc requests from stakeholders and customers for information related to business customer processes and performance
Work within the Customer Services QMS
Provide timely and accurate reporting inputs on behalf of Customer Services highlighting trends, analysis, results and appropriate commentary.
Development of information systems to assess performance and improve processes
Identify business or process improvement opportunities through understanding of business customers and analysis of performance data
Keep relevant stakeholders informed of potential impacts on business performance
Use current systems until May 2019, with the ability to start learning and re-writing reports in new systems from December 2018
About you
Tertiary qualifications in an appropriate discipline or relevant experience in a similar role
5 years’ experience in a business analyst role; preferably in the water sector or another utility
High skill level in SQL Developer, Oracle database environments, Microsoft Access
Well-developed computing skills (Excel, Power BI, SAP Business Objects, Word, PowerPoint)
Understanding of trade waste and backflow management processes, and business customer tariffs and charging would be desirable
SAP (IS-U and CRM) experience would be desirable
Excellent written and oral communication skills with the ability to liaise effectively with internal and external stakeholders
A high level analytical and problem-solving skills is desirable
Application Closing date: 21st October 2018
Please see the position description for the roles full accountabilities.
You must be an Australian Citizen or Permanent Resident at the time of submitting your application to be considered for this role. For more information, you can contact recruitment@sydneywater.com.au
We want your perspective and ideas to help us find better ways to delight our customers, so we encourage you to apply no matter your age, sex or culture. You can be part of a committed, highly skilled team who’ll appreciate what you bring to the table. You’ll set and achieve real goals and make decisions that matter, as together we help shape the lifestyle of greater Sydney.
As part of the application process, Sydney Water will be collecting your personal information to assess your suitability for the role. We will also use your personal information to establish a LiveHire talent profile in our Talent Community. We look at our Talent Community first when new opportunities come up when you apply for a role. Your personal information will be collected in accordance with LiveHire’s Terms, Privacy Policy and Sydney Water’s Privacy Collection Statement – Job Application
title: Business Analyst

description:
Want to join one of Australia's largest and most forward thinking Data, Tech and Analytics agencies?

We are Annalect. We're a part of global marketing company OMG (Omnicom Media Group), and we're looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our team. We use data, analytics and technology to drive digital strategy and achieve outstanding results for our rapidly expanding clients.
This is a great opportunity to work on market-leading brands and develop your career!

Why you'll love us
Through our people philosophy “Because I am, we are”, we believe that happy people with a great work/life balance are able to bring the #WOW factor to work.They're also much more fun to share an office with. Join us and surround yourself with like-minded, high achieving individuals. Together, we can change the way digital works.

We can offer:

Unbeatable career development opportunities and mentoring
Flexible working arrangements centered on work / life balance
State of the art tools – we have a dedicated internal tools team
A social culture with a well-being focus - yoga, nutrition, meditation + more

Why we'll love you
You have a passion for Data, Tech and Analytics and you're ready to make a real impact. As the Senior Data Scientist, you'll play a critical role in helping clients across multiple industries make data driven marketing decisions. Specifically, you will analyse large amounts of data to determine how customers interact with our clients' advertising across different channels and devices.

Here's what you'll need:

3-5 years' experience of building models and deriving insights in a position as an Analyst or a Data Scientist
A degree in a quantitative discipline e.g. Math/Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Econometrics, Actuarial etc. is required
Proficiency and experience in statistical modelling and machine learning techniques (feature engineering, regression, classification, segmentation, cross validation, bootstrapping, Bayesian techniques etc.)
A high level of proficiency with at least one programming languages used in data science (R/Python/SAS/Scala/MATLAB).
Understanding of media technology (ad-servers, DMPs)
Proficiency with SQL
Experience with visualisation and dashboarding software (Tableau, Power BI)
Proficiency in dealing with large datasets (data mining etc.)
Proficiency with AWS, Hadoop, Spark, Redshift or other big data platforms

Why our love will last
Not just anyone can fill this role. We want someone who can take it and make it their own. To do this, we want to see you:


Provide business solutions and optimisation through various statistical and quantitative methods. Provide statistical models to support predictive analytics and deliver non-technical presentations to all levels of the business as well as technical documentation to the wider team
Build bespoke Digital Attribution models and improve our digital attribution product offering
Build direct response and econometric models. Maintain and improve our processes and methodology
Become an expert in marketing science, this includes understanding how data is collected and processed across different platforms and channels
Derive insights from data and communicate those insights to a non-technical audience through presentations and documentation
Work effectively as part of a team to deliver client outcomes
Deliver analytical consulting services to Omnicom clients. These include ad-hoc modelling and analysis projects as well as providing recommendations on data and analytics processes and projects
Possess excellent communication skills - being able to both interpret and convey information in a clear, concise way

Does this sound like a you? Bring your passion and drive to a company who want you to thrive. Get in touch with us today. We can't wait to meet you.
title: Senior Data Scientist

description:
Job Description
Business Analyst - 6 Month Fixed Term Contract - Sydney

IBM is the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, serving clients in 170 countries. In this new era of Cognitive Business, IBM is helping to reshape industries by bringing together our expertise in Cloud, Analytics, Security, Mobile, and the Internet of Things. We are changing how we create. How we collaborate. How we analyse. How we engage. IBM is a leader in this global transformation so there is no better place to launch your career.

IBM Global Business Services (GBS) is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants enabling enterprises to make smarter decisions and providing unparalleled client and consumer experiences in cognitive, data analytics, cloud technology and mobile app development. With global reach, outcome-focused methodologies and deep industry expertise, IBM GBS empowers clients to digitally reinvent their business and get the competitive edge. We outthink ordinary. Discover what you can do at IBM. We are hiring.

We are currently recruiting for Technical Business Analyst Fixed term contract, based in Sydney.

The Application Development team is responsible for supporting the full life cycle of enhancements. As a Senior Tech BA your responsibilities include –
Technical Business Analyst experienced in Insurance domain with at least 5 years of insurance domain background.
Technical Business Analyst with strong Business and technical knowledge of Orion (Fineos) Claims management product with prior work experience of minimum 3 years in it.
Technical Business Analyst who will provide technical support to client and participate in client meetings to communicate status or give demos or design reviews.
Technical Business Analyst who possesses niche skill sets in JAVA with experience in translating business requirements Orion (Fineos) application into technical requirements and user stories and in the process, will help de-risk the project outcome in terms of delivery.
Work effectively individually and with team members toward customer satisfaction and success
Conduct Requirement gathering session to elicit the business needs for the development.
Advise the team on business needs and acting as liaison between CLIENT team and IBM team
Abide by CLIENT’s standard for design and development of requirements.
Work with CLIENT to understand their strategic view and position IBM team in alignment with goals.
To ensure success in the role you will possess the following skills –
Extensive experience in Business Analsysis.
At least 5 years of experience in Insurance domain.
Minimum 3 Years of experience in Orion (fineos) claims management product
Experience with SQL databases, JAVA
Strong written and verbal communications
Experience in Agile methodologies, BPM exposure and Selenium-Gherkin automation exposure a nice-to-have
Compensation package from $83,790 (full-time equivalent) and will be determined based on successful candidates relevant skills and experience.

If you tick these boxes, and are ready to start your next challenge with a career at IBM – click “Apply” today. To find out more, head to www.ibm.com.au/careers


Required Technical and Professional Expertise

TBC

Preferred Tech and Prof Experience

TBC

EO Statement
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

description:
Work closely with an experienced Analytics Manager that has worked for tech giants & big 4 consultancies in a growing Data Science function!

The Opportunity
My client is looking for a Data Scientist to join their growing Analytics team based in the North of Sydney. Work closely with the Analytics Manager and existing Data Analysts as they take the next step in their journey with most of this role involved in statistical modelling and data science.

The Role
Meeting with stakeholders to understand their business problems and provide tailored data-driven solutions.
Working with a team of data analytics experts to help design, build and implement statistical models.
Being involved in the end to end analytical life-cycle.

About YOU

Educational background in Stats, Maths, Engineering with 2+ years of commercial experience
Technical expertise with SQL, Tableau and R/Python
Exposure to and interest in the end to end analytical lifecycle
Ability to articulate technical specifications clearly to non-technical stakeholders

Highlights

Permanent role within a growing Data Science & Analytics team
Opportunity to work on statistical modelling end to end
Work across various business functions and directly with stakeholders

Salary
The salary range for this role is $80000 to $119,999.

Location
This job is located in or around Sydney.
title: Data Scientist

description:
At AKQA, we believe in the imaginative application of art and science to create beautiful ideas, products and services. With an entrepreneurial and collaborative approach, we design adaptive digital services and applications that capture the imagination, delivering impressive returns for our clients.

As a Business Analyst, you will be highly motivated and even more meticulous. You’ll have a passion for delivering digital solutions that are as polished as they are innovative, capturing necessary requirements and significantly contributing to architecting a solution that fits them perfectly. You’ll work closely with clients, project management and our Technical and User Experience teams.

ROLE REQUIREMENTS

Manage impact analysis of changes at both solution requirement and resource levels.
Participate in user modelling and requirements-gathering workshops.
Document and control project requirements.
Develop and manage Scrum sprint backlog (Epics, Stories, etc.).
Assist in Scrum iteration planning.
Direct the solution to meet client expectations and requirements.
4+ years’ experience as a Business Analyst, preferably in web/eCommerce projects.
Strong experience working across the full SDLC, and Requirement and Functional Specification development, particularly within a Scrum environment.
Strong experience of data modelling and UML methods.
Strong experience of web development technologies and online user experience.


QUALITIES AND CHARACTERISTICS

Meticulous in your work, with high attention to detail.
Exceptional interpersonal skills.
Able to effectively present to a wide range of stakeholders.
Excellent documentation and time-management skills.
Embody a culture of continuous improvement.
Motivate and generate enthusiasm within the team.


AKQA is an Equal Opportunities Employer, we believe that diversity is vital to AKQA’s ability to provide our clients with the best recommendations and are committed to fostering a varied and inclusive work environment. Your race, colour, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability or veteran status have no bearing on our hiring decisions. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

management and introducing organisational change, and leading and managing the team in order to achieve greater efficiency and solve organisational problems so as to maximise the value and performance of the businessPrimary responsibilities, tasks and duties include: Analysing business and operating procedures to devise most efficient methods and strategies of achieving business plans and Business Plan to outline category strategies for the next 12 months;Recording and analysing business forecasts, such as financial forecast reviews, budget, performance, opportunities and threats $125,000.00 + superannuation.
