description:
Senior Master Data Analyst, Clerk Grade 7/8 - 180022
 - 00006JF3
Full time ongoing appointment
Location: Parramatta

EDConnect is the Department’s new Shared Service Centre, delivering integrated transactional and advisory services (shared services) for the Department. Organisational performance in EDConnect is underpinned by the ‘EDConnect Way’ culture – we keep the customer at the centre of everything we do; we collaborate with and support each other to succeed; we take ownership of our work to ensure a quality outcome is delivered; we communicate transparently and listen actively; and we are accountable to each other to develop and grow.

About the role
The Senior Master Data Analyst plays a leading role in providing exemplary customer service and specialist advice, and engages team members in the delivery of accurate, reliable and targeted outcomes that meet customer expectations. The role is also accountable for optimising business outcomes and drives the day to day operational activities of the team in order to achieve team objectives.

The role supports the Master Data Management within Shared Services Finance. The Finance function is responsible for managing all finance activities within the Shared Services function to ensure the smooth running of the Directorate. Finance activities include accrual accounting, posting general ledger journals, budgeting and funding, forecasting, financial reporting, accounts management (accounts receivable and payable), managing travel and accommodation expenses and benefits realisation.

Please click her for the organisation chart

About the Department of Education
The NSW Department of Education provides, funds and regulates education services for NSW students from early childhood to secondary school, delivering world-class education through its public schools and providing funding support to non-government schools. We employ, develop and support teachers, leaders and other staff to deliver the best outcomes for students and to advance the wellbeing of Aboriginal people.

How to apply
The NSW Department of Education is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce as an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer. We encourage diverse applicants from a range of backgrounds to apply for roles in the department.

To apply for this role, please submit an application by clicking “Apply Online” below. To apply, you will need to attach a cover letter (max. 2 pages) and your resume (max. 5 pages) in either Word or PDF format. Please address any pre-screening questions and any essential requirements. We are looking for you to demonstrate your competence in the focus capabilities as outlined in the role description in your answer, so please develop your response with this in mind.

Note: the selection process will include a range of assessment techniques to assist in determining your suitability for the role.

If you are called to interview you will need to provide the following documents and your employment may be subject to the Department’s Nationally Coordinated Criminal History Check to determine your suitability for employment.

Proof of Identity information
Informed Consent Form
Declaration for non-child work

PRE-SCREENING QUESTIONS:
From your recent experience tell us about a situation where you identified a specific issue in relation to database(s). What were the scenario and the solution chosen? How did you select the solution from the range of options? (300 words maximum).
Describe a situation where you used your knowledge and specific skill to resolve an issue caused by an incorrect logic/process and describe what steps you took to fix the problem? (300 words maximum).

ESSENTIAL REQUIREMENTS:
Tertiary qualifications or relevant experience in Administration, Finance and Accounting or a relevant discipline, and/or demonstrated successful experience in stakeholder/customer engagement in a Shared Services/Contact Centre environment.
Proven experience across a range of accounting and finance functions, with a sound knowledge of accounting principles and standards, financial data processing and reporting.
Knowledge of and commitment to the Department’s Aboriginal Education and Training policies. (Please find Aboriginal Education Review – Information)

Closing date: 30 October 2018

Note: A recruitment pool may be created through this recruitment process. A recruitment pool is a group of applicants who have been assessed and identified as suitable for this role or similar roles, and who may be considered for a range of similar roles, including temporary, term or ongoing roles, over the next 12 months.
Location Sydney Region-Sydney - Greater West
Work Type Full-time
Number of Positions 1
Total Remuneration Package: $108,207. Package includes salary ($94,782 - $104,918), employer's contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading.
Contact Munir Rahman - (02) 8633 1051
Closing Date 30-Oct-2018
Job Category Analyst
Organisation Department of Education
title: Senior Master Data Analyst, Clerk Grade 7/8 - 180022

description:
Business Analyst 4-Ops-18000WYE

Preferred Qualifications

Overview:
The Food & Beverage Global Business Unit (FBGBU) is a newly formed Global Business Unit that was spun off from the Hospitality Business Unit (HGBU) in Fiscal Year 2019. We are embarking on a new path and are looking for high energy, enthusiastic individuals to facilitate continuous improvements around tools and processes. Looking for innovative thinkers that are comfortable working outside the box. Need to be passionate about initiating changes that are good for the business and seeing it through completion. Must be comfortable working in a complex, fast paced environment and have the ability to work across organizational lines as well as different lines of business in a partnership role

General Description:
This business analyst will sit within the sales operations group for the newly formed Food & Beverage Global Business Unit (FBGBU) focused on the Asia Pacific region. This role will focus on supporting the F&B Sales Teams in understanding and effectively using the Oracle sales processes and Tools. Regional liaison to the FBGBU Sales Operations in relating policy and best practices to Sales Team. Occasional evening and early morning hours to participate in global meetings as needed.

Responsibilities:
 Develop a deep understanding of the FBGBU sales processes and systems (with a focus on territory planning, pipeline management, forecasting and sales compensation). Develop a deep understanding of the FBGBU sales processes and systems (with a focus on quoting, ordering and approvals). Establish strong relationships with other key GBU groups (finance, business planning, and operations) as well as with the broader Oracle support groups (e.g. finance, Global Sales & Consulting Operations, HR, Global Incentive Comp, Deal Management, Legal, other regional sales ops teams) Collaborate with Corporate functions, Central GBU Operations, and Regional teams to assess local processes to eliminate complexity and inefficiencies. Partner with regional FBGBU sales teams to understand operational challenges and implement resolutions to identified issues Assist FBGBU field sales teams in understanding Oracle’s standard practices, policies, and tools Work with Sales teams and Finance to support accurate sales forecasting, effective pipeline management and reliable sales credit allocation. Support field enablement efforts Support implementation of new Oracle processes and systems including communications and enablement
Qualifications: 5+ years work experience in Sales or Business operations roles Outstanding organizational and problem solving skills. Ability to focus and set priorities. Ability to work in a rapidly changing international environment. Service orientated and a team player Ability to work under time constraints and deadlines. Excellent communication skills in English both spoken and written. Experience with systems used by Oracle Sales (e.g. Sales Cloud, SI, DAS, CPQ, etc.) is an advantage

Detailed Description and Job Requirements
Provides programs to improve operational efficiency, consistency, and compliance in support of the organization*s financial and tactical business objectives. Provides business practices and processes. Develops, communicates, and trains the organization on business practices and processes.

Serve as a liaison with other divisions such as Finance, Contracts, HR, Legal, Shared Services, Accounts Receivable, Purchasing, and Risk Management in an effort to ensure accurate and timely transaction processing. Collect, input, verify, correct, and analyze data to measure key performance indicator actual versus business objectives. Provide updates to management regarding budget to actual, informing them of deviations and opportunities. Provide management with economic impact and compliance issues surrounding key business decisions and/or deals. Communicate Oracle Business Practices to the organization and monitor process and approvals for full compliance. Drive implementation of new processes and procedures.

Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. Ability to collect, organize, and display data in spreadsheet format. Follow-through skills necessary to get information from internal and third parties and have data errors/omissions corrected. For this, relationship management skills strongly desired. Strong written and verbal communication skills. 8 plus years relevant work experience.
title: Business Analyst 4-Ops

description:
Business Analyst
Information Technology
Financial Market Systems
6 month contract


TCorp (NSW Treasury Corporation) provides best-In-class financial solutions for the whole of the State Government family. We are the State’s Central Financing Authority, funding and managing the NSW debt portfolio. As aligned with the overall corporate strategy, our Information Technology team enables all our business needs and activities, delivering an effective development and support function, whilst ensuring protection and integrity of TCorp systems and data.
Reporting to the Financial Markets Business Solutions Manager, you will be responsible for gathering, understanding, verifying and documenting the requirements for our Financial Markets systems (primarily FX and rates trading-to-settlements systems) and pre-trade risk and pricing systems. This includes defining and documenting high level solution design in collaboration with internal business SME’s and technology development teams.
In this role you will: engage stakeholders to guide and positively influence desired outcomes, analyse and define business and functional requirements, and collaborate on overall system design and concept. You will also be accountable for: the liaison with business units to prioritise requirements, communicate progress and release planning schedules, and the support and development of project and implementation plans.
You will need to demonstrate that you possess: excellent verbal and written communications skills, have an inherent customer service orientation and are a ‘Thought Leader’. Your career to date will evidence that you have excellent planning, research, documentation and analysis skills, and an ability to understand and solve complex issues through to a positive outcome.
You will be a self-driven, motivated and results oriented professional with experience working in an Agile environment (preferably SCRUM). With a minimum 5 years business analysis experience in Financial Markets including foreign exchange, money markets, fixed income and swaps (with some exposure to front office pricing and valuation models highly desirable) your knowledge and experience in all areas of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) will be considered an essential requirement.
At TCorp we place great emphasis on flexible working. We know that our people can be the best they can be – at work and in life – when they have the opportunity to enjoy their life outside work. We offer a highly collaborative culture where people support each other to succeed and learn from the ideas and contributions of colleagues - working together to achieve common goals. TCorp has an inclusive culture and we recognise that our diversity, and the variety of perspectives it brings to our organisation, is a great asset for building and sustaining a successful organisation and delivering on our strategy.

description:
Senior Business Analyst
 - 00006JGL

The Office Accommodation Program is series of activity based working, refurbishment and construction program under one Portfolio covering 7 major DFSI work locations to 2020.

An opportunity exists for a Senior Business Analyst to join the team to work with stakeholders and provide business and financial analysis as well as undertake specialised projects to assist with the delivery of services and align solutions with business requirements and organisational strategies and plans.

This role sits within the Program Manager Office (PMO) and works with a small team of other Business Analysts. This will be on a full time, temporary basis for up to two years in duration.

Key Responsibilities:
Undertake analysis and report on relevant information from internal and external sources
Prepare and Asses Resourcing and Financial models to support the portfolio
Manage the audit requirements for PMO and assist with preparing documentation required for audit purpose
Assist Programs with development of strategic plans based on requirements
Assist the PMO in the preparation of reporting packs for senior governance groups
To be considered for this role you will have:
Relevant tertiary qualifications or demonstrated experience in policy and business/financial analysis
Relevant experience in Project Management Office space
Advanced skills including MS Office, Data Analytics, SAP and relational database are desirable
Demonstrable experience in data analysis, dash boarding and manipulation
An ability and proactive willingness to embrace and rapidly learn new software, tools and analysis approaches
Advanced written, oral and interpersonal communication skills

Please review the Role Description and for enquiries about this opportunity please contact Jovan Apostolovic on 02 8514 2289 to understand more about the Department of Finance, Services and Innovation.

Closing date 21 October 2018. Your application should include a cover letter, and an up-to-date resume of no more than five pages which clearly details your skills and experience as relevant to this role. Applicants invited for interview will be required to complete additional assessments. There are no selection criteria to be addressed.

Salary Grade 9/10 maximum salary package up to $131,969 Package includes salary [$108,044 – $119,061] and employer’s contribution to superannuation, commensurate with skills and experience.

Job status Temporary under the Government Sector Employment Act 2013.

Apply now at I work for NSW (formerly Jobs.NSW) Should you encounter any technical problems, please contact their helpdesk 1800 562 679.


The Department of Finance, Services and Innovation is an EEO employer and welcomes applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people from diverse cultures and people with a disability. At DFSI, we endeavor to make roles flexible. While this role is advertised as full time, we will consider requests to undertake the work flexibly.


Location Sydney Region-Sydney City
Work Type Full-time
Number of Positions 1
Total Remuneration Package: $131,969 Package includes salary ($108,044- $119,061), employer's contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading.
Contact Jovan Apostolovic - 02 8514 2289
Closing Date 21-Oct-2018
Job Category Business analysis
Organisation Department of Finance, Services & Innovation
title: Senior Business Analyst

description:
Location: Sydney, CBD

Business Unit: Business Performance and Analytics

Direct Reports: None

Your Role:

Credit Risk data underpins Westpac’s capital calculations, decision management, limit setting, risk strategies and quantitative models and as such is vital to the organisation. As a Senior Business Analyst in this role you will be responsible for supporting quarterly releases of Credit Risk Calculation Engine (CRCE) systems.

The purpose of this role is:
Support delivery of IT changes to Credit Risk Systems
Working with business stakeholders to elicit requirements
Assist with successful completion of project deliverables
Perform technical and business analysis for changes in CRCE system
Work with developers and technical leads to ensure technical design meets requirements
Prepare test strategy, test cases, write and run test scripts

In this role your duties will include, but not necessarily be limited to, the following:

1.Business Analysis:
Gather and investigate business requirements via variety of methods/channels
Perform detailed technical and business analysis of the requirements
Write clear and detailed project documentation including business requirements, functional specifications and test strategies
Perform impact analysis to identify impacts on upstream and downstream applications and quantify movements in results
Perform data mapping
Prepare data model prototypes using SQL/SAS
Develop business process models and documentation
Generate test plan and test cases, mapping these back to the requirements
Assist in managing and coordinating project deliverables and activities to ensure requirements are satisfactorily delivered on budget, on time and to agreed scope
Consistently adhere to the WBC Project Execution Framework (PEF) and Solution Engineering Life Cycle (SELC), as well as the BPA Project Management Framework


2.Stakeholder Engagement & Risk Management:
Manage communication and relationships with stakeholders - Risk Managers, Portfolio Managers, Group Risk, Subject Matter Experts, other BA’s, Release Team and Information Technology.
Ensure all stakeholders are sufficiently briefed and have appropriate understanding of delivery and outcomes the BPA team are working toward
Identify issues and risks, and actively work to mitigate, manage and resolve or escalate them

You:

The role would suite a technically minded Business Analyst with IT background and knowledge of Credit Risk or a SAS developer wanting to move into BA space.

To be successful in this role you will have the following skills, experience, education and/or expertise:

Expertise:
5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst or 3+ years as SAS Developer and 2+ years as a Business Analyst
Familiar with Credit Risk management and Financial Management
Experience as a Business Analyst in leading / managing technical changes to successful implementation including governance, working with technical resources and stakeholder change management and engagement.
Strong understanding of business performance and analytics concepts and applications
Strong understanding of relevant business management requirements and systems
A strong work ethic and a desire to go the extra mile
Ability to work in demanding and high pace environment

Technical Skills:
Base SAS, SAS Enterprise Guide (Highly Desirable)
Information management and data analysis (Advanced )
Credit Risk Management (Intermediate)
SQL and Database Technologies (Intermediate to Advanced)
Excel (Advanced)
Data Modelling and Reporting (Advanced)

Working with Westpac:

Working with us you'll discover new ways of working, and an exciting range of roles to showcase your skills. Think inspiring locations, flexible work spaces and unexpected careers.

Joining Westpac has many perks besides building a long and stable career. You’ll be:
Able to have access to some of the best banking, wealth and insurance benefits in the market
Offered a highly competitive remuneration that is fair and consistent for all our people
Entitled to a suite of online learning, training modules and career planning tools to grow with us
Encouraged to participate in the community through paid volunteer leave and secondments available

Westpac Group is an equal opportunity employer. As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.
title: Senior Business Analyst

description:
Our Business Analysts are an integral part of our Business Improvement service offering. We are currently seeking Senior Business Analysts within the IT and Telecommunications area with consulting backgrounds who have a range of analytical skills and hold a track record of delivering outstanding results and meeting critical timeframes. The ideal candidate will have excellent interpersonal & communication skills and possess the ability to build strong relationships and rapport with clients and key stakeholders.

Is this you?
 We are seeking skilled professionals who are passionate about generating meaningful change for clients and who are keen to belong to a company committed to bringing out their best, and supporting them along the way.

Business Analyst with 10+ years’ experience

Business Consulting background preferred

Experience in Networks, Network Technology, System Integration and/or Application Upgrades essential

Immediate start preferred


To be successful in this role, you must possess the following skills:


Strong communication skills –excellent oral, written and visual communication skills, with the ability to tailor your style to suit the audience you are working with.

Stakeholder Management & Organisation Skills– the ability to identify stakeholders and to influence others to reach a desirable outcome or agreement. You should hold exceptional organisational skills, enabling you to work in complex environments

Analytical skills – you should be able to analyse and interpret data, demonstrating your ability to identify business and functional requirements.

Business Process Mapping/ Re-engineering - Ability to document, map and develop business processes.

Relevant Industry experience – IT and telecommunications, specifically within Networks, Network Technology, System Integration and/or Application Upgrades

Strong Australian Industry experience

What can Terra Firma offer you?


Our people and our culture make Terra Firma a unique and awesome place to work

We value your ideas and reward you with a collegiate atmosphere full of opportunities

You will have access to global best practice frameworks including IIBA, PMBoK, ProSci and TOGAF. Our staff are also encouraged to enrol in our in-house training programs or gain external accreditations.

We have mentors who are industry recognised experts.

All our consultants have access to Employee Assistance Program for Physical, Psychological, Financial and Nutritional support

Through our alliance with a large corporate travel organisation, we are able to offer our consultants access to discounted travel and insurance

But most importantly, we offer you the opportunity to live our values with us: Pride & Passion, Collegiality and Adding Value!

We are ALWAYS on the lookout for people with the skills and personality to join us.

To begin your new career with us apply to the link below or call our careers team on 03 8611 5099 for a confidential discussion. We look forward to hearing from you.
title: Business Analyst - IT and Telecommunications

description:
@Metigy we are creating the next generation of AI-driven Marketing Technology (Martech) for business by helping them discover and unlock the secrets hidden in their data. Our AI is built on state-of-the-art data mining and delivered using the art of storytelling delivered through statistics and gamification. We aim to delight and reward our customers by improving their marketing performance and delivering best in class tools.
As a lead data scientist @Metigy , you will lead the team in creating and defining data-driven stories that help our customers understand and grow their marketing. We believe data should drive insights, trigger actions and reward our customers.
Our Mission is to help users succeed with our marketing assistant technology.

What You’ll be working on

You will be instrumental in conception and delivery of our product using AI to tailor and deliver marketing recommendations to customers
Using analytical methods and visualization techniques to surface marketing insights that lead to recommendations to drive key marketing decisions for customers
Selecting features, building and optimizing data collection, processing and classifiers using machine learning techniques
Develop company A/B testing framework and test model quality continually
Provide leadership and mentorship to the data team
Leading the Big Data Engineers to build highly available, scalable, and secure systems tacking technical ownership and managing resources
Coordinate with different parts of the business to help design and implement models to solve marketing challenges and monitor outcomes
From a vague question, you can come up with a thorough data-driven answer, doing ad-hoc research and analysis, presenting results in a clear manner and occasionally publishing research

What Data Scientist are you?
Firstly, what we have just described is something you are already passionate about.

You are product focused and see everything, theoretical or actual through to delivery
Strong problem-solving skills and a gift for telling beautiful stories with the data. You dream of working with large, multi-source, multi-faceted, complex, exciting datasets built from the Social Graph (can you tell we love our datasets?)
User Experience is part of the art of how a data scientist tells a data-driven story and you are passionate about building clear interfaces that give users the best experience possible
Experience working with and creating data architectures
Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
You love communicating with small, nimble teams in a high visibility role where you can really own the solution
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for communicating across teams
You’ve worked for over 5-7 years in a data related role and become a generalist because you love solving problems in creative ways and developing end to end solutions

Above all, you have the drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques continually. We live in a beautiful, ever-changing world that happens in real time, all the time. And our goal is to help our customers conquer that new frontier, one great recommendation at a time!
You will need to be Sydney based.
title: Lead Data Scientist

description:
Want to do petabyte scale deep learning and ship product to real customers? If so, this opportunity may be for you. At Nearmap, we're growing our data science team, and we’re after a data scientist / machine learning engineer who’s got enough experience to just come in and get stuck in.

At Nearmap, we have petabytes of high quality aerial imagery (covering half a million square kilometres a year at 5-7cm resolution, and regularly captured imagery back to 2009). We've also just started producing automated 3D models of entire cities. Couple that with recent progress in deep learning, cloud based GPU compute, and the opportunity to work with a vast network of customers and partners eager to extract commercial value through machine learning for a wide range of industries and applications, and you'll appreciate why data science at Nearmap is an exciting place to be. As a mature publicly listed startup, we have both the resources to allow you to succeed in your role, and the agility (thanks to cloud-based infrastructure) to rapidly take advantage of the latest developments in the field.

You will report to the Director of AI Systems, and will be responsible for completing a range of end-to-end projects applying cutting edge deep learning techniques to geospatial imagery. You will be ready to move beyond the confines of stock CNN architectures, making adaptations to train and deploy custom models that take full advantage of our rich geospatially referenced and 3D imagery.
A bit more about the culture…

At Nearmap, every opinion matters, our business model partnered with our open-door management style gives you the opportunity to make an impact. Our Nearmappers see the world differently and are intently focused on delivering the best location content in the world. Having a shared goal and a lot of fun reaching it is how our Nearmappers truly flourish at their home away from home. We're all super down-to-earth - except when we're in the sky capturing fresh imagery!
More about what you need to bring…

We're after an exceptional data scientist / machine learning engineer, who has the ability to deliver an end-to-end project, but will also value the opportunity to be mentored by the more experienced members of the team.
The main attributes we're after are:

Pragmatism: While extensive knowledge of ML theory is highly valued, pragmatism wins over elaborate theory when it comes to shipping products that work.
Collaboration: We believe data science is a team sport, and are after candidates who can communicate well, share knowledge, and be open to taking on ideas from anyone in the team. Having worked on shared code-bases in a commercial environment is a big plus, but it's the attitude that matters most.
Technical Skills: A decent base of python, linux, and modern machine learning are key to a role in the team. Highly valued experience includes working with 3D point clouds, custom conv net architectures, and geospatial imagery. Our stack includes GPUs, Keras, Tensorflow Docker and Kubernetes.
Education and Experience: At minimum, a technical bachelors level degree (engineering, sciences, etc.), with a few years of experience beyond that (commercial or research).
Attention to detail: Showing attention to detail when it counts is important... to be considered for this role, click this link and apply some basic data science skills.


Some of our perks include…
Competitive pay, commission plan and Employee Share Scheme
Flexible working environment, work life balance is a necessity
Opportunities for continued career growth and development
Ergonomic workstations with sit stand desks
Fortnightly massages
Free reign of Nearmap’s products
Free healthy breakfast, snacks & lunches available in our kitchen with water views
An allowance to help you focus on your well being


Watch our culture video and find out more about what a day in the life at Nearmap looks like: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R7rikZqa8n8

If you think you tick all the boxes and could see yourself working at Nearmap, we invite you to come and make a difference!
title: Data Scientist

description:
Who you'll be working with:

TANDEM is a leading Australian company providing advisory and field based workforce management services with a culture of encouraging employee development. Managing a subcontractor workforce of 2,900 subcontracting companies who engage in excess of 5,200 workers, TANDEM is a rapidly growing organisation.

Position Summary:

We are looking to fill two positions:
The KPI Reporting Analyst is responsible for analysing and compiling relevant KPI data from day to day operations and setting up relevant reporting formats to determine whether the KPIs are being met. Your data analytics will steer continuous improvement efforts to identify root cause, and you will work collaboratively with the team to provide the data to support the measurement of lead and lag indicators.
The Forecasting Data Analyst is responsible for building and maintaining detailed forecasts of the expected volume of work over the next 1, 3 and 12 months. This forecast will be built on an analysis of historical data, enriched with weather and other projections. The output of this work will provide the basis for effective operational capacity management, and is a crucial enabler for the successful and timely delivery of Tandem services to its customers.
What you’ll be doing:

KPI Analyst -
Analyse KPI reports within required timelines.
Monitor the data to identify most ‘at risk’ performance areas, and assist in instigating proactive, cost effective solutions.
Ensure data is managed correctly in the KPI systems and checked for accuracy.
Forecast Data Analyst –
Analyse historical forecasts for accuracy and completeness
Build and improve forecast models over various periods, identifying peaks and drivers of volume change
Build and improve capacity models that enable effective management of demand while optimising efficient use of resources
Utilise actual outcomes to improve the forecast models on an iterative basis

Both roles will be working to:
Ensure that data is cleansed so that an accurate picture is represented both to regions and the client.
Transform data into automated reporting platforms, including dashboards
Provide information and analysis to relevant internal and external stakeholders as required.
Resolve problems as quickly and effectively as possible, escalating to management when required.
Ensure working relationships with relevant internal and external team members to ensure that their requirements for data and reporting are met.
Assist relevant staff interpret data for their regions.
Manage customer relationships and ensure that service levels are met and exceede
What we're looking for:
Graduate qualifications in accounting/business/commerce/Computer Science with post grad qualifications an advantage.
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office suite, and Tableau
Experience with SQL and database design principles
Experience as a KPI Analyst, forecasting analyst, and/or data analyst with elements of these roles
In depth understanding of performance measurement, attribution analysis and Risk (ex-ante and ex-post).
Computer literate, in particular Excel, Access, Word.
Strong numerate and analytical skills and able to undertake non-traditional analytical tasks.
Working knowledge of industry reporting standards.
Ability to work accurately and achieve operational goals under the pressure of tight deadlines.
Ability to effectively analyse information on performance to identify issues/problems and identify corrective action with relevant people.
Ability to prepare useful reports on performance using the KPI data.
High-level written, verbal communication skills and demonstrated ability to manage and influence stakeholders.
Preferably – the ability to explain the complicated and technical in simple, layman terms
Why you should apply

Join TANDEM and you will be part of a high energy team with a supportive culture. In addition to competitive salaries, we offer incentives and rewards that are designed to recognise high performance. Our leadership team works with you to make sure you have the tools and support to do your job exceptionally well so that you can achieve your goals. Come on, apply today!

Please Note - the successful candidate/s for this position will be asked to consent to a police check.

By applying for this role you agree to Tandem collecting, using and disclosing your personal information as set out in our Privacy Policy

http://www.tandemcorp.com/privacy-policy/
title: KPI Reporting and Data Analysts

description:
My client is a dynamic eCommerce retailer taking Australia by storm, having already won a number of retail awards in their short history. Having enjoyed a period of growth they are looking to hire a Data Analyst to join their enthusiastic marketing team.

As the successful Data Analyst you will be working within the Marketing Team helping to analyse data and help drive the company forward. This is a great opportunity for anyone coming out of University or with a couple of years experience to make a real difference.

You will be responsible for providing valuable customer insights through applying your experience in data analytics to feedback to sales and marketing teams to ensure high levels of customer success.
Create and deliver quarterly, monthly, weekly reporting

Advanced MS Excel is essential
Experience using Google analytics will be highly regarded

University Degree in Commerce will be highly regarded
E-Commerce experience will be highly regarded
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Australian Residency
'Apply now' or feel free to contact Tito Tealdo on +61 2 8249 8381 for a confidential talk.

title: Business Analyst - Capital Markets

description:
Cover Genius was nominated in the global Fintech 100 by KPMG in 2017 and was recognised as the fastest growing company in Australia by Smart Company in 2017. This is an opportunity to become part of the next product that disrupts the World's largest industry. And you get to do it where the model is proven and growth is accelerating!
We distribute insurance products to the largest e-commerce sites globally via a B2B platform. Our first product to market, RentalCover.com, has been an outstanding B2B and B2C success within the travel vertical. Behind this success, we have Brightwrite, the engine powers all the analytics and intelligence.
We’re seeking a senior data scientist to support the product and marketing with insights gained from analysing company data. The ideal candidate should adept at using data sets to identify opportunities for increase revenue and using models to test the effectiveness of different actions.
Given Cover Genius’ global recognition, excellent track record, and hockey stick growth, this role presents significant opportunities for the right candidate. We are looking for self-starters that are passionate about new technology and innovation. People that have a “can do” attitude and who work well within startup environments where needs and roles can change quickly. Needless to say, we are not your average insurance company!
Requirements
Mandatory
Proficiency with a variety of Machine Learning and statistical testing techniques
Master's or Ph.D. in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or other Quantitative fields
5+ years of experience in manipulating data sets using Python/SQL and building statistical models
Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on product development
Functional knowledge of relational databases and data warehousing
A drive to learn and master new technologies/techniques, good communications and be able to work in Australia
Nice to have
Experience in analysing data from Google Analytics, Adwords, Facebook and other customer experience platforms.
Experience with distributed data manipulations (Map/Reduce)
Experience with data engineering, ETL processes etc..
Our Culture
Our team thrives on the challenges that the hockey stick style of growth brings. We've enjoyed wide recognition within the startup and insurance industries, including Smart Company who recognised Cover Genius as the Fastest Growing Company in Australia in 2017.
Our Vision is to enable the all world's global eCommerce businesses to distribute insurance to their global customers.
Benefits
Salary Negotiable
A generous Employee Options Package applies for permanent roles at Cover Genius.
Opportunity to travel extensively including to UK, EU and US
High energy, fast paced and inclusive working environment
Sydney CBD location
Flat organisation structure
Fun, inclusive work environment
Health and wellness benefits
Peer bonus program
Stock-based incentives
Generous bonuses for employee referrals
New office fitout
Free office snacks and drinks
Job-related training
Global network which offers opportunity to transfer to other markets

description:
We're always looking to improve things here at Vocus, whether it is creating the best Customer Experience ever, through to making things simple so we deliver faster.

As a Business Analyst supporting the Enterpirse and Wholesale team you will be at the centre of these transformations, and will provide access to parallel programmes of work that will define how we evolve at Vocus.

There will be plenty of projects that will give you the opportunity to be at the forefront of many great Business and technology innovations, along with exposure to leaders within Sales, Service and Assurance.

Working alongside the Portfolio Delivery Manager you will be providing high quality business analysis and business requirements for migrations, projects and enhancements.

We are looking for a collabrative and creative BA to work with us to make what we do simple as easy for the business. Your day to day will be varied and will look a little like this:
Accountable for gathering and analyzing business requirements through functional designs or solutions
Providing innovative solutions for IT systems and the business that are simple and easy.
Help drive change through proactively identifying system & process opportunities, whilst eliciting business requirements for assigned projects and change initiatives.
Develop designs or recommendations for future system enhancements and development
Ensure technology solutions are feasible within the technical and commercial limitations of the project and aligned with Vocus enterprise architecture
Prepare documentation such as process maps, data flow diagrams, requirements documents and functional specifications
Perform test functions as required
Provide ongoing assistance to support teams for functionality released into production
In your past roles your experience has allowed you to
Deliver telecommunications / IP network related programs of work and/or technology heavy software application delivery projects
work on large-scale Telco automation, integration and service orchestration or Robotic Process Automation
have exposure to software and solution delivery lifecycle experience, ideally with experience as a scrum master on an agile project
What you will need to bring to the table
Solid experience (4+ years’ experience) in a project BA capacity
Strong stakeholder management, negotiation and conflict resolution skills and the ability to support the needs of multiple business channels
A customer focused work ethic with experience in managing customer expectations
Ability to facilitate large workshops involving a variety of Business and IT stakeholders
Strong time management skills with the ability to manage work load effectively, follow up track information and deliver on tight timeframes
Solid understanding and experience to implement all stages of the System Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
Technical knowledge of programming, database concepts and system design
Ability to work autonomously and as part of a team, sharing ideas and encouraging others to participate
What's in it for you:
We offer you an opportunity where you can be part of a team with real opportunities to grow your career in an organisation that truly makes a difference to the Australian businesses and people. You will also have access to excellent benefits!
Agile project environment, Flexible working conditions, Great business benefits
title: Business Analyst

description:
The Company

DB Schenker is a globally integrated Transport and Logistics company providing international air and sea freight forwarding services together with national logistics solutions across Australia and the globe.

About DB Schenker

At DB Schenker, you are part of a global logistics network that connects the world. A network that allows you to shape your career by encouraging you to contribute and truly make a difference. With more than 72,000 colleagues worldwide, we welcome diversity and thrive on individual backgrounds, perspectives and skills. Together as one team, we are Here to move.

The Role

We are seeking a Business Analyst specialising in Contract Logistics/ Supply Chain Management to join our busy Yennora NSW team.

Position Summary:

Conceptualise logistics strategies, process flows, alternative designs and
methodologies to develop and create the optimal solution based on operational
performance.
Significant judgement is required in planning, design, and technical functions related to
the response to tenders with solid knowledge of Schenker’s products, services,
procedures and processes
Analyse data and develop business models including pricing for both warehousing and
transport
Provide transport solutions and domestic transport pricing nationally for all new and
existing customers.
Provide support in contract renewal of existing customers
Responsibilities
Departmental/Operational key Responsibilities may include:

Co-ordinate all Logistics (Warehousing and Transport) tender opportunities
Compile a wide range of diverse information into a readable and logical format
Providing transport solutions and domestic transport pricing nationally for all new and existing customers
Analyse tender opportunities and convert raw data into logical business requirements
Assist Business Development team to prepare a professional and quality tender response
Review requirements with customer and reach agreement on findings
Work with customer to develop alternative solutions and implementation strategy
Standardise reports and presentation to business development team and customers
Undertaking costing and pricing ‘what if’s’ for inclusion in presentations
Case study preparation and review
Proposal preparation and review
Collaborate in the presentation of high quality, clear solutions to customers –verbal, written and formal
Assist in project implementation and on boarding of the new customers by working closely with project management team, operations, commercial / finance and transport and TMS
Undertaking projects such as contract renewal of existing customers
Customer Focus - manages difficult customer situations; responds promptly to customer needs; solicits customer feedback; responds to requests for service and assistance
Qualifications
Competencies and Skills required:

Tertiary qualifications e.g. Supply Chain, Industrial engineering, Finance, Accounting or similar
Very strong analytical skills
Prior experience in similar roles either in 3PL or other warehousing / logistics /domestic transportation environments
Customer facing experience in complex business environments
Exposure to complex account sales & management
Expert product and industry knowledge coupled with the ability to deal with clients at all levels and translate client needs into a complete solution
Costing, pricing and modelling experience
Process mapping and system analysis
Hands-on mentality, customer orientation, target/result focus
High level of written / verbal communication skills
Ability to engage directly with clients on analysis, solutions and commercial negotiations
Strong problem, planning, organising and management skills

title: Technical Business Analyst

description:
About DataSpark
DataSpark was created from a vision to transform the rich and unique repository of spatial temporal data, such as those coming from telecommunication networks, into business value and social impact. We use our data sources to gain an in-depth understanding of human behavior.
We use data science to try to answer questions about how people interact with the world around them during their daily lives. Our data science products and advanced analytics services provide powerful insights and advanced analytics capabilities to government and businesses in Australia and across the region. We strive for our analytics to be trustworthy and relevant to our clients while adhering to high standards of data privacy.

The Role
This role is part of ensuring our customers are successful in using our products to solve their business needs. You will have the opportunity to apply your technical, problem solving and customer engagement skills to help customers solve problems in transportation, retail, property development, advertising, and other domains. Someone who has experience working with spatiotemporal data to understand human behaviour and an understanding of the importance of geographic context in data analytics
Working alongside creative, energetic and passionate teammates from around the world, you get to be a part of our exciting growth journey as we build the company to the next level. You will be closely collaborating with your colleagues in the Product and Commercial teams to evangelise our products, provide assistance to customers in learning and using the products, and ensure that customers continue to use and benefit from our mobility insights. You will also play a role in shaping our future product roadmap by analysing customer needs according to our product management framework and providing valuable learnings about market needs to the Product team.
Additionally, you will join a growing team of highly motivated and capable individuals who aspire to create deep insights and to productise those insights to deliver maximal business growth. You will gain from the combined decades of Data Science experience around you to develop your expertise and your career in the field. Our team are data enthusiasts with a collaborative ethos who love to share knowledge and want to do pioneering with you out on the cutting edge.

What you need to be successful?

BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Analytics, or equivalent applied quantitative field;
Demonstrated ability to execute data processing tasks, including data auditing, preparation, integration, transformation and aggregation using “SQL” AND “R OR Python OR Scala”
Demonstrated ability to think of different use-cases that can be solved by data analytics (Consulting)
Demonstrated ability to understand the difficulties and challenges of dealing with spatial data OR demonstrated ability to work with variety of data types
Demonstrated ability to evaluate different analytical approaches that can be applied to solve a problem, select the most suitable one and justify the selection

Optus believes in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers.
title: Senior Data Scientist

description:
Master Data Analyst, Clerk Grade 5/6 - 180025
 - 00006JCG
Temporary full time appointment for a period up to: 30 June 2019 with possibility of extension
Location: Parramatta

EDConnect is the Department’s new Shared Service Centre, delivering integrated transactional and advisory services (shared services) for the Department. Organisational performance in EDConnect is underpinned by the ‘EDConnect Way’ culture – we keep the customer at the centre of everything we do; we collaborate with and support each other to succeed; we take ownership of our work to ensure a quality outcome is delivered; we communicate transparently and listen actively; and we are accountable to each other to develop and grow.

About the role
The Master Data Analyst role delivers excellent customer service and specialist support, facilitated by strong customer relationships and working collaboratively with team members to create consistent, high-quality service delivery. This role requires a deep understanding of customer needs, and draws upon previous experience and specialist knowledge to effectively resolve internal and external customer enquiries in a prompt and professional way.

The role is responsible for the efficient delivery of a range of master data management activities for internal and external customers within a shared services environment. The role supports the Master Data team within Shared Services Finance functional area. The Finance function is responsible for managing all finance activities within the Shared Services function to ensure the smooth running of the Directorate. Finance activities include accrual accounting, posting general ledger journals, budgeting and funding, forecasting, financial reporting, accounts management (accounts receivable and payable), managing travel and accommodation expenses and benefits realisation.

Please click her for the organisation chart

About the Department of Education
The NSW Department of Education provides, funds and regulates education services for NSW students from early childhood to secondary school, delivering world-class education through its public schools and providing funding support to non-government schools. We employ, develop and support teachers, leaders and other staff to deliver the best outcomes for students and to advance the wellbeing of Aboriginal people.

How to apply
The NSW Department of Education is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce as an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer. We encourage diverse applicants from a range of backgrounds to apply for roles in the department.

To apply for this role, please submit an application by clicking “Apply Online” below. To apply, you will need to attach a cover letter (max. 2 pages) and your resume (max. 5 pages) in either Word or PDF format. Please address any pre-screening questions and any essential requirements. We are looking for you to demonstrate your competence in the focus capabilities as outlined in the role description in your answer, so please develop your response with this in mind.

Note: the selection process will include a range of assessment techniques to assist in determining your suitability for the role.

If you are called to interview you will need to provide the following documents and your employment may be subject to the Department’s Nationally Coordinated Criminal History Check to determine your suitability for employment.

Proof of Identity information
Informed Consent Form
Declaration for non-child work

PRE-SCREENING QUESTIONS:
Please provide us recent example/s of continuous improvement initiatives that you have developed/part of/implemented. How many stakeholders were involved in this process and what was the outcome? (300 words maximum).
Describe a situation where you had to deal with an escalation that requires you to do some research. How did you do that and ensure that your solution was fit for purpose . What strategies did you use to achieve a successful outcome? (300 words maximum).

ESSENTIAL REQUIREMENTS:
Appropriate tertiary qualifications Business Administration or a relevant/related discipline, and/or demonstrated successful experience in stakeholder/customer engagement in a Shared Services/Contact Centre environment.
Effective execution of the day to day activities of the Analyst function, following directions and consulting with the supervisor where required.

Closing date: 24 October 2018

Note: A recruitment pool may be created through this recruitment process. A recruitment pool is a group of applicants who have been assessed and identified as suitable for this role or similar roles, and who may be considered for a range of similar roles, including temporary, term or ongoing roles, over the next 12 months.
Location Sydney Region-Sydney - Greater West
Work Type Full-time
Number of Positions 1
Total Remuneration Package: $102,011. Package includes salary ($83,403 - $92,026), employer's contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading.
Contact Munir Rahman - 02 8633 1051
Closing Date 24-Oct-2018
Job Category Analyst
Organisation Department of Education

description:
Aurecon has a proud heritage of design excellence and delivery of complex projects. We have built our brand from that foundation and the trust our clients place in us. We describe what we stand for as “Bringing Ideas to Life” which reflects our belief that what we do best is to help clients bring their ideas to reality. Our “Just Imagine” initiative reflects our aspiration to help our clients become future ready and our design thinking strategy is an important part of this initiative.
We are now seeking applications from enthusiastic, experienced Business Analysts to join our Global Finance team. The position is based in Neutral Bay.
Your Role
You will be responsible for assisting the Global Advisory Commercial Manager by providing commercial and financial support, as well as assisting the Global management team to ensure the achievement of objectives. This position is required to provide high quality project support services to the global advisory leadership team working within Regions to enable true business partnership. You will provide commercial and financial interpretive analysis across a range of financial indicators to ensure complete understanding of financial aspects. The key responsibilities of this role include:Performing financial analysis to review business performance and key trends against strategic priorities. Identify and implement initiatives to drive business performance.Provide internal and external reporting requirements to ensure consistency, accuracy and timeliness of financial and non-financial reporting to achieve regulatory and business outcomesEnsure efficient use of business unit resources by providing support to business unit leaders in the effective management of staff utilisation and overhead costs in liaison with Commercial Managers.Assist the management of robust financial controls together with the Group Finance team to ensure integrity of all financial systems, processes and outputs.Prepare working capital results for global region and to delve into working capital performance including Working Capital updates, including a consolidation of the weekly cash forecast provided by each region.Provide support and consolidation of the budget process at global advisory regional level including project data, backlog analysis, P&L and operational cash flow statementGood understanding of the processes in place for projects in delivery including revenue recognition, cash flow management and project costs to complete to be able integrate project performance details when preparing the monthly commentary for global advisory results.Act as the key business partner for Leadership Finance teams and Regional Leadership Operational teams by providing financial support
About You
Your key qualities and skills would include:Substantial business acumenClear, comprehensive understanding of the link between Finance/Commercial initiatives and business strategyAbility to collect and synthesize large quantities of quantitative and qualitative dataAbility to recognize trends and develop recommendations based on data analysisAbility to develop and deliver relevant, effective training programs to targeted audiencesEffective team player and networkerStrong interpersonal, communication, and customer service skillsSolid knowledge of Finance/Commercial policies, processes and talent management practicesRelevant tertiary qualifications and technical post tertiary qualifications including CA or CPA qualifications or equivalent.5+ years’ experience in the relevant field of expertise.
What We Provide
We believe a career is not just a job; it's a collection of experiences you gain through professional networks, working with current technologies and expanding your knowledge base. All this while working on a broad range of projects and the possibility of local, interstate and international travel within a globally collaborative business.
Alignment with the Aurecon Attributes is also vital: Co-creative, Commercial, Sense-maker, Inquisitive, Engaging, Resourceful, Fearless and Unconventional Thinking.
Kindly refer to http://www.aurecongroup.com/en/careers/themes/why-join-aurecon/aurecon-attributes.aspx for more detail.
Working within the global Aurecon team offers extensive career prospects whilst providing an environment that empowers, encourages sustainability and promotes team work. For examples of some of our projects, visit http://www.aurecongroup.com/en/projects.aspx .
How to Apply
If you are seeking an opportunity to drive and deliver project outcomes, within a creative business that encourages innovation and fresh ideas, please click the Apply Now button below.
Aurecon is an equal opportunity employer.

The ideal candidate will have all or some of the following skills:
Experience working as a data analyst, technical business analyst or business analyst

description:
Come and join one of Australia’s most iconic brands; where inspiration is at its best. Freedom is one of the nation’s leading lifestyle retailers. We don’t just sell furniture, we sell the dream! Where our people can be themselves and deliver to the Australian people exceptional products at great value that are unique to the Australian way of life.
With over 35 years in the furniture and homewares industry, Freedom has established itself as a market leader, in style, on-trend products and quality. We are known for our great design and a customer experience that you will be proud to be part of.
We are committed to delivering a world class customer journey, coupled with a highly engaged retail team. Our number one priority is to build on our existing talents to create a culture that rewards high performance, fosters job satisfaction and invests in career opportunities.
Role:
This is a rare full time opportunity, where you manage and maintain the testing process for new and modified software before deployment into production. To define the user requirements for new and modified software and assist in the selection and evaluation of software based on these user requirements, as well as ensure a smooth handover of new software to the IT support teams.
Your responsibilities will be (but not limited to):
Elicit business requirements for new systems and system changes
Communicate to the Retail Operations required identified changes to systems procedures requirements
Resolve system issues escalated by IT Service Desk Analysts as required
Conduct testing as required for software to be released into production
Ensure the test environment is available for user acceptance testing and co-ordinate resources to complete tests with the relevant business units
Developing and maintaining integrations between systems using the company ESB/Middleware (Dell Boomi)
Assisting in the development of business reports and data extraction use Microsoft tools (eg MS SQL queries, MS PowerBI, MS Excel)
To be successful you will need:
3+ years experience working within a similar role
Strong technical writing skills
Strong MS Office skills
Experience in developing and executing test scripts (including automated test scripts). ISTQB or similar qualifications
Business Analyst experience and strong communication skills
Experience in a retail environment as a business analyst is highly regarded
Ability to interpret technical information and translate in business terms for users to understand
Strong problem-solving skills

description:
Come and join one of Australia’s most iconic brands; where inspiration is at its best. Freedom is one of the nation’s leading lifestyle retailers. We don’t just sell furniture, we sell the dream! Where our people can be themselves and deliver to the Australian people exceptional products at great value that are unique to the Australian way of life.
With over 35 years in the furniture and homewares industry, Freedom has established itself as a market leader, in style, on-trend products and quality. We are known for our great design and a customer experience that you will be proud to be part of.
We are committed to delivering a world class customer journey, coupled with a highly engaged retail team. Our number one priority is to build on our existing talents to create a culture that rewards high performance, fosters job satisfaction and invests in career opportunities.
Role:
This is a rare full time opportunity, where you manage and maintain the testing process for new and modified software before deployment into production. To define the user requirements for new and modified software and assist in the selection and evaluation of software based on these user requirements, as well as ensure a smooth handover of new software to the IT support teams.
Your responsibilities will be (but not limited to):
Elicit business requirements for new systems and system changes
Communicate to the Retail Operations required identified changes to systems procedures requirements
Resolve system issues escalated by IT Service Desk Analysts as required
Conduct testing as required for software to be released into production
Ensure the test environment is available for user acceptance testing and co-ordinate resources to complete tests with the relevant business units
Developing and maintaining integrations between systems using the company ESB/Middleware (Dell Boomi)
Assisting in the development of business reports and data extraction use Microsoft tools (eg MS SQL queries, MS PowerBI, MS Excel)
To be successful you will need:
3+ years experience working within a similar role
Strong technical writing skills
Strong MS Office skills
Experience in developing and executing test scripts (including automated test scripts). ISTQB or similar qualifications
Business Analyst experience and strong communication skills
Experience in a retail environment as a business analyst is highly regarded
Ability to interpret technical information and translate in business terms for users to understand
Strong problem-solving skills
Familiar with writing MS SQL queries
Able to work with and are familiar with TM1
Ability to work well in a team
We offer:
Great company and team culture
Free onsite gym & gym classes
Rewards and recognition - we believe in recognising our employees and our outstanding performers through various reward and recognition programs
Generous staff discounts across all reputable brands, incentive schemes and other benefits
If you have a positive and team player approach, who has a strong experience as a Business Analyst, then this is the role for you!

Workshops will need to be defined and facilitated. Creative problem-solving of issues will be required. There will be extensive interaction with patients, clinicians, governance bodies, Health technologists and solution vendor stakeholders.

What you will be doing:

Delivering high quality outputs while meeting deadlines.
Maintaining focus on key deliverables amid many competing demands.

Data Analysis techniques

Experience across primary, secondary and allied health sectors would be beneficial
Experience with health system solution vendors would be beneficial
Some interstate travel may be required (approx once a month). If this appeals to you, please call Denise on 0410 678 736 or apply NOW.
title: Senior Business Analyst

description:
Data Science in Sydney, Australia
@Metigy we are creating the next generation of AI-driven Marketing Technology (Martech) for business by helping them discover and unlock the secrets hidden in their data. Our AI is built on state-of-the-art data mining and delivered using the art of storytelling delivered through statistics and gamification. We aim to delight and reward our customers by improving their marketing performance and delivering best in class tools.

As a lead data scientist @Metigy, you will lead the team in creating and defining data-driven stories that help our customers understand and grow their marketing. We believe data should drive insights, trigger actions and reward our customers.

Our Mission is to help users succeed with our marketing assistant technology.

What You’ll be working on
You will be instrumental in conception and delivery of our product using AI to tailor and deliver marketing recommendations to customers
Using analytical methods and visualization techniques to surface marketing insights that lead to recommendations to drive key marketing decisions for customers
Selecting features, building and optimizing data collection, processing and classifiers using machine learning techniques
Develop company A/B testing framework and test model quality continually
Provide leadership and mentorship to the data team
Leading the Big Data Engineers to build highly available, scalable, and secure systems tacking technical ownership and managing resources
Coordinate with different parts of the business to help design and implement models to solve marketing challenges and monitor outcomes
From a vague question, you can come up with a thorough data-driven answer, doing ad-hoc research and analysis, presenting results in a clear manner and occasionally publishing research
What Data Scientist are you?
Firstly, what we have just described is something you are already passionate about.

You are product focused and see everything, theoretical or actual through to delivery
Strong problem-solving skills and a gift for telling beautiful stories with the data. You dream of working with large, multi-source, multi-faceted, complex, exciting datasets built from the Social Graph (can you tell we love our datasets?)
User Experience is part of the art of how a data scientist tells a data-driven story and you are passionate about building clear interfaces that give users the best experience possible
Experience working with and creating data architectures
Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
You love communicating with small, nimble teams in a high visibility role where you can really own the solution
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for communicating across teams
You’ve worked for over 5-7 years in a data related role and become a generalist because you love solving problems in creative ways and developing end to end solutions
Above all, you have the drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques continually. We live in a beautiful, ever-changing world that happens in real time, all the time. And our goal is to help our customers conquer that new frontier, one great recommendation at a time!

You will need to be Sydney based.
title: Lead Data Scientist in Sydney

description:
About the Company
Established in 2001, Australian owned and operation DX Solutions is one of Sydney's leading end to end ICT Service Providers having built a reputation for innovation, insight and leadership in the professional services industry.

As a rapidly growing business, DX was listed in BRW's Fast100 in 2014 and 2015 consecutively acknowledging the drive and commitment of our team of over 200 employees.

About the Role
As the Business Analyst, you will work effectively with stakeholders across the organisation to identify, analyse and collate the business requirements to enable the design, execution and successful implementation of key initiatives being pursued on the ERP and digital platforms. The ideal candidate will have extensive BA and integration experience in eCommerce and/or supply chain as well as multi-channel environments. This role is a 12-month fixed term contract.

Main Responsibilities:
Plan and execute process analysis and requirements gathering in a timely, efficient, and engaging manner
Gather & facilitate the definition of business requirements to a detailed level that all can easily understand
Effective translation of business requirements to convey the required functionality back to the business & technical staff
Ensure the various project teams thoroughly and accurately understand the business requirements and interprets those requirements correctly into technical specifications
Track progress on the delivery of specific features and address any business issues that arise during the development process.
Challenge assumptions to drive efficiencies through process and systems improvements
Provide expert advice and support to the business for testing and feature-related queries
Develop and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders across the organisation
Main Skills:
Strong experience with software development life cycle, business analysis methodologies and its application
Experience in applying process and methodology appropriate to achieve the required outcome given organisational maturity
Experience in conducting analysis and deconstruct the problem or solution ie. Business process models, decision models, work-flow diagrams or wire frame prototypes.
Experience in creation and execution of quality test scripts and data requirements
Ability to build strong stakeholder relationships across all levels of the organisation
Ability to create and present clear and concise documentation.
Highly developed problem-solving skills, tenacity, drive, creativity, sound planning and organizational skills, ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Knowledge and experience of ERP and CRM systems and how they are used in an eCommerce/multi-channel implementation
Qualifications:
10+ years business analysis experience across a variety of industries and functions, with an IT and business focus
3+ years UAT experience preferably with ERP systems
Working knowledge of waterfall and agile methodologies
Tertiary qualifications in an IT or business related
Highly proficient in the use of MS Office, MS Excel, and MS Visio or similar modelling tool
If you have the above skills and you are keen for a fixed term contract role, please “Apply Now”.
