description:
Digital Business Analyst-SYD000752
Flexible work options - work smarter in a way that suits your lifestyle.
18 weeks paid parental leave - for mum, dad & foster carers.
Opportunities available in both Sydney or Brisbane

Looking for an exciting, diverse and challenging new role with a global impact? Join a newly formed technology team in Australia's largest professional services firm that delivers cutting-edge digital products and automation solutions for our Assurance practice.

The Opportunity
At PwC, we help Australian businesses, not-for-profits and governments create value and improve the way they work. From improving healthcare, to creating smarter cities and igniting Australia’s start up industry, you’ll build trust in society and solve important problems.

The Assurance Innovation Lab is a small team of highly experienced designers, developers, data scientists and analysts who are responsible for delivering digital products and automation solutions to PwC’s Assurance business across the Asia-Pacific region.

We partner with subject matter experts across the business to advise on, design and develop technology-enabled solutions that help to transform the way we deliver assurance services to our clients.

Our Assurance business delivers a broad range of financial audit and risk advisory services. Our teams work with clients to help them protect and strengthen every aspect of their business, from people to performance, strategy to systems, and business plans to business resilience.

The Role
As the Digital Business Analyst you will be responsible for partnering with our client-facing teams and business subject matter experts to facilitate requirements gathering workshops, deconstruct processes and identify methods for standardising the way that they are delivered.
On a day-to-day basis you will be:
Facilitating business process analysis workshops with client-facing teams.
Applying human centred design principles in the design of products, services, and internal processes.
Deconstructing and documenting user stories, features and requirements in product backlogs.
Translating business process flows into repeatable workflows and business rules.
Partnering with designers and developers in the Digital CoE to help translate business needs into technical development requirements.
Facilitating engagement with business teams, including support during test planning and execution.
Actively participating in daily team stand-ups.
Participating in firmwide business analysis forums and communities to share ideas and contribute to our body of knowledge.

About you
The brief is simple...

Applicants must be able to demonstrate the following key capabilities and behaviours:
Exceptional problem-solving and critical thinking skills, an analytical mindset and outstanding attention to detail.
Strong presentation and facilitation skills in large group settings.
Experience applying design thinking methods and human centered design principles to solve business problems.
Strong experience writing user stories, business requirements and functional specifications.
Experience documenting processes using Business Process Model and Notation (BPMN).
Ability to understand complex technical requirements.
Ability to work efficiently with remote teams using collaboration technology.
Ability to identify issues and solve complex problems as part of a team.
Ability to remain calm when under pressure and meet demanding deadlines.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Experience working in Professional Services, Financial Services or Consulting environments.

Ideally, you will also have:
Experience developing low fidelity user interface wireframes.
Experience working on projects that follow an Agile Scrum methodology.
Experience documenting user stories, features and requirements in an Agile work management tool such as Microsoft’s Visual Studio Team Services (VSTS).

Sound like you? Read on.

What we offer
Working for Australia’s largest professional services firm you’ll join a global network spanning 157 countries that delivers meaningful outcomes for a wide range of clients.

Our culture and benefits are why we’re LinkedIn’s number one Australian workplace. With state of the art offices and premium technology, each person has access to flexible work options. The dress policy is flexible too – you choose what you wear based on the work you do with your team and clients.

Fostering an inclusive culture and embracing differences is at the core of everything we do. PwC empowers you to be yourself and work with people from many backgrounds to achieve things never thought possible. Get involved in our employee-led diversity networks (cultural, disability, LGBTI or gender equality) and benefit from our best-in-class policies such as 18 weeks maternity/paternity leave, flexible work and gender equity.

Up for a challenge? We’re committed to helping our people unleash their potential. Hard work doesn’t go unrewarded and industry best coaching, mentoring, training and development are ready and waiting. If you hold a genuine desire to make a difference and want to surround yourself with like-minded, talented and driven individuals who strive to do the same, apply now.

PwC is committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce. Our Reconciliation Action Plan sets out our commitment to increase Indigenous employment. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Australians.

Sam Thomas is the Recruitment Manager for the role. As the team experience high volumes of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all.

Job Software Design & Engineering
Primary Location Sydney
Job Type Full-time

description:
As a Business Analyst, you will join an Agile team that is creating the future of the experience for Financial Advisers by creating an exceptional, customised and simple digital platform. Drawing upon your wealth of experience with a client-facing user interface, you will be passionate in driving our product to be the best it can be.

Are you a Business Analyst with a passion for all things digital?

We’re building the future of the corporate banking experience by making it as easy and captivating as possible, just as it should be.

We're a little different to how Big banks and financial institutions work; we work like a small start up in a large organisation which is awesome, but unlike some start-ups we're fully funded to innovate and push digital boundaries.

You'll be a part of a team that loves the work they do and enjoys working with each other and are empowered to make decisions which result in the best product for our customers ... period.

As a Business Analyst, you will join an Agile team that is creating the future of the experience for Financial Advisers by creating an exceptional, customised and simple digital platform. Drawing upon your wealth of experience with a client-facing user interface, you will be passionate in driving our product to be the best it can be.

In this role you will join a diverse team with backgrounds from across the world, but with two mutual passion – all things tech and transforming client experiences. We are doing great things which will revolutionise how our clients interact with us and our products. You’ll be joining a digital team that loves the work they do and that thoroughly enjoys working with each other. We love Agile and you will be part of a fast and collaborative group, constantly being empowered to make decisions which result in the best product for our advisers and their clients.

As our business analyst you will work closely with the product owner and scrum team to refine and write user stories, provide guidance to the scrum team on user behaviour and to enhance user experience. You will help driving development, identify areas of improvement through data analysis and promote continuous improvement to enable us to achieve our strategic goals.
You will also be helping the team with ensuring the quality of work that is being delivered as well as sharing the responsibility of providing production support.

If you’re ready for this exciting opportunity, please apply using the link below or contact lucy.glover@macquarie.com

Banking and Financial Services Group (BFS) comprises our retail banking and financial services businesses, providing a diverse range of personal banking, wealth management and business banking products and services to retail customers, advisers, brokers and business clients. BFS operates predominantly in Australia and is organised into three business divisions: Personal Banking, Wealth Management and Business Banking.

Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

description:
4 or 5 days per week
Shared Services team
12 month contract
The Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) is Australia's central bank and has a unique and essential role to ensure economic strength and stability through the development of monetary policy and maintenance of a strong financial system. Our core values are promotion of the public interest, integrity, excellence, intelligent inquiry and respect.

The Bank is currently focusing on improving the efficiency and effectiveness of the Bank's internal services. To support this initiative we are seeking an experienced, pragmatic and consultative senior Business Analyst to undertake a review of HR and Finance processes across the Bank.

Reporting to the Business Process Improvement Manager, you will work closely with the functional process owners and SMEs to assess the current state of a range of key processes, review and modify where required and ensure consistency of process content, format and presentation.

Key responsibilities include, but not limited to:

Planning and facilitating workshop sessions to gather business requirements
Collating information for each "in scope" process including all documented procedures, task lists, work instructions and related policies
Capturing As Is processes
Validating changes with Functional Heads
Support design, testing documentation and implementation activities
To be successful in this role, you will need exceptional skills in business and data analysis, process review and reengineering and stakeholder relationship management. A background in Human Resources and/or Finance including experience in Shared Services would be an advantage.

The role could be filled on a part time basis provided the candidate can commit to a minimum of 4 days per week over the project duration.

Your application should include a resume detailing your experience and qualifications.

By joining the RBA, you’ll have the opportunity to work in a collegiate environment within a community of intelligent, inquisitive, and highly motivated people dedicated to understanding and improving our society.

The Reserve Bank of Australia is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace and encourage applications from experienced candidates seeking workplace flexibility.

title: Data / Business Analyst

description:
The Company

Hitachi Vantara combines technology, intellectual property and industry knowledge to deliver data-managing solutions that help enterprises improve their customers’ experiences, develop new revenue streams, and lower the costs of business. Hitachi Vantara elevates your innovation advantage by combining IT, operational technology (OT) and domain expertise. Come join our team and our employee-focused culture and help drive our customers’ data to meaningful customer outcomes.

The Role

Job Title: Specialist Business Analyst, Australia & New Zealand

Location: North Ryde, Sydney, Australia

Reports to: Financial Controller, Australia/New Zealand

Job Overview:

The Specialist Business Analyst is responsible for deal structuring support and the revenue recognition and compliance of all deals done within an assigned territory within the Australia and New Zealand region.

The Specialist Business Analyst will partner directly with the sales, services and support organisation to advise on all financial related aspects of customer contracts including, but not limited to, deal structuring advice, risk assessment, deal feasibility, customer’s credit risk and approval of non-standard terms whilst ensuring compliance within HITACHI VANTARA policy and meeting HITACHI VANTARA’s financial objectives. The Specialist Business Analyst is responsible for deal support and revenue recognition across multiple element arrangements such as Hardware, Software, Support, Professional Services and Managed Services. The BA is the primary interface between local country and SSC for all deal related topics.

Responsibilities

Deal Structuring, Revenue Recognition and Compliance:

Provide financial support to the sales Account Managers and Sales Directors through proper deal structuring utilising expertise and knowledge of leasing, consumption models, accounting, contracts and revenue recognition.
Business decision support on all deals including managed services business cases.
Provide local country Management with deal status and figures to ensure complete and accurate forecasts.
Accurate and timely recognition of the Product, Managed Services, Professional Services and Maintenance revenue, including maintaining provisions per the HITACHI VANTARA policies and procedures and month end reconciliation review.
Responsibility to put controls in place to ensure all transactions obtain proper approvals and follow the appropriate processes.
Review & Approval of Statements of Work for Professional Services engagements
Manage compliance with all Deal Management Process approvals, IFRS15 and HITACHI VANTARA policies across all transactions.
Responsible for the final review & submission of Deal Checklists & Sales Order Summary sheets (with all supporting documentation) to Shared Services Centre for processing.
Support HITACHI VANTARA’S internal and external audits where these audits relate to revenue recognition and deal structuring.
Contract Management:

Review & Approval of all customer contracts both standard and non-standard for compliance to HITACHI VANTARA policy and financial risk management
Engage legal, commercial and services team as appropriate to ensure the commercials are understood and properly contracted to maximise financial return to HITACHI VANTARA

title: Senior Business Analyst

description:
We’re BCG Digital Ventures. Welcome.

A wholly owned subsidiary of the Boston Consulting Group, we invent, launch, scale, and invest in game changing start-ups with the world's most influential companies. We know that we have the greatest impact when people with different perspectives from different backgrounds work together inclusively and with relentless dedication to the customer. BCGDV brings together multidisciplined teams to create extraordinary ventures that have a profound impact on the way the world thinks, works, interacts and behaves every day. If you have the passion, tenacity, and curiosity to build innovative businesses from the ground up, adventure awaits you…

Introducing our Engineering Team.

Our Engineers design, develop and maintain the technology which is at the core of our ventures, solving challenging problems with radically simple solutions that disrupt markets, generate value and positively impact millions of lives. Working in multidisciplinary teams of Product, Business, and Design professionals, Engineers at BCGDV build products from scratch and create testable software which delivers maximum value for our ventures. You are given the opportunity to learn technologies which are outside of your core specialism due to shifting projects and the opportunity to rotate from one venture to the next.

As a Lead Data Scientist, you will:
Use data-driven insights to craft new software products. You will be involved from the early stages of defining data needs and sourcing data, all-the-way through to productionising predictive models as part of working systems. As a data scientist, you have a solid grounding in scientific work and are able to define and communicate key metrics to stakeholders, as you progress through delivery.
Work as part of the engineering team to develop deployable and scalable software.
Rapidly plan, design, implement and test solutions to data-science problems.
Perform analysis on large sets of data to extract actionable insights and help drive decisions.
Work on end-to-end projects to ensure your findings are executed and tested in a desired way.
Work closely with cross-functional teams of data scientists, product managers, designers and engineers across the company who are passionate about building creative ventures.
Be a collaborating partner to product development teams, making and giving recommendations
As a Lead Data Scientist, you will need:
Solid experience as a data scientist, with a degree in Mathematics, Computer Science or a related quantitative discipline.
Experience developing software in a contemporary programming language (such as Python, Java, C++, R).
Practical experience using contemporary machine learning frameworks, such as caret, scikit-learn, tensorflow or similar.
Familiarity with current approaches and methodologies in solving core machine learning tasks, such as supervised and unsupervised learning.
Experience driving real world product or feature decisions based on your analysis.
Deep understanding of numbers, as well as a strong business sense.
Ability to understand and solve loosely defined problems, find answers and actionable insights to inform product development decisions.
Ability to query, manipulate and analyse large datasets.
Additional valued capabilities include:
PhD or similar research degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or related areas.
Expertise in recommender systems, personalization, collaborative filtering and content based filtering.
Experience working with deep-learning models to solve visual and language problems.
Open-source contributions to contemporary and relevant machine-learning libraries.
Ability to work with dashboard and visualization software (such as Tableau, D3, Mixpanel, Flurry or Google Analytics).
Experience collaborating closely with research to design novel analytical approaches.
Experience with distributed systems such as Hadoop/MapReduce, Spark, streaming data processing, cloud architecture.

title: Business Analyst - Data

description:
This role is within the data science team at CHE Proximity, a key pillar in this full-service agency's strategic offering.
The requirement is to work hands on with some of Australia's largest business' databases, manipulating a variety of data, analysing to identify insights & opportunities, and interpreting the findings in a clear and meaningful format that can then deliver business advantage.

Responsibilities include


Designing and building complex and often large data sets from a variety of sources
Thinking strategically about uses of data and the interaction with customer experience
Designing and implementing statistical data quality procedures around new data sources
Performing data studies and data discovery around new data sources or new uses for existing data sources
Implementing any software required for accessing and handling data appropriately
Implementing and handing over data checking and updating procedures
Performing statistical analysis (from basic significance testing to complex data modelling) with existing data sets
Being a leading voice in the development and advocate of machine learning and AI
Visualising and reporting data findings creatively in a variety of formats
Researching software and hardware related to new technology, for example mobile, and the data opportunity
Day to day liaison with clients, internal departments and 3rd party suppliers to enhance the work

Required Skills and Attributes


Degree in Statistics, Computer Science or related technical field
Utilisation of multiple diverse data sources (i.e. transactional databases, social media data and web analytics) to formulate insight-driven strategy across multiple channels, including direct and digital
Practical ability to visualize data, communicate the data, and utilize it effectively
Strong problem solving and logical skills
Ability to think creatively
Ability to work well both as part of a team and as an individual contributor
Proficiency in specific data analysis and data manipulation tools (e.g. R, Python, SAS, SQL)
Proficiency in data visualisation tools (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI)
Competent ability in MS PowerPoint and able to communicate the output
Strong mathematics and statistics skills

A Bit About Us
At CHE Proximity we solve business problems by starting with the value of customers.
By combining data, technology, customer experience (in both paid and owned channels) and disruptive content, we engineer communications that change customer behaviour and motivate greater commercial return.
When it comes to staff, we look for individuals who are passionate and dedicated to delivering world-class solutions. People who radiate and bring energy into every conversation and project. People who know who they are and where they are going.

description:
State Street’s IMS service is an integrated solution of technology, operations and processes for an Investment Manager who has outsourced their core investment operations functions to State Street. This typically includes trade management, settlements, data management, investment recordkeeping, valuations, reconciliations, cash forecasting, corporate actions, client reporting and information delivery. By outsourcing these functions to State Street, clients are able to free up resources to focus on expanding their product offerings and increasing their global reach, whilst taking advantage of our integrated, scalable platforms without incurring long-term technology expenditures.
Reporting to the Head of Program Delivery IMS APAC, the Project Manager has responsibility for managing projects associated with:
onboarding new Middle Office Clients
strategic initiatives for existing Middle Office Clients
Responsibilities
Instill a detailed status reporting process, including reporting against plan
Track the actual project expenses (including business & IT staff and travel costs) and compare/manage to the original project budget.
Creating the proper governance model, organization structure and culture across key areas of business and technology to enable the achievement of strategic/tactical goals.
Prepare the following baseline artefacts; Project Brief, Project Initiation Documentation, Project Plan
Manage the IMS Project Plan ensuring that tasks are planned, resources are allocated and due dates are clear. Focus on prioritization and key planning decisions.
Manage the scope of the project, including tracking the status of the IT development activities.
Maintain Issues and Risk Registers and Lessons Learned Log
Work with Test Manager and Conversion Manager, to ensure that the solution/processes and conversion tools are adequately tested prior to go-live.
Work with the Operational Readiness Manager to ensure that the business, systems and client are operationally ready prior to the go-live.
Work with IT in order to ensure alignment and delivery in line with the agreed plan.

You will work closely with finance and operations to provide key insight through effective communication and assisting stakeholders with decision making and reporting.
The Business Analyst will have enormous progression potential within the business. With a culture of fostering talent, the business ensures that talented employees are trained both laterally across the business as well as supporting promotions wherever possible.

Design & build reporting outputs

You have experience using Cognos reporting and feel comfortable building and developing reporting. Your prior experience with business analysis means that you feel comfortable and confident interacting with operations and finance teams. Your personality is energetic and strong and you have robust influencing skills. This position will require strong stakeholder management skills as you will interpret data and educate wider teams on how to utilise this to their advantage.

Your role will be to:
Run weekly reports, from multiple data sources, doing manual data manipulation using formulas/macros (combining/sorting/filtering)
Conduct data analysis and root cause assessment
Oversee data quality in Salesforce – from leads, opportunities, accounts, territory assignments, ownerships, hierarchy etc; and train the sales team as required
Perform manual data manipulation – identify data discrepancies, manually resolve bad data, determine patterns and make mass data updates to Salesforce
Perform list uploads into Salesforce for target campaigns
To be considered for this position you will have:
Expert Excel skills
Experience in the use of Salesforce (Certified Salesforce administrator is desirable)
Proven experience of analysing data with the ability to pull out insights and information that are meaningful to business leaders
Experience with QlikView would be advantageous
Working understanding of relational databases
Only Permanent Residents will be considered for this Contract opportunity

Click 'Apply' below to submit your resume for an immediate interview..

This leading media company based in the heart of Sydney CBD are currently looking for a highly motivated and ambitious Business Analyst with system, application and Data migration experience to come on board to join their highly collaborative, motivated and dedicated team. In this role you play a pivotal part working on a large transformation of work. You will gain exposure working with senior level stakeholders on a variety of different projects. You will display excellent aptitude, with the keenness to develop and hone your BA skillset

Essential Skills / Background
Analyse and challenge commonly held assumptions and accepted processes.
Examine and develop alternative solutions that are constructive and innovative.
Facilitate discussions with SMEs to elicit stakeholder requirements.
Drive and champion standardisation and seek the reduction of complexity in process and data design.

Assist in the analysis and design of entity models and database schemas.

Active listening and interview skills to fully understand stakeholder roles and responsibilities.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Data migration BA background, Data Warehousing / mapping

Data scientists will work closely with business partners to understand the business objectives and challenges and helps to design analytical solutions to meet business goals.
The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets and streaming data to find opportunities to help optimise portfolio performance, identify customer needs and test the effectiveness of different courses of action.
They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analytics methods, using a variety of analytics tools, building and implementing models.
They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights and must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams.
The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions and working with business stakeholders to improve business outcomes.

This is a great role where you will work closely with the business and be pivotal in producing information that can drive the way the business is run. It is incredibly commercial and requires someone just as commercial to come on board.

Qualifications and Key skills

Tertiary education in the Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics disciplines
3 + years’ experience in statistical modelling in a big data environment (Hadoop/Spark/R/Python).
Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SQL, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
Knowledge of a variety of statistical and data mining techniques (regression, statistical tests and proper usage, random forest, clustering, decision tree learning, deep learning text mining etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
Experience of applying machine learning techniques in solving real life problems, preferably in the business or banking domains.


These roles require full working rights and the ability. If you are interested in the role, please apply today or contact Adam at adam@talenza.com.au

description:
Brand Influence Group (BIG) is an industry leading experiential and field-marketing organisation that provides an outsourced solution for mobile workforce optimisation. Our mobile workforce community is over 1,500 strong across Australia and New Zealand includes experts in fields such as; brand representation, sales, and visual merchandising.

We are in search of a forward-thinking, proactive and energetic business professional to work with our well-known partners in FMCG. You will have proven experience in statistical modeling, and strong skills in data analysis, report generation and in providing key insights to help drive greater business efficiency, profitability, and growth. You will regard yourself as a Tableau and Microsoft Excel guru in complex functions and love working in a very fast paced dynamic customer environment.

Ideally, you will have a background in analysing high volume field-based project/services data where time, travel and tasks change on a daily basis and need to be reported on with pace.

To be successful in this role, your CV will need to reflect on following skill-set:
Key responsibilities:
Build and automate a broad range of required business reports for internal and external stakeholders on a daily and weekly basis using Tableau and Excel
Provide proactive and evidence-based customer Insights derived from these reports with operational efficiency and financial insights based on field force activity being key focus areas
Build dashboards and visual aids to support account teams and senior management decisions
Identify emerging issues in the current processes and suggest potential solutions
Support day-to-day operational requirements of the account - point of sale and resource allocation through collation and upload of account team/client requirements
Monitor operational performance of the account and manage communication and updates around quarterly KPI targets to ensure account team are on track to achieve results in line with expectations
Key skills required:
Experience working with Microsoft office products in particular within the Apple OS Platform.
Ability to model data using VBA or similar toolset, interpret this data to refine operational and financial requirements for strategic business accounts
Experience in data analysis and interpretation for:
Resource optimisation
In field execution statistics using real time data
Financial Analysis & ROI models
Immaculate communication and presentation skills and ability to present at meetings and client workshops
Advanced Microsoft Excel(including the ability to create complex pivot tables, use string formulas, perform index matching, "if" functions)
Experience in building customised reports using Tableau.
Strong data extraction, manipulation and cleansing skills and experience working with large, unstructured data sets.
Minimum of 3 years relevant experience (preferably in FMCG industry but not essential)
Educational requirements: Tertiary qualified in Business, Financial, Analytics, Statistical, Mathematics or Science background preferred.

We have a reputation for hiring the best talent in the market, and investing the time and individualised attention required to keep our team successful at everything they do.

Create Influence, Think BIG!

description:
TW Power Services (TWPS) is a leading provider of integrated asset management, operations and maintenance services to the power and energy industry. We work with our customers to achieve their goals by using best-practice systems and processes backed by technically skilled people to deliver project management, outage management and sustaining capital works operations and maintenance services. Our business is growing and we are seeking to add highly skilled and motivated people to our teams.

Due to ongoing business success, we have an opportunity for a Business Analyst to join the team based at our North Sydney office. Reporting to and working alongside the Senior Business Analyst, the Business Analyst supports business objectives and improvements through data and process analysis using an Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system.

This newly created role works closely with relevant business Subject Matter Experts (SME’s) on various projects to deliver value added performance and reporting to internal and external customers. This role suits someone who is developing in their career but already has a few years experience in working within the Microsoft Dynamics AX environment.

Key responsibilities will include:
Ensuring appropriate infrastructure elements, incl. documents, periodicals, manuals etc. are kept up to date
Developing best practice techniques and tools for project execution and key performance metrics
Serves as 1st level Microsoft Dynamics AX 2012 escalation point
Preparing manuals, data setup requirements, flows and procedures as documentation
Development of training documentation and training end-users
Make contributions in the development of Test Plans and Test Scripts and perform test execution
Liaise with various stakeholders to document business processes effectively
To be successful, you display:

Experience with Dynamics AX
Experience of a Dynamics AX implementation is beneficial
Strong knowledge of Dynamics AX Finance and Project modules (additional knowledge of Enterprise Asset Management desirable)
Functional requirement gatherings and documentation experience
Fit-Gap analysis and submitting business cases for change
End User training and support
Atlas & Power BI Report development essential
IT degree/certification preferred

The ideal candidate is still emerging in their career but has some experience in Microsoft Dynamics AX 2012 process mapping and documenting business requirements, gathering and producing user guides and how-to manuals.

Thriving in a dynamic, responsive environment, you couple a 'can do' attitude with a positive, friendly demeanour. Curious by nature, your ability to engage a broad range of people will ensure success. In return for your skills, experience and attitude, we offer a competitive remuneration package and you join Australia’s leading independent asset solutions provider to the Power Generation industry.

Pre-employment checks form part of the recruitment process for TW Power Services, these include reference checks and a pre-employment medical including drug & alcohol screen. You must hold valid working rights to be considered for this role.

TW Power Services is an equal opportunity employer that promotes an open and inclusive culture.

description:
Prospa, Australia's #1 online lender to small businesses.

We are a visionary FinTech leader that changes the lives of under-serviced small business owners in Australia. We build innovative and easy to use financial products that help small businesses achieve their dreams, by providing fast and easy funding pathways around their business challenges.

We are proud to say that on our journey so far we have helped over 12,000 small business customers across Australia, injecting over half a billion dollars into the Australian economy, and counting.

Prospa is extremely passionate about its people. Their diversity, skills, and passion are the foundation of what we deliver to our customers. Our people, in turn, are driven by our values.
Obsess About Customers - We don’t just listen, we hear what’s important.

5* Trustpilot Customer Rating (9.8/10)
Be Bold, Open and Real - Have the courage to take smart risks.

Winner - 2017 FinTech Australia ‘Finnie’ Award for ‘Best Leaders’
Day 1 – We’re driven by the start-up mentality.

Winner - 2018 Financial Times High-Growth Companies (Asia Pacific)
Deliver Value Fast – We celebrate outcomes not process.

Winner - 2015 Deloitte Tech Fast 50 (Almost 7000% growth in three years)
Simplicity – The work of a true genius is making the complex simple.

Winner - 2017 Fintech Business Awards ‘Lending Innovator’
One Team – Success comes from embracing different perspectives.

4.6* Glassdoor Staff Happiness Rating & 2018 Aon Best Employer

Our Risk Insights & Solutions team is responsible for measuring, monitoring and controlling risks originating from the business.

The key focus areas of the team are: Building sophisticated risk rating systems for credit underwriting, pro-active portfolio management, credit risk reporting and audit.

As Risk Business Analyst you will join the RI&S team providing support across a vast range of credit & risk related areas such as process mapping, audit and fraud prevention.

Key activities include:


Being a single point of contact & owner for the end to end process related documentation; specific to risk management
Responsible for understanding business requirements and translating them in bite sized specs
Being able to work in an agile environment & actively participate in various agile ceremonies, such as scrums & working in cross functional teams
Creating, maintaining & updating a thorough framework for audit & review of applications in the credit portfolio
Preparing thorough training packs to share the learnings from the audit & review exercise
Responsible for designing and imparting training to the wider operations staff
Oversee the fraud prevention & operational risk functions within credit & risk.
Responsible for credit administration activities such as: Delegated Lending Authority framework, credit policies and procedures, etc.
Responsible for iteratively improving technical & business specification documents




Essential Qualifications, Experience & Skills:

Should hold a degree in commerce / finance
Minimum of 3 years relevant work experience in financial services; banking or credit lending preferred
Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint & Visio)
Basics of SQL / ability to query a database is desirable
Eye for detail and strong believer in documentation
Able to analyse data, present and communicate findings and generate recommendations and insights.



Competencies and Personal Attributes:

Should be enthusiastic and willing to work with different stakeholders
Attention to detail and ability to articulate effectively is a must
Ability to organise resources – stakeholders time, their consent, common understanding of cross-functional teams and being able to derive the desired outcomes



Come and join us
We offer a unique opportunity to shape and contribute to a flourishing, fast-growing business as an integral part of a highly engaged team with great perks and a fun workspace.

Achieving our vision to change the way small business owners experience finance requires a diverse group of passionate, creative and innovative people. You can find out a bit more about working at Prospa here.

We never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.

With the greatest respect, we will not be accepting CVs from recruitment agencies for this role.

description:
We’re on the search for an experienced Technical Business Analyst to join the team, to work on some of our most exciting and high-profile tech projects across the business.

We only want the country's most switched-on talent to join us on the Vocus journey. You will be passionate, motivated and ready to shake up the Telco industry by thinking outside the box and helping to make Vocus the Most Loved Telco.

In this role as Technical Business Analyst you’ll work within the technology environments across a range of telecom and other infrastructure & systems operations projects that utilize the latest technologies. An important part of the role will be to assist in the definition of our key technical solutions, that will help us drive operational effectiveness and efficiencies.


What you’ll do:
Work with internal technology teams and potential suppliers and vendors to develop business justifications, proof of concept or feasibility assessments.
Be accountable for project concept proposals, feasibility assessments, solution artefacts and initiatives.
Support the operationalisation of new technology, products and services in the business.
Working with project stakeholders to gather and document detailed service migration requirements, new infrastructure builds, system enhancements and other technology operations function.
Facilitating Inception, Estimation & Planning and Retrospective session
Produce use cases, user stories, acceptance criteria and diagrams as needed to clearly define and communicate systems requirements.
Develop and maintain strong relationships our key tech stakeholder groups around the business.

What you’ll need:
3-4 years as a Technical Business Analyst, ideally with proven hands on experience in the telecommunications or transferable industry.
A detailed understanding of operational activities in a telecommunications and IT.
Industries, and of technologies used by key operational delivery groups.
Demonstrated ability to work with large teams to develop their functional competencies through process improvements environment.
Solid foundation of Agile Delivery.
Excellent negotiation skills, practical experience with key stakeholders both internal and external
Demonstrated experience and skills in identifying 'as is' and 'to be' infrastructure, system and data requirements.
Technical skills in process modelling (including experience utilising BPMN or LEAN principles) and data analysis and modelling.
There will be some interstate travel expected.

Why Vocus?
Vocus Group is an award winning and fast-growing telecommunications infrastructure provider to the telco and corporate markets in Australia and New Zealand.

Our success and growth is attributed to our people, as part of the Vocus team you’ll work with clever people #nomuppets, People that have a crack and an environment where new ideas are welcome and encouraged!
So if you’re someone who thinks outside the square, loves a challenge and thrives on success then this could be your calling!

Ensure that SMEs' (subject matter expert) needs are not narrowed down to (existing) routine and practices but instead have a broadened understanding of issues and possible solutions to allow the project deliver optimal results.
Assist and support SMEs understand and take a business (cross-functional) process approach to problem resolution and avoid narrowing their focus to within their immediate functional area.
Assist and support SMEs adapt and accept the TechnologyOne "out of box" as a first and only option unless there is a clear case for variations.
Ensure that the project stream is delivering to the overall project objectives and timeline.
Ensure that SMEs are educated and are prepared to participate productively throughout the various stages of project life cycle.
TechnologyOne solution meets Council operational requirements

Ensure that Council's requirements are met by the TechnologyOne solution by:

Assisting SMEs to thoroughly articulate Council's (operational) requirements. Reconcile these requirements against TechnologyOne's "out of box" process model. Any variation to "out of box" must be validated and justified against Council's priorities, policies and business processes.
Ensuring that all project deliverables are captured in the TechnologyOne Solution Design Document (SDD) and that these deliverables can be reconciled against Council's business processes, policies and priorities.
Assist SMEs in reviewing and signing off on the SDD before configuration by consultants can commence development work.
Assist SMEs in documenting the acceptance criteria for all deliverables and build these criteria into test plans.
Acceptance of project deliverables

Devise test plans to validate project deliverables making sure that the timeline is aligned with the overall project schedule for solution configuration and data migration.
Ensure that testing includes validating
The overall solution against Council's business processes, policies and priorities.
Data from legacy systems are correctly migrated.
The performance (response time and through put) of the solution is in line with expectations.
Manage the testing effort in a manner that delivers a complete and conclusive outcome with proper controls, due diligence and approvals.
Ensure that SMEs participate productively in testing activities and with issues accurately documented for resolution.
Project data migration objectives are met

Prepare Council staff for the new operating environment

Understand and scope the training requirements to prepare all affected staff to operate the new system and design the training plan in response to this requirement.
Assist with or prepare the training material required for end user training.
The Successful Applicant
Essential Criteria:

Degree qualifications in a related field or extensive relevant experience
A well-developed knowledge of (NSW) local government corporate business systems.
Proven experience working in a large scale business systems implementation and transformation project with demonstrable understanding of the role of a business analyst in a project environment including:
Proven ability to lead a team within a project.
Having the ability to act effectively at various levels of detail (business process, business systems, data, procedures, testing, planning).
Facilitating problem-solving and decision-making processes.
Use project management and change management techniques to implement business process changes and technology.
Actively involved in project activities, such as planning, business case development, work package development, requirements elicitation and documentation, acceptance planning and execution, data migration and training.
Proven ability to understand and capture business and (reconcile) system requirements.
Strong leadership skills including the ability to influence across the organisation
Strong written and verbal communications skills.
Excellent analytical, research and presentation skills.

Desirable Criteria:

Experience with InforPathways, TechnologyOne and/or Civica local government solutions.
Experience with migrating and validating large scale data from legacy systems into a different platform.
Experience with developing and managing test plans for acceptance of solution.
What's on Offer
On offer is the opportunity to be involved in a dynamic government project

Competitive day rates

3 month contract

Contact:
Nathan Velu

description:
Exp. in Investment Control and translate requirements into user stories
Exp. working in trading operations in Agile environment & production type issues
Provide BA level support function to support and enhance the unison application
Business Analyst (Unit Pricing)
North Sydney NSW
Large Tier 1 Financial Organisation
Join a High Performing Team
Permanent role
We are looking for Business Analyst who loves to Analyze – Wealth Technologies and Delivery
Someone who has experience with Unit pricing, who can translate requirements into user stories and give it to tech team developers to develop
Previous experience in investment funds, how trading operations work in Agile environment, work with production type issues, experience in investment control.
Experience in supporting the unit pricing application called as Unison (it is inhouse) – Provide BA level support function to support and enhance the unison application.
This is a trading platform – data flows from one direction to other – real time algorithms or unit prices required for business to make decisions
Work with Business and Tech team to get the job done
This unison platform runs on Oracle DB, UNIX OS, Oracle Middleware, written in C++, vb.net as a front-end
DETAILED JOB DESCRIPTION:
Reporting to Manager, Engineer
Support & Develop core Wealth applications
Opportunity to become the best you can be
The Retail and Corporate Superannuation Team are seeking quality focused, enthusiastic, Analyst Engineer to join us in supporting and delivering solutions for our Wealth Applications,
You will contribute in an AGILE environment and work within the AGILE scrum team in the analysis, testing, implementation, support and continuous improvement of our applications, with specific focus on the Unison (Unit Pricing) and Cashiering Applications
Key responsibilities of this role will include:
Elicitation of business requirements using the most appropriate method(s), including interviews, questionnaires, workshops, existing systems and policies and regulation
Analysis and specification of requirements that are uniquely traceable, verifiable and prioritized in a manner that is acceptable to both business and technology stakeholders
Documenting business processes, needs and issues for workable, quality, efficient and cost-effective technology solutions that meet strategic and global objectives of the business unit
Effective use of data and process modelling tools (including, but not limited to, process mapping, business, object and dataflow modelling) to analyses and represent information in an effective form, to translate business requirements into meaningful statements of work
Model current and proposed business processes, identifying stakeholders, gaps and opportunities for improvement, to ensure a smooth system implementation
Liaise with Business Unit Managers to offer advice and direction regarding requirements, and resolution of issues and conflicts. Liaise with technical specialists in business areas such as Risk and Operations, to offer advice and resolve issues on systems
Act as an interface between Business and Technology to ensure that needs are met
Using structured user acceptance testing processes and documentation, verify that business requirements have been met
Support the implementation of new systems through training and documentation and ensure that business processes are not adversely impacted by the implementation of a software system
Financial background essential. Prior experience in Unit Pricing and/or Funds Management systems preferred.
Demonstrated knowledge of complex finance systems and related business processes.
Provide support to ensure availability of systems for business activities. This may involve monitoring of Applications and Systems within Production to ensure that they are functioning as expected day to day. Early morning support activities as well as Overnight/On Call Support for applications may be required as part of this role
Working closely with Developers to investigate business processes, procedures and user requirements to establish system requirements.
Working closely with other team members in a forum to share and discuss the latest technology process and to learn and understand the code used by the core application
Procedures to develop / modify structured code to produce quality programs using the AGILE framework
Contribute to the on-going evaluation and quality review of system development processes or procedures to deliver improved team productivity and efficiency
Support and undertake unit testing activities in relation to software solutions to ensure agreed specifications are always met. This includes contributing to maintaining operating environments to enable testing which reflects user environments
Conduct peer reviews / post implementation reviews to assess the effectiveness of the Technology solution provided
Participate in enterprise wide regular implementations
Ensure all work is carried out and documented in accordance with required standards, methods and procedures to support information retention and re-use. This includes contributing to the development of systems documentation such as Asset Lifecycle Plans.
Achieve key Systems Development Life Cycle stages in terms of quantity, timing and quality of all aspects of work allocated
Your background:
Financial background essential. Prior experience in Unit Pricing and/or Funds Management systems preferred.
Demonstrated knowledge of complex finance systems and related business processes
3 years in applicable business, project or technology environment
Formal training in analysis and project management, process mapping, analytical tools (e.g. case modelling)
Ability to think broadly and draw on wide personal experience in both the applicable business and technology environments
Working in Waterfall and Agile environments.
Demonstrated ability in analysis and problem solving
To be considered, it is expected that you will most likely have the following qualifications and experience:
Relevant Wealth Management / Financial Service Industry experience advantageous
Tertiary qualification in a relevant Business/Technology discipline or related field would be desirable but not essential
Superannuation and Unit Pricing experience preferred
How to apply:
Please apply using the link below or call (Neil – 03 8506 6522) for further details. Applications closes based on the volume of applications received. Only short-listed candidates will be contacted. Please share your resume in Word format only.
Adaps is an equal opportunity employer that actively embraces diversity in its workforce through accurate community representation of gender, culture; thought and work arrangements.

description:
We are working with an exciting, successful fintech company where machine learning and data science are at the core of their product, growth, profitability and competitive advantage. We are seeking a senior data scientist who has worked in a start-up (or small team) and implemented machine learning algorithms in production environments.

Exposure to building reliable Machine Learning infrastructure/pipelines and optimising models and code working closely alongside machine learning & data engineers is key to this role.

This particular requirement is mandatory as we want someone who has overcome similar challenges and problems and knows how to build products and get things deployed.

From a business acumen and cultural fit perspective, you will be well-acquainted with meeting deadlines under pressure and have the ability to draw the line and ship work that isn’t perfect (then iterate and improve later).


Required skills & experience:

4-5 years of experience in a data science role carrying out modelling and machine learning in a commercial, production environment – preferably a start-up or innovation lab
Strong SQL, R and Python skills – with experience in Linux OS and working to build real products/applications alongside engineers and dev teams
Good stakeholder management skills and pragmatism to identify the correct level of accuracy needed for different priorities and projects.
Insurance or dynamic pricing experience is advantageous but not mandatory
Passion for learning and keeping up to date with both techniques and developments in the fields of Machine Learning and data-related technologies
Spark, Scala, PySpark, Spark-SQL, SparklyR, Java experience would be nice to have.

What makes this role different:

This is an already successful start-up – well beyond the ‘early days’, with large revenue, recognition and already impressive growth in Australia and overseas markets.
Production ready: you have probably been looking for a legitimate, challenging role where your work isn’t shelved or looked at as ‘too hard to implement…’
This is a product-based company and data science is a key competitive advantage for them. Your work is central to their success and this role is due to growth, not catching-up to the market...
They have global scope and you would be working with high calibre peers and founders from Google, Yahoo, etc.
End-to-end work; if successful, you will be involved in the entire lifecycle from conception to build, finetuning, maintenance, productionisation and refinement.

If you are interested in this role, but have not been working on implementing and deploying machine learning models in production yet - please check some of our other openings, which may be more suited to you at this stage of your career.

If you are specifically a machine learning engineer and interested in this company, please email me directly instead of applying for this DS role; patrick@talentinsights.com.au
title: Senior Data Scientist - Production Machine Learning Experience

description:
Are you a Technical Business Analyst with three plus years of experience and strong skills around data?

Do you have a technical background & seeking the role that's really going to kick-start your career, working for a highly prestigious global firm?

If you want to work for a company at the forefront of technology in a team with an awesome culture and benefit from excellent career growth opportunities, hit the Apply for this job button now!

They are:


As a highly prestigious international finance firm, they have a focus on hiring the best technologists on the market, but more than that, people who fit their genuinely collaborative, supportive & driven culture.

You'll enjoy working in premium CBD offices (arguably the nicest in Sydney), with amazing views, fantastic facilities, onsite gym, library and paid breakfasts & lunches (prepared by their chef).

With a friendly, personable & very knowledgeable manager, you'll gain exposure to finance & trading, guaranteed bonuses & wonderful perks.


You are:


You’re a Junior to mid-level Technical Business Analyst with around three to five years of experience & a highly analytical approach to working through problems and coming up with solutions.

You come with solid experience working with data and know how to find information, analyse it, then piece the puzzle together.

The tools you use are up to you, it may be Python, SQL, Excel etc. and you’ll ideally be able to do some back-end testing.


The role:


As a Technical Business Analyst, you will partner with technical & business teams to analyse processes and recommend, implement, and/or support technology based solutions that align high level project goals.

Working in a small projects team of four, you’ll have the opportunity to progress into project management in the longer term, move into different teams (risk, back-office etc.) or move into data analytics.

The work in this role will be varied and will span across all parts of the business, with some emphasis on market data.

Requirements / Skills / Experience:


Curious nature & ability to ‘investigate’ situations to find the information you need
Skills to understand, analyse, diagram and describe complex distributed systems, processes and high level data flows
Able to analyse and document business processes and use cases, diagram system topologies
Able to leverage knowledge of the software development life cycle to enhance the analysis, coordination and maintenance of tasks
Some back-end testing
A few years of experience providing application and/or systems implementation and technical business analysis / task management
Strong analytical/problem solving skills

This is a great opportunity - To apply, please submit your CV via the portal by clicking the APPLY for this job button below.

You can also contact Erinn Brukmann on 0422 154 366.

description:
This leading media company based in the heart of Sydney CBD are currently looking for a highly motivated and ambitious Business Analyst with system, application and Data migration experience to come on board to join their highly collaborative, motivated and dedicated team. In this role you play a pivotal part working on a large transformation of work. You will gain exposure working with senior level stakeholders on a variety of different projects. You will display excellent aptitude, with the keenness to develop and hone your BA skillset
Essential Skills / Background
Analyse and challenge commonly held assumptions and accepted processes.
Examine and develop alternative solutions that are constructive and innovative.
Facilitate discussions with SMEs to elicit stakeholder requirements.
Drive and champion standardisation and seek the reduction of complexity in process and data design.
Work closely with the Data Migration team to map data structures and processes across different platforms
Build models and classification structures to make complex processes understandable and measurable.
Assist in the analysis and design of entity models and database schemas.
Map database schemas across different data stores including SaaS applications, Data Warehouses and ad-hoc repositories.
Create business process models using the Business Process Model and Notation (BPMN) specification to allow a clearer understanding of procedures.
Write Epics and Stories across different business domains and systems as part of the Agile team.
Contribute to the management of the Product Backlog and Sprint planning to ensure the MVP delivers business value early and often.
Active listening and interview skills to fully understand stakeholder roles and responsibilities.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Able to work effectively on digital and cloud projects with solid agile practices adhering to lean principles.
Contribute positively and proactively to the project, and willing to cross functional boundaries and roles to get things done in a flat organisational structure.

To be successful for this position you must have:
Over 3+ years demonstrated project team experience delivering complex solutions in an agile environment.
Knowledge of operational, finance, CRM and online systems, especially SaaS applications
Experience of middleware integration products and patterns.
Good technical understanding of current and emerging technologies and how other enterprises are employing them to drive digital strategy
Willingness to learn and develop you BA skillset
Enjoy working in a social and strong working culture

If you have the above experience and want to join a fun, fast paced passionate team please forward your resume to julians@charterhouse.com.au or call me on 9641 2453.

description:
Large government organisation based in Chatswood
Initial contract until end of June 2019 with further extension
Needs to have previous experience working within the health sector
Our client is a large government organisation based in Chatswood.

They are looking for a Clinical Business Analyst who will provide clinical expertise to the design of clinical solutions during the analysis and design phase for a Single Digital Patient Record.

As part of the design process, the Clinical Business Analyst will be managing the review and analysis of the organisation's clinical intentions, services, processes and information needs to identify changes that lead to enable a single digital patient record. The key role is to manage processes associated with receiving, reviewing and actioning requests for new and changed functionality.

Accountabilities include:

Provide leadership in driving the elicitation of clinical and business requirements using a broad range of engagement techniques including, data and systems analysis, requirements workshops, site visits, process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, event lists, business analysis, task and workflow analysis, and/or viewpoints.
Utilise clinical expertise in user requirements analysis, translate clinical requirements into design recommendations, engage and negotiate with stakeholders and provide leadership in the delivery of safe and high quality solutions.
Manage and update clinical design and support documentation in line with agreed design principles, best practice and quality assurance processes.
Oversee the review and analyse of existing application design to optimise functionality, workflows and usability including performing gap analysis, communicating specific enhancement requirements to relevant support teams/vendors, and co-ordinating user acceptance testing.
Provide direction and clinical advice on the strategic development of business plans and processes aimed at enhancing the efficiency of the Design & Build team and support the implementation of strategy and processes.
Manage and support projects by undertaking analysis and impact assessments including testing, training and business transitions.
To apply for this role, please send your application online to the attention of Kristin Shi.

description:
The Organisation
This is a global Financial Services organisation headquartered in Europe. The major services they provide include Investment Banking, Wealth Management and Asset Management for both Corporate and Private clients.

The Role

To ensure that security is factored into the evaluation, selection, installation and configuration of hardware, applications for external customers and software necessary for the programme. You will be implementing technical controls to support and enforce defined security policies of the organisation. The Security Business Analyst is highly motivated professional with quality-oriented mind-set. He/she is passionate about development and ready to pick up tasks that cover functional and non-functional requirements.

You
You will be implementing the security IAM for the customer facing applications including mobile apps (You must have this experience)
Facilitate workshops and solution review sessions with business stakeholders and technical personnel, and manage feedback loop and expectations.
Analyse and capture IAM requirements in close collaboration with all stakeholders
Write functional requirements using use case specifications, user stories, flow diagrams, sequence diagrams and acceptance criteria
Assist with the development, testing and implementation of the Identity and Access Management solution – this will include providing direction to technical, other analyst and test resources in the team, ensuring that there is consistent high quality in the work that is produced.
Develop and re-engineer procedures and processes as required, ensuring that any changes make the best use of the features inherent in the technology, and future extensibility of the solution
Skills
5 years’ experience as a Business Analyst in software development
Strong understanding of the Cyber/Information Security space.
Strong understanding of finance / banking / IT industry products, services and internal functions
Knowledge of web-based security architecture and service-based integration architecture i.e., API security
Experience with or knowledge/awareness of a broad range of security controls and technologies such as firewalls, key management, tokenisation, IAM, network segmentation, MFA, App whitelisting, encryption, data classification, zoning models and cloud services
Experience in implementing / integrating with multi-factor authentication methods like Vasco Digipasses or RSA tokens, SMS based authentication, device app based authentication

description:
My client is an innovative Financial Services giant who are committed to the application of Advanced Analytics and Data Science in order to maintain competitive advantage. As their Data Science function (which is building a reputation for delivering real advantages within the business) continues to grow and I am looking for experienced Data Science & Data Insights hires to join their team.

I am looking for candidates from either a Software Engineering/Machine Learning background or those from either a Data Science or more traditional Statistical/ Predictive Modelling background who have fluent programming skills (Python and R are essential) and typically have strong academics in a relevant discipline (BSc, MSc, PhD Data Science, Statistics, Actuarial, Computer Science et al) and who wish to join a high performing team involved in practically every aspect/business function possible and are regarded as increasingly essential to business improvement.
Alternatively, If you have solid SQL experience and have real expertise on finding, delivering Insights and turning data into meaningful information that can drive real business (strategic or tactical) decisions and genuinely add value then this could be the role for you.
If you are a Data Scientist who could also walk into a high performing Senior Insights role with a Consulting firm (eg, presentation skills, customer engagement, strategy and planning, insights to find opportunities, drive sales etc.) then stop what you are doing and send me your CV !- I need to speak with you immediately : -)
Working with other Data Scientists, specialist 3rd party teams & key stakeholders, your core role will involve the design, development, testing and deployment of analytically focused algorithms designed to solve business problems. Your tool-kit to deliver on this will include methods and techniques such as Data Visualisation, Natural Language Processing, Statistical & Machine Learning Modelling, BigData etc. Working as part of a high performing team you will work as part of a broader cross-functional group of Data Scientists and Engineers, Back-End Engineers, UX experts so the ability to communicate effectively, enjoy the process of having your ideas positively challenged and also looking to improve your peers output is a key component of my clients culture and expectations for you in this role.
This role requires a strong coding focus so it is important that you have fluent programming skills and a strong grasp of computer science/software engineering fundamentals. Working in an Agile environment with a CI philosophy employed you will need to enjoy keeping current with new technologies, tools and methodologies and how they can be practically employed. Alternatively, first class Insights Analyst's will be considered regardless of level of coding although the more the merrier is my clients thoughts on this.
The ability to thrive is an environment where your core focus is complex problem solving on a daily basis is key. Candidates can come from a diverse set of disciplines so what is important is that you can combine Advanced Analytics qualities with software development qualities and have a decent level of commercial and organisational awareness as you apply your Data Science expertise to solve business problems.
This is an exciting time to be joining my client as they continue their growth internationally and continue to innovate in a vast variety of ways (e.g. Self Service Analytics/AI arena. Whilst these roles require first class technical capabilities equally important is the ability to understand business problems, business context, have a grasp of organisational and commercial realities and incorporate effectively all these diverse factors into the analytical features/services and algorithms that you build.
My client offers a first class working environment – professional, collegiate and creative all in one. Working alongside some of the finest Data Scientists and Software Engineers anywhere in Australia you can be sure that this role will offer fantastic challenges and opportunities with a real focus on your professional growth. Having a positive attitude towards your own self-development is key.
Ideally I am looking for applications from more Senior candidates (e.g. 5+yrs exp) who can assist with the bigger picture challenges associated with running a high performing product/feature development team although candidates with less experience but who can demonstrate they have the technical and business smarts to succeed in this environment should not hesitate to apply.
In short, this is one of the finest Data Science related opportunities you will see in Sydney in 2018. Strong & innovative leadership, a superb work culture and environment, fabulous opportunities for progression given the company trajectory/ pace of growth & the ability to make a meaningful contribution/have a tangible impact on a day to day basis makes this role seriously not to be missed. Please apply online with an up to date CV/Resume or call Declan on 0452411968 for a confidential discussion.
title: Data Scientists/Insights Professionals, Western Subs, Sydney

description:
The Organisation
This is a global Financial Services organisation headquartered in Europe. The major services they provide include Investment Banking, Wealth Management and Asset Management for both Corporate and Private clients.

The Role

To ensure that security is factored into the evaluation, selection, installation and configuration of hardware, applications for external customers and software necessary for the programme. You will be implementing technical controls to support and enforce defined security policies of the organisation. The Security Business Analyst is highly motivated professional with quality-oriented mind-set. He/she is passionate about development and ready to pick up tasks that cover functional and non-functional requirements.

You
You will be implementing the security IAM for the customer facing applications including mobile apps (You must have this experience)
Facilitate workshops and solution review sessions with business stakeholders and technical personnel, and manage feedback loop and expectations.
Analyse and capture IAM requirements in close collaboration with all stakeholders
Write functional requirements using use case specifications, user stories, flow diagrams, sequence diagrams and acceptance criteria
Assist with the development, testing and implementation of the Identity and Access Management solution – this will include providing direction to technical, other analyst and test resources in the team, ensuring that there is consistent high quality in the work that is produced.
Develop and re-engineer procedures and processes as required, ensuring that any changes make the best use of the features inherent in the technology, and future extensibility of the solution
Skills
5 years’ experience as a Business Analyst in software development
Strong understanding of the Cyber/Information Security space.
Strong understanding of finance / banking / IT industry products, services and internal functions
Knowledge of web-based security architecture and service-based integration architecture i.e., API security
Experience with or knowledge/awareness of a broad range of security controls and technologies such as firewalls, key management, tokenisation, IAM, network segmentation, MFA, App whitelisting, encryption, data classification, zoning models and cloud services
Experience in implementing / integrating with multi-factor authentication methods like Vasco Digipasses or RSA tokens, SMS based authentication, device app based authentication
