title: Senior Business Analyst

description:
MVP* is seeking to recruit two Business Analyst roles for long term contract work with one of our Commonwealth government clients.
About us. MVP* provides skilled lawyers and other professionals to government, corporate and not-for-profit in-house teams all over Australia. Our contracts range in length from a few days to over two years.
Your role. We’re currently looking for two experienced Business Analysts who will be working on one of two projects:
Human Systems Project - The project scope is to review and replace HR Systems within the entire HR domain which may include Core HR and Payroll, Recruitment, Learning Management, Performance Management and Rostering.
Integrated Response Project - The scope of the role for this FY is to be responsible for analysing and assessing business processes and systems (current and future), gathering and documenting business requirements. The role will also require assisting in documenting a market approach of the future incident and emergency response capability.
Essential skills and experience
Minimum of 5 years demonstrated experience working as a Business Analyst delivering multi-faceted artefacts for government programs and/or projects.
Demonstrated experience and skills in developing, analysing and documenting current and future business process and requirements. Identifying gaps and opportunities including process definition and modelling, business requirements, data mapping and other products as required.
Strong business client engagement skills.
Demonstrated experience in technical writing and documenting guidelines and operational procedures.
Demonstrated experience supporting the rollout of new tools and systems including delivery of standard operating procedures, workflow diagrams, training materials and post-launch support resources.
Nice-to-have skills and experience
Experience in the analysis, design and delivery of solutions within the Human Resources (HR) domain and a good understanding of commercial off the shelf HR systems OR incident management.
Experience in developing market approach documentation in alignment with government processes
Experience in the creation in UAT Test scripts, training guides and change management activities.
The position will initially be offered full-time for a 12 month period, with a view to extension.
You must be an Australian Citizen and undergo a police check.
Salary for this position will be negotiated on the basis of skills and experience. At MVP* we take pride in supporting our staff. In addition to the other perks we offer, we organise regular social events and pay incentives for completing your agreed contract term.
Apply. If you are interested in working with us, please submit a cover letter detailing your skills and experience and email your CV to admin@mvpresence.com.au. For more information, please call Chris Headon on (02) 6279 4381. All information will be treated confidentially.
title: Business Analyst - Multiple Roles

description:
The role

The Business Analyst is a team member of the Workforce Operations team for Supermarkets and will develop the workforce planning /labour modelling and analysis processes to support the business strategy within our Fresh department.

Providing insight into how we can structure and approach labour models to best support our availability and commerciality, this role will involve sourcing data from various systems and stakeholders to build pre and post impact analysis, understanding our customer needs as well as ensuring we are aligned to commercial requirements.

This is a 6 month Fixed Term contract opportunity based at our Store Support Centre in Hawthorn East.

To be successful, you’ll have:

demonstrated experience in business analysis and data modelling ideally for workforce planning/labour modelling within large corporations
advanced analytical and problem solving skills with a commercial and business focus
exposure with communicating & presenting complex data & concepts to enable decision making (beneficial, but not essential)
advanced MS Excel skills to create and present detailed reports
the ability to communicate to and engage with stakeholders at all levels
Your key responsibilities will be to:

conduct data gathering and analysis for labour modelling to support business strategy requirements
support the business’ short-and long-term labour modelling to ensure the delivery of commercial goals and budgets
develop, write, and communicate business requirements and functional specifications for the implementation of business solutions
provide assistance in documenting current business processes and options based on business case (i.e., through research and data collection)
Culture

Coles is a fast-paced, constantly changing business that focuses your talents and challenges you to perform at your best.

As a team, we’re bold with ideas and operate with pace and passion, always looking for better ways to transform retail and delight customers.

Benefits

If that isn’t exciting enough, as a team member at Coles you:

will receive a staff discount and exclusive team member offers
can enjoy a convenience store located onsite
are able to sample new products and flavours before they hit the shelves
have access to a Fitness Centre and Body Therapy Clinic
will be part of a fun and inclusive culture where customer, community and team are at the heart of what we do
About us

Today, Coles is one of Australia’s iconic retailers, providing a range of fresh food, groceries, general merchandise, liquor and fuel to millions of customers every week.

We have a combination of over 2,400 retail outlets across Australia covering Coles supermarkets, Coles Express fuel and convenience sites, Spirit Hotels and liquor stores under Liquorland, Vintage Cellars and First Choice Liquor branding.

While some things have changed over the years, one thing remains the same – our customer first strategy. We have over 112,000 fantastic team members across the country that are focused on making life easier for our customers and making a difference to the communities we serve every day.

Please Note

We prefer to deal with you directly and have not engaged an agency for this role, so if you’re interested, please apply.

At Coles, we aim to ensure our team represents the community we serve, embracing the richness of Australia's diverse population.

This role is eligible for the Team Member Referral Program
title: Business Analyst - Workforce Planning Data

description:
Who are we?
At illion (formerly Dun & Bradstreet), we are always seeking innovative and forward-thinking individuals to join us on our journey. Our vision is to use data and analytics to solve problems for our customers, using our unique, extensive and expanding datasets. We create unique business models that support our customers' decision-making processes when acquiring, on-boarding and managing their receivables.

Our culture is unique. It's fast, results-driven and dynamic. It's certainly not for everyone. But if you thrive in a high performing environment - Illion could be for you!

About the role:

In this role you will be taking the lead on ensuring all CRS data processes are working effectively and efficiently, whilst supporting release schedules, statistical reporting, liaising with the data management team and external clients, and leading relationships with existing and prospective external data suppliers related to consumer data.

As a Senior Consumer Data Analyst you will be required to:
Lead identification and resolution of systemic issues in data quality and processes

Establish automated data monitoring to highlight any data issues that need to be addressed

Lead the preparation and execution of User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Production Verification Testing (PVT) in support of the Consumer Credit Bureau (CCB) Release Schedule

Lead periodic statistical reports and analysis to internal clients

Lead initiatives and/or develop robust business cases to improve the consumer database quality, coverage and match rate performance

Lead the development of an end-to-end consumer data procedures and quality manual, and to actively pursue and recommend opportunities to improve efficiency in process and data quality

Support internal and external data and quality audits

Develop strong supplier and internal customer relationships.


The successful candidate will need to demonstrate excellence in communication, innovation and analytical skills. You must also be able to demonstrate an ability to remain results focused in a fast changing environment with the drive to successfully manage multiple initiatives with competing priorities.

The ideal candidate will have the following:

Essential

Minimum 5 years working in a data intensive environment

Advanced data and process analysis skills, especially investigative analysis of data or process issues to determine data quality problems and solutions

Exceptional abstract reasoning and attention to detail

Ability to code in SAS and SQL or Perl
Exceptional project management skills. Able to adapt and manage multiple projects and work under tight timelines
 Experience in extracting data from a number of different systems into MIS/Analytical software (Excel, Access Database, SAS, etc).
Desirable

Ability to code in R and Python

General understanding of how the credit or insurance sectors operate

Tertiary qualification in a business related field, risk, statistics or another numerically-based discipline is desirable.
If you believe you have the necessary skills and experience, we would love to hear from you!
title: Senior Consumer Data Analyst

description:
At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.

We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together.
About the role

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst who will develop advanced customer analytics to increase sales effectiveness and enable smarter selling. This new and critical role is responsible for generating actionable insights working with a range of functional areas including sales, marketing, product and operations.

You should have outstanding technical experience, the ability to interpret data in the context of our business, and strong project delivery skills.
What you'll do

Manage and automate where possible the data ingestion, de-duplication and enrichment of our lead database (restaurants)
Design and deliver customer profiling, segmentation and scoring models
Develop advanced queries, data analysis and visualisations to address specific business cases
Automate reporting and analysis processes and continuously improve data accessibility and tools for relevant stakeholders
Identify opportunities where data analytics can support key business decisions

What you’ll bring

Bachelor or advanced degree in Business Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Econometrics, or equivalent
4+ years of relevant experience
Strong data analytics skills:
Advanced in SQL - ability to import & join data, build complex tables & queries, and automate processes
Advanced in Excel
Experience with Python and/or R
Ability to translate complex analytics into clear, concise and actionable communications
Ability to work with cross-functional stakeholders and apply project management skills to deliver business relevant outcomes

Bonus Points if
Understanding of Salesforce
Experience with text mining and text matching techniques

About the Team

With Uber Eats, we’re building Uber’s newest and fastest growing business, spanning 180+ cities across all six continents in two years. Today, Uber Eats is available across many parts of APAC including Mumbai, Hyderabad, Chennai, Bangalore, Tokyo, Hong Kong, Auckland, Wellington, Sydney, Perth, Brisbane, Adelaide and Melbourne - and we’re just getting started.
title: Uber Eats Data Analyst, ANZ

description:
Data Analyst - Performance & Insights

My client, one of Australia's leading FMCGs, is seeking a Data Analyst to join its Logistics & Supply Chain Performance & Insights team.

Ideally seeking someone with an understanding of operations and operational performance in a Retail, FMCG or Logistics organisation. Working with volume numbers, warehouse productivity rates at task levels and efficiency in transport and provide insight an recommendation to Operations Managers.

You will have strong analytical skills, Power BI and SQL / SRSS experience at the back end.

title: Data Analyst

description:
6 month contract with possible extension
Federal Government Department within the Disability Sector
Dandenong Location
We are seeking an experienced Business Analyst to join a Government Agency based in Dandenong. This role will be an APS5 equivalent role for initially a 6 month period. This role will pay between $40 - $45 per hour + Super.

The Role:
The Business Analyst will provide high level support to help develop and maintain performance monitoring and reporting processes across business streams within a Regional Hub.

Responsibilities include:

Developing and implementing data collection systems and other strategies that optimise statistical efficiency and data quality.
High level data analytics and reporting which will include interpreting data, analysing the results and using basic statistical techniques and providing ongoing reports.
Acquiring data from primary or secondary data sources and maintaining databases and datasets on regional performance.
Coordinate and drive all site reporting requirements.
Coordinate and drive internal quality assurance processes including sample audit programs and reports on service delivery quality trend analysis, communities of practice and outcomes analysis.
Ensure staff are following Agency guidelines and operating procedures.
About you:
To be successful in this role you will have exceptional service orientation and collaboration skills, along with high attention to detail and developed communication skills.

In addition, you will demonstrate:

Intermediate to advanced MS Excel Skills
Experience in a similar role which had a focus on data and analytics
Experience in data interpretation using statistical techniques
Demonstrated ability in report writing and development
A strong interest or previous experience with the Disability Sector (desirable)
As this role is within the Federal Government, applicants are required to hold Australian Citizenship.

title: APS5 Data Analyst

description:
Our Consumer Data Analytics & Science team are looking for an innovative Senior Data Scientist to help them work on key projects to predict consumer behaviour, and conduct advanced analytics across the carsales consumer business. Data is a key decision making tool at carsales, and better understanding our customers’ behaviours is an important piece of the puzzle.

You’ll work with a highly motivated and exceptionally talented team of data analysts and scientists to build reporting and predictive solutions, and deliver data-rich products, insights and analytics to both external clients and internal stakeholders across our sales, marketing, technology and product management teams.

What you’ll do

Development of end to end analytics including customer profiling, segmentation, lifetime value and loyalty.
Work with stakeholders across the business to generate insights that will lead to the optimisation of product & marketing activities.
Analyse website performance to identify and recommend new ways to connect with customers and enhance their online journey.
Develop new ways of analysis through statistics and modelling that assists in understanding and predicting customer behaviour.
Act as a subject matter expert, yet collaborate effectively across-channels and different teams
Support growth, marketing, product, UX support and multiple other teams with data analytics and reporting expertise
Work across all business units and international branches to ensure measurement and transparency of all activity.

What we’re looking for

Strong SQL skills, with working knowledge of Python and/or R. Experience with large-scale column-oriented databases is advantageous.
At least a bachelor degree in an analytical field (e.g. Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or a similar discipline), preferably with knowledge of hypothesis testing and statistical/machine learning.
Someone who will work collaboratively with various teams to collect, collate and interpret data, and then communicate the insights effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Customer-centric mindset, with proven ability to recommend opportunities that drive greater advocacy.
Experience in a commercial environment is essential and exposure to digital data is highly sought after.
Exposure to leadership, coaching or mentoring juniors would be a bonus but isn’t a requirement.

Why Apply?

carsales offers extensive opportunities to learn and evolve in a diverse, fast-paced and dynamic environment. We are committed to our people through many ongoing initiatives associated with culture and benefits, career development, health and well-being, community, work-life balance, reward and recognition. We continually strive to attract and retain the most talented people through a number of programs designed to support learning and development. When you work at carsales you don't just have a job, but you have a rewarding career.

carsales is an equal opportunity employer who prides themselves on providing a diverse workplace that brings out the best in its people. We encourage women and men of all ages and background to apply.
-
title: Senior Data Scientist

description:
The function of the Data Analyst is to collect relevant Operational and KPI information on a regular basis and present results. You will present your findings from the analysis of the data in the form of graphs, charts, diagrams, tables and reports and distribute the relevant information to the project team and management to ensure continual improvement of contract performance. The Data Analyst is required to identify trends and create models to predict what might happen in the future. This role will be for a two month period with the possibility of extension.

Responsibilities

Interpret data, analyse results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports

Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimise statistical efficiency and data quality

Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems

Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets

Filter and "clean" data, and review computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems

Work closely with management to prioritise business and information needs

Locate and define new process improvement opportunities

Skills

Strong numerate and analytical skills and able to undertake non-traditional analytical tasks

Working knowledge of industry reporting standards

Ability to work accurately and achieve operational goals under the pressure of tight deadlines.

Ability to prepare useful reports for the business using the given data

Ability to diagnose problems and take action to resolve system issues

Capability to identify, develop and implement new systems

Superior communication capabilities with the ability to inform, negotiate and influence

Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques

Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (e.g. Tableau etc), databases (e.g. SQL etc), and preferably programming/scripting experience (XML, JavaScript, or PHP)

Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analysing large datasets

Qualifications

Graduate qualifications in accounting/business/commerce/Computer Science with post grad qualifications an advantage

QLD Licence- LHL-02514-D2P2F
title: Data Analyst

description:
About us
Shelde is a 7-year-old integrated digital, security and data analytics partner. With a strong security heritage and multi-disciplinary team in the Application Security and Cyber Security domain, we have developed our capabilities in Digital Engineering and Data Analytics space with monitoring, understanding and visualizing data. Our unique depth and breadth of capabilities across cyber security, application security, data platforms, analytics, cloud and digital transformations allow us to deliver rich insight, robust strategies and innovative solutions that help our clients amplify their possibilities.

About the opportunity
Paul (https://www.linkedin.com/in/paul-johnson-251a65/), our Head of Cyber Security, is looking for a Business Analyst in both Sydney and Melbourne who possess exceptional analytical skills to join his team. As a Business Analyst at Shelde, you will form an integral part of our Cyber Security practice.

The successful candidate is capable of building and maintaining relationships with different levels of client organisation, from technical team to C-level managers. You have experience supporting both technical and sales teams, producing policies and processes in alignment to key industry standards and legislations, as well as developing process mapping and documentation.

Other skills that will ensure success in this role is experience with technical implementation of projects in a project management position in large enterprise environments. Knowledge of our technical environment SIEM and/or Application Security concepts and processes will be viewed favourably, as will knowledge of key IT security standards and control frameworks and familiarity with the ISO2700x suite, government standards (PSPF, ISM, VPDSS), and/or PCI-DSS.
What will you bring to Shelde?
We would love to hear from individuals who have all or most of the following;

Personal values that align with ours! At Shelde we approach our work with our Honey Badger spirit – the successful candidate will be outcome driven, responsible and accountable and have a no BS approach to life!
Technical knowledge of MS Office Suite and Visio
Experience with process mapping and requirements elicitation
Proven ability to work independently
Understanding of the ISO2700x suite, government standards (PSPF, ISM, VPDSS), PCI-DSS
Ability to develop business requirements and complete work effort estimations
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience working in as a Business Analyst for a minimum of 3 years

What can Shelde offer you?
The successful candidate will have the opportunity to join a growing team of experts who hold some of the highest levels of certification and accreditation in a wide range of security technologies. You will be supported by our talented Cyber Security team, and by the entire Shelde community, through your journey with us.

At Shelde, we offer ongoing personal and professional development through assessing your hardwired DNA behaviours to explore and leverage your individual talents to empower you and ensure we’re providing you with the right tools and support to be the best individual you can be.

Shelde is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We are Shelde! We love it and you will too… Follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter @Shelde_Au #Sheldebydesign #Sheldecybersecurity
