title: ENERGY DATA ANALYST

description:
Business Analyst 4-Ops-18000WYE

Preferred Qualifications

Overview:
The Food & Beverage Global Business Unit (FBGBU) is a newly formed Global Business Unit that was spun off from the Hospitality Business Unit (HGBU) in Fiscal Year 2019. We are embarking on a new path and are looking for high energy, enthusiastic individuals to facilitate continuous improvements around tools and processes. Looking for innovative thinkers that are comfortable working outside the box. Need to be passionate about initiating changes that are good for the business and seeing it through completion. Must be comfortable working in a complex, fast paced environment and have the ability to work across organizational lines as well as different lines of business in a partnership role

General Description:
This business analyst will sit within the sales operations group for the newly formed Food & Beverage Global Business Unit (FBGBU) focused on the Asia Pacific region. This role will focus on supporting the F&B Sales Teams in understanding and effectively using the Oracle sales processes and Tools. Regional liaison to the FBGBU Sales Operations in relating policy and best practices to Sales Team. Occasional evening and early morning hours to participate in global meetings as needed.

Responsibilities:
 Develop a deep understanding of the FBGBU sales processes and systems (with a focus on territory planning, pipeline management, forecasting and sales compensation). Develop a deep understanding of the FBGBU sales processes and systems (with a focus on quoting, ordering and approvals). Establish strong relationships with other key GBU groups (finance, business planning, and operations) as well as with the broader Oracle support groups (e.g. finance, Global Sales & Consulting Operations, HR, Global Incentive Comp, Deal Management, Legal, other regional sales ops teams) Collaborate with Corporate functions, Central GBU Operations, and Regional teams to assess local processes to eliminate complexity and inefficiencies. Partner with regional FBGBU sales teams to understand operational challenges and implement resolutions to identified issues Assist FBGBU field sales teams in understanding Oracle’s standard practices, policies, and tools Work with Sales teams and Finance to support accurate sales forecasting, effective pipeline management and reliable sales credit allocation. Support field enablement efforts Support implementation of new Oracle processes and systems including communications and enablement
Qualifications: 5+ years work experience in Sales or Business operations roles Outstanding organizational and problem solving skills. Ability to focus and set priorities. Ability to work in a rapidly changing international environment. Service orientated and a team player Ability to work under time constraints and deadlines. Excellent communication skills in English both spoken and written. Experience with systems used by Oracle Sales (e.g. Sales Cloud, SI, DAS, CPQ, etc.) is an advantage

Detailed Description and Job Requirements
Provides programs to improve operational efficiency, consistency, and compliance in support of the organization*s financial and tactical business objectives. Provides business practices and processes. Develops, communicates, and trains the organization on business practices and processes.

Serve as a liaison with other divisions such as Finance, Contracts, HR, Legal, Shared Services, Accounts Receivable, Purchasing, and Risk Management in an effort to ensure accurate and timely transaction processing. Collect, input, verify, correct, and analyze data to measure key performance indicator actual versus business objectives. Provide updates to management regarding budget to actual, informing them of deviations and opportunities. Provide management with economic impact and compliance issues surrounding key business decisions and/or deals. Communicate Oracle Business Practices to the organization and monitor process and approvals for full compliance. Drive implementation of new processes and procedures.

Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. Ability to collect, organize, and display data in spreadsheet format. Follow-through skills necessary to get information from internal and third parties and have data errors/omissions corrected. For this, relationship management skills strongly desired. Strong written and verbal communication skills. 8 plus years relevant work experience.
title: Business Analyst 4-Ops

description:
What we offer

Our Senior Business Analyst remuneration package includes a great bonus scheme, public transport & phone allowances, laptop, plus free access to an on-site pool & gym.

Our bonus scheme means that the best analysts have the opportunity to earn significantly more than their base salary, which makes for a very competitive package.
Come and do something you love!

Are you passionate about Power BI & Excel? Do you love working with a wide variety of clients? Then, why waste your time doing the same thing every day? Come and do a wide variety of projects using the technology you love all day, every day!

We’re looking for highly professional, highly skilled and motivated individuals who’d relish the challenge of providing reporting, data analytics, & reporting to a variety of world-class companies.

Reporting directly to the Principal Business Analyst, you’ll be involved directly in working on client consulting assignments, with responsibility for ensuring these are delivered on time, on budget, and in accordance with best practices.

You’ll have a lot of independence, flexibility and autonomy. We don’t micro-manage at Access Analytic.
Mandatory

Solid understanding of Power Query (including M language), Power Pivot (including DAX formulas), Power BI, data extraction from databases, data transformation, analytics, dashboard presentation, ODBC, and SQL.

Highly-advanced skills in Excel, accounting and financial modelling. If you consider VLOOKUP advanced, this role is not for you! You won’t need any training to use functions/formulas such as SUMIFS, SUMPRODUCT, INDEX/MATCH, OFFSET, INDIRECT, array formulas, data tables, or Pivot Tables.

3+ years’ experience in a Big 4, tier 2 Chartered Accounting firm, or another related consultancy. Alternatively, you may have worked extensively in management accounting roles, dealing with stakeholders at all levels within the organisation. Bear in mind that this is a client-facing consulting role so we’re looking for more than just technical skills – you need to be comfortable talking to clients, calling them, attending client functions, and dealing professionally with clients of all levels at all times.

Confidence in providing the highest quality professional service to a wide client base. This role involves extensive client contact so highly-developed written and verbal English communication skills are essential. You’ll also need to be comfortable with the idea of calling clients, visiting them on your own, and networking (don’t worry, we provide training to help you in these areas).

A friendly personality with the natural ability to form strong relationships with clients. We’re looking for people our clients will naturally love to have back in their offices time and time again!

A desire to develop yourself, learn and grow, plus the ability to handle multiple projects with conflicting demands at once.

Highly Desirable

CPA/CA or other related postgraduate qualifications.

An extensive network of Perth business contacts.

Experience in developing VBA macros could be useful.

Applications

To apply, please send your CV, covering letter (and samples of your work) to info@accessanalytic.com.au

For further enquiries, call Jeff Robson on +61 8 6210 8500.

Only those who are eligible to work in Australia already should apply (we cannot sponsor you unfortunately). Applications from recruitment agents are not generally considered – your fees are too high!

Last updated: October 14th, 2018
title: Senior Business Analyst

description:
The Company

DB Schenker is a globally integrated Transport and Logistics company providing international air and sea freight forwarding services together with national logistics solutions across Australia and the globe.

About DB Schenker

At DB Schenker, you are part of a global logistics network that connects the world. A network that allows you to shape your career by encouraging you to contribute and truly make a difference. With more than 72,000 colleagues worldwide, we welcome diversity and thrive on individual backgrounds, perspectives and skills. Together as one team, we are Here to move.

The Role

We are seeking a Business Analyst specialising in Contract Logistics/ Supply Chain Management to join our busy Yennora NSW team.

Position Summary:

Conceptualise logistics strategies, process flows, alternative designs and
methodologies to develop and create the optimal solution based on operational
performance.
Significant judgement is required in planning, design, and technical functions related to
the response to tenders with solid knowledge of Schenker’s products, services,
procedures and processes
Analyse data and develop business models including pricing for both warehousing and
transport
Provide transport solutions and domestic transport pricing nationally for all new and
existing customers.
Provide support in contract renewal of existing customers
Responsibilities
Departmental/Operational key Responsibilities may include:

Co-ordinate all Logistics (Warehousing and Transport) tender opportunities
Compile a wide range of diverse information into a readable and logical format
Providing transport solutions and domestic transport pricing nationally for all new and existing customers
Analyse tender opportunities and convert raw data into logical business requirements
Assist Business Development team to prepare a professional and quality tender response
Review requirements with customer and reach agreement on findings
Work with customer to develop alternative solutions and implementation strategy
Standardise reports and presentation to business development team and customers
Undertaking costing and pricing ‘what if’s’ for inclusion in presentations
Case study preparation and review
Proposal preparation and review
Collaborate in the presentation of high quality, clear solutions to customers –verbal, written and formal
Assist in project implementation and on boarding of the new customers by working closely with project management team, operations, commercial / finance and transport and TMS
Undertaking projects such as contract renewal of existing customers
Customer Focus - manages difficult customer situations; responds promptly to customer needs; solicits customer feedback; responds to requests for service and assistance
Qualifications
Competencies and Skills required:

Tertiary qualifications e.g. Supply Chain, Industrial engineering, Finance, Accounting or similar
Very strong analytical skills
Prior experience in similar roles either in 3PL or other warehousing / logistics /domestic transportation environments
Customer facing experience in complex business environments
Exposure to complex account sales & management
Expert product and industry knowledge coupled with the ability to deal with clients at all levels and translate client needs into a complete solution
Costing, pricing and modelling experience
Process mapping and system analysis
Hands-on mentality, customer orientation, target/result focus
High level of written / verbal communication skills
Ability to engage directly with clients on analysis, solutions and commercial negotiations
Strong problem, planning, organising and management skills
title: Business Analyst

description:
Job posted:
17/10/2018
Applications close:
28/10/2018 (Midnight) 8 days remaining






Today
Job Description
The Department of Economic Development, Jobs, Transport and Resources (DEDJTR) is the Victorian Government’s lead agency for creating the conditions to sustainably develop the Victorian economy and grow employment. Our role is to increase jobs, investment, exports and opportunities; stimulate innovation, competitiveness, and confidence; and support sustainability. The Department is committed to building a culture where we say 'yes' to flexible work arrangements, and support ways of working that help employees balance work and home life. The Department is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applicants from a diverse range of backgrounds. The Department strongly encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people. The Department offers reasonable adjustments for applicants with disabilities on request.

$95,275 - $115,276 (Plus Superannuation)
Fixed Term (to June 2020)
Usual hours of work: Full Time (flexibility may be available)
Usual work location: Melbourne CBD (flexibility may be available)
The Resources Division within DEDJTR develops policy, programs and regulation to enable investment and generate jobs through sustainable development of the State's earth resources, including extractives, minerals and petroleum.

Reporting to the Manager, Business Quality and Management Systems (BQMS), the Systems Business Analyst is a key member of the BQMS team working closely with internal and external stakeholders to develop future state options for the Earth Resources Regulation branch.

Key accountabilities include:

Addressing change requests raised within the established Salesforce environment though evaluation, analysis and documentation of current process and systems and working with the business to understand requirements and timeframes
Identify process improvements and manage the collection, analysis and evaluation of data to support process and system alignment
Actively participate in project teams providing system and data analysis expertise and assist in addressing key issues / risks.
Manage and drive quality management ensuring system changes are tested and implemented
To be successful in this role you will have proven high-level systems analysis experience within a Salesforce environment combined with the ability to manage change requests including identifying solutions and developing system requirements. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills will be required to develop effective working relationships with a diverse range of internal and external stakeholders. The ability to prioritise and deliver outcomes within a complex environment, often with tight timeframes will be required. Knowledge of Salesforce Classic and Salesforce Lightning is highly desirable with a completed Salesforce Administrator certification an advantage.

For a confidential discussion, please call Praveen Mathew on 8392 7189.

Successful candidates will be required to undergo a National Police Records Check prior to commencing employment with the Department.

For further information on the position, please see the attached position description. To apply, please click the ‘Apply Now' button below.

Applications close at midnight on 28 October 2018.

Please note: When submitting your application online, there will be questions pertaining to a number of the position's Key Selection Criteria to which you are required to respond. The generic online form may ask you to provide the responses to all of the KSC. At this step in the online process, please only upload your resume and cover letter (there is NO requirement to address all of the KSC) and move on to the last screen where you will be asked to submit responses to the specific questions only". Complete these specific questions to complete your application.
title: Systems Business Analyst (VPSG5)

description:
The Organisation
Apple and Pear Australia Ltd (APAL) is an industry representative body and not-for-profit membership based organisation that works to add genuine value to Australia’s commercial apple and pear growers. It is a unique peak body as it has both a commercial and industry aspect to it. APAL owns, licenses and manages a number of fresh produce brands which includes the globally recognised Pink Lady® apple brand.
The Role
An exciting opportunity is now available for a Data Analyst to join APAL. Reporting to Financial Planning and Analysis Manager, the main focus of this role is to source, analyse and manage data across the full spectrum of APAL’s industry and commercial needs, determining optimal data collection and analysis processes.
You will love data and use your initiative and creativity to present new ideas on data analysis and integration. Your accountabilities will include analysing data sets, identifying patterns and trends and reporting outputs back to relevant stakeholders to assist in reasoned and informed decision making. Your ability to demonstrate depth of knowledge across industry and commercial trends will hold you in good stead as will your ability to tackle a problem by using your systematic and sequential approach.
The Responsibilities
Source, analyse and manage data across the full spectrum of industry and commercial needs
Provide useful analytical information and content for dissemination in regular Australian industry publications and communication to the global Pink Lady® network
Work alongside teams within the business or the management team to establish business needs and provide proactive data solutions
Build strong relationships and regularly discuss data needs with the relevant heads of department and communicate complex data findings transparently and logically to a wide audience
Qualifications and Experience
Previous experience within a similar Data/Reporting Analyst position
Tertiary qualifications in relevant discipline is desirable (Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Management, Analytics)
Advanced knowledge of MS Excel for data manipulation and reporting and previous exposure to Salesforce ideal
Strong stakeholder management and ability to establish rapport and build effective relationships with stakeholders at all levels
Analytically minded, with the ability to think creatively about data improvements
Strong sense of initiative and collaboration with team
Strong communicator, high level of written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present complex information in clear and concise manner
Strong commercial acumen
You’ll be joining a great team with a strong culture and supportive environment. This role will provide you flexibility and the exciting opportunity for career development and growth.
If this role sounds like your next step, we look forward to hearing from you. Please call Emilie from fibreHR for a confidential discussion on 9205 5804 or click the Apply Now link.
title: Data Analyst

description:
Position Title: Business Analyst – Systems & Performance
Employment Type: Maximum Term Full Time (2 Year Duration)
Hours per week: 38 hours
Position Grade: Health Manager Level 3
Salary: $110,961 - 126,496
Enterprise Agreement The Affiliated Health Organisation Health Employees Agreement 2009
Department Name: Finance Systems and Performance

Position Summary:
A vacancy exists in the above unit for a highly motivated Business Analyst with appropriate knowledge and skills to join our friendly and supportive team. Our progressive and innovative team offers development opportunities for our staff and a caring environment for the delivery of high quality patient centred care. The successful applicant(s) will be responsible for planning of business analysis activities, small projects and streams of work related to large scale projects, solution testing & improving operational procedures and business processes. The Business Analyst is also responsible for assisting with the BI Tool Development, Finance systems maintenance, establishing and maintaining effective relationships and communication with External Vendors, Consultants & Companies to ensure organisation goals and priorities are met.

Position Duties:
Project Management
1. Takes assigned small to medium sized projects, project streams & tasks from original concept through to final implementation
2. Creates and maintains project schedules by developing project plans, establishing deadlines, monitoring tasks & milestones, providing timely reporting of issues that impact project progress and resolving conflict
Business Analysis & Reporting
3. Elicits the underlying business need to be addressed and information related to the product and project requirements, often through conversations with stakeholders.
4. Reviews & analyses requirements and creates detailed documentation of business processes & functional specifications
5. Assist with data analysis, ETL processes, data visualisation and design (SQL and BI Tool)
Quality Assurance & Testing
6. Defines, develops and implements testing strategies and end user test plans (UAT)
7. Identifies and trouble shoots issues early to mitigate project and operational risks
Training
8. Assists with training strategy development, procedural documentation and end user training as required.
9. Establishes & maintains effective relationships & communication with internal & external stakeholders

The vacancy is open to Australian citizens, New Zealand citizens who hold a valid New Zealand passport, Australian permanent residents and those non-residents deemed by the Department of Immigration and Citizenship to be eligible to work in Australia only.

About St Vincent's Health Network Sydney:
St Vincent's Health Network Sydney is made up of three public hospitals, St Vincent's Hospital Sydney, Sacred Heart Health Service and St Joseph's Hospital at Auburn. We are part of St Vincent's Health Australia, the largest diversified health care organisation within Australia's not for profit Catholic health care sector. As a Catholic health and aged care service provider, our mission is to bring God's love to those in need through the healing ministry of Jesus, with a commitment to those who are poor and vulnerable.

We are committed to equal employment opportunity, ethical practices, and the principles of cultural diversity and promote a smoke free work environment. Appropriate criminal record and child protection checks are conducted for all successful candidates. Employment with St Vincent's is subject to you having current immunity status that complies with the Assessment, Screening & Vaccination against Specified Infectious Diseases - Policy Directive Immunisation history complies with NSW Health Policy Directive PD2011_005. Appointment and ongoing employment will be subject to continued compliance with the policy directive.

title: Business Analyst

description:
Join the Everyday Banking Tribe and be part of ANZ’s NWOW
An opportunity to work on some exciting projects that will have real customer impacts
This is a Business Analyst role like no other, you will focus on technology delivery and vender management
First, a bit about ANZ.
At ANZ, everything we do boils down to ‘why’ – our purpose – to shape a world where people and communities thrive. We're just as focused on seeing our people thrive as well as our customers.

We are responding faster to changing customer requirements, focusing on the things that matter the most, energising our people, eliminating waste and reducing bureaucracy.

ANZ NWOW Video

The mission of the Everyday Banking Tribe is to help our customers with surprisingly easy ways to move, manage and use their money.

This position will be based within the Loyalty squad, our mission is to recognise and reward all our customers for their loyalty. You will be working on the squad’s key priority to better reward our customers.

As a Journey Expert in the Loyalty squad you will be working with our technology partners, 3rd party vendors and other key stakeholders to meet and deliver project outcomes to fulfil the squads mission.

To be successful in this role you need to bring your strong Business Analyst and Vendor Management experience, ideally from the tech universe, to hit the ground running and assist the squad in landing some key projects.

This is a 12 month fixed term contract

Who are you?
A team player – You know we only win if we all win. You recognise and value the different perspectives and skills your colleagues bring. It is not about being a hero but jumping in and contributing to the successful delivery of the team’s mission
The customer’s biggest fan – You demonstrate a thirst for better understanding the customer and define the problem and develop solutions through their eyes
Comfortable being uncomfortable – You are comfortable with uncertainty and have the ability to effectively manage yourself through ambiguity and change
Continuous improvement junkie – You constructively challenge the status quo, look for better ways to do things and passionately advocate continuous improvement
Committed to your own and other’s growth – You strive to stretch and grow yourself and others by identifying your own development areas, seeking feedback and providing feedback to others to help them learn and grow everyday
A problem solver – You are energised by tackling complex problems and use critical thinking, your network, skills, knowledge, and available data to drive better outcomes for our customers and the bank
Risk savvy – You build sustainable solutions that protect customers, stakeholders and the community
What you bring?
First and foremost we are looking for passionate people who are creative, innovative and who want to live and breathe our new ways of working. From here you will bring;
An intense passion and curiosity for customers, their needs and wants, putting them at the centre of everything you do.
Demonstrable BA experience in areas such as; Business Implementation, Change Management, Business Analysis, Project Planning, and Stakeholder/Vendor Management.
A desire to optimise customer journeys and experiences.
Ability to explore customer needs in a data-driven way, develop and implement innovative solutions, test the outcomes, and iterate.
Interest in and an affinity for Technology.

Further general information on our opportunities please go to https://www.anz.com.au/careers/

“At ANZ we aim to create an inclusive environment where employee differences such as gender, age, culture, disability, sexual orientation, family and caring responsibilities and religion are valued.

We work flexibly at ANZ. Talk to us and let us know how this role can be flexible for you.”
title: Business Analyst (Journey Expert)

description:
Business Analyst - Analytics
Define, asses, create and measure customer experiences that matter.
Understand and articulate requirements and opportunities for leveraging insight from data.
Ensure we design and build the right solutions to our customers.
About Us:
We have a vacancy for a Business Analyst to join our Analytics team, performing Business Analysis services in collaborative agile squads in our Analytics Platform.
This includes being a member of the BA Chapter. The Chapter fosters relevant agile BA capability development and peer support. Â Join us at Bankwest in our journey of adopting agility at enterprise scale, as we strive to deliver what matters to our customers. Enjoy working in a great environment with great colleagues.
The successful applicant will have the following key skills and attributes;
As a strong practitioner with minimum 3 years experience in BA or equivalent role, you will have relevant attributes and skills including:
Strong, relationship and stakeholder management.
Outcome focus, with an ability to challenge while retaining empathy.
Adaptability.
Ability to operate across multiple squads at times, assessing and supporting decisions around prioritising work from multiple different stakeholder sources.
Experience with agile and scrum, user stories and story mapping.
Familiarity with current concepts, tools and trends in the analytics space e.g. predictive and prescriptive analytics (including machine learning).
Hypothesis and experiment design in the analytics context.
Desired:
Tertiary qualifications in IT or Business-related field or appropriate professional certification.
Key Deliverables include:
Co-designing experiments for proof of problem and value, and analysing results.
Developing user journeys and use cases, user stories, story maps supporting customer experience, as well as related system requirements and user tests.
Data identification, extraction and modelling (to an extent)
Process modelling, "as-is" and "to be".
Developing and applying metrics and measurement
Contributing to work prioritisation, scoping and estimating.
As a member of the BA Chapter, you will also have a role in:
Promoting and influencing the Bankwest culture and agile way of working.
Identifying and sharing trends in the internal and external environment around agile BA practise, analytics and extracting insight from data.
What's on offer
We promote flexibility to balance your work and home life and ensure you achieve your career goals and personal needs. Making a difference in the community is important to Bankwest and colleagues have the opportunity to volunteer two days per year for a cause that matters to them. The successful applicant will enjoy an attractive salary package plus bonus in conjunction with the opportunity to access a range of market leading employee benefits.

title: Business Analyst

description:
Aurecon has a proud heritage of design excellence and delivery of complex projects. We have built our brand from that foundation and the trust our clients place in us. We describe what we stand for as “Bringing Ideas to Life” which reflects our belief that what we do best is to help clients bring their ideas to reality. Our “Just Imagine” initiative reflects our aspiration to help our clients become future ready and our design thinking strategy is an important part of this initiative.
We are now seeking applications from enthusiastic, experienced Business Analysts to join our Global Finance team. The position is based in Neutral Bay.
Your Role
You will be responsible for assisting the Global Advisory Commercial Manager by providing commercial and financial support, as well as assisting the Global management team to ensure the achievement of objectives. This position is required to provide high quality project support services to the global advisory leadership team working within Regions to enable true business partnership. You will provide commercial and financial interpretive analysis across a range of financial indicators to ensure complete understanding of financial aspects. The key responsibilities of this role include:Performing financial analysis to review business performance and key trends against strategic priorities. Identify and implement initiatives to drive business performance.Provide internal and external reporting requirements to ensure consistency, accuracy and timeliness of financial and non-financial reporting to achieve regulatory and business outcomesEnsure efficient use of business unit resources by providing support to business unit leaders in the effective management of staff utilisation and overhead costs in liaison with Commercial Managers.Assist the management of robust financial controls together with the Group Finance team to ensure integrity of all financial systems, processes and outputs.Prepare working capital results for global region and to delve into working capital performance including Working Capital updates, including a consolidation of the weekly cash forecast provided by each region.Provide support and consolidation of the budget process at global advisory regional level including project data, backlog analysis, P&L and operational cash flow statementGood understanding of the processes in place for projects in delivery including revenue recognition, cash flow management and project costs to complete to be able integrate project performance details when preparing the monthly commentary for global advisory results.Act as the key business partner for Leadership Finance teams and Regional Leadership Operational teams by providing financial support
About You
Your key qualities and skills would include:Substantial business acumenClear, comprehensive understanding of the link between Finance/Commercial initiatives and business strategyAbility to collect and synthesize large quantities of quantitative and qualitative dataAbility to recognize trends and develop recommendations based on data analysisAbility to develop and deliver relevant, effective training programs to targeted audiencesEffective team player and networkerStrong interpersonal, communication, and customer service skillsSolid knowledge of Finance/Commercial policies, processes and talent management practicesRelevant tertiary qualifications and technical post tertiary qualifications including CA or CPA qualifications or equivalent.5+ years’ experience in the relevant field of expertise.
What We Provide
We believe a career is not just a job; it's a collection of experiences you gain through professional networks, working with current technologies and expanding your knowledge base. All this while working on a broad range of projects and the possibility of local, interstate and international travel within a globally collaborative business.
Alignment with the Aurecon Attributes is also vital: Co-creative, Commercial, Sense-maker, Inquisitive, Engaging, Resourceful, Fearless and Unconventional Thinking.
Kindly refer to http://www.aurecongroup.com/en/careers/themes/why-join-aurecon/aurecon-attributes.aspx for more detail.
Working within the global Aurecon team offers extensive career prospects whilst providing an environment that empowers, encourages sustainability and promotes team work. For examples of some of our projects, visit http://www.aurecongroup.com/en/projects.aspx .
How to Apply
If you are seeking an opportunity to drive and deliver project outcomes, within a creative business that encourages innovation and fresh ideas, please click the Apply Now button below.
Aurecon is an equal opportunity employer.

description:
If you're looking for a way to work on the latest and most exciting data focused projects in Melbourne my client is looking to speak with you. This division has experienced a number of big wins in the data space and are looking for an experienced and motivated data analyst to join the team.

You'll join this experienced team helping a number of their key clients make sense of their data by creating amazing and reusable data visualisations, helping find anomalies and trends in the data and even create reports and dashboards from big data environments. You won't be stuck doing BAU work, you'll be brought in as the expert to help move the client to their future state.

The ideal candidate will be comfortable working directly with clients providing expert advice and helping solve problems that directly affect the clients' success.

This is a great opportunity for someone looking to gain experience across various industries and bring data literacy to new industries and clients.

The ideal candidate will have all or some of the following skills:
Experience working as a data analyst, technical business analyst or business analyst
Experience with data visualisation tools such as: Tableau, Spotfire, Microsoft Power BI, D3.js, Qlikview, Sisense, etc.
Strong SQL skills / Excel skills (Querying skills)
Database and SSIS or data modelling experience
Stakeholder management skills
As a leader in their field my client offers:
Flexible work arrangements
On going training, certification and recognition
Extras such as additional leave, education allowances and more
Opportunity to travel if desired

Don't miss out on this opportunity, send your resume for immediate consideration to mark@parktrail.com.au

Salary packages from $85,000 -130,000 depending on experience.

Only candidates with Australian working rights or visa should apply at this stage.

description:
Contract until June 2019 with possible extensions
Geelong Location
Join a dynamic, growing organisation
The Opportunity

On behalf of our federal government agency client in Geelong we are looking for a Junior Business Analyst to join the team and assist with monitoring, tracking performance , identifying areas for improvement and reporting against operational KPI's.

This is a contract role until June 2019. This role is an APS5/APS6 Level paying between $45 - $49 per hour plus super.

As this role is within the Government sector, applications are required to hold Australian Citizenship in order to be considered. We are unable to consider Permanent Residents.

The Role

The Business Analyst will contribute to the delivery of the service charter and action plan ensuring that the agency's interactions are monitored and evaluated for satisfaction.

Responsibilities include:

Coordinate information and communication across teams
Develop and create systems to track multiple projects attributed to team deliverables
Assist with coordinating response to complaints and feedback
Undertake analysis of performance against KPI's and provide advice on procedural changes
Coordinate and undertake analysis on feedback
Coordinate all reporting requirements
Coordinate internal quality assurance processes including sample audit programs and report on quality trend analysis, communities of practice and outcomes analysis
To Be Considered

To be successful in this role you will;

Qualifications or experience in data collection, analysis and/or statistical collections
Competency in developing and creating monitoring tools and systems for reporting purposes
Adaptable communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to work within a team and adapt quickly to changing environment
Ability to respond to and prioritise competing and often urgent requests
To Apply

As this role is within the Government sector, applications are required to hold Australian Citizenship in order to be considered. We are unable to consider Permanent Residents.

If you would like to be considered for this role, please click APPLY NOW or call Angela at DFP Recruitment for a confidential discussion on 8632 9900.

description:
ASX100 – global manufacturer & marketer of fertilisers, industrial chemicals, commercial explosives, and industrial explosives
Support our high performing business development and strategy team with key analyical and market research
Melbourne head office at Southbank with great culture and flexibility


About Us
Incitec Pivot Limited (IPL) and its subsidiary company Incitec Pivot Fertilisers and Dyno Nobel, is a diversified industrial chemicals company that manufactures and distributes fertilisers, industrial explosives and industrial chemicals. We provide ground breaking solutions through practical innovation in the agricultural and mining services industry. The group comprises more than 5,000 people across the sales, commercial operations and manufacturing footprint globally, including the key mining markets in North America, Asia Pacific, South Africa and South America.
The Role
Working within the Strategy and Business Development team in our head office, this position will see you provide key analytical support for the Strategy team globally. The Business Analyst will have core accountabilities to provide insightful gather, interpret and analyse information across the functions of research, strategy, mergers and acquisitions as well as to provide insightful analysis on key strategic issues the business is facing.
Naturally we will leverage your excellent written and verbal communication to support delivering detailed and strategic level pieces of work for the senior stakeholders in the business.
You will be successful by:
Understanding commodities industries having a strong research capabilities and passion
Ability to translate trending data/concepts into pragmatic & commercial evaluations
Strong track record of excel/complex modelling with high attention to detail
Demonstrated capability in developing hypotheses quickly for different audiences


About You
Tertiary qualified in Accounting/Finance/Business or MBA
Strong experience within a similar business analyst role within a commodity business
Adaptability working within a large complex, geographically dispersed, matrix and joint venture structure.
Developed skills from analysis to present in project findings tailored for different audience levels
Strong Supportive, collaborative and approachable working style enhancing a positive and inclusive culture


If this is your next career opportunity simply select "apply now" button or to learn more about this role contact Katie Le Page – Senior HR Shared Services Advisor via email on Katie.lepage@incitecpivot.com.au
Benefits to you
We are a team based on trust, collaboration and respect
An above market attractive salary package is offered.
Work within our inclusive, diverse and collaborative people culture
This is your opportunity to be part of a growing organisation where you can have an impact on the change and future vision.
Agribusiness is an exciting and growing global industry.


A little more about us
At the heart of Incitec Pivot Limited culture is business excellence and we seek like-minded individuals who treat the business as their own and who strive to challenge and improve the status quo, focusing on improving productivity whilst maintaining zero harm for everyone, everywhere.
The culture of safety is paramount and you will play an integral part in promoting Health Safety & Environment (HSE) procedures to ensure Zero Harm at all times. You will also be familiar with modern safety practices as well as have the ability to pass a pre-employment medical assessment (including a drug and alcohol screen).
We support diversity in the workplace; women, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and people with a multicultural background are strongly encouraged to apply.
Incitec Pivot Limited is a proud member of the Diversity Council of Australia and Male Champions of Change, and holds a State Chair position on the National Association of Women in Operations.
title: Business Analyst (Business Development)

description:
This position is a Business Analyst role reporting to the Client & Corporate Functions Business Solutions Manager.
The Business Analyst is responsible for responsible for requirements and support activities across TCorp’s Client and Frontline experience systems, primarily CRM, Client Portal and the Data Warehouse.
The role will liaise with business users and system subject matter experts to analyse and define business and functional requirements, through to facilitating User Acceptance Testing (UAT).
In addition, the role will assist with test planning and execution, as required.

Organisation Environment:
The Information Technology (IT) team is responsible for developing and delivering the TCorp IT strategy, which is aligned with TCorp's corporate strategy.

Our goal is to provide a secure, robust and efficient IT platform to enable all of TCorp's business activities. We deliver an effective development and support function which meets TCorp’s business requirements, while protecting the integrity of TCorp’s systems and data.

Key Outcomes and Accountabilities:
 Engage stakeholders to guide and positively influence and shape outcomes.
 Analyse and define business and functional requirements, and assist with overall system design and concept.
 Liaise with business units and IT teams to prioritise requirements, and groom and manage the backlog.
 Ensure that user stories meet the "definition of ready" (fully elaborated with acceptance criteria, etc.).
 Communicate progress and release planning schedules to business stakeholders.
 Support the development of project plans and implementation plans.
 Coordinate resolution and re-testing of the issues/defects raised, with the business users and development team.
 Facilitate UAT and end user training workshops.
 Manage implementations as required.

Key Capabilities Required for the Position:

This section describes the level of skills, knowledge and abilities (capabilities) needed for this role.


 Excellent verbal & written communications skills.
 Customer services oriented.
 A ‘Thought Leader’.
 Excellent planning, research, documentation and analysis skills.
 Ability to understand complex issues, analyse the cause of the problem and solve it.
 Experience with the use of SQL and BI tools.
 Ability to quickly learn new business processes, applications and procedures.
 Ability to effectively manage competing priorities and meet deadlines.
 Ability to work autonomously and within a team.
 Excellent attention to detail
 Self-driven, motivated and results oriented.
 Ability to understand the business operations and technology.

Experience and Qualifications:
 Experience working in an Agile environment, preferably SCRUM
 Certification as a Scrum Master and/or Product Owner
 Minimum 10 years business analysis experience including requirements specification and defining user stories.
 Minimum 5 years of strong experience supporting CRM systems. Microsoft Dynamics CRM preferred.
 Knowledge of ‘best-practice’ and current trends for CRM and Client facing systems.
 Experience of forming and rolling-out a Digital Strategy.
 Understand the needs of content delivery across multiple channels; Web, Phone, service / industry API’s, Email, Video, Social Media, Mobile.
 Strong understanding of UX design principles.
 Good understanding of Marketing, Campaign & Event Management.
 Experience of Business Intelligence and Data Warehousing.
 Knowledge and experience in all areas of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) including requirements, design, development, testing, training, implementation and ongoing support.
 Knowledge of Financial instruments and mathematical models within the Fixed Income and Investment Management markets
 Knowledge of Government and Financial Institution Relationships and Security Requirements or understanding of Amazon Web Services are highly desired.

description:
Business Analyst - 6 Month Parental Leave Contract
At SKYCITY Darwin Casino our job is to thrill, excite and give everyone the chance to win. It is what we do, why we exist, and it applies to every aspect of our Business. Most importantly for you, it applies as much to the people who work here as it does to our customers; we want you to have a highly satisfying career.
We have over 550 employees, 650 Electronic Gaming Machines, 23 Gaming Tables, 7 bars, and 5 restaurants. We need a diverse range of talented individuals in every aspect of the business.
We are seeking a Business Analyst for a 6 month parental leave coverage period, to work with Executive Management team members to support optimisation for overall SKYCITY Darwin performance, through the provision of high quality confidential analysis of business operations. The Business Analyst will support individual business units as well as combined property revenue and profit optimisation.
Key Accountabilities and Outputs will be to:
Provide detailed analysis of Business trends and activity levels
Undertake special projects and / or feasibility studies as required
Assist in the preparation of the budgets, forecasts and the analysis thereof
Prepare detailed daily, weekly and monthly reporting and analysis on gaming and/or other business areas as required
Present reporting, analysis findings and recommendations to Executive Managers.
To be considered for this exciting and challenging role, you will be degree qualified in numerical discipline, i.e. Mathematics, Statistics, Economics etc. and have a flair for analysis. You will have the ability to interpret data, detect trends and provide insight to ensure commercially astute business decisions can be formed.
Critical to the role is excellent communication and presentation skills, accurate and timely reporting and analysis; as such your attention to detail will be thorough and your advanced MS Excel skills including pivot tables and data visualisations.
If you are results focused, have proven experience in a similar role, preferably within the Casino industry, please apply online.
All successful candidates can expect excellent benefits and conditions of employment including free meals, subsidised dry cleaning / a fully laundered uniform (remove which ever not applicable) and car parking, as well as free access to our online learning system that helps you develop yourself and your career. The Darwin Casino expects candidates to demonstrate the flexible and adaptable attitude necessary to work in our dynamic and fast paced environment.
This position is subject to the approval of a Casino Operatives Licence. The Northern Territory Department of Business will conduct a criminal and financial history check. The cost of this process is approximately $300.00.
 Kick start your winning career today!!
title: Business Analyst - Darwin - 6 Month Parental leave Contract

description:
Big Data Analytics
Machine Learning/ Artificial Intelligence
Using one or more of R, Python or Scala

Our Federal Government client is seeking the services of an experienced Data Scientist to develop machine learning models and other analytics solutions and help solve problems using data and robust data science techniques.
The Role:
Conduct detailed analysis of data to support the development of risk assessments
Use statistical and data mining techniques to analyse data to provide insights into current and emerging risks and issues
Conduct research and development activities to come up with innovative solutions to problems
Apply advanced data science techniques including machine learning, graph analytics, data visualisation, text analytics plus development of custom algorithms to identify patterns and predict outcomes from large datasets
Develop, implement, deploy, test and evaluate machine learning models to model risk
Perform data wrangling and create data pipelines, integrating diverse disparate datasets
To be considered you'll have the following skills & experience:
Degree in data science (machine learning, artificial intelligence) or a related field e.g. applied mathematics, statistics, computer science, or equivalent industry experience.
Industry experience in delivering data science solutions to improve business outcomes.
Industry experience in development of big data analytics solutions using Scala and Apache Spark.
Industry experience in programming using one or more of R, Python or Scala in creating complex analytic models.
Industry experience in breaking down and communicating complex technical information to business users and senior management
Experience with federal government and financial/banking sector projects. (Desirable)
Please note: For this role our Govt Dept client is only able to engage Australian Citizens with a Negative Level 1 (NV1) Security Clearance or higher.
Contract: Initial 12-month contract with possible 12 month extension
For further information please contact Shar Grieve and the GMT Team on 02 6201 0100.

description:
Darwin based 6 month contract
Legacy data convergence, cleansing and synchronisation
Health Care / Clinical Systems / Legacy Data Migration

Our client a Government Agency is looking to hire a Technical Business Analyst to migrate legacy clinical data into a new system that's being implemented. The ideal candidate will have prior experience working with clinical data or experience working within the Healthcare industry.

The Role:
Working with the project stakeholders to gather and document detailed legacy data conversion business requirements.
The definition of business rules for legacy data convergence, cleansing and ongoing synchronisation activities.
The completion of legacy data profiling activities.
The completion of legacy data mapping activities (source to target).
The identification and communication of project continuous quality improvement opportunities

Skills & Experience required
Demonstrated extensive experience as a Technical Business Analyst on complex, large-scale, multi-system data conversion and/or migration projects
Ability to work with multiple project stakeholders (technical and business) to gather and document detailed legacy data conversion business requirements via workshops and working groups.
Ability to develop data convergence, cleanse and validate business rules based on agreed detailed business requirements based on outputs of workshops and input from working groups.
Experience writing complex SQL queries and report writing.
Hands-on experience conducting and supporting data conversion test activities (technical and business validation)
Ability to support data profiling activities and documentation.
Ability to develop and provide input into the design, planning and management of data conversion processes.

This is a 6-month extendable contract in Darwin. The successful candidate must be willing to relocate to Darwin (NT).

For more information on the role apply online or call Calvin on 08 82281560.

description:
Senior Business Analyst
Define, assess, create and measure customer experiences that matter.
Ability to understand, plan, scope and communicate complex work across multiple processes, stakeholders and inter-related systems.
Strong understanding of Agile software development methodology.
Understanding of data modelling.
Basic knowledge and understanding of IT skills.
Mentor and Guide other BA's.
About Us:
We have a vacancy for a Senior Business Analyst to join our team as a member of the BA Chapter. The Chapter is a community of practise that provides scalable business analysis services, enabling Bankwest tribes and platforms to rapidly discover and quantify opportunity for customer and business value. We help develop, assess and test ideas, stories and requirements for new (or modified) products and processes, to realise value.
Join us at Bankwest in our journey of adopting agility at enterprise scale, as we strive to deliver what matters to our customers. Enjoy working in a great environment with great colleagues.
The successful applicant will have the following key skills and attributes;
As a strong practitioner with minimum 5 years experience in BA or equivalent role, you will have relevant attributes and skills including:
Strong, relationship and stakeholder management.
Outcome focus, with an ability to challenge while retaining empathy.
Adaptability.
Ability to operate across multiple squads at times, assessing and supporting decisions around prioritising work from multiple different stakeholder sources.
Experience with agile and scrum, user stories and story mapping.
Familiarity with current concepts, tools and trends in the IT space.
Hypothesis and experiment design in the analytics context.
Ability to interpret and visually communicate complex work across multiple processes and inter-related systems.
Strong coaching and mentoring skills to enable quality delivery.
Desired:
Tertiary qualifications in IT or Business-related field or appropriate professional certification.
Key Deliverables include:
Co-designing experiments for proof of problem and value, and analysing results.
Visually communicating relationships and dependencies across complex processes, enabling multiple teams to understand their scope of work.
Developing user journeys and use cases, user stories, story maps supporting customer experience, as well as related system requirements and user tests.
Data identification, extraction and modelling (to an extent).
Process modelling, "as-is" and "to be".
Developing and applying metrics and measurement.
Contributing to work prioritisation, scoping and estimating.
As a member of the BA Chapter, you will also have a role in:
Promoting and influencing the Bankwest culture and agile way of working.
Identifying and sharing trends in the internal and external environment around agile BA practise, analytics and extracting insight from data.
What's on offer
We promote flexibility to balance your work and home life and ensure you achieve your career goals and personal needs. Making a difference in the community is important to Bankwest and colleagues have the opportunity to volunteer two days per year for a cause that matters to them. The successful applicant will enjoy an attractive salary package plus bonus in conjunction with the opportunity to access a range of market leading employee benefits.

description:
Job Description
Business Analyst - 6 Month Fixed Term Contract - Sydney

IBM is the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, serving clients in 170 countries. In this new era of Cognitive Business, IBM is helping to reshape industries by bringing together our expertise in Cloud, Analytics, Security, Mobile, and the Internet of Things. We are changing how we create. How we collaborate. How we analyse. How we engage. IBM is a leader in this global transformation so there is no better place to launch your career.

IBM Global Business Services (GBS) is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants enabling enterprises to make smarter decisions and providing unparalleled client and consumer experiences in cognitive, data analytics, cloud technology and mobile app development. With global reach, outcome-focused methodologies and deep industry expertise, IBM GBS empowers clients to digitally reinvent their business and get the competitive edge. We outthink ordinary. Discover what you can do at IBM. We are hiring.

We are currently recruiting for Technical Business Analyst Fixed term contract, based in Sydney.

The Application Development team is responsible for supporting the full life cycle of enhancements. As a Senior Tech BA your responsibilities include –
Technical Business Analyst experienced in Insurance domain with at least 5 years of insurance domain background.
Technical Business Analyst with strong Business and technical knowledge of Orion (Fineos) Claims management product with prior work experience of minimum 3 years in it.

Technical Business Analyst who possesses niche skill sets in JAVA with experience in translating business requirements Orion (Fineos) application into technical requirements and user stories and in the process, will help de-risk the project outcome in terms of delivery.
Work effectively individually and with team members toward customer satisfaction and success
Conduct Requirement gathering session to elicit the business needs for the development.
Advise the team on business needs and acting as liaison between CLIENT team and IBM team
Abide by CLIENT’s standard for design and development of requirements.
Work with CLIENT to understand their strategic view and position IBM team in alignment with goals.
To ensure success in the role you will possess the following skills –
Extensive experience in Business Analsysis.
At least 5 years of experience in Insurance domain.
Minimum 3 Years of experience in Orion (fineos) claims management product
Experience with SQL databases, JAVA
Strong written and verbal communications
Experience in Agile methodologies, BPM exposure and Selenium-Gherkin automation exposure a nice-to-have

description:
State Street’s IMS service is an integrated solution of technology, operations and processes for an Investment Manager who has outsourced their core investment operations functions to State Street. This typically includes trade management, settlements, data management, investment recordkeeping, valuations, reconciliations, cash forecasting, corporate actions, client reporting and information delivery. By outsourcing these functions to State Street, clients are able to free up resources to focus on expanding their product offerings and increasing their global reach, whilst taking advantage of our integrated, scalable platforms without incurring long-term technology expenditures.

Reporting to the Head of Program Delivery IMS APAC, the Project Manager has responsibility for managing projects associated with:
onboarding new Middle Office Clients
strategic initiatives for existing Middle Office Clients

Responsibilities
Instill a detailed status reporting process, including reporting against plan
Track the actual project expenses (including business & IT staff and travel costs) and compare/manage to the original project budget.
Creating the proper governance model, organization structure and culture across key areas of business and technology to enable the achievement of strategic/tactical goals.
Prepare the following baseline artefacts; Project Brief, Project Initiation Documentation, Project Plan
Manage the IMS Project Plan ensuring that tasks are planned, resources are allocated and due dates are clear. Focus on prioritization and key planning decisions.
Manage the scope of the project, including tracking the status of the IT development activities.
Maintain Issues and Risk Registers and Lessons Learned Log
Work with Test Manager and Conversion Manager, to ensure that the solution/processes and conversion tools are adequately tested prior to go-live.
Work with the Operational Readiness Manager to ensure that the business, systems and client are operationally ready prior to the go-live.
Work with IT in order to ensure alignment and delivery in line with the agreed plan.
Work with the other Project Managers across the Program, to ensure that the business workstreams are aligned and that our efforts are coordinated.
Work with the Client’s Middle Office Lead in order to ensure the services are provided in line with the agreed scope of services.
Defining success criteria (contractual milestones, financial targets, risk mitigation, etc.) for each client integration and working closely with the Program Manager/Unit Head to actively manage the achievement of these objectives.
Directing development of customized end-to-end client transition plans and ensuring management of client conversions to State Street’s operating model and technology.
Driving strategic direction for IMS global deal integration, ensuring consistent processes and tools.
Manage and report on project issues/risks
Establish Change Control and escalation procedures in order to limit scope creep.
Lead and motivate the project team and ensure that behavioural expectations of the team members are established.

Education & Experience
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
Project Management certification such as PMI/PRINCE2, although not mandatory will be highly regarded.
Proven track record in change management/project management, with a minimum 5 years project management/business analysis experience.
Excellent understanding of Middle Office Operations processes and deliverables.
Proven ability to communicate in a clear, concise and professional manner at all levels of staff including IT developers, product and platform owners and senior management.
Strong time management and project management skills.
Demonstrated market knowledge and understanding of the required controls.
Industry certification will be highly regarded. (e.g. FINSIA, CFA)
Proven relationship and client management skills
A focus on risk excellence, with proven risk evaluation, mitigation and management skills
An ability to work effectively with senior management/stakeholders

Work Characteristics
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
Project Management certification such as PMI/PRINCE2, although not mandatory will be highly regarded.
Proven track record in change management/project management, with a minimum 5 years project management/business analysis experience.
Excellent understanding of Middle Office Operations processes and deliverables.

description:
----------------
About HelloFresh
----------------

At HelloFresh, we want to change the way people eat. Over the past 6 years we've seen this mission spread beyond our wildest dreams. Now, we are the leading global company in the expanding online recipe kit delivery market.

So, how did we do it? Our weekly recipe boxes full of exciting recipes and lovingly sourced, fresh ingredients have blossomed into a community of inspired, energised home cooks that expands across the globe. We are one of the fastest growing meal kit businesses and are active and growing in 10 different countries across 3 continents.

If you would like to join an energetic and highly motivated team and work in a dynamic, high-energy, high-growth field where you can really have an impact and make a difference every single day then join us and become part of developing a global fresh food champion.

---------------
Job description
---------------

You will…


Be part of the Growth marketing team to develop HelloFresh's activity
Manage some core marketing channels, from strategic set-up to roll-out
Track performance, analyse key KPIs and monitor budget allocation
Identify gaps in opportunities and processes to optimise campaign performances
Work autonomously and with initiative. As a start-up we need you to drive yourself!

----------------------
Mandatory requirements
----------------------

You have...


Ability to turn analysis into impactful business decision and operational roll-out
Very good understanding of KPIs and an analytical mindset
Strong skills in Microsoft Excel, and a logical way of working
Previous experience (1-2 years) in high intensity business environment
Attention to detail and a proven ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines
Great communication skills (written and spoken) to give recommendations
SQL and willingness to learn is a big plus

You are…


Passionate about our business and obsessed with food!
Data, strategy and growth driven
Proactive, ambitious, and assertive: you take ownership of your work and think beyond the scope of a given assignment
Excited to work in a fast-paced and innovative environment

Must have permanent rights to work in Australia - Full time Position
title: Junior Business Analyst

description:
Job Description

As an experienced Data Scientist you will apply data mining techniques, perform statistical analysis, and develop machine learning algorithms to help us make smarter decisions to deliver even better solutions to Leidos and its customers. You will help us discover the information hidden in vast amounts of data and be comfortable communicating with a variety of stakeholders and importantly using language that is targeted to your audience.
You will work across a variety of projects at one time and your day may include:
Design and develop methods, processes, and systems to consolidate and analyse structured and unstructured, diverse sources including “big data” sources.
Develop and use advanced software programs, algorithms, querying and automated processes to cleanse, integrate and evaluate datasets and model complex business problems.
Supporting our business development and pre-sales activities by identifying advanced analytics opportunities that benefit current and potential customers
Research, design, implement and validate cutting-edge algorithms to analyse diverse sources of data to achieve targeted outcomes

Qualifications

Coupled with your Masters you will have previous experience delivering world-class data science outcomes, you solve complex analytical problems using quantitative approaches with your unique blend of analytical, mathematical and technical skills.
You will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.
Your confident and clear communications skills will see you effectively communicate to a variety of stakeholders and present information to senior leaders and executives.
You will also
Bring your in-depth understanding of statistical and predictive modelling concepts, machine-learning approaches, clustering and classification techniques, and recommendation and optimisation algorithms.
Have experience with common data science toolkits, such as R, Python, NumPy, MatLab, etc. (Excellence in at least one of these is highly desirable)
Be highly effective in managing multiple, concurrent activities, while understanding and managing priorities, dependencies and risk
Have strong conceptual, analytical and interpretive skills with high level of attention to detail
Be comfortable working in a fast-paced, test-driven, collaborative and iterative technology environment.
Additional Information

At Leidos you’ll enjoy 12 weeks’ paid parental leave as a primary carer, flexible work practices, discounted health insurance, novated leasing and more. Foster your career through complete access to learning and development and mentoring opportunities, we have a strong track record of internal promotion and career transitions. Join a company who acknowledges “People First”.
As a business we are focusing on setting people up for success and ensuring there is exposure to a variety of projects, so individuals can develop not only specialist skills, but broaden their experience within the defence field. If this sounds like you and you have the right attitude coupled with the willingness to learn and wanting to be part of a team of professional engineers that are leading the field – apply today
Redefine Possible for your career at Leidos.
This role does requires the successful applicant to be an Australian Citizen and hold at a minimum a Baseline Clearance.
title: Senior Data Scientist

description:
Deloitte Digital: Colliding the discipline of Deloitte with the power of creativity.
About the team
Who says work can’t be exciting? At Deloitte Digital, the worlds of business, creative, and technology intersect to transform the way we work, play, and communicate.
Our vision is simple: Empower clients to reimagine how they connect and engage with their customers. We provide clients with a full suite of digital services, covering digital strategy, user experience, content, creative, engineering and implementation across mobile, web and social media channels.
We employ over 400 people, comprising many of the country’s most talented online strategists, designers, engineers, marketers, copywriters, consultants, business analysts and quality assurance professionals. The integration of our passions and talents enables us to build more than just a website. We build new business capability by creating the right balance of creativity, communications and technology.
How are we different? Our difference comes from our diversity. We bring many different perspectives to our clients’ challenges and opportunities. We have the business acumen of a strategic advisor; the design capability of a creative agency and the engineering depth of a technology firm. Furthermore, we can shape our broader range of capabilities into an integrated solution for the more transformational projects requiring expertise in areas such as operations, human capital management, risk management and data analytics.
About You
Our studio in Canberra is growing as we cater for the rapid increase in demand for transformational digital services, due to recent policy developments and whole-of-government initiatives, that create new momentum for change within the public sector. Digital disruption has truly moved from the edges to the core of the Canberra economy!
We like working with bright, talented people who share our passion for all things Digital. With us, you get the chance to work on a variety of projects with some of Australia’s largest and most iconic organisations. Our projects are often high profile – leading, shaping and changing the way the local industry does digital.
The scope of work is always diverse – our strategy is centred on developing solutions for:Mobile applicationsInternet / IntranetCustomer experience designSocial mediaDesktop applicationsTechnology architecture and developmentSystem integrationManaged solutions

Skills / Experience Required
You will have had experience working in multi-disciplinary teams to undertake discovery required for digital transformation projectsYou will be comfortable conducting research activities – interviews, surveys, and desktop researchYou will have had substantial exposure to developing quantitative and qualitative analysis to inform research findingsYou will possess extensive design process experience to support a range of activities, including but not limited to service design, experience design, and UI designYou will possess extensive business analysis and requirements development experience on a range of complex engagements, and be comfortable supporting these activitiesYou will have a passion for developing reports and other project artefacts, and be expected to apply Deloitte consulting methods and tools to solve client business problems
Deloitte Culture
We are innovative and different because YOU are… we pride ourselves on our team of diverse, high performing Deloitte Professionals who are talented, supportive, inclusive and social – and who are at the heart of our success. Our aim is to ensure that all our people feel comfortable to bring their whole selves to work, and as a result, build a workplace that encourages the true spirit of 'And different'.
From day one at our firm you’ll be considered part of the Deloitte community and our development and career progression framework will help you develop the skills and capabilities that will set you up to succeed – in every sense of the word. At Deloitte, we assume that you perform other roles within your life…you could be a student, a teacher, a passionate hobbyist and a caring family member. We recognise the importance of balance and embrace agility, understanding that this means different things to each and every one of our employees.
Next Steps
If this sounds like an exciting career challenge, that aligns with your personal goals and expertise, we want to hear from you. Check out our YouTube page and social channels for further insights into life at Deloitte Digital. In the meantime, we look forward to receiving your application.
The minimum salary offered for this role is $70,000.

description:
Permanent Full Time
Location: Sydney - Inner Suburbs & CBD, Brisbane - Inner Suburbs & CBD, Melbourne - Inner Suburbs & CBD
Categories: Analyst, Insurance, Team Member, Pay Band 5

Senior Business Analyst
Permanent role
A collaborative and customer focussed analyst role
A coaching and mentoring role
Sydney, Brisbane OR Melbourne CBD location
We are looking for a Senior Business Analyst to work as part of the Business Delivery team to support the review of Insurance processes and their interactions with technology systems, working with business and Technology, Data and Labs personnel to develop requirements that support the Suncorp strategy. The size, complexity and number of concurrent projects will vary. This exciting role assists projects to define requirements and processes and supports the delivery of projects across the Insurance function. The Senior Business Analyst also works closely with stakeholders (sometimes in complex and unfamiliar environments) using appropriate methods to understand true business needs and elicit requirements, and be a trusted advisor and advocate for the Insurance business.

Key responsibilities:
Requirements elicitation, using various methodologies (such as interviews, facilitating requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, vendor assessments etc) and collaborating closely with key business stakeholders and subject matter experts
Requirements documentation, including process mapping and modelling (As-Is and To-Be), artefact management, and Standard Operating Procedures/training material/communication development
Critically evaluating information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true business needs
Identification and implementation of industry best practices (processes, tools, technology) to drive high-quality results throughout business analysis activities
Identification and mitigation of issues or risks; act as an escalation point for day-to-day tasks and project issues
Assist the business prioritise high level business requirements, recommending options, providing cost benefit analysis and solution option development
UAT planning and management/oversight
Developing relationships and building confidence to become a trusted advisor to key business stakeholders.
Actively coach and mentor junior BAs to understand and become proficient in process modelling, project management practices and principles, and build an awareness of Business Analysis standards.
Active involvement as an expert in a Community of Practice, championing Business Analysis standards and integrating BABOK tools and techniques
 Skills and Experience:

5+ years’ of extensive experience as a Business Analyst across multiple business areas and technical domains (Insurance industry preferred)
Minimum of 3 years Insurance industry experience is mandatory
CBAP or above accreditation preferred
Previous experience working on system implementation projects is desirable
Experience coordinating and overseeing the work of other BAs, including mentoring others and contributing to a Business Analysis Community of Practice
Experience working on complex projects and programs of work including multiple integrated systems and across functions
Don’t miss this opportunity to work with a supportive performance driven team!

If this sounds like you, apply online today. For further information please contact Annette Frasca on 02 8121 3236.
Advertised: 17 Oct 2018 AUS Eastern Daylight Time
Applications close: 31 Oct 2018 AUS Eastern Daylight Time

description:
What will you be doing?

Our clients range across the Financial services sectors, and the engagements are diverse and varied, so you could be on site assisting in the enablement of a digitisation strategy, identifying the way clients are going to be serviced in the future, or working on ensuring the security of customer data. And that’s just the start!
Is this you?
We are seeking skilled professionals who are passionate about generating meaningful change for clients and who are keen to belong to a company committed to bringing out their best, and supporting them along the way.
