You are confident of your abilities to build and manage stakeholder relationships at all levels

description:
Come and join one of Australia’s most iconic brands; where inspiration is at its best. Freedom is one of the nation’s leading lifestyle retailers. We don’t just sell furniture, we sell the dream! Where our people can be themselves and deliver to the Australian people exceptional products at great value that are unique to the Australian way of life.
With over 35 years in the furniture and homewares industry, Freedom has established itself as a market leader, in style, on-trend products and quality. We are known for our great design and a customer experience that you will be proud to be part of.
We are committed to delivering a world class customer journey, coupled with a highly engaged retail team. Our number one priority is to build on our existing talents to create a culture that rewards high performance, fosters job satisfaction and invests in career opportunities.
Role:
This is a rare full time opportunity, where you manage and maintain the testing process for new and modified software before deployment into production. To define the user requirements for new and modified software and assist in the selection and evaluation of software based on these user requirements, as well as ensure a smooth handover of new software to the IT support teams.
Your responsibilities will be (but not limited to):
Elicit business requirements for new systems and system changes
Communicate to the Retail Operations required identified changes to systems procedures requirements
Resolve system issues escalated by IT Service Desk Analysts as required
Conduct testing as required for software to be released into production
Ensure the test environment is available for user acceptance testing and co-ordinate resources to complete tests with the relevant business units
Developing and maintaining integrations between systems using the company ESB/Middleware (Dell Boomi)
Assisting in the development of business reports and data extraction use Microsoft tools (eg MS SQL queries, MS PowerBI, MS Excel)
To be successful you will need:
3+ years experience working within a similar role
Strong technical writing skills
Strong MS Office skills
Experience in developing and executing test scripts (including automated test scripts). ISTQB or similar qualifications
Business Analyst experience and strong communication skills
Experience in a retail environment as a business analyst is highly regarded
Ability to interpret technical information and translate in business terms for users to understand
Strong problem-solving skills
Familiar with writing MS SQL queries
Able to work with and are familiar with TM1
Ability to work well in a team
We offer:
Great company and team culture
Free onsite gym & gym classes
Rewards and recognition - we believe in recognising our employees and our outstanding performers through various reward and recognition programs
Generous staff discounts across all reputable brands, incentive schemes and other benefits
If you have a positive and team player approach, who has a strong experience as a Business Analyst, then this is the role for you!

description:
Project Business Analyst
Work within our BI Team
6 month Secondment or Fixed Term Contract Role

Welcome to This Australian Life.

From the millions of Australians we protect, to those that make it happen every day at TAL, people really are what we’re all about.

TAL needs people who represent our diverse Australian community. People who embrace our spirit and inspire confidence in their colleagues, customers and community. People who are passionate about making the most of the choices and options we provide. People who do what’s right, aim high, and work smart.

About the Opportunity
The Project Business Analyst will play an integral role in the delivery of a key organisational BI project. This role will require strong project & time management skills, solid commercial acumen, effective stakeholder management skills, and an awareness of BI & reporting.

The role will require adoption of industry best practices and adherence to standards and governance in the collation of information, and design & implementation of new BI solutions.

In this role you will be responsible for:
Facilitating design and requirements workshops across a broad range of stakeholders (including senior executives)
Leading and managing the collection & synthesising of technical and non-technical requirements from a broad range of stakeholders
Process mapping & analysis of underlying issues to identify synergies & insights
Establishing clear documentation and draft minutes for project meetings & workshops
Initiating, influencing and maintaining relationships with and between key internal & external stakeholders, fostering relationships through lessons learned, feedback mechanisms and management of expectations
Collaborating with other members of the project team to optimise project outcomes
Managing multiple simultaneous deliverables
Promoting and ensuring the use of appropriate project management techniques, methodologies and tools

About You
To be successful in this role you will have:

Tertiary education in Commerce, Business, Economics, or Marketing disciplines
The ability to engage with stakeholders to capture and translate business needs into technical & non-technical specifications
Strong problem solving abilities and be comfortable with complexity and ambiguity
Excellent requirement gathering, analysis and documentation skills and experience writing concise user stories and designing storyboards
Experience communicating with a wide range of business stakeholders, from frontline to executive level
Strong Microsoft Office skills, especially PowerPoint and Excel
Experience within Life Insurance, General Insurance or Financial Services industry preferred
Working knowledge of SQL & Tableau desirable
Working knowledge of BI reporting, data warehouses, data management, & CRM systems from both technical and business perspectives desirable

Work is a big part of this Australian life, and we work hard to make it one of the best parts. We want our employees to work in ways that suits their life and the nature of their role, so they feel able to meet their work life commitments and support their wellbeing. Everyone’s welcome to work for us – regardless of their age, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, intersex status or any disabilities they might be living with.

We know it’s the people we work with and experiences we share that make work meaningful and fulfilling, and we’d love for you to be part of it.

You don’t have to be an artist, adventurer, doer or dreamer, but it really helps.

If you would like to apply or refer a friend please click on the relevant button below and follow the instructions. Alternatively, if you would like further information please contact Tania Villiers, Talent Acquisition Partner at tania.villiers@tal.com.au

You will use this understanding to support delivery, derive systemic insight and improve products to ensure customer value is delivered and successful renewals achieved.

The Senior Data Analyst is part of the Analysis team and will work closely with operational counterparts in Customer Relationship Management, Engineering and DevOps.

With a focus on Waste & Markdown optimisation system, you’ll be helping the customers reduce the amount of food thrown away each day, using analytics and process improvement.

You will:

Support the Customer, Customer Relationship Manager and Insight Manager by being the expert on the customer’s data and the output of the products (SLA, accuracy, parameters, formatting, value).
Work closely with the Engineering or Decision Science teams to further tune and develop either existing products, whilst being hands-on with the product day-to-day, understanding what impact changes will have.
Leverage knowledge of store operations, data and the products to derive valuable insight for the customer and continuously demonstrate value of our products (and ways to improve our value from product/service enhancement).
Identify business development opportunities through exploration of current customer solutions.
Be involved in the deployment of new and existing products to new markets and/or clients, including POC work, product demonstrations etc
What does it take to be successful in this role?
Requirements:

5+ years’ experience in an analytical role providing demonstrable value and commercial impact.
Knowledge of retail operations and processes. Ideally, you will have worked at a retailer or FMCG company.
Ability to take abstract and unfamiliar datasets and tell a meaningful story with actionable insights
Strong working knowledge and experience in SQL & Excel
Experience with data-centric scripting/programming (eg, R,Python,Scala)
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and a strong cross-functional collaborator.
Knowledge of BI platforms (e.g. MicroStrategy) and data visualisation software (e.g. Power BI) is desirable, not essential.


If this sounds like you then we’d love to hear from you.
josh@talenza.com.au

description:

Development of big data analytical solutions

About the Organisation

Our client is a government department who identify threats within the Australian financial system. Their main responsibility is to combat anti-money laundering and counter-terror financing as well as working alongside other government agencies overseas as well as nationally to keep Australia safe from financial crime as well and build and maintain trust in Australia's financial system as part of the global community.

About the Role

As the Data Scientist, you will be required to engage with statistical and data mining techniques to provide insight into ML/FL risks. It will also be required of you to conduct research and then develop activities to implement some innovative solutions to the identified risks.

Undertake research and development activities to provide innovative solutions
Participate with data science techniques to identify algorithms
Perform data wrangling and create data pipelines
Develop, implement, deploy, test and evaluate machine learning models to model risk

description:
Digital Business Analyst-SYD000752
Flexible work options - work smarter in a way that suits your lifestyle.
18 weeks paid parental leave - for mum, dad & foster carers.
Opportunities available in both Sydney or Brisbane

Looking for an exciting, diverse and challenging new role with a global impact? Join a newly formed technology team in Australia's largest professional services firm that delivers cutting-edge digital products and automation solutions for our Assurance practice.

The Opportunity
At PwC, we help Australian businesses, not-for-profits and governments create value and improve the way they work. From improving healthcare, to creating smarter cities and igniting Australia’s start up industry, you’ll build trust in society and solve important problems.

The Assurance Innovation Lab is a small team of highly experienced designers, developers, data scientists and analysts who are responsible for delivering digital products and automation solutions to PwC’s Assurance business across the Asia-Pacific region.

We partner with subject matter experts across the business to advise on, design and develop technology-enabled solutions that help to transform the way we deliver assurance services to our clients.

Our Assurance business delivers a broad range of financial audit and risk advisory services. Our teams work with clients to help them protect and strengthen every aspect of their business, from people to performance, strategy to systems, and business plans to business resilience.

The Role
As the Digital Business Analyst you will be responsible for partnering with our client-facing teams and business subject matter experts to facilitate requirements gathering workshops, deconstruct processes and identify methods for standardising the way that they are delivered.
On a day-to-day basis you will be:
Facilitating business process analysis workshops with client-facing teams.
Applying human centred design principles in the design of products, services, and internal processes.
Deconstructing and documenting user stories, features and requirements in product backlogs.
Translating business process flows into repeatable workflows and business rules.
Partnering with designers and developers in the Digital CoE to help translate business needs into technical development requirements.
Facilitating engagement with business teams, including support during test planning and execution.
Actively participating in daily team stand-ups.
Participating in firmwide business analysis forums and communities to share ideas and contribute to our body of knowledge.

About you
The brief is simple...

Applicants must be able to demonstrate the following key capabilities and behaviours:
Exceptional problem-solving and critical thinking skills, an analytical mindset and outstanding attention to detail.
Strong presentation and facilitation skills in large group settings.
Experience applying design thinking methods and human centered design principles to solve business problems.
Strong experience writing user stories, business requirements and functional specifications.
Experience documenting processes using Business Process Model and Notation (BPMN).
Ability to understand complex technical requirements.
Ability to work efficiently with remote teams using collaboration technology.
Ability to identify issues and solve complex problems as part of a team.
Ability to remain calm when under pressure and meet demanding deadlines.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Experience working in Professional Services, Financial Services or Consulting environments.

Ideally, you will also have:
Experience developing low fidelity user interface wireframes.
Experience working on projects that follow an Agile Scrum methodology.
Experience documenting user stories, features and requirements in an Agile work management tool such as Microsoft’s Visual Studio Team Services (VSTS).

Sound like you? Read on.

What we offer
Working for Australia’s largest professional services firm you’ll join a global network spanning 157 countries that delivers meaningful outcomes for a wide range of clients.

Our culture and benefits are why we’re LinkedIn’s number one Australian workplace. With state of the art offices and premium technology, each person has access to flexible work options. The dress policy is flexible too – you choose what you wear based on the work you do with your team and clients.

Fostering an inclusive culture and embracing differences is at the core of everything we do. PwC empowers you to be yourself and work with people from many backgrounds to achieve things never thought possible. Get involved in our employee-led diversity networks (cultural, disability, LGBTI or gender equality) and benefit from our best-in-class policies such as 18 weeks maternity/paternity leave, flexible work and gender equity.

Up for a challenge? We’re committed to helping our people unleash their potential. Hard work doesn’t go unrewarded and industry best coaching, mentoring, training and development are ready and waiting. If you hold a genuine desire to make a difference and want to surround yourself with like-minded, talented and driven individuals who strive to do the same, apply now.

PwC is committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce. Our Reconciliation Action Plan sets out our commitment to increase Indigenous employment. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Australians.

Sam Thomas is the Recruitment Manager for the role. As the team experience high volumes of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all.

Job Software Design & Engineering
Primary Location Sydney
Job Type Full-time
title: Digital Business Analyst

description:
Ashdown People are looking for an experienced BA within the health sector to join our government client in this 7 month contract role located in Chatswood.

This role will be working on a statewide end to end digital transformation project where records and information will be transitioned to a single platform, where the information can then be accessed by a number of medical professionals.

The Business Analyst will provide clinical expertise to the design of clinical solutions during the analysis and design phase of the program. As part of the design process, the Business Analyst will be managing the review and analysis of the organisation's clinical intentions, services, processes and information needs to identify changes that lead to enable a single digital platform. The key part of the role is to manage the processes associated with receiving, reviewing and actioning requests for new and changed functionality.

Responsibilities include:
Driving the elicitation of clinical and business requirements using a broad range of engagement techniques including, data and systems analysis, requirements workshops, site visits, process descriptions, use cases etc.
Utilise clinical expertise in user requirements analysis, translate clinical requirements into design recommendations, engage and negotiate with stakeholders and provide leadership in the delivery of safe and high quality solutions.
Manage and update clinical design and support documentation in line with agreed design principles, best practice and quality assurance processes.
Oversee the review and analyse of existing application design to optimise functionality, workflows and usability including performing gap analysis, communicating specific enhancement requirements to relevant support teams/vendors, and co-ordinating user acceptance testing.
Provide direction and clinical advice on the strategic development of business plans and processes aimed at enhancing the efficiency of the Design & Build team and support the implementation of strategy and processes.
Manage and support projects by undertaking analysis and impact assessments including testing, training and business transitions.

Selection criteria:
Demonstrated experience in a relevant clinical and/or healthcare administration role/function; or a satisfactory combination of education, training and experience.
Demonstrated experience documenting clinical business requirements and working directly with solutions teams to translate into application solutions.
Demonstrated experience of business analysis in health ICT using Agile or Prince2.
Demonstrated experience with end user and application support functions including problem solving and resolution of application function defects.
Pay - $600-650 + super per day.
Location - Chatswood

Please apply now for immediate consideration. Please note we are ideally looking for candidates who have the capacity for an immediate start pending national criminal record check clearance.

description:
If you’re a smartphone user then you are part of an ever more connected and digital world. At Amdocs, we are leading the digital revolution into the future. From virtualized telecommunications networks, Big Data and Internet of Things to mobile financial services, billing and operational support systems, we are continually evolving our business to help you become more connected. We make sure that when you watch a video on YouTube, message friends on SnapChat or send your images on Instagram, you get a great service anytime, anywhere, and on any device. We are at the heart of the telecommunications industry working with giants such as AT&T, Vodafone, Telstra and Telefonica, helping them create an amazing new world for you where technology is being used in amazing new ways every single day.



In one sentence

Understands business needs. Assesses the impact of those needs, capturing, analyzing and documenting requirements and providing high level solutions that leverage product capabilities and best practices in order to produce an optimal solution. Communicates and implements recommended solutions.



What will your job look like?

You will work with the client's business to shape the business requirement in a tangible form. He should understand telecom industry well to also advise Telstra on the use cases and the potential domains that will have an impact. and you feed this information to the service designer.
You will have the opportunity to reflect customer needs by gathering business documents and technical requirements.
You will be a key advisor for customers based on product capabilities and best practices, leveraging reuse where applicable.
You will design holistic and integrated high-level solutions that fit customers' business needs, production operability and budget.
You will participate in and/or leads formal and informal reviews with stakeholders, applying knowledge and experience and providing technical perspective and support.
You will be responsible for communicating the solution with customers' business and IT personnel. Will be expected to explain the new details of new solutions and their impact on business processes.
You will ensure that the customer understands the solution and receive responses to all open questions and action items.
You will support the customer during the scoping phase in a specific domain up through and including customer sign off (for example, COP process for various customer types and products, EPC lead for all product models and designs, etc.)
You will prepare solution-related documents and specifications. Configures the solution, and creates, executes and maintains accurate and detailed test plans for testing when applicable.
You will support the resolution of configuration/ implementation related issues if and when they arise.




All you need is...

Business Analyst works with the client's business to shape the business requirement in a tangible form. He should understand telecom industry well to also advise Telstra on the use cases and the potential domains that will have an impact.
Business Analyst feeds this information to the service designer.

Basic Skills:
Degree in Computer Science or Industrial Engineering & Management - Information System
At least 5 years of business analyst/PDM experience in Telecom domain
Customer-facing experience – ability to present the Amdocs solution using various methods (presentations, demos, and so on)
Must have strong and solid background of telecom network technologies
With sufficient technical knowledge to understand high-level architecture and technical requirements around OSS Telecommunication solutions



Why you will love this job:

You will be able to use your superior business analyst skills to make a significant impact on high-level solutions that best produces the optimal product solution.
You will be a key member of a global, dynamic and highly collaborative team with various possibilities for personal and professional development
You will have the opportunity to work in multinational environment for the global market leader in its field

description:
Melbourne,Victoria,Australia BEH7X3
Boeing is the world's largest aerospace company and leading manufacturer of commercial airplanes and defense, space and security systems. We are engineers and technicians. Skilled scientists and thinkers. Bold innovators and dreamers. Join us, and you can build something better for yourself, for our customers and for the world.
We are looking for a Data Scientist to support the Australian region, Information Technology and Data Analytics (IT&DA) organisation. The organisational scope supports Boeing businesses in Australia and associated enterprise functions: Commercial and Government Aftermarket Services; Engineering, Manufacturing, Quality, Safety, Supply Chain, HR, Finance, and Corporate functions.
At Boeing, we are already making a difference across the industry using data analytics to deliver strong, rich and safer product experience to our commercial and government customers. We are expanding and growing in all areas in the frontier of aerospace industry. We are working on projects that utilize the latest techniques in Machine Learning (including Deep Learning, Neural network), Natural Language Processing and deep infrastructure. We’ve already been joined by some of the best minds, and we’re looking for talented Data Scientists that have applied experience in the field to join our team.
Data scientists will have opportunities to work on projects with highest priority to the business. Paramount to success in this role is the ability to determine, define and deploy predictive/prescriptive analytic solutions to identify and perform root cause analysis on adverse trends, by choosing best fit methods, defining algorithms, and validating and deploying models to achieve results.
Requirements
This role will lead the businesses to strategic outcomes, partner with all functions across the business, applying their strong data analytics skills to drive decision making for better outcomes.
This role requires a close cross functional collaboration across multiple teams including analytics, product management, and operations to drive product development.
Assesses current reporting for best fit, combine best practices and business expertise to deliver efficient and scalable business analytics to improve business productivity and business to desired outcomes.
Passionate about working with large and complex unstructured and structured data sets. Utilizing that large amounts of data to identify information that can be used for predictive analytics to drive business outcomes.
Discover insights that enable senior management to make strategic decisions and address business challenges and lead the business to deliver to these.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills. You should be able to work across functions and effectively present, recommend and communicate a position by demonstrating its value and tradeoffs.
Able to self-direct and succeed with minimal guidance.
Comfortable conducting design, algorithm, and code reviews.
Ability and passion to train and educate others on the skill of data analytics
Bachelor’s degree in a computer, engineering or quantitative discipline (e.g., statistics, operations research, bioinformatics, economics, computational biology, computer science, mathematics, physics, electrical engineering, industrial engineering).
3+ years of relevant work experience in data analysis or related field. (e.g., statistician, data analyst, data scientist, computational biologist, physicist, bioinformatician)
Experience with statistical software (e.g., R, Octave, Julia, MATLAB, pandas) and database languages (e.g., SQL).
Experience in Natural Language Understanding, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Algorithmic Foundations of Optimization, Data Mining or Machine Intelligence (Artificial Intelligence).
Experience in working with large, complex and disparate data sources.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to explain analytical methodologies simply and thoroughly.
Excellent collaboration & influencing skills and a proven ability to work with stakeholders to deliver on outcomes
High attention to detail for data integrity and the ability to track down data inconsistencies.
Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Experience with and having the ability to quickly understand complex data sources and logic.
Proven track record of success working in dynamic environments with frequently changing business environments.
Finance background or previous experience working closely with a finance team is a requirement. Knowledge of SAP Record to Report and Procure to Pay (MM / WM / PP / FICO) an advantage.
Great interpersonal skills to create strong relationships and trust with senior stakeholders and the wider business.
Background of trend analysis and qualitative or statistical analysis & modeling
Boeing, we are committed to creating an inclusive and incident and injury free workplace, where employees can realise their career goals and make a positive contribution to Boeing's success. If this role is you and you're excited by the opportunity to be part of building something amazing, we welcome your application.
Yes, 10 % of the Time CIO, Information & Analytics Individual Contributor No No Standard Australia; Boeing Australia Holdings Proprietary Limited

description:
Job Description
Are you passionate about leveraging data to deliver actionable insight that impacts daily business decision of Amazon? Does the prospect of dealing with massive volume of data excite you?

Amazon is seeking an outstanding Business Analyst to join Amazon Australia’s operations team, in transportation. Our team is responsible for planning & execution of Amazon’s transportation network in Australia. Amazon has culture of data-driven decision-making, and demands business intelligence that is timely, accurate, and actionable. During our day to day operations, tons of data is generated which is leveraged to make important business decisions.

Our ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, relishes working with large transactional volumes and big data, enjoys the challenge of highly complex business contexts (that are typically being defined in real-time), and, above all else, is a passionate about data and analytics.

As a Business Analyst, this individual will be developing SQL/ETL queries, accessing data warehouse, creating automated reports through macros, and creating relevant KPIs and metrics for performance of transportation and supply chain operations. This role will publish daily/weekly/monthly performance reports as needed; and will give us business insights based upon data to further improve our operations.

A successful candidate knows and loves working with business intelligence tools, is comfortable accessing and working with big data from multiple sources, and passionately partners with the business to identify strategic opportunities to deliver results. This individual must have an internal drive to answer “why?” questions, excellent analytical abilities, strong technical skills, as well as superior written and verbal communication skills. S/he will be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, able to think big (while paying careful attention to detail), and enjoy working in a fast-paced dynamic environment.

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in technical field
Experience working in SQL and writing queries
Experience with developing reports from Tableau preferred
Proficient in MS Excel (macros, pivot tables, vlookups, hlookups, etc.)
Should understand business context and creating KPIs/Metrics as per business needs
Excellent communication skills in English
Preferred Qualifications
Work experience in Transportation environment
Knowledge of statistical programming language (e.g., Python, R, etc.)
Master’s degree in Computer Science or related technical field

description:
Opteon is an international provider of valuations, advisory and specialist property services in the Australian and New Zealand market. Recognised as the largest valuation professional services firm in these regions, we deliver meaningful solutions for our clients across all property types and market sectors. We are experiencing an exciting period of growth and change, positioning the company as one of the most prominent property services providers. Our future growth strategy is for organic growth, diversification and international expansion.

About the Role

Reporting to the People Operations & Strategy Manager, within the People & Culture team, this newly created role will work closely with the project teams to assist with requirements, analysis and development of tools, data, techniques and processes to effectively execute "Project Daylight", Opteon's Human Capital Management (HCM) / Enterprise Resource Management (EPR) solution.

This will entail:

Providing advice and support in relation to Project Daylight - HCM/ERP Systems incorporating Finance, HR and Payroll, with a focus on the HR / People component
Working closely with the HR People & Culture, payroll and Daylight project teams for the implementation phases of products within Project Daylight
Assisting in the development, preparation and execution of test cases of the systems for Daylight
Providing input to test case development, execution and documentation
Assisting with the data migration activities for transition to the Daylight solution for any current and future integrated businesses
Assisting with the development of any integration tools, scripts, processes etc associated with the implementation of Daylight
Building of new HR process and workflows
Assist with developing end user training to support implementation, including the development of training material
Documentation and definition of business rules, including rules and policies related to employee benefits, leave, and compensation, will be part of this role


About you

You will possess highly developed interpersonal and communication skills. The ability to build and maintain effective working relationships with key stakeholders at all levels is essential to ensure smooth and timely outcomes of business priorities, together with:

Strong knowledge and understanding of end to end HR business processes, tools and systems
Prior experience with HCM / ERP implementation, and in particular with Microsoft and Workday
Demonstrated prior experience in testing and supporting Enterprise and Human Capital systems
Demonstrated prior experience in maintaining, testing and supporting HR systems
Knowledge of business processes and workflows for enterprise systems
Sound knowledge of Group business practices and project management principles


What we offer

We offer rewarding careers for outstanding individuals, a positive and inclusive culture and the distinct opportunity for high performers to develop professionally. This is your opportunity to be a part of Opteon and its ongoing success.

How to apply

Please apply for this position by submitting your confidential application online including resume and cover letter.

you will be required to work with the business cross functionally and build and maintain strong relationships while influencing key stakeholders. description:
Requisition ID: 16888
Job Category: Consulting; Engineering; Information Technology; Technology

With over six decades of business and technical experience in the mining, energy, and infrastructure sectors, we understand that challenges are changing rapidly in every industry. We respond quickly with solutions that are smarter, more efficient, and innovative. We draw upon our 9,000 staff with experience in over 150 countries to challenge the status quo and create positive change for our clients, our employees, and the communities we serve.
Unique opportunity to be exposed to complex & diverse data science problems across various industries
Access to global expertise, technologies and career advancement opportunities
Enthusiastic team with fresh ideas, where you can contribute and shape to the future growth of the practice
Hatch is seeking applications from Senior Data Scientists in Brisbane, who can develop and use AI/ML tools innovatively and manage data science projects to solve technical challenges for our clients in the mining & resource industries.
You will define and manage data science work scopes to import, clean and wrangle data, carry out exploratory data analyses, build and evaluate various predictive models and productionise models. Working with subject matter experts, you will understand the context of the problem, transform the data to answer the business question and use and evaluate models to uncover insights into the processes under investigation, and communicate results in a clear and consumable way. You will be able to assess the appropriateness of the results, know how to safely deploy the models into processes and control systems and advise on the monitoring and maintenance requirements for the deployed solution.
You will be working with the project manager, utilising effective project planning techniques like Agile to break down moderately complex projects into tasks and ensure deadlines and deliverables are kept.
This is an opportunity to join a professional, progressive organisation and become part of an inclusive, supportive team. You will be able to network with colleagues locally, regionally and globally to achieve career success. We strive to maintain a culture that welcomes diversity of thought, individual contribution and team collaboration.
We are an entrepreneurial business in which opportunities abound, so we may ask you to travel domestically and internationally for business, as well as potentially undertake extended assignments away from time to time.

Core Functional Tasks & Key Responsibilities of this role include:

As a data science SME you will manage and perform data science work scopes for
Processing, cleansing and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis
Utilizing exploratory data analysis techniques to understand the data and multivariate analysis to generate new features
Building predictive models using state-of-the-art methods and use appropriate diagnostics to access the performance of the models
Drive the safe deployment of the solution in the client’s processes or control systems and develop the monitoring and support and maintenance plans.
Identifying meaningful insights from large data and metadata sources and interpret and communicate insights and findings from analysis to clients and internal interdisciplinary teams
Identifying and drive implementation of opportunities to improve and enhance data collection and management procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytics systems
Collaborate with clients to ensure projects and outcomes meet their business requirements and manage the execution of a data science project.
Communicating and coordinating effectively with the data science team, systems team, and customer-facing teams to ensure models and results are well understood and incorporated into their business processes
Develop data science opportunities internally and externally, and write data science scopes of work.
Coach and mentor junior data scientists through projects and training sessions.

We are ideally looking for individuals who possess the following qualifications and skills:

Bachelor's or higher degree in Mathematics, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science or related area
Experience in quantitative analysis / research of large, complex data sets
Deep understanding of and extensive experience with predictive analytics techniques and inductive statistical analysis to predict outcomes and behaviours
Expert knowledge and understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms such as GLM, Neural Network, Naïve Bayes, SVM, Decision Trees, Random Forrest, Boosting methods, etc.
Experience with common data science analytical/programming tool, such as R, Python, Matlab,,SAS, IBM SPSS, IBM DSX/IBM PMQ, RapidMiner.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Spotfire, PowerBI, etc.
Understanding of big data techniques & open source platforms and their application to data capture/integration
Possess confidence, creativity, critical thinking ability, a willingness to learn and take feedback, a proactive attitude when faced with challenges, a meticulous attention to unexpected details
Good written, verbal, analytical, organisational, problem-solving and presentation skills
Ability to lead smaller teams on data science projects
Exposure with delivering using Agile.
Experience in at least R, Python or Matlab is also highly desirable.

An employee owned organisation, by joining Hatch you will have the opportunity to be recognised and rewarded for your efforts. You will be provided with many benefits including: competitive remuneration and above statutory superannuation payments; optional salary sacrifice for additional annual leave, and participation in various employee reward and recognition and health and wellbeing programs.
To submit your application please click the "Apply" button below.
Unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies will not be accepted for this position.
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are committed to fostering a workforce in each of our locations that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we operate. If you have any special needs requirements, please let us know and we will do our utmost to accommodate. Hatch also supports and encourages a flexible workplace. We offer our employees comprehensive benefits, including up to 12 weeks annual leave per year as part of our Purchased Leave Program.

description:
When you make work flow, you help people get more done. With fewer hassles. In less time. You impact more companies in more ways. And make more of your career. We help companies do what they set out to do. It’s inspiring work, and it takes inspired thinkers like you.

In this role you will be the primary point of contact for Support Operations, you will work with members of our Global Support Team (do you like to have friends in countries around the world?), the Nintex Management Team (do you want access to decision makers?), and our Business Systems Team (do you love technology?). You will work to gather requirements, create project plans, and execute on the tasks related to the automation of our support processes. You will have ongoing management of support tools and implement new technologies all focused on improving the overall customer and employee experience at Nintex. We will also count on you to provide data analytics on all support platforms by creating automated reporting.

The Day to Day:

Become a trusted advisor on process automation and support tools.
Maintain contact with stakeholders with timely feedback throughout the delivery of a project.

Tracking and mitigating project risks and issues.
Create, maintain, and own high quality user requirements.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to correctly interpret, implement and validate required functionality.
Empower business users to effectively and efficiently use Supports systems.
A little bit about you:

1 – 2 years’ experience as a Business Analyst in Support or IT.
Exposure to Microsoft platforms, solutions or product testing and software testing tools.
Strong MS Office + Visio + Project skills including O365.
Illustrated experience producing quality user requirements, design documentation and project execution.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.
Strong attention to detail.
Sound time management and organizational skills – able to juggle multiple projects simultaneously.
Proven project coordination / management experience.
Experience automating processes with the Nintex suite of products is highly desired
Come cultivate your career with us. Apply now. Work InspiredTM

Nintex participates in E-Verify for work authorization. We are an Equal Employment Opportunity Organization.

title: SAP Master Data Scientist

description:
Requisition ID: 192061
Work Area: Consulting and Professional Services
Expected Travel: 0 - 100%
Career Status: Professional
Employment Type: Regular Full Time

COMPANY DESCRIPTION
SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

SUMMARY:
Do you combine knowledge of business innovation and next-generation technologies to help companies run their businesses better? Do you dream of changing what businesses can achieve and the impact they can have through the intelligent use of these technologies? SAP Leonardo Services is a dynamic new incubator entity within SAP Digital Business Services that combines business innovation, next-gen technology, thought leadership and an entrepreneurial spirit to create impact at scale for SAP customers.
“Together, we make it happen” and the unique position of being able to work on our trust in the intelligent enterprise of tomorrow using the technologies of Blockchain, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, IoT and Advanced Analytics thrills us and opens opportunities like nowhere else.
At SAP, we believe in the power of collaboration and empower our employees to perform at their best in an environment that encourages free and open expression of ideas. Here, you work alongside creative thinkers and deep experts who share your interests, while turning big ideas into reality for our customers. With innovative job training, mentors to help you grow, and the flexibility to balance your work and personal life, you’re able to build your career. It’s no wonder that some of the sharpest minds from around the world are working for a company that is consistently recognized as a global top employer.
THE ROLE
SAP is currently expanding a team that provides latest machine learning technology services to customers, helping them to improve their business results based on scientific analysis of large amounts of business data and apply existing or create new machine learning models to build the intelligent enterprise.
In this role, the machine learning expert works directly with industry experts and technology experts to translate our customers’ business needs into mathematical models or provides a creative approach based on SAP Cloud offerings and will then present and deliver the solution approach to the client.
This position requires the ability to work and communicate as a part of a high-performance team in an international environment. You will bring in your customer expertise to the relevant development units to enhance the coverage of our portfolio.
As a thought leader in Machine Learning you know that learning and personal development is a must and therefore ensure that you keep track of the latest developments and share your knowledge actively with others. This is part of our obligation to help to scale the responsible delivery units after we prepared the ground for scaling.
ROLE REQUIREMENTS
For the Machine Learning / Data Scientist position we are seeking professionals with ideally 3-5 years’ work experience, with high analytical problem-solving skills.
Master’s degree or Ph.D. in Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Data Science
Strong in mathematics and statistics
Software development experience and application of software development frameworks
Capture customer requirements and translate them into applicable machine learning models or applications
Ability to deliver clear, concise presentations to non-scientific audiences
Willingness to participate in the sales process as a subject matter expert
High energy, clear goal orientation and strong work ethic; “can do” attitude
A natural collaborator comfortable working with a diverse range of people across geographies and organizational borders.
#SAPDBS #TogetherWeMakeItHappen

WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.
SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.
SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).
Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.
Additional Locations: Virtual - Japan

Comply with Cubic Human Resources Procedures

Desirable:
Post graduate study in Systems Engineering or related area
INCOSE Certification
Project Management certification

Skills/Experience/Knowledge
7+ years experience working in a software driven technology environment
5+ years experience at a team level in development or technology integration across complex technology solutions
3+ years experience in dealing at customer interface level
Experience at a team level in development or technology integration teams
Formal Systems Engineering Experience
Familiarity with Software Development Life Cycles using both Waterfall and Agile approaches
Familiarity with expressing system designs using UML or other modelling language
Ability to troubleshoot and debug technical issues
Knowledge of relevant engineering standards and relevant “Health and Safety” legislative requirements
Experience of working in a formal project structure following ISO 9001 processes
Project experience with software development projects

Desirable:
Experience with automated fare collection systems, including customer facing and back office technologies
Solid SQL, data management and relational database skills
Data modelling and system design using formal notations
Project co-ordination experience
Human factors knowledge and familiarity with HMI considerations
Knowledge of embedded devices and technology, and engineered IT system solutions

Knowledge of relevant standards in systems engineering domains such as INCOSE, ISO/IEC 15288, EIA-632, or Mil-Std 499, or business analysis domains such as IIBA BABOK

Personal Qualities
Willingness to learn with an open mind.
Self-motivated with an ability to work autonomously but also be an integral member of the Engineering Team

Ability to communicate well, both verbally and in writing, with good presentation skills
Commercially aware and able to protect Cubic’s business interests while striving to deliver superior products and services
Ability to learn and be a system reference expert
Aware of software development best practice and able to apply standards and procedures effectively
High level problem solving skills
Excellent system level understanding of complex systems
Ability to occasionally travel both intrastate and overseas
The ability to work well under pressure in a variety of situations

Successful outcome of a National Police Check
Worker Type:

Employee

title: Technical Business Analyst

description:
Requisition ID: 16936
Job Category: Consulting

With over six decades of business and technical experience in the mining, energy, and infrastructure sectors, we understand that challenges are changing rapidly in every industry. We respond quickly with solutions that are smarter, more efficient, and innovative. We draw upon our 9,000 staff with experience in over 150 countries to challenge the status quo and create positive change for our clients, our employees, and the communities we serve.
The Hatch Advisory Practice fills the gap between technological innovation and strategy consulting to drive sustainable growth of the bottom line of our clients. We are growing at a very rapid pace across the globe and we are looking for Business Analysts to join our dynamic and passionate team in Perth.

As a Business Analyst, you will work within collaborative teams, which include highly motivated management consultants supported by world class technical and operational experts sourced from Hatch’s technical and project delivery divisions. This unique combination ensures that Hatch Advisory provides our Clients with actionable winning strategies and effective implementation support.

We are looking for business savvy individuals with strong technical aptitude to assist in delivering general advisory services within the mining, metal, process, energy, and infrastructure industries. Typical assignments include techno-economic due diligence, mergers and acquisition assistance, lender's engineer, asset management, business improvement, cost control, debottlenecking, technology and innovation roadmapping and other advisory services to support investment strategy and decisions.

We strive to maintain a culture that welcomes diversity of thought, individual contribution and team collaboration. Working closely with other regional and global leaders, you will be tasked with promoting Hatch values and assisting develop our internal talent.

If you are genuinely passionate about unleashing potential for clients and colleagues and enjoy exploring how technology can drive value sustainability, we welcome applications from management consultants and other relevant backgrounds.

Nature of Work:
Take responsibility for delivering segments of analysis within consulting projects
Work with Hatch and client project teams
Select and use a variety of business analysis tools and techniques
Work on a variety of projects, with exposure to several industries, geographies and project types
Undertake potentially frequent travel to client/project sites
Assist in the development of communications (proposals, reports, presentations, etc.)
Assist the clients to identify opportunities, create and execute strategy, achieve the expected outcomes, and sustain these outcomes through the development of technical strategies, key performance indicators and performance measures
Conduct appropriate audits or surveys to identify corrective or adjustment activities to ensure that improvement outcomes stay in line with the client's business needs
Facilitate workshops with clients
Report and present material to Hatch and/or clients as to outcomes achieved and future activities required to sustain and continuously improve
Identify and engage existing clients to further develop business opportunities
Identify and engage new clients to grow the practice
Work with team members to continuously improve practice services and capability

Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Engineering
Solid industry experience relevant to mining, metals, energy, or infrastructure. Specific experience in the mining or metallurgical industry is an asset
Proven experience in using research and analysis tools (particularly Microsoft Excel)
Ability to work independently and under own initiative, or actively contribute as an effective member of a team
Proficiency in MS Office suite of software including PowerPoint, Word, and Excel
Experience working in a high-energy, deliverable-oriented environment with the ability to multi-task
Strong data analytics skills, including experience with business requirements gathering, analysis and ability to translate business requirements into technical process solutions.
Excellent verbal and written communication is essential and competency in additional languages will be considered an asset.

To submit your application please click the "Apply" button below.

Unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies will not be accepted for this position.
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are committed to fostering a workforce in each of our locations that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we operate and we support and encourage a flexible workplace.

description:
Work life balance
Python and SQL Data Modelling
Customer personalisation predictive analytics
We are looking for a Pricing Data Scientist for one of our aviation clients based in Melbourne.

The hiring manager wants a Data Scientist with strong analytics technical skills and knows machine learning in a big data environment.

You could have worked in a commercial environment or have a research academic background and want to move into a commercial role.

This is an expanding team in advanced analytics and you will be working alongside another Data Scientist and Data Engineers. Technically, strong skills with Python would serve you well in this environment.

You will be focused on the customer, working closely with pricing, marketing and personalisation in the digital practice. The big data environment was established 10 months ago and you would be working with the business on a major user case for personalisation. This will involve building models that can do things like recommending destinations and next best offers for customers based on behaviour.

In this role, you will need to make sense of customer data and build models and algorithms using predictive and machine learning techniques. The hiring manager also needs somebody that can articulate to the business what the data means for them.

The majority of your time spent in this role will be spent on data modelling, mainly with Python and SQL. The other part of the role is communicating insights to the business stakeholders and making sure that the work you are doing aligns with what the business wants to achieve.

You will need to be able to work independently and have a statistics, programming and data science background. A commercial, technical, academic or operational background will be helpful.

There is lots of variety in the work you will be doing, as part of a diverse team. Work life balance is important to this business and flexible working from home arrangements are available. There are also big company perks, including huge discounts on domestic and international flights for you and your spouse/partner with a number of different airlines.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about analytics and data science. This can be a fast paced and dynamic working environment. You will need to lead, prioritise tasks and work as part of a team.

Junior, intermediate and senior Data Scientists are encouraged to apply, as there are two positions available.

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

Data Science, programming and statistics background
Data modeling skills
Data query skills
Able to visualise data and present
Desirable to have skills in Machine Learning and / or Artificial Intelligence
Worked with Python and SQL or other similar tools
Desirable to have worked in a Big Data environment
Advantageous to have worked in an AWS and Agile environment
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong stakeholder management skills
Passionate about data science
If the above sounds like you, please get in touch. We can wait for a notice period to be served and we are interviewing immediately.
For further information on this role or to confidentially apply, please contact Rik English on 02 8227 9200 or apply directly via the Apply for this job button. Only WORD FORMAT resumes will be accepted.

description:
Are you a skilled Business Analyst with experience running projects from inception through to delivery? This is an exciting opportunity to use your Business Analysis, Project Management and stakeholder engagement skills to support a well-regarded organisation with a number of ERP related projects.
We are looking for a driven and self-starting individual to:-
Facilitate workshops & requirement elicitation activities
Manage requirements, throughout a project lifecycle
“As-is” and “to-be” process mapping in order to identify gaps
Requirement prioritisation and risk identification
Produce quality outputs that meet the needs of your varied stakeholders
Work with the change team to understand and communicate the impacts of changes and assist in the development of training documentation.
Provide input into the solution design to ensure solutions meet the needs of the stakeholders.
Suitable candidates will ideally have a minimum of 3-5 years’ experience working as a Business Analyst and will have had considerable exposure to ERP related projects. You will have strong exposure to analysis practices, including Data Mapping, ‘As Is’ ‘To Be’ Process Mapping and Gap Analysis.

To be successful in this role, you will require strong communication and stakeholder management skills and experiences of effective facilitation, listening & presenting. You will be comfortable working as part of a team and will have strong problem solving and influencing skills
title: Business Analyst

description:
THE COMPANY YOU WOULD BE JOINING
Join this global, leading manufacturer of medical devices.
Their products are sold in over 100 countries and they pride themselves on being different.
This is all part of their refreshing perspective to their customers.
It's this spirit that helps them provide advantages to both patients and clinicians and they have an entrepreneurial spirit that drives innovation.
WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?
This company is dedicated, they won’t quit until the job is done right for people who use their products, end users, their clinicians and their employees.
They are inventive - they continually push themselves to improve every product they make and every relationship they build.
They have seriously strong partners in their customers, they are seen as trusted advisors and their customers truly respect them.
They have numerous testimonials to back up what a great company they are.
Their culture is friendly, they are open and easily approachable, a great place to work!
THE JOB - ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS PERFORMED
This is a newly created and very exciting role that will play a key part in ensuring the success and delivery of all sales and marketing initiatives. Your strategic approach, strong analysis skills, key stakeholder management, and commercial focus is what will be required to help drive the business to deliver maximised growth within the ANZ market.
You will provide predictive modeling and forecasting to enable the business to be on the front foot and proactive in its go to market approach.
You will conduct and work closely with finance to report on RIO/cost/benefit investment analyses on key business initiatives.
You will strategically target profit leaks and provide remedy options.
You will proactively and regularly review territory and key account budgets.
You will play a key partnering role with the National Sales Manager and National Key Accounts Manager, to assess and support sales resource allocation including territory alignment initiatives and channel management.
You will manage the CRM tool, which is Salesforce, and act as location lead for salesforce.com.
You will monitor and report on data quality/accuracy and efficiency through Salesforce.com, and make recommendations as appropriate.
WHAT YOU WILL NEED
Minimum 3 years’ experience in a business analyst role, preferably in the healthcare industry.
Knowledge and exposure to Salesforce.com CRM tool.
Ability to translate complex data into informed commercial recommendations.
Proficient with the use of business intelligence tools (e.g. Cognos), Excel, Word and PowerPoint.
Confident in extracting data from a number of different sources.
Tertiary qualifications, ideally Business, Finance or Science.
Interested? Please apply now or call Lawrence Sleiman on 02.9817.0599 quoting reference number 2622. Please note, your details/resume will not be sent anywhere without a formal interview and, if successful, your subsequent prior permission. Personal information provided will be used for recruitment purposes only and be treated in the strictest confidence. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
title: Business Analyst

description:
Our Client

A progressive and well-established WA company invested and committed in testing and adopting new ideas, collaborating more effectively, and significantly boosting technology investment to become more agile and responsive to customer needs.

About the Role

This large and prestigious organisation have a job opening for a NEW Business Analyst with a principal focus on effective working in Agile squads. You'll help the team define, assess, articulate, create and measure customer experiences that matter and Drive the execution of key activities within agreed timeframes and at highest level of quality!

Key responsibilities for this role will include:

Perform Business Analysis services within collaborative Agile squads.
Developing and analysing idea canvasses, value cases, and business cases.
Designing experiments for proof of problem and value, and analysing results.
Developing user journeys and use cases, as well as user stories, story maps, related system requirements and user tests supporting overall Customer Experience.
Process modelling, as-is and to-be
Developing and applying metrics and measurement
Data identification, extraction and modelling
Contributing to work scoping and estimating

Key Criteria

You must be able to demonstrate the following skills and experience:

Agile experience mandatory
Problem identification / solving, creative thinking.
Facilitation and interview techniques with a focus on requirement elicitation.
Excellent information presentation and communication, both written and verbal.
Critical thinking; ability to rapidly assess and analyse ideas and information to provide solution design inputs.
Business case and business process development.
Stakeholder management, including influencing and negotiation.
Experience in relevant Business Analysis frameworks; BABOK, BPMN, Lean
Experience in customer centric design (CX)

What's on Offer

This opportunity is an excellent chance for an Business Analyst to join one of WA's most innovative technology practices, and to be a part of a future project to help shape their company. You will be based in the heart of Perth CBD state-of-the-art agile workplace offices where innovation, collaboration, motivation and passion to achieve results are encouraged and rewarded.
title: Business Analyst

description:
About the Company


An opportunity to join a leading tier 1 organisation based in Melbourne CBD. This organisation has undergone major change and is looking to on-board a Senior Data Analyst to work across Digital projects.


About the Role



Interpret data, analyse results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
60% hands on and 40% people leadership
Develop and Integrate databases, data collection, data analytics and other strategies that optimise statistical efficiency and quality
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Mentor, coach and lead a team
Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities

Skills/Experience



Has strong experience working with data from multiple sources and bringing it together to derive insights
Databases such as Oracle, Teradata, DB2
Tools such as SAS, Brio, Qlik, Tableau, PowerBI, Python
Analytical/Statistical skills – must be able to describe and demonstrate knowledge of common statistical methods
Knowledge of SQL essential
Experience with financial services data or product knowledge preferred but not essential
Ability to analyse customer demographic and product data, and web interaction data, and identify causation and contribution and hypothesise on what levers to pull to change conversion and sales outcomes
Ability to understand the customer’s buying journey as they transition from a prospect to a customer
Knowledge of models and modelling techniques ideal but not essential
Experience working with a digital analytics platform such as Adobe Analytics, Adobe Audience Manager, Target or Google Analytics) - Please note I have a number Junior and Senior positions working with these tools.

To apply, click the link and upload your current resume in Microsoft Word format only (.doc or .docx). If you would like to have a confidential discussion, please contact Sam Beeny on 03 9929 9552 , quoting ref no. JO-1808-90675 . Want to know more about Davidson? Visit us at www.davidsonwp.com

. Want to know more about Davidson? Visit us at www.davidsonwp.com
title: Lead Data Analyst - Digital

description:
Work for a global leader in the Healthcare space
Excellent remmuneration $500 - $1000 p.d
Work in an innovative & dynamic team
ABOUT THE COMPANY

Our client is a large pharmaceutical & Healthcare global leader dedicated to addressing the most important medical needs of our time by developing sustainable and integrated healthcare solutions.

ABOUT THE ROLE:

We are currently seeking an experienced Analyst to perform comprehensive data analysis to aid in the development of an integrated cross‑MD Regulatory information technology solution that will facilitate global tracking, business workflow, reporting and analysis of critical Regulatory information and work output

POSITION DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

Rapidly gain an understanding of RIM vision for Medical Devices
Take a complete inventory of all Regulatory information artifacts from specified Medical Devices Regulatory Affairs business units (and relevant non‑Regulatory information sources)
Support development of accelerated plan for data gathering and analysis
Identify critical gaps and/or impediments to effectively achieving goals
Identify/escalate critical issues in a timely manner


EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:

A minimum of a Bachelors degree or equivalent
A minimum of 0-2 years of relevant data management experience / expertise
Understanding of Regulatory business process a plus
Understanding of enterprise systems environment a plus


FUNCTIONAL/TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES & EXPERIENCES:
Ability to understand cross-enterprise data flow and systems
Advanced knowledge with Microsoft Office and data processing applications, i.e. Excel, Access, Alteryx
Fosters excellent cross-functional communications and works effectively across team to achieve business objectives
Excellent communication skills, ability to establish positive working relationships and gain trust of business partners
Strong analytical and organizational skills with the ability to work across diverse business landscape
Preferred experience working within health care regulatory environment such as medical devices, pharmaceuticals or consumer products
Able to work collaboratively in a highly matrixed environment
A strong results-orientation and sense of urgency whilst demonstrating proficiency and success in prioritizing and handling multiple tasks simultaneously
Ability to achieve results under demanding time constraints with expansive and changing priorities.

LEADERSHIP COMPETENCIES:
Strong leadership required in alignment with company's Leadership Imperatives: Connect, Shape, Lead, Deliver
Connect : Cultivate strong internal partnerships and collaborations to maximize effectiveness
Shape: Drive innovative approaches and challenge the status quo; be a positive agent for change
Lead: Take ownership of your performance and development
Deliver: Act with speed, agility and accountability
Please note this is a 2 months assignment / Project approx. with possibility of extension.

If you are looking to join a leading company in the healthcare space please click APPLY today or alternatively send your resume to Alexander Sacro Alexander.sacro@kellyservices.com.au

Due to the overwhelming response, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

description:
Business Analyst
Initial 6 month
Extensions available for an extra 18 months
CBD location
Our Federal Government client is seeking a Business Analyst to join the branch for an initial 6 month contract with possible extension options. The Senior Business Analyst will use business analysis and communication skills to lead and develop requirements, analysis, process and system documentation to support delivery of a number of data and analytics initiatives.

Your new role:
Research and analyse problems, issues and ideas to contribute to the design of practical solutions and processes
Plan, organise and lead the activities of team members, engaged in business systems and/or process design
Work with SME’s to recognise and resolve unique problems, identify and generate new ideas, devise and/or analyse alternative courses of action and their implications, and advance new approaches
Address the key concerns of the audience, tailor communication style and language according to their level of knowledge, skill and experience
Apply established methodologies and tools to understand, analyse and document business processes and requirements in line with technical, administrative or policy constraints
Understand and comply with legislative, policy, regulatory and other established frameworks
Undertake work with team members to produce low level business specifications which model/specify the problem and design solution.
Ideally, you will have:
Demonstrated experience in end to end system testing, developing test cases, involving users and documenting outcomes
Outstanding communication skills and client focus
