Feeder/inter-fund structures
Development of critical path timetable/logistical solutions
Ability to engage with multiple business areas
Familiarity with complex work environments
Confidence in communicating ideas to business stakeholders
title: Data Analyst (2 month contract)

description:
About the Team
Our Insight and Data team helps our clients make better business decisions by transforming an ocean of data into streams of insight. Our clients are among Australia's top performing companies and they choose to partner with Capgemini for a very good reason - our exceptional people.
About the Role
The Data Analyst will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions and actions. You will identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets, then create reports.
Most importantly about you


Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Analyst
A Reporting and Data Visualisation specialist
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages, ERPs, databases and programming
Knowledge of and experience working with Big Data and relevant processing technologies beneficial
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analysing datasets
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
Relevant tertiary qualifications

What we can offer you?
Working at Capgemini you'll find the rewards are more than just financial. Not only will you work alongside inspiring colleagues with a world of experience, but you will also have access to great benefits including, salary continuance insurance, paid parental leave, education assistance, salary packaging, the ability to purchase additional leave, as well as, discounts on entertainment, financial and wellbeing services, travel and shopping.
About Capgemini
Capgemini is one of the world's foremost providers of consulting, technology, outsourcing services and local professional services. Present in over 40 countries with more than 180,000 people, the Capgemini Group helps its clients transform in order to improve their performance and competitive positioning.
Ranked among Ethisphere's 2018 Most Ethical Companies in the Word. Our seven values are at the heart of everything we do - Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Team Spirit, Freedom, Fun and Modesty.
If you believe you have “La Niaque” to go the extra mile, then apply by submitting your resume and cover letter.
Want to know more? To learn more about Capgemini and find out about what makes our people unique, log ontowww.capgemini.com.au
Proof of work entitlements and visa status will be required prior or at offer time. Successful applicants will be required to complete a Criminal Record and Reference checks prior to commencement of employment.
title: Data Analyst

description:
Job posted:
11/10/2018
Applications close:
31/10/2018 (Midnight) 10 days remaining






Today
Job Description
At the Department of Justice and Regulation, we’re looking for people who want to make a difference. People who take pride in their work. People who get things done. People who are committed to making Victoria a safer place. We embrace diversity and strive to have a workforce that reflects the community we serve. We’re all about recruiting the best people, regardless of gender, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation or cultural background. If you think you can do the job and would be a good fit for our department, we’d love to hear from you. The department is committed to the safety and wellbeing of children and recognises that children’s rights need to be respected, their views welcomed and valued, and their concerns taken seriously and acted upon. If you’re having any trouble viewing this ad and would like it or any attachments in an accessible format (such as large print), please don’t hesitate to get in touch with the contact person listed on the ad. For more information on working with us and our recruitment process, please visit justice.vic.gov.au/careers We’re proud of the important work we do across Victoria. Want to be part of it?
About us

The Crime Statistics Agency (CSA) is responsible for the publication of Victoria's recorded crime statistics independent of Victoria Police, as well as research into crime and criminal justice trends across the state. Established in January 2015, the CSA receives crime data from Victoria Police and independently publishes crime statistics to assist law enforcement and government policy and improve public access to data. The Crime Statistics Agency also provides broader statistical services to the justice portfolio.

About the role

Reporting to the Senior Data Analyst, the Data Analyst will work in the development team within the CSA, assisting in the implementation of the Royal Commission into Family Violence's recommendations related to data and statistical improvements.

Specifically, this role concerns the production and updating of the Victorian Family Violence Database, and finding innovative solutions to help the agency better utilise data relating to family violence. The Data Analyst will work as part of the broader development team, and may be expected to undertake and support other related projects relating to crime and criminal justice statistics.

About you

As our ideal candidate, you will be required to demonstrate:

experience in data analysis
strong written communication skills with previous experience in preparing written briefings for a range of audiences
experience in the use of recognised statistical and analytical applications, with knowledge of SQL, Python and/or Tableau being an advantage.
This position may require the successful applicant to obtain a baseline level security clearance.

How to apply

Please click the Apply button at the bottom of this advertisement. Applications should include a resume and covering letter. Attachments can be uploaded in .doc, .docx, .pdf, .txt or .rtf formats.

Please note: When submitting your application online, there will be questions pertaining to a number of the position's Key Selection Criteria to which you are required to respond.
title: Data Analyst (VPSG4)

description:
At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.

We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together.
About the role

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst who will develop advanced customer analytics to increase sales effectiveness and enable smarter selling. This new and critical role is responsible for generating actionable insights working with a range of functional areas including sales, marketing, product and operations.

You should have outstanding technical experience, the ability to interpret data in the context of our business, and strong project delivery skills.
What you'll do

Manage and automate where possible the data ingestion, de-duplication and enrichment of our lead database (restaurants)
Design and deliver customer profiling, segmentation and scoring models
Develop advanced queries, data analysis and visualisations to address specific business cases
Automate reporting and analysis processes and continuously improve data accessibility and tools for relevant stakeholders
Identify opportunities where data analytics can support key business decisions

What you’ll bring

Bachelor or advanced degree in Business Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Econometrics, or equivalent
4+ years of relevant experience
Strong data analytics skills:
Advanced in SQL - ability to import & join data, build complex tables & queries, and automate processes
Advanced in Excel
Experience with Python and/or R
Ability to translate complex analytics into clear, concise and actionable communications
Ability to work with cross-functional stakeholders and apply project management skills to deliver business relevant outcomes

Bonus Points if
Understanding of Salesforce
Experience with text mining and text matching techniques

About the Team

With Uber Eats, we’re building Uber’s newest and fastest growing business, spanning 180+ cities across all six continents in two years. Today, Uber Eats is available across many parts of APAC including Mumbai, Hyderabad, Chennai, Bangalore, Tokyo, Hong Kong, Auckland, Wellington, Sydney, Perth, Brisbane, Adelaide and Melbourne - and we’re just getting started.
title: Uber Eats Data Analyst, ANZ

description:
Data Analyst - Inclusive Education, St Mary's College, MARYBOROUGH


The successful applicant will:
have a commitment to and understanding of the ethos and traditions of Catholic Education;
currently hold or be eligible to hold a Paid Employee Positive Notice Blue Card; and
be eligible to work in Australia for the duration of the appointment.


Characteristics The Data Analyst – Inclusive Education is required to update, maintain and manage information on various computer databases. The key function of this role is overseeing student progression through data analysis. The Data Analyst – Inclusive Education will be responsible and accountable to the Support Teacher – Inclusive Education (STIE). There is a range of roles and tasks in a variety of contexts that relate to this role. The Data Analyst – Inclusive Education will need to ensure all reporting is inclusive and comprehensive which involves gathering information, amending and delivering reports. Delivery of information will be to various people within the College community and at times external organisations. The Data Analyst- Inclusive Education may also be required at times to supervise students for study and exams and undertake small, literacy group activities. The Data Analyst – Inclusive Education needs to be a highly self-motivated person with essential requirements of this role including the ability to problem solve and work to timeframes in order to meet deadlines. Working efficiently, accurately and having attention to detail is an important part of this role. Qualifications Tertiary qualifications at Certificate level or equivalent qualifications relevant to the position may be required or such knowledge, qualifications and experience that are deemed by the employer as necessary to successfully carry out the duties of the position.

St Mary’s College is a Brisbane Catholic Education College in the Fraser District (Maryborough) catering for 410 secondary students. Our school offers the latest in teaching and learning, technology and extra curricular activities. The College has a proud reputation of producing outstanding academic results and providing various career pathways for all students. We are a high quality Catholic school offering our students a holistic education that supports personal growth based on Christian values.

Visit our school website here


Estimated Start Date: Commencing January 2019

Position Tenure: Fixed Term

Weeks Worked: School term weeks only - holidays unpaid

Tenure Duration (If Fixed Term): School Year - 1 Year Contract

Total Paid Hours (per wk) & Days Required: 22.5 hours a week, days and hours negotiable

Salary Level, Range or Hourly Rate: School Officer - Level 3

Employment Conditions: Diocesan Catholic Education Employing Authorities in Queensland Single Interest Agreement 2015-2019


This position involves working with children. The appointment of successful applicants will be subject to satisfactory employment screening for child related employment in accordance with the law.


Contact Person: Mrs Leisa Pedersen

Contact Telephone Number: 4121 2650 (Ext 2)

Contact Email: lpedersen@bne.catholic.edu.au

Role Statement
title: Data Analyst - Inclusive Education, St Mary's College, MARYBOROUGH

description:
Job Description
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking highly motivated Database and Big Data Administrators who are passionate about technology, want to work with and learn one of the fastest growing Cloud platforms in the world and deliver extraordinary customer experiences.

As a Cloud Support Engineer you’ll help customers to deliver solutions in the Cloud on AWS Big Data and Data Warehousing (Redshift) platforms. You will be part of the Support team in Sydney working with customers from all over the world. Every day will bring new and exciting challenges on the job while you:

Learn and use ground breaking technologiesApply advanced troubleshooting techniques to provide unique solutions to customers individual needsWork hands on with customers to develop, migrate, and debug service issuesExpand your knowledge across several database engines and have the opportunity to learn AWS developed Big Data and Data Warehousing solutions
Basic Qualifications
Experience with Linux Application level troubleshooting
Experience administering databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle)
Database performance tuning, troubleshooting, and optimisation
Operating System administration experience (Linux or Windows)
Fundamental networking skills
Understanding of the concepts of Virtualization and Cloud Computing
Communication skills to successfully engage with customers
Self-starter who is excited about learning new technology
Ability to work either Sunday – Thursday, or Tuesday - Saturday
Preferred Qualifications
Some experience with query analyzers and query tuning / slow query optimization etc.
Demonstrable Knowledge & experience in various Big Data or distributed systems. Such as Hadoop, NoSQL, Search and Streaming.
Knowledge and experience maintaining large networks (Routers, Switches, Firewalls)
Experience working with large Cloud platforms or Virtualisation platforms(AWS, Azure, VMware)
Experience working in Large Enterprise, Public Sector, or with vendor managing, and/or maintaining large scale Enterprise systems.
Exposure to security concepts / best practices
Experience managing full application stacks from the Operating System up through Front End applications
Scripting / Programming experience in database related fields
title: Database Administrator / Data Analyst / Data Engineer

description:
The role of the Data Analyst is a high visibility role supporting our Enterprise Platform. Strong skill and ability to triage and prioritize requests based on level criticality is essential.

Hexagon Mining’s Enterprise Platform maps real time data feeds from the field to a production database from which data is transformed and enriched in order to support all levels of reporting: Corporate, Operations and Day to Day ad hoc analysis.

The Enterprise platform is an application hub for all our Life of Mine products, and as such, this role requires coordination and preparation with Product Owners to ensure the reporting requirements of each system and the overall platform is understood and delivered in a timely manner.

As the Data Analyst you will help to develop and maintain a vision for the integrations and will be responsible for communicating that vision to Product Management and the development team.

The Data Analyst works with architects, product management, product owners and development teams to ensure that business, quality and functional goals are met with each product integration.

Must have strong technical knowledge and capability in the areas of report creation, database architecture, database design and documentation

This position is responsible for:

Reviewing and understanding the various datasets which exist in life of mine projects
Planning, Scheduling, Fleet Management, Safety and Production Management
Mapping time series based data to the Enterprise platform for historical reporting
Defining business rules to validate and enrich data mappings
Defining and ensuring teams adhere to database structures and naming standards
Understand end user reporting requirements to define self serve reporting views
Creating and managing development backlog including prioritizing tasks based on Product Management input


Key responsibilities include:

Scoping and documenting reporting requirements of each life of mine system
Managing clear and defined integration mapping requirements
Able to work with key stakeholders across the company to ensure successful execution of development activities related to Integration work
Able to work with multiple international teams
Able to assess and mitigate risk
Effective and efficient decision making
Effective Operating Organization and Talent Development
Efficient and on Time Delivery of Requirements maintaining High Quality and Low Cost
Efficient and Effective Solution Delivery Process
Promote Continuous Improvement
Inspire and motivate the development teams to deliver innovative and exciting solutions with an appropriate sense of urgency

Experience / Skills/ Attributes:

Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology or similar
5 + Years of database integration definition and documentation
Strong experience in Project Management phases such as Requirement Analysis, Business Analysis, QA Testing, user training & support.
Strong organization skills including the planning and documentation of multiple requirements
Knowledge of project manager tools
Strong database analysis skills including data structures and transact-SQL
Experience in report design and development using tools such as Power BI and Microsoft Reporting Services
Exposure to mining, in particular Fleet management systems is highly desirable.

Travel:

Travel (interstate, intrastate and overseas) may sometimes be a requirement of this role
title: Technical Business / Data Analyst

description:
BI/Data Implementation
12 Month Contract
SQL, Teradata, Tableau and/or other BI tools
Liberty IT Consulting Group are in search of an end to end Data focused Business Analyst to assist the program with their understanding, evaluation and implementation of data controls.
Play a hands on end to end Business Analyst role
Experience facilitating workshops and requirements gathering with business stakeholders
Documentation of solutions and hands on business analysis
Drive improvement to processes across data governance and data management practices
Skills/Experience Required:
Must have previous banking experience

Ideally has operated as both a business and a Technical BA (not looking for a pure Tech BA)
Must have strong knowledge of database concepts and data lineage
Must be able to read and understand complex SQL queries and interpret into Pseudo-code
Beneficial to have operated as a data analyst
Beneficial to have hands on knowledge and experience in using analytics programs (e.g. SQL, SAS, Tableau etc)
This is a fantastic prospect where you will have opportunity to enhance your skills in both a business and technical capacity. You will use your keen eye for detail and love of all things “Data” to make this role an invaluable success.
Liberty IT Consulting Group are expanding rapidly and now is the perfect time to jump on board and capitalise on the steady flow of opportunity.
For more information click the APPLY NOW button!

title: Technical Business Analyst (Data/Analytics)

description:
Join our team as a Data Analyst and help us deliver on a significant book of work that is crucial to the Group.

The role will reward you if you can use your initiative to help drive maturity into the reporting functionality and deliver improvements within that space. This is a unique opportunity for you to help us make better data-driven decisions and deliver a more informed, more agile Finance function.

You will develop an intimate understanding of the flow of data through the organisation and contribute to the design of the Macquarie Corporate data model and framework having regard for business and regulatory drivers. You will also work with IT to on-board and embed tools that enable an analytical approach to data and lead efforts to continually improve the quality of data across Finance platforms. In addition, you will interrogate and investigate the Data Warehouse to deliver an improved reporting & analysis toolkit, supporting strategic decision- making across the broader organisation.

You will have an ability to manage your workload to effectively deal with competing demands along with strong technical skills including relational databases, data modelling, data warehousing, SQL, Excel, data lakes and further exposure to Alteryx &/or PowerBI (or other). You will also have an ability to concisely share data insights in both the spoken and written form, along with a proven ability to work across all levels of stakeholders and build relationships quickly. Your strong analytical, problem solving and solution design skills, coupled with your experience within Finance and/or product knowledge of financial instruments, will ensure you are successful in this role. An understanding of Enterprise Data Management and data quality concepts would be desirable but not a necessity for this role.

If this sounds like the opportunity you have been waiting for, please apply today.

The Financial Management Group provides financial, tax and treasury services to all areas of Macquarie. The group is focused on providing strategic analysis and advice to Macquarie's businesses and senior management, managing Macquarie's funding, liquidity and capital position, ensuring Macquarie continues to meet regulatory and compliance obligations and managing Macquarie's corporate communications and investor relations.

Find out more about Macquarie careers at www.macquarie.com/careers

Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

We facilitate a range of flexible working arrangements within our teams. Talk to us about what flexibility may be available.
title: Business Analyst - Data Management

description:
At AKQA, we believe in the imaginative application of art and science to create beautiful ideas, products and services. With an entrepreneurial and collaborative approach, we design adaptive digital services and applications that capture the imagination, delivering impressive returns for our clients.

As a Senior Data Analyst at AKQA, you’ll focus on generating insights from data, enabling us to optimise our clients’ business performance, whilst ensuring their own customers enjoy more relevant and personalised experiences. You’ll work closely with digital specialists from a range of strategy, creative and technology disciplines. And you’ll provide leadership and direction to more junior team members, whilst building valued partnerships with all your clients and colleagues.

At AKQA, you’ll work in a meritocratic culture surrounded by some of the brightest minds in their fields. You’ll have the opportunity to learn and grow within a creative and technically advanced team, with access to ongoing personal and professional development. At AKQA, we’re committed to your career growth, as well as your work/life balance.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Build a strong understanding of your clients’ business challenges and goals.
Take a proactive approach to problem-solving, developing hypotheses and actionable insights from data sets related to everything from eCommerce shopping carts to online video.
Prepare reports and create dashboards which give our clients information and insight into their business’ performance.
Collaborate with technical engineers to integrate data platforms together.
Design, deploy, analyse and optimise A/B and multivariate tests.
Configure and deploy website tagging and analytics tools for site implementations, including custom events, variables and dimensions.
Prepare presentations and present to senior-level clients, combining your ability to generate insights with your data manipulation and visualisation skills.
Mentor team members and enhance the growth and reputation of AKQA and our Insights & Personalisation team.


SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:

Experience with Adobe Analytics is a must.
Experience with Google Analytics is a must.
Experience with Adobe Experience Cloud products such as Target, Audience Manager and Tag Manager desired.
Understanding of campaign tracking.
Experience with Google Tag Manager and wider Google 360 suite desired.
Ability to write basic code for data manipulation.
High proficiency in MS Excel.
Experience with Tableau or Power BI is highly regarded.
Strong communication skills, enabling you to present insights with confidence and ‘tell a story’ with data.
Enthusiastic, solution-focused attitude, with the determination to find the best outcome for all projects.


AKQA is an Equal Opportunities Employer, we believe that diversity is vital to AKQA's ability to provide our clients with the best recommendations and are committed to fostering a varied and inclusive work environment. Your race, colour, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability or veteran status have no bearing on our hiring decisions. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.
title: Senior Data Analyst

description:
The function of the Data Analyst is to collect relevant Operational and KPI information on a regular basis and present results. You will present your findings from the analysis of the data in the form of graphs, charts, diagrams, tables and reports and distribute the relevant information to the project team and management to ensure continual improvement of contract performance. The Data Analyst is required to identify trends and create models to predict what might happen in the future. This role will be for a two month period with the possibility of extension.

Responsibilities

Interpret data, analyse results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports

Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimise statistical efficiency and data quality

Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems

Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets

Filter and "clean" data, and review computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems

Work closely with management to prioritise business and information needs

Locate and define new process improvement opportunities

Skills

Strong numerate and analytical skills and able to undertake non-traditional analytical tasks

Working knowledge of industry reporting standards

Ability to work accurately and achieve operational goals under the pressure of tight deadlines.

Ability to prepare useful reports for the business using the given data

Ability to diagnose problems and take action to resolve system issues

Capability to identify, develop and implement new systems

Superior communication capabilities with the ability to inform, negotiate and influence

Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques

Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (e.g. Tableau etc), databases (e.g. SQL etc), and preferably programming/scripting experience (XML, JavaScript, or PHP)

Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analysing large datasets

Qualifications

Graduate qualifications in accounting/business/commerce/Computer Science with post grad qualifications an advantage

QLD Licence- LHL-02514-D2P2F
title: Data Analyst

description:
The company:
A multinational financial services organisation
The role:
Develop, midify and run SAS code, generating business and regulatory reporting as required. Duties include:
Write and/or modify and/or execute SAS code
Document and update policies and procedures confirming regulatory compliance
Contribute to the completion of ad-hoc MIS and data analysis using SAS and Excel
Monitor, document and raise the profile of data integrity issues, and manage the process of addressing these to completion
The opportunity:
Work for a global financial services organisation
Work with talented and experienced colleagues
10 Month Contract with the possibility of extensions
About you:
You will have at least 2 years' experience in SAS and/or SQL programming, as well as degree in Mathematics or Statistics related discipline.
Essential skills and experience:
Strong working knowledge of MS Excel
Strong data manipulation skills
Strong analytical skills
Desirable (but not essential) skills and experience:
Financial Services experience
Start date is as soon as possible.
title: Risk / Data Analyst (SQL / SAS)

description:
TNT Express is one of the world's leading providers of business-to-business express delivery services. We are dedicated to offering a positive and vibrant working environment while providing our employees with training that will unlock their full potential and create pathways for career advancement.
Working within a team of analyst and reporting to the Business Control Manager, we are seeking a Finance Business Analyst on a 12-month fixed-term contract who can improve our level of commercial analysis for the TNT Regional Express Business.

This is a true business partnering role and an excellent opportunity to drive strategic opportunities while influencing key stakeholders across our organisation by providing reporting & analysis of financial management information and improving business performance at both a local and group head office level.
About the role
Preparation of the weekly and monthly P&L process.
Assist improving the quality and reducing process time of weekly and monthly P&L
Support general manager through the budgeting and forecasting process – working closely with functional directors to ensure all group requirements are met.
Analyse and understand the drivers of the business, KPI’s, and trends within revenues and costs
Write commentary on business performance and help stakeholders improve business performance
Assist in the forecasting and budgeting process and provide support to strategic planning exercises
Support and assist with Finance and cross-functional projects ranging from training needs to finance system reviews
Ensure accuracy, timeliness and relevance of all local and overseas reporting.
Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders within and outside Finance
Assist in the support and development and implementation of business intelligence systems
Support LEAN initiatives in the business by providing insightful financial analysis.
About you
Experience in developing business-partnering relationships with Business Managers and supporting non-finance Management requirements
Degree qualified within business, economics or accounting
CA/CPA qualified or working towards this
SAP experience is an advantage but not essential
Strong experience in application and utilisation of systems and reporting tools including Excel, Access and Cognos TM1
The ability to demonstrate key stakeholder management skills up to Director level
Knowledge of the transport industry is an advantage but not essential
What we can offer you
The opportunity to be a part of a global industry leader within the transport industry
Work within a supportive and collaborative team environment
Fantastic career development opportunities with on-going training and support
Special employee discounts such as health insurance, gym memberships, travel and more
Located 100m from Mascot train station
If you have the above skills and are looking for an exciting and rewarding career, apply today. We look forward to hearing from you.
title: Business Analyst

description:
You will be responsible for conducting detailed analyses of current state operations that will inform the design of an Operating Model while also identifying process, technology, people, business and service partners needs. The position will also design and implement a Dashboard, suite of operational performance reports (e.g. call centre, administration, process exception, people and financial) and a benefits realisation tool that will support the program as it delivers innovative and transformative enterprise solutions.

We will trust you to:
Conduct detailed analyses (via desktop / primary research) and record findings using the Depatments approach and tools in order to report findings, share insights within the team and stakeholder groups and recommend enterprise solutions.
Research, devise and implement a ashboardd in order to support the group in transforming its operations.
Define service readiness in terms of process, system, data, people and service partners to ensure leaders are informed and have information to make decisions to be ready to accept and operate new solutions.
Support the delivery of service readiness reporting process, analytics, and implementation and reporting for the duration of pre and post go live.
Support operational performance reporting for call centre, administration, process exception, people and financial (revenue and cost) in order to ensure effective business activity.
Contribute to high-level risk identification, design modelling (across all elements of development and design and benefits reporting in order to support the maturation.
Use the products of detailed analyses to devise and implement a range of enterprise solutions that will support the transformation of the Program.
What we are looking for:
Degree in relevant discipline or equivalent skills, knowledge and experience.
Advanced Excel and/or Access skills to develop logical data tables; macros to automate routine tasks; statistical, mathematical and logical formulas to enrich data; and pivot tables, graphs, Qualtrics or other to present data.
Advanced PowerPoint skills combined with experience in reporting and analytics.
Ability to address and meet focus capabilities as stated in the Position Description.
You need to have:

The ability to work legally in Australia without visa sponsorship now or in the future.

If this sounds like you:

Apply! If we believe you're a good match, we'll get in touch with you to let you know the next steps.

Infopeople - Rajaa Nour

description:
FinXL IT Professional Services is an established innovative Australian company providing technology enabled business solutions and consulting services across a number of industries including Telecommunications, Commercial, Government and Finance.
In Queensland our growth continues, especially in our managed service practice and as a result we have a new roles available in our team.

We’re seeking experienced Data Analysts to support Data Migration and Data Quality activities.
You will be responsible for:

Profiling customer base to establish appropriate migration cohorts
Dimension migration scenarios to support migration treatment decisions
Development of data quality processes for profiling and remediation
Analysing customer transactional behaviour to establish likely migration profiles.
We’re looking for Data Analysts that meet the following criteria:

Proven experience in data analysis
Advanced skills in SQL, Hive, Spark and other associated Big Data technologies (Primary analytics environment is Hortonworks stack)
Knowledge of data quality improvement processes
Proven ability to rapidly acquire new skills
Experience working in an Agile team environment
Strong communication skills.
In return you'll be joining a supportive team based in Brisbane and also be a part of a consulting workforce of more than 1000 professionals Australia wide. To succeed in this role you'll be passionate about technology and the differences we can deliver for our customers and their stakeholders.

We encourage you to take the next step in your career by applying now.

description:
About the Company

This large ASX sits within a dynamic and growing industry. Based in the inner CBD this organisation is looking for an experienced, motivated and passionate commercial analyst/ management accountant to join their team. Partnering with the business this role will see you work closely with both internal and external stakeholders and directly contribute to the performance of the business operations.


About the Role

Working within a close knit team, on a daily basis your role will be responsible for:

Performing analysis on financial data to provide business insights into operation and performance
In this role you will be required to work with both internal and external stakeholders, at all levels across the business to analyse and present financial data on business performance.


About You

The successful individual will be a self-motivated CA/CPA qualified accountant with 3 to 5 years’ experience in a management accountant/ business partnering role. As someone who possesses highly developed commercial acumen and want to make the move to a more strategic role.


You will have a proven skills in developing business strategies and working in an operationally focused team. As an outstanding communicator, you will be seeking an opportunity to utilise your finance skills to influence strategic business decisions. Experience within the travel or airline industry will be highly regarded.


The Benefits

Competitive salary - up to $75K including super

Organisational culture second to none

description:
This Globally recognised innovative software businesses who has consecutively been awarded as one of Australia's top places to work is in search for a Data Analyst with experience in Salesforce to join their team.

This business are fast becoming a dominant player in the Australian market. Their state of the art cloud based accounting software is revolutionising the financial lives of millions of small to medium sized businesses owners and as a result with the growth in all teams they need additional Data support.

Supporting the team of 100 you will work within a team of 5 analysts producing reports and solutions on how to better the businesses use of Data. This position will require strong stakeholder management skills as you will interpret data and educate wider teams on how to utilise this to their advantage.

Your role will be to:
Run weekly reports, from multiple data sources, doing manual data manipulation using formulas/macros (combining/sorting/filtering)
Conduct data analysis and root cause assessment
Oversee data quality in Salesforce – from leads, opportunities, accounts, territory assignments, ownerships, hierarchy etc; and train the sales team as required
Perform manual data manipulation – identify data discrepancies, manually resolve bad data, determine patterns and make mass data updates to Salesforce
Perform list uploads into Salesforce for target campaigns
To be considered for this position you will have:
Expert Excel skills
Experience in the use of Salesforce (Certified Salesforce administrator is desirable)
Proven experience of analysing data with the ability to pull out insights and information that are meaningful to business leaders
Experience with QlikView would be advantageous
Working understanding of relational databases
Only Permanent Residents will be considered for this Contract opportunity

Click 'Apply' below to submit your resume for an immediate interview..

description:
Seeking a Strong Master Data Analyst to support all aspects of the master data management – including the identification, collation and cleansing of master data from a multitude of sources.

Strong experience working as a Master Data Analyst with SAP EAM or equivalent Asset Management module

Extensive experience in master data management of enterprise assets of construction industry or similar
Experience in identifying master data source, consolidation, normalisation, error detection & correction, distribution, classification, enrichment and governance

Ability to perform data migration tasks and assist data owners in filed mapping, value mapping and data construction
Ability to define data standards and create and load sample data set and ability to develop master data management plan and on-going maintenance procedures
Understand complete data migration cycle and ability to work on Test, Dress Rehearsal and Go-Live phases

description:
The Role: The Project Management Office (PMO) at Mercer is responsible for the implementation of in-house and revenue-generating projects. The role of all members of the Analyst Practice within the PMO is to be responsible for delivering successful project outcomes.

Key Responsibilities: As the Superannuation Business Analyst, you will be responsible for the following:
Performing planning activities to determine the best approach and techniques on the project
Analyse requirements, solution analysis and estimate of effort for detailed quotes within the analysts expertise
Prepare functional and technical specifications, including mapping for all registry and ancillary systems
Manage the provision of information to establish the agreed data integration platform, liaising with the Data Analyst and external stakeholders where required
Validation of system and application changes, including benefit replication and bulk reconciliation to enable signoff on benefits
About You: To be successful in this role, you will ideally have:
Experience in System integration planning and monitoring particularly in the superannuation industry is essential
Demonstrate an understanding of the organization’s nuances and how to get things done
Superior verbal and written communication, and interpersonal skills with the ability to influence outcomes at all levels within the team
About Mercer:
At Mercer, we make a difference in the lives of more than 110 million people every day by advancing their health, wealth, and careers. We’re in the business of creating more secure and rewarding futures for our clients and their employees — whether we’re designing affordable health plans, assuring income for retirement or aligning workers with workforce needs. Using analysis and insights as catalysts for change, we anticipate and understand the individual impact of business decisions, now and in the future. We see people’s current and future needs through a lens of innovation, and our holistic view, specialized expertise, and deep analytical rigor underpin each and every idea and solution we offer. For more than 70 years, we’ve turned our insights into actions, enabling people around the globe to live, work, and retire well. At Mercer, we say we Make Tomorrow, Today.

If you think you meet these requirements and you are inspired to join a dynamic and international organization, we look forward to your application letter and resume. Please note should your resume be shortlisted, you will receive a link from HireVue to complete a digital video interview as part of the recruitment process. We hope you enjoy the process and look forward to viewing your interview very soon.

Applications will only be accepted from candidates who have the appropriate approval to work in Australia. Successful applicants will be required to complete a Criminal & Bankruptcy check prior to commencement of employment.

Mercer is an equal opportunity employer committed to embracing a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people regardless of their sex (including intersex), marital/parental status, ethnic origin, nationality, age, background, disability, sexual orientation and gender identity.
title: Superannuation Business Analyst

description:
Interesting and varied role within a reputable global ASX brand

Excellent career progression - First class learning & development offerings

About Our Client
With over 10,000 employees around the world, our client is an ASX Top 100 company with an impressive Brisbane head office. Known for offering first class training and development, this is an employer of choice that leads through a culture built upon teamwork and innovation.

In this role, you will be pulling out data from various sources to do your modelling and be able to communicate that information back to managers in the business and support the identification of operational and cost efficiencies. Working with other skilled Accountants/Analysts and Data Warehousing subject matter experts, this is an excellent opportunity for a switched on individual to grow your career within an iconic global brand.

Job Description
Reporting to the Commercial Finance Leader, some of your key responsibilities will include:

Preparation of monthly management reporting;
Financial analysis and modelling of income streams;
Assist with global budgets and forecasts;
Identify continuous improvements within operations/systems/procedures;
Ad hoc analysis and projects.
The Successful Applicant
To be considered for this opportunity, you would have a relevant Bachelor degree (Accounting or related) and are CA/CPA qualified (or working towards). Prior experience in a similar type role/company will be highly regarded (Travel/Airlines will be useful). title: Business Analyst -Human Resources

description:
MTP Services is seeking two experienced Business Analyst's for the HR Systems Project and Integrated Response Project for a leading government client.
This is an exciting opportunity to work in a great team environment on an emergency management, geospatial, incident and response capability or Human Resources project.


HR role
The scope of the role for this FY is to be responsible for analysing and assessing business processes and systems (current and future), gathering and documenting business requirements. The role will also require assisting in documenting a market approach of the future incident and emergency response capability. The successful candidate will work closely with the IT Project Manager, Architecture Team and Business to define the current and future business processes and requirements. This is an exciting opportunity to work within a great team environment on an emergency management, geospatial, incident and response capability project.

Emergency/ Incident Managment Role
The project scope is to review and replace HR Systems within the entire HR domain which may include Core HR and Payroll, Recruitment, Learning Management, Performance Management and Rostering. You will work closely with the Project Team and Business to update and finalise the detailed requirements (currently 90% complete). You will assist the business to understand the new technologies, business process change and support them through implementation. A large amount of work will be understanding the new systems and assisting the Business to make the transition. You will need to undertake a requirements traceability matrix exercise, assist in developing training material and reviewing test cases. This role isn't purely just requirements gathering. The successful candidate will work closely with the IT Project Manager, Data Analyst and Business to define the current and future business processes and requirements. This is an exciting opportunity to work within a great team environment on a full HR domain implementation spanning multiple years.

What will the specialist do?
Develop, analyse and document current and future business process and requirements
Actively engage stakeholders to ensure the business requirements are accurately captured and that stakeholders are fully informed and engaged;
Communicate with SME's to define the needs based on an understanding of business, information and technical constraints;
Identify and engage relevant stakeholders and setup/facilitate relevant workshops;
Support the rollout of new tools and systems to nationwide teams including delivery of standard operating procedures, workflow diagrams, test scripts, training materials and post-launch support resources;
Develop market approach documentation in alignment with government processes.

MTP Services Pty Ltd provides IT Contracting and Professional Services to the Canberra Market. Join a talented team and work in a culture that fosters an inclusive and flexible work environment, offering opportunities to grow and contribute to the company.

If you have any questions please contact Sally Dixon from MTP Services on 6154 5424, or via email sally.dixon@mtpservices.com.au

Apply now for more info!

description:
Haven’t heard of us? Let me surprise you! Top 200 ASX listed company, revenue 400M+, and you see our products every day - that’s just the start!
Water is the world’s most precious resource. At GWA we are doing our part to help the planet by ensuring that water saving is fundamental to the beautiful products we design and craft for use in all Australian bathrooms and kitchens. Our iconic Australian brands Caroma, Dorf and Clark position GWA as market leaders, while our history and commitment to innovation, in all its forms, will continue to sustain and enhance this leadership position. As we invest behind these lifestyle brands through transformational consumer engagement platforms, we are also executing fundamental change to the way we both engage and sell to our customers. What does this mean for you? lots of opportunity!
Come join us on our journey to help save the planet.
Requirements
We’re in the middle of an exciting evolution, it’s fast paced and dynamic, so we need an Commercial Analyst that’s focused on being a dedicated business partner to Senior Managers and Leaders within our Sales & Marketing teams. You will have input into the business performance and day to day business activities.
Sales reporting and analysis
Price / margin analysis
Trend, customer and product reporting
Profitability analysis
Preparation of business cases and process improvement initiatives
Preparation of budgets, forecasts and management reporting
Assisting with growth projects and adhoc analysis
ABOUT YOU
CP/CPA qualified or close to completion
Strong business partnering will be the main focus although it would be advantageous if you have worked in a fast paced environment such as retail or FMCG
Minimum 5 years’ experience partnering with either marketing sales or supply chain
Commercial mindset
Strong attention to detail with the ability to liaise with business influence stakeholders
Benefits
GWA can offer flexible working options, corporate health care and discounts, paid parental leave, education assistance, and volunteer and community opportunities. If you are excited by an ASX-listed organisation, strong growth results, and the opportunity to directly impact our transformation from consumer goods to a lifestyle brand, please apply now.

description:
1Cover is simply a great place to work. Why? We are a leading international travel insurance provider with operations in Australia, New Zealand and the UK. Our key philosophy is that our customers and employees are the most important people in our company. At 1Cover we believe you should explore the world and return home safely. That is why we provide all travellers with travel insurance they can count on. We are a travel insurance brand unlike any other, we are quirky, fun, and charismatic.

At present, we need a Junior Business Analyst to support our growth. The Junior Business Analyst will act as a pivotal link between the business units and IT, ensuring that business requirements are understood, documented and correctly articulated in order to plan and build the relevant solution.

What we will expect you to do:

 The Junior Business Analyst will be expected to take ownership of the delivery. From chasing requirements, to follow up on the development, unblocking developers’ road blocks, seek business sign off and finally ensure the deployment to production and test.

Other activities are, conducting detailed investigations, identifying issues & risks, documenting the findings and facilitate meetings with key stakeholders to manage expectations.

Here's what we are looking for in candidates for this job:

1-2 years Business analysis experience in a technology focused environment.
Experience with Agile methodologies and tools (such as JIRA/Confluence)
Understanding of the SDLC – especially delivering Web based projects
Basic Knowledge of HTML and be able to use the Browser’s Developer tools.
Ability to work autonomously and being able to multitask across various projects
Motivated, eager and able to use initiative to get the job done
Confident in dealing with executives, technical teams and vendors
Superior analytical, conceptual and problem-solving skills
Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills
If you have drive, charisma and a passion for software development and want to work for a company that provides unparalleled career opportunities - then you must look no further. Apply for this job today!

description:
4mation Technologies are seeking a talented and enthusiastic Business Analyst to join our ranks. The role will sit within a cross-functional agile development team and report direct to one of our Tribe Leads (ie team lead).

The opportunity provides exposure to a broad range of technologies, as we produce high-quality solutions for our various clients across multiple industries. The right candidate will enjoy working in a fast-paced agency environment while living and breathing the Agile Mindset.

As a business analyst in the team, you will take the lead role in gathering business & user requirements from the necessary parties, documenting these requirements into specifications, user stories and acceptance criteria. You will work as a fundamental part of the development team, seated with the developers you will ensure the team understands the who, what, and why of the project and ensure that deliverables achieve sprint goals and meet quality expectations.
Facilitate workshops, interviews, focus group sessions
Gather business, and application requirements
Produce user stories and acceptance criteria
Identify project risks and risk mitigation strategies
Maintain high level schedules of all projects
Work with your team’s UX Designer on how best to move the needle on key metrics

Essential Skills
Proven ability to gather, model and document business and functional requirements
Experience in creating specifications expressed as user stories, use cases, contextual and visual diagrams and technical scopes
Experience working in a client facing environment
Experience delivering projects on time and budget
Must have full-time working rights in Australia
Experience in a Scrum Master role, and/or fundamental understanding of Agile principles and ceremonies would be highly regarded for this position.

About us
Recognised as one of Australia's top 100 tech companies to watch in 2018, 4mation is on the rise! Since our foundation in 2001, we have grown to a team of over 70 of the brightest minds in the industry. 4mation is dedicated to producing solutions that people love to use and count amongst its clients some of the country’s biggest companies and a generous helping of the most exciting and innovative start-ups.

While the work we do at 4mation is reward enough, we also don’t mind showing off some of our trinkets, like winning Best Overall Company at the Business Excellence Awards 2017 and consistently ranking among Australia's Best Places to Work, alongside companies such as Atlassian, SalesForce and Canva.

We're located in the social hub of Surry Hills, convenient to Central Station along with plenty of popular pubs, cafes and restaurants. Our office environment is alive with fun and excitement. We enjoy a pool table, ping-pong, all current generation consoles, regular parties to celebrate our wins (and commiserate our losses!)

You can learn more about working with us here: https://careers.4mation.com.au/why-4mation/

Salary Range: $70-100k
title: Business Analyst

description:
Efficient business analysis and elicitation techniques
Maintain relationships with internal and external stakeholders
Join an organisation that invests in your career

About The Role
Role Location: 347 Kent Street, Sydney NSW 2000
Role Type: Permanent (40 hours per week)

As Business Analyst, you will work with project stakeholders to analyse and synthesise information, understand the organisational context and complete business analysis activities, and ultimately elicit, document and manage the requirements throughout the project or program end to end, and other analysis activities such as testing, process mapping and change transition. Working within the stakeholder engagement framework for the project, you will communicate these requirements to key stakeholders to ensure a clear understanding of the project’s or program’s objectives and benefits.

About You

About ANZ
At ANZ, everything we do boils down to ‘why’ – our purpose – to shape a world where people and communities thrive. We're just as focused on seeing our people thrive as well as our customers. We'll give you every opportunity to develop your career.

We are responding faster to changing customer requirements, focusing on the things that matter the most, energising our people, eliminating waste and reducing bureaucracy.

A happy workplace is a thriving one. So in order to attract and keep the best talent, and say thanks for the hard work, we make sure all our employees are rewarded.

ANZ recognises the value of an inclusive and diverse work environment. We take pride in the diversity of our people and encourage applications from diverse candidates. description:
IT Business Analyst-SYD000795
Flexible work options - work smarter in a way that suits your lifestyle.
18 weeks paid parental leave (for mums, dads & foster carers), with no minimum service
Work with a great team with like-minded individuals who want to advance their skills and career

Join PwC's Digital Technology Services, Platform Operations team as a Cloud Engineer and help build and operate the automation subsystems that power numerous applications across multiple cloud platforms.

The Opportunity
At PwC, we help Australian businesses, not-for-profits and governments create value and improve the way they work. From improving healthcare, to creating smarter cities and igniting Australia’s start up industry, you’ll build trust in society and solve important problems.

The Digital Technology Services team bring this to life by empowering people with the platforms, tools, and competencies to lead themselves, our people, and the market, in a world of continued significant digital disruption.

As the Business Analyst your impact will be focused more on operational release items as well as providing overall administrative support for the day to day BA activities. With a core focus on agile delivery to our clients there is a requirement to maintain a strong relationship with other DigiTech SDLC teams (being the Test, Development and Release Teams).

Success does stem from a positive attitude, hard work and going the extra mile, but that’s not all!

You will:

Lead the development and documentation of minor release and hotfix related initiatives such as enhancement solution designs and software fix solutions.
Communicate with the DigiTech development team to gather inputs and analyse end user requirements
Support the DigiTech Release team in the delivery of quality release deliverables
Lead enhancement/issue solution functional testing
Assist DigiTech Testing team with the creation and execution of test cases
Communicate with the client on any clarification of requirements and deliverable timelines
Contribute knowledge to support release go-live activities

About you
The brief is simple...

You have a solid background in the Application Development space and are capable of providing solutions in an Agile environment. You’re passionate about technology and delivering quality and value to your clients. You thrive in a collaborative and innovative culture and want to join a firm that values problem solvers, the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and key stakeholders.

The key behaviours of this role will include but not be limited to:
Strong ability and comfort in working in an agile and fast paced environment
Ability to work independently with a strong sense of initiative
A proactive approach to problem resolution
Professionalism – professional approach to the role and to handle confidentiality in line with the firm’s guidelines
Drive and enthusiasm – energetic and passionate about the firm and the role
Interpersonal and influencing skills- establish and maintain relationships with both internal and external stakeholders
Demonstrate commitment to team and self-development - set high standards of performance, sponsor and influence knowledge and capabilities growth of self and others on a continual basis
Willingness to work flexible hours when necessary

Sound like you? Read on.

What we offer
Working for Australia’s largest professional services firm you’ll join a global network spanning 157 countries that delivers meaningful outcomes for a wide range of clients.

Our culture and benefits are why we’re LinkedIn’s number one Australian workplace. With state of the art offices and premium technology, each person has access to flexible work options. The dress policy is flexible too – you choose what you wear based on the work you do with your team and clients.

Fostering an inclusive culture and embracing differences is at the core of everything we do. PwC empowers you to be yourself and work with people from many backgrounds to achieve things never thought possible. Get involved in our employee-led diversity networks (cultural, disability, LGBTI or gender equality) and benefit from our best-in-class policies such as 18 weeks maternity/paternity leave, flexible work and gender equity.

Up for a challenge? We’re committed to helping our people unleash their potential. Hard work doesn’t go unrewarded and industry best coaching, mentoring, training and development are ready and waiting. If you hold a genuine desire to make a difference and want to surround yourself with like-minded, talented and driven individuals who strive to do the same, apply now.

PwC is committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce. Our Reconciliation Action Plan sets out our commitment to increase Indigenous employment. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Australians.

Sam Thomas is the Recruitment Manager for the role. As the team experience high volumes of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all.

Job Support
Primary Location Sydney
Job Type Full-time
title: IT Business Analyst

description:
About the company

Donesafe is Australia’s fastest growing cloud workplace health, safety and compliance platform. Known as “The People’s Safety Software”, Donesafe is built with the user in mind and is designed to ease the administrative burden and cost of WHS management. Donesafe, by making WHS management easier and more efficient, creates a safer, happier workforce. With over 1,000,000 + users ranging from sole trader businesses to Global 500 and ASX 50 companies, Donesafe is one of the fastest growing startups in Australia.
About the role

You will be a highly competent Business Analyst who has excellent communication skills and an affinity with technology. Ideally you will come from a testing or development background and be comfortable engaging clients to extract business workflow for safety systems and configure them into the company’s platform. Experience in handling web based technologies and exposure to agile product development environments would be preferred.
Other requirements include:
Comprehensive customer-centric Business Analysis work
Analyse, recommend, and improve complex business workflow
Working with development teams on web-based projects
An ability to translate business needs into technical requirements
A hands-on, can-do approach and the willingness to go above and beyond
Communicate to internal and external stakeholders like management, architects and developers
Experience working multiple and parallel projects
Write reports, process documentation, procedures, and comprehensive recommendations
Familiarity with preparing requirement analysis and documentation
Excellent problem solving skills and attention to detail
Requirements
Your technical and interpersonal skills are equally paramount. You must be highly effective when it comes to both written and verbal communication. You should be looking for an organisation where you can make an impact and benefit from seeing the fruits or your labour. This is a 'technical' BA role, you need to be strong when it comes to SQL analysis, business process analysis and platform/system configuration - as well as having the soft skills necessary to make you effective.
Your experience and skills should include most, if not all:
Confidence in engaging with and managing client interactions at all levels.
Demonstrated experience with workshop facilitation, process analysis and documentation.
Work on SaaS Cloud Implementation, System Integration and Business System Analysis.
Experience working in a small team as a conduit between technology and the business.
Not required but good to have WHS business process experience.
In addition you will likely have an IT degree or other relevant technical/project/delivery qualifications. The role also requires the ability to prioritise your work and excellent written communication skills.

Write reports, process documentation, procedures, and comprehensive recommendations
Familiarity with preparing requirement analysis and documentation
Excellent problem solving skills and attention to detail
Benefits
The Donesafe team love coming to work in our awesome office in WeWork Pyrmont and that’s not just because of the building. Being a startup, our workers have the freedom to work together and autonomously. The Donesafe team are enthusiastic, resourceful and honest. The thing that brings us to work every day is the firmly held belief that we’re making a serious difference in the WHS space and by proxy, a positive difference in the lives of everyday workers. Also, a dollop of geekiness will not be out of place at Donesafe.
Autonomy and support in your day to day activities.
Become part of a fast-growing team and make your mark
Work in funky offices with break-out spaces and some great perks including an in-house bar all in the heart of Pyrmont, Sydney
Work with a fun, friendly team of like minded people
Great salary package with a focus on work-life balance

Sydney CBD based

title: Senior Business Analyst

description:
Job posted:
22/10/2018
Applications close:
01/11/2018 (Midnight) 10 days remaining






Today
Job Description
About Us

Western Health manages three acute public hospitals: Footscray, Sunshine and Williamstown Hospital. It also operates the Sunbury Day Hospital, Transition Care at Hazeldean and a range of community based services along with a large Drug and Alcohol Service. We care for a culturally diverse population of more than 800,000 people. We have more than 6,700 employees who are driven by our values of ‘Compassion, Accountability, Respect, Excellence and Safety’ (CARES).

Our continued growth will see the completion of a new purpose built, multi-storey Joan Kirner Women's and Children's Hospital.

About the Role

An exciting opportunity for a Business Analyst is available within the Financial Planning & Analysis team at Western Health. This position is based at the Sunshine and Footscray Hospital.

Reporting to the Manager of Financial Planning & Analysis, you will provide business planning, performance reporting and financial analysis services to support key stakeholders across various business units within the organisation. Specifically to understand business needs, assessing the financial impact of operational initiatives, capturing, analysing and documenting requirements and then supporting the communication and delivery of those requirements with relevant parties.

Your excellent verbal and written communication skills will enable you to effectively present business ideas, financial data and performance analysis to a wide range of audiences. Your superior stakeholder management and interpersonal skills will allow you to work seamlessly with the finance team, operation mangers, divisional directors and executive directors of WH. You must have extensive knowledge of business management including budget development, forecasting, costing, analysis, and reporting. Your positive, and “can do” attitude will ensure you are well fit into the energetic and productive FP&A team.

Essential Criteria

To meet the requirements of the role you must hold tertiary qualifications in accounting, commerce or other finance disciplines with CPA or CA designation preferred. Experience at senior levels within health services would be an advantage but not necessary.

Benefits

Work-life balance
Professional development and career advancement opportunities
Salary packaging including novated vehicle leasing
Onsite fitness clubs
Culturally safe and respectful environment
Access to an Employee Assistance Program

Culture

At Western Health, we value our employees and provide them the opportunity to grow and develop. Our teams are friendly and supportive, ensuring we deliver a safe, person-centred and connected patient experience. Western Health is an equal opportunity employer committed to attracting and retaining diversity in our workforce. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

Agency enquiry is not required at this stage

All appointments are made subject to a satisfactory Police Record Check, an Immunisation status clearance and (if applicable) a working with children’s check.

description:

description:
We are currently seeking a motivated and dynamic Technical Business Analyst to join our Sydney team. Reporting to the Delivery Manager, you will be an integral team member. You will be working closely with developers, UX specialists, managers, and clients in an Agile environment. You will be responsible for analysis, assessment and clarification of client business requirements, turning these requirements into clear understandable backlog for developers to work from.

Key responsibilities include:
Engaging and liaising with clients and internal stakeholders to develop, interpret and understand client business requirements

Educate clients on agile procedure and process to ensure efficiency of software development

Identify and engage with key business stakeholders and building ongoing stakeholder relationships

Provides regular status updates on project changes whilst working closely with the Delivery Manager and stakeholders

Identify opportunities for improving business processes. This will include working with the Delivery Manager and business stakeholders

Conduct change impact analysis to assess the potential implications of changes and document business rules, functions and requirements.

This is an excellent opportunity to become an integral member of a progressive international company. As the successful applicant, you will be provided with on the job training and be well supported with career path planning and regular performance and development reviews. You will receive a competitive remuneration package including many first-rate benefits such as health insurance, life and income protection insurance and subsidised broadband.
View Position Description Here
About You

As the successful candidate, you will ideally possess:
Minimum 2-3 years' experience as a Business Analyst with a solid understanding of agile development process

Extensive experience with requirements gathering

A strong understanding of user stories and experience writing these

Ability to facilitate and run workshops to develop and understand business requirements with confidence

Experience working closely with development teams facilitating their development activities and evolving requirements based on developer feedback

Ability to work to schedules to keep a steady flow of work ready for development team

Documentation and project reporting skills

Excellent written and verbal communications skills

You will be:
Self-motivated

An engaged and active team member of an established team

Cooperative and team focussed

Organised and can work and prioritise time independently

Excellent at communicating (written and verbal)

Fun to work with while working towards delivering outcomes

Working with other stakeholders such as: BAs, Experience Designers, PMs, Developers, Account Managers.

description:
Job Role

The requirement is for an experienced Business Analyst who will assist in the development of system requirements, technical design and engagement of key business and ICT stakeholders.

Provide technical advice and design options to ensure the best use of existing technologies to meet the above business requirements.
Evaluate existing technical implementations to understand existing functionality.
Develop and document detailed technical designs in the form of user specifications and technical specifications.
Work closely with technical staff to ensure that technical implementation is aligned with agreed designs and business requirements.
Work on the Resource and Demand Management (RDM) tool which has been developed on a Microsoft stack (SQL database, SharePoint and Project Professional UI all running on Windows server). The enterprise Project Management tool set which is built off the following Microsoft stack:
MPS 2013/16
Microsoft Project Professional
Microsoft SharePoint
Microsoft SQL Server
Microsoft Project Web App (PWA)

Mandatory Criteria


Demonstrated high level experience as Business or System Analyst in large and complex, enterprise environments (preferably with Federal Government organisations).
Previous experience designing and implementing new applications within a large organisation.

Weighted Criteria


Previous experience in working with an Australian Government Department.
Demonstrated ability to write technical specifications and design documents.
Previous experience engaging various business and ICT stakeholders through various channels such as workshops and meetings.
Previous experience in user interface (UI) design
At least 5 years’ experience as a Business Analyst or Systems Analyst.

Canberra, ACT, Australia

description:
Are you ready to be a part of a high performing team?
Work with a company that values collaboration and diversity
Contribute to the growth of a thriving community

About The Role
Role Location: 347 Kent Street Sydney NSW
Contract Duration: 10 months

As a Project Business Analyst, you will be working in an emerging Agile environment on ATO Superannuation Compliance projects. The role may be embedded in a Squad, or may be outside the squad feeding requirements into the Squad. In this role, you will analyse and synthesise information, understand the organisational context and complete business analysis activities, and ultimately elicit and document using User Stories.

You will also be involved in other activities such as testing, process mapping, operational support artefacts and change transition. Moreover, you will be responsible in communicating these requirements to key stakeholders to ensure a clear understanding of the project’s or program’s objectives and benefit.

About You
To be successful in this role, you must possess the following:
Relevant experience in Change Management Activities
Knowledge in different project methodologies including Agile, ideally in a Wealth environment, Superannuation and Insurance
Experience in writing user stories and business documentation
Strong stakeholder management skills, with the ability to influence and negotiate with stakeholders of all levels
Strong presentation and communication skills
About ANZ
At ANZ, everything we do boils down to ‘why’ – our purpose – to shape a world where people and communities thrive. We're just as focused on seeing our people thrive as well as our customers. We'll give you every opportunity to develop your career.

We are responding faster to changing customer requirements, focusing on the things that matter the most, energising our people, eliminating waste and reducing bureaucracy.

A happy workplace is a thriving one. So in order to attract and keep the best talent, and say thanks for the hard work, we make sure all our employees are rewarded.

ANZ recognises the value of an inclusive and diverse work environment. We take pride in the diversity of our people and encourage applications from diverse candidates. Our recruitment decisions are based on the key inherent needs and requirements of each role, and candidates are selected based on their unique strengths and characteristics.

We work flexibly at ANZ. Talk to us and let us know how this role can be flexible for you.

To find out more about working at ANZ or to view other opportunities visit www.anz.com/careers. You may apply for this role by visiting ANZ Careers and search for reference number AUS090475.
