title: Business Analyst

description:
Join our Commodities and Global Market Group and work within our Central business team. Central is dedicated to working with businesses and support areas in our Commodities and Global Markets Group to ensure that businesses operate efficiently and effectively to meet strategic goals. The team helps find solutions for operational, commercial and strategic issues facing the business. We’re seeking a highly skilled Business Analyst bringing an expertise in financial markets. The position is immediately available and for an initial six month maximum term contract.

Utilising your understanding of financial instruments, trading activities and the regulatory requirements that impact on these activities, you’ll take responsibility for:

managing the process of gathering and documenting information from multiple sources
determining the most effective way to structure and represent this information for your stakeholders. You may need to implement an analytical tool, although this is not a key requirement or capability.
As a global business, you will be expected to build your knowledge and understanding of our activities as well as, importantly, our regulatory obligations. Experience in organising, attending or running workshops will be included in your remit, as well as gaining buy-in at all levels to ensure obligations are mapped appropriately.

We believe you will need 4-6 years’ experience from working in financial services, although this contract may suit a legal professional who has covered financial services engagements but now not looking to remain in practice or in a formal legal role.You’ll be driven by working with and analysing material, often unstructured, and turning it into a format and deliverable application as well as be able to demonstrate a strong focus in understanding policy and practical implementation. An important component will also be to build relationships with business teams and Macquarie-wide stakeholders.

With appropriate tertiary qualifications and work experience as noted above, other key attributes will be your project planning and implementation management skills, the ability to analyse issues and find solutions to complex issues, as well as to work independently, yet work to the wider team project deadlines

If you would like to be considered for this opportunity, please apply on line but submitting a covering letter and concise resume as one Word or PDF-formatted document.

For more information, please visit www.macquarie.com/careers

Commodities and Global Markets provides clients with an integrated, end-to-end offering across global markets including equities, fixed income, foreign exchange and commodities.

Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

We facilitate a range of flexible working arrangements within our teams.

Talk to us about what flexibility may be available.

#LI-AT

title: Business Analyst

description:
Job Description:
Summary
Performs complex analyses of business goals, objectives and needs of the general business environment to align information technology solutions with business initiatives for multiple, complex accounts. Serves as a subject matter expert and the liaison between technical personnel and non-technical personnel.
Essential Job Functions
Plans and designs complex business processes and system modifications. Makes recommendations to improve and support business activities.
Gathers business requirements through a variety of techniques such as work sessions and interviews. Analyzes and documents client complex business requirements and processes; communicates these requirements to appropriate parties.
Creates complex test case scenarios to be used in testing; monitors/oversees the testing of business applications to verify that all client requirements are incorporated into the system design.
Provides input into developing and modifying systems to meet client needs. Develops business specifications to support these modifications.
Coordinates and facilitates meetings with clients to gather and document requirements and explore potential solutions.
Coordinates business analyst tasks on information technology projects and provides project team member guidance and support. May plan, allocate and monitor work of other business analysts.
Participates in technical reviews and inspections to verify 'intent of change' is carried through the entire project.
Provides time estimates for project related tasks.
Provides leadership and work guidance to less experienced personnel.
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience
Bachelor's degree in business administration, information systems, or related field preferred
Nine or more years of business analysis experience
Experience working with the interface of information technology with functional groups within an organization
Experience working with business processes and re-engineering
Experience working with computer programming concepts and basic language
Other Qualifications
Strong interpersonal skills to interact with customers and team members
Strong communication skills
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Good presentation skills to present to management and customers
Good leadership skills to coordinate, oversee and lead team/project members
Good personal computer and business solutions software skills
Ability to work in a team environment
Willingness to travel
Work Environment
Office environment
title: Advisor Business Analyst

description:
Business Analyst
Attractive salary package on offer
Based in Huntingwood plenty of on-site parking available
On-site Health & Fitness Centre and On-site Child Care Centre

Business Analyst - 2 years fixed term
Join one of Australia’s largest energy distributors
Attractive salary package on offer
Based in Huntingwood plenty of on-site parking available
On-site Health & Fitness centre and On-site Child Care Centre
We are currently seeking to appoint a Business Analyst within our Business Development Branch.
ABOUT THE COMPANY

We are one of Australia’s largest energy distributors, or ‘poles and wires’ businesses, responsible for the safe and reliable supply of electricity to 2.4 million people in households and businesses across Sydney’s Greater West, the Blue Mountains, the Southern Highlands, the Illawarra and South Coast.

We are 50.4 per cent owned by an Australian-led consortium of long-term investors within the private sector operating the network under a 99 year lease. The remaining 49.6 per cent is held by the NSW Government.

Our customers are central to our plans. We’re committed to delivering better value for customers by reducing our costs, without compromising safety or services

ABOUT THE ROLE

Reporting to the Head of Business Development the role will undertake analysis and present business, investment and strategic opportunities that will create value that drive the strategic direction of the businesses. It will provide complex financial modelling incorporating market and competitor research to make sure Endeavour Energy is a market leader.

ABOUT YOU

You will have a degree in Finance, Accounting, Engineering and or Business and specialised experience working within a corporate, finance advisory or consulting firm. You will have demonstrable experience developing financial models and engaging with a diverse range of stakeholders.

If you are an Analytical thinker, financially astute and excellent in managing multiple priorities and meet the selection criteria mentioned above, please apply now.

OUR DIVERSITY COMMITMENT:

Endeavour Energy is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and we encourage diversity within our organisation.

Diversity and inclusion makes our organisation better, safer, stronger and more competitive.
We are proud of our differences, and are committed to actively shaping our workplace into one that is inclusive and where individual contributions are valued.

Women, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and people with a multicultural background are strongly encouraged to apply.

To find out more, please refer to attached Position Description.

Applications close 5pm on 24 October 2018

 - 00006JEF

Full Time, Temporary up to 24 months, Bathurst, NSW

Spatial Services, a division of the Department of Finance, Service and Innovation, is the key provider of spatial land information services in New South Wales. Spatial Services’ integrated framework connects the people of NSW to a comprehensive package of land and property services including property information, surveying and mapping. Spatial Services' provides land information services to individuals, businesses, government agencies and non-profit organisations throughout NSW, Australia and internationally.

Spatial Services is committed to providing a working environment that values diversity and inclusion, which supports all employees to reach their full potential.

Reporting to the Manager, Strategy and Architecture, you will be responsible for analysing and developing the documents that are aligned with the organisation’s business intentions, services, processes and information needs to identify changes that lead to business improvements or its integration with technology.

To be successful within this role you will need strong communication skills and be able to effectively build relationships with both business and ICT stakeholders; provide advice on technical issues to non-technical audiences; and work with key stakeholders to identify how changing business requirements may be delivered with existing solutions.

To be successful in the position you will have:
Exceptional documentation skills
Exceptional analytic skills with a pragmatic approach focused on business outcomes
Strong attention to detail
Demonstrated communication skills at all organisational levels
Self-starter with good time management and prioritisation skills
Work productively in a fast-paced team environment

title: Business Analyst

description:
Business Analyst

As one of the fastest-growing Fintechs globally (and Australia's fastest-growing), Lendi is a marketing and technology company and mortgages are our product. We're revolutionising the industry with a best-in-class technology platform and suite of tools that takes the hard work out of home loans - for our Customers and Brokers alike.

Due to growth, we're seeking an experienced Business Analyst to undertake an end to end role that will include:

identifying key users and stakeholders;
developing functional requirements;
overseeing end user testing frameworks;
implementation & post-implementation;
project management duties.


What will you be doing?

Working closely with key stakeholders, end users and engineers to translate business needs into tangible and practical solutions

Engaging users in testing – implementing change with a detailed view
Demonstrating proven analytical skills with a 'can do' attitude – we're looking for someone who can propose, document and deliver.


Your skills, attributes & experience:

Demonstrable experience in a similar role working in a fast-paced, rapid growth sales environment
Proven credit decisioning experience within an Australian Financial Institution
Demonstrated experience within mortgages and deal structuring
Demonstrated understanding of project management frameworks (AGILE preferred)
Proven understanding of how mortgage origination works
High levels of commercial acumen, communication skills & proactive in identifying areas for improvement
Driven & motivated, with the ability to inform & influence stakeholders at all levels
High degree of technical experience using CRM systems (Salesforce highly preferred)
Advanced Excel.
To be considered you'll need experience in implementing new systems. You'll be a team worker who enjoys working in a nimble, smaller project team that is very delivery focused. Excellent communication skills are essential, as is the ability to liaise with senior stakeholders.

The opportunity:

This is a chance to join an industry-leading marketing and tech business that will be doubling the size of the operation over the next 12-18 months, and exponential growth thereafter as we continue to expand. As such, the opportunities for career advancement will be significant. As a forward-thinking, entrepreneurial Fintech, we love what we do, and want to take people like you on the journey.

So if you want to be part of the action, apply now and attach a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and why you're the best applicant, and what separates you from your peers.

Apply now to be part of our Australian success story!

description:
As the Lead Business Analyst you will lead a team to deliver initiatives that enhance AGL's omni-channel customer experience while delivering a positive commercial impact.
After a period of successful activity, the Improvements Team are now in creative ideation phase. During this pivotal time your ability to successfully articulate business benefits of the team's developments will be important to your and your team's success. Additionally, you will take end-to-end accountability for overseeing all analysis activities from ideation to delivery.

Your key responsibilities will be to:
Facilitate ideation all the way through to delivery
Perform and manage your own business analysis activities
Support the team and ensure produced BA artefacts are produced in a consistent fashion across the entire team
Provide leadership and support to your team of direct reports
Create Lean Canvases and articulate the benefit metrics that support the business case
To be successful, you'll have:
Demonstrated experience as a Senior or Lead Business Analyst as well as experience in both agile and waterfall methodologies
Multiple instances of proficiently delivering complex, large initiatives end-to-end in an agile environment
Demonstrated experience of lean agile techniques
Exceptional stakeholder management skills with demonstratable strengths in influencing and conflict resolution
Advanced ability to think independently, and diplomatically challenge assumptions
Additional experience as a Team Lead or a formal mentor will also set you apart from the pack

What's in it for you?
You'll be working in an A-grade building with state of the art activity based working facilities. Being supported by our new flexible ways of working. We call it Smarter Working.

You'll get the opportunity to work with some of the most engaged and innovative in the business. Being exposed to more opportunities to advance your skills and career.

Working in a company the size of ours the sky's the limit for your career aspirations and we're focused on investing in you.


About us
It truly is an exciting time to be part of AGL Energy as we lead the way in generating sustainable energy solutions for all Australians.

With a heritage of over 175 years and listed in the top 50 companies on the ASX, AGL offers a genuinely diverse, safe and supportive work environment, where "actions not words" fosters a culture of achievement and personal development.



Come with us on a journey of exploration and creativity, doing the same things differently, better, faster by encompassing innovation and passion for a more sustainable world.
title: Lead Business Analyst - Improvements

description:
The Role & Opportunity
You will be working as a Business Analyst within the IT group of our government client, delivering key business analysis activities (including documentation) and preparation of business cases for a number of IT related initiatives.

Key Deliverables:
This business analyst role will lead the end-to-end business analysis of the initiatives based on our client’s Business Analysis Framework. This BA framework requires business analysts to perform end-to-end business requirements management and analysis which includes but not limited to the following activities:


Facilitating business problems or opportunities.
Impacts analysis.
Current process state analysis.
Proposed process analysis.
Solution options analysis.
Risks and issues analysis.
Engaging vendors and service providers to solicit information.
Assist with Cost /Benefits analysis and payback analysis.
Documentation of business processes (this includes process mapping and documentation).
User Acceptance Testing.
Assist with documentation of IT feasibility reports and business cases.
Assist with organisation change management analysis.

Mandatory Skills:
This role will suit a business analyst who has solid experience in the business centric environment, with solid experience and skills in the following areas:


Workshop facilitations and interviews to gather requirements and relevant information as well as to obtain decisions from various business stakeholders.
As Is and To Be process analysis, gaps analysis, solution analysis, requirements analysis, risks and issues analysis), incl. documentation – evidence of previous work will be requested.
Business case development, incl. Documentation – evidence of previous work will be requested.
Process mapping and process documentation – evidence of previous work will be requested.
Coordination of User Acceptance Testing activities.
Management of stakeholders with various backgrounds and business needs (incl. external stakeholders such as software & hardware vendors and service providers).
Working within a specific methodology / framework.
Time management – the successful candidate will be assigned to work in two initiatives.
Excellent communications skills and teamwork.

What's in it for you?


6 months contract role with possible extension.
Ideal for candidates located close to North West Suburbs.
Immediate start.

Interested? If you have the skills and motivation we are looking for, please Apply Now.

description:
The Company

Due to continuous growth the market leading client are looking for a Junior Business Analyst to join their team in a newly created role. Sitting in between the business and IT teams, you will work closely alongside the projects team to play a vital role in continuous developments within technology.

The Role

A Newley created role for a junior candidate to develop their career into a fully-fledged BA. You will be working closely with other Business Analysts and Project Managers to develop your skills. Working across multiple projects from internal systems to new websites and interfaces, you will be working throughout the complete SDLC. Of course, sitting between teams will see you liaising closely with senior stakeholders from both the business and technical teams.

Your Skills & Experience

2 Years Business Analysis experience

Role Description

2 year, Full-Time position with the potential for further extension

East Melbourne

Catholic Education Melbourne (CEM) is a dynamic education service provider to 331 Catholic schools in the Archdiocese of Melbourne. More than 400 staff work across four regional offices and in its central office in East Melbourne. CEM offers flexible working arrangements, generous salary and conditions, and the opportunity to enhance the education of more than 140,000 students. This community is committed to the safety, wellbeing and protection of all children in our care.

The Integrated Catholic Online Network (ICON) project will provide a common technology platform for teaching, learning and school administration for Catholic schools in Victoria, alongside existing IT applications.
DUTIES
Establish and maintain effective working relationships by keeping stakeholders engaged, responsive and proactive towards achieving project / programme goals and objectives
Accurately identify appropriate business analysis approach and related tasks to meet the needs of the area of analysis
Accurately elicit, analyse and validate requirements to meet stakeholder needs
Produce comprehensive work products
Conduct workshops with schools and other stakeholders prior to migration onto the ICON solution
Actively participate in the migration of user groups to new application solutions
Ensure that stakeholder responsibilities are carried out in a manner which safeguards related information and facilitates review for effective decision making
Other duties as assigned by the Executive Director

Special Requirements


Relevant qualifications (with a preference for tertiary qualifications in information technology) and professional experience
Knowledge of and experience in education related solutions
Knowledge of and experience in enterprise solutions
Good workshop facilitation skills
Exposure to software development projects with a preference for exposure to bespoke database applications, web services, API and message queues

KEY SELECTION CRITERIA
Demonstrated understanding and business analysis experience on complex projects including:
Business Analysis Planning & Monitoring
Requirements elicitation, analysis, management and communication
Business Process Improvements
Testing
Facilitation of workshops to achieve pragmatic, balanced solutions
Demonstrated understanding of enterprise solutions and experience working with cloud bases applications (or Software as a Service), 3rd party IT providers and system integrators
Demonstrated experience working in the education sector, such as Schools and/or School Systems
Good ability to work with stakeholders (including schools, diocesan staff, business, internal IT and IT vendors)
Ability to work autonomously as well as within a team
Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills
Experience working with project management principles such as SDLC and agile, including the development of key project documents and artefacts
A commitment to and understanding of the ethos, values and mission Catholic Education Melbourne


Application Procedures


Applicants need to provide:
a) a separate statement addressing the Key Selection Criteria;
b) a Cover Letter; and
c) an up to date Curriculum Vitae including contact details of two referees.
Applications can be uploaded via the 'Apply' tab on the CEM website. All enquiries can be directed to the Recruitment Officer at recruitment@cem.edu.au or (03) 9267 0228.

description:
At swipejobs we are a small team, in a fast paced environment, focused on the U.S market. We are a fully funded, entrepreneurial tech company using leading edge technology to transform the staffing market.
We are looking for a Business Analyst. Your role will involve dealing with clients and team members, running deliverables from conception to implementation, and applying the business strategic direction into product development. You will be working closely with the Tech Team on a daily basis to manage and see these product goals implemented effectively.
To be successful in the role, you need an ability to learn on the go, show strong initiative to pick things up and run with them, and excel in a collaborative environment. The ability to always connect the nitty gritty detail of the every day to the strategic direction of the business is a key capability and something that swipejobs is founded upon. You will need to have successfully completed a degree in the area of Commerce, Business, Economics or Science and have at least two years relevant experience.
You duties will include collaborating with internal and external stakeholders, gathering and documenting user requirements, applying project management and development methodologies and creating and maintaining user training documentation.
You will find yourself working alongside talented, driven people who will push you to learn and excel. We focus on the important things and get them done.

We have a casual friendly working environment, a flat organisational structure (where everyone is accessible on a day to day basis) and a technology stack, which is cutting edge. There will be opportunities for problem solving and innovation; where your contribution can have a significant impact as we strive to be the global leader in labour market technology.
You will be based near Circular Quay in a modern office with great views over the harbour. All food and drinks are provided with a team lunch every day. We also provide you with up-to-date equipment to do your job. It doesn't end there, with a U.S focus we have employees based with our clients in the U.S. so there are opportunities to travel and work in the U.S. directly with clients and users.
If you are talented, driven, keen to get accelerated development and not get stuck in the grind of a big-co grad program. Then come along for the journey; we would like to hear from you!
The salary range offered for this position is between $75,000 and $95,000 inclusive of super.
title: Business Analyst

description:
Compass is looking for a Business Analyst with UX/UI experience to assist in the creation of specifications to enable the delivery of key features of the Compass platform.

This role would suit an entry level developer or recent graduate looking to move into a technical business analyst role. Interest in and experience with User Experience or User interface design is highly desirable.

Here at Compass we are less interested in what you have done and more interested in what you can do. So if you have a non-traditional background of skills but are a master communicator with technical nouse then we want to hear from you.
Key Responsibilities
Understand - Develop an intimate understanding of the Compass platform, and how it works.
Assist and Communicate - Identify and prioritise changes to the Compass platform, through stakeholder and user feedback.
Track - Document, develop, manage, and analyse business rules in our software.
Refine - Analyse proposed roadmap enhancements, customer suggestions, and bugs in the software. Use your skills in UX/UI to enhance and improve the overall customer experience.
Advise - Identify ways to make our support and development processes more efficient. Demonstrate your confidence in coming up with new ideas for feature changes and projects.
What we are looking for
Number one you must be an outstanding communicator in every sense of the word. We are looking for someone who can write well and interpret detailed specification documents and be able to write your own. Your English skills must be top notch.

Someone who can talk to all levels of the business with confidence, engaging with team members and asking probing questions to determine the best outcomes for the product. Detective work and the ability to communicate is at the heart of being a Business Analyst.

You must be able to navigate your way around a computer with ease. Do you have some tricks and programs up your sleeve that increase your productivity? Even better! Do you enjoy coding and learning about new developments in technology? Then you are the kind of person we need in the Business Analyst team.
A basic understanding of code (.NET, Java, C#, SQL)
Experience in UX/UI design
An ability to write quality specifications for developers to follow
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Problem solving skills; an ability to think outside the box and come up with clever solutions to complex problems
What else do you need
Have an exceptional command of spoken and written English (native speaker or IELTS Level 9)
Be an Australian citizen, permanent resident, or have the appropriate working visa/permit.
Send your application with a covering letter and resume to: jobs@compass.edu.au and attention it to the BA team.
In addition to your resume, specifically address in your covering letter (dot points is fine) how you meet our key responsibilities.
Do not contact us if you’re a recruitment agency (we will put you on hold with John Farnham music).

description:
2 year fixed term contract: salary + benefits
Join a high-calibre collaborative team
Recent graduates welcome to apply
Be part of an energetic and fast moving team that delivers enormous business value to our clients. Within the scope of the RBA’s Renovation of Banking Applications and Systems (ROBAS) program, you'll be responsible for assisting with the development and implementation of applications and systems.

If you have some experience working on projects, enjoy collaborating with other members in an agile environment and want to be play a key role on an exciting high-profile program, then we are interested in hearing from you.

As the Business Analyst you will:

Assist with the development of business requirements for ROBAS using the defined project methodology that takes into consideration current and future customer requirements.
Liaise with other sections within Banking Department (BK) and other departments to ensure that the proposed developments meet business and other department requirements.
Liaise with Technical staff to ensure that requirements are technologically viable and appropriate for BK customers.
Ensure that appropriate documentation and sign-off is achieved in line with project guidelines.
Undertake testing of new and enhanced systems and produce associated test plans and scripts as required.
Assist in preparation of operational procedures and staff training materials for new and enhanced systems in consultation with relevant Banking Department sections.
Provide assistance to respective owners of communication plan, customer migration plan, implementation and change management plan in creation of these documents.
Assist in resolving post implementation problems during the warranty period.
Provide suggestions on improving the processes within the Business Analysis area and foster greater collaboration with other project and business staff.
Assist the project team in its objective of improving maturity of Agile processes, practices and tools by being at the forefront of Agile adoption.
To be successful in this role, you will have an understanding of the business analysis domain and knowledge of tools, methods and communication techniques to extract, develop, validate and document business requirements. Some experience working in a project team as part of a business or technical project is essential. A degree qualification in finance, IT, business or another relevant discipline is desirable.

If this sounds like the challenge you are looking for we invite you to apply.

The Reserve Bank of Australia is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace and encourage applications from experienced candidates seeking workplace flexibility.

The Reserve Bank of Australia pursues national economic policy objectives and undertakes a range of associated activities in financial markets and banking. It also issues Australia's banknotes and operates infrastructure critical to the payments system. Staff at the Bank, have an important role to play in achieving these objectives, whether directly or in a supporting role. Our core values are promotion of the public interest, integrity, excellence, intelligent inquiry and respect.
Applications close 23 October

Advertised11 Oct 2018

description:
The role:
What an exciting time to join AGL and be part of the Marketing Centre of Excellence.
The Delivery & Implementation team is primarily responsible for the successful delivery of the customer communications and other program of work through our external vendors . This includes the documentation and maintenance of all Customer Markets development processes.
Your key responsibilities will be to:
engage with Business Product Owners and the Customer Communications team to identity and implement ongoing changes to deliver customer communications updates/changes in an efficient and agile manner.
facilitate workshops with team members, project and business SME's, vendors and other external parties to identify & manage impacts (as required).
ensure the end-to-end integrity of all communications issued through internal and external vendors.
build and maintain strong and positive relationships with key stakeholders to ensure customer communications are top of mind early in any proposed initiatives.
be the conduit of information between the Customer Marketing team and other internal and external vendors, assisting with gathering information for decision makers, designing solutions and supporting team members.
To be successful, you'll have:
tertiary qualifications in Marketing or Communications desirable but not essential.
experience working on desktop publishing software/applications.
experience working directly with outsourced technical providers (e.g. mail houses, printers) and external suppliers.
the ability to clarify functional processes or proposing alternative solutions to technical challenges.
experience writing Technical Specifications or System Integration documentation.
experience with SAP or utilities preferred but not essential.
experience in Marketing and/or Customer Communications disciplines preferred but not essential.
experience working on a large-scale projects.
strong project management skills, capable of managing work priorities and completing multiple projects within agreed timelines.
What's in it for you?
You'll be working in an A-grade building with state of the art activity based working facilities. Being supported by our new flexible ways of working. We call it Smarter Working.

You'll get the opportunity to work with some of the most engaged and innovative in the business. Being exposed to more opportunities to advance your skills and career.

Working in a company the size of ours the sky's the limit for your career aspirations and we're focused on investing in you.


About us
It truly is an exciting time to be part of AGL Energy as we lead the way in generating sustainable energy solutions for all Australians.

With a heritage of over 175 years and listed in the top 50 companies on the ASX, AGL offers a genuinely diverse, safe and supportive work environment, where "actions not words" fosters a culture of achievement and personal development.

Come with us on a journey of exploration and creativity, doing the same things differently, better, faster by encompassing innovation and passion for a more sustainable world.

description:
Come and join one of Australia’s most iconic brands; where inspiration is at its best. Freedom is one of the nation’s leading lifestyle retailers. We don’t just sell furniture, we sell the dream! Where our people can be themselves and deliver to the Australian people exceptional products at great value that are unique to the Australian way of life.
With over 35 years in the furniture and homewares industry, Freedom has established itself as a market leader, in style, on-trend products and quality. We are known for our great design and a customer experience that you will be proud to be part of.
We are committed to delivering a world class customer journey, coupled with a highly engaged retail team. Our number one priority is to build on our existing talents to create a culture that rewards high performance, fosters job satisfaction and invests in career opportunities.
Role:
This is a rare full time opportunity, where you manage and maintain the testing process for new and modified software before deployment into production. To define the user requirements for new and modified software and assist in the selection and evaluation of software based on these user requirements, as well as ensure a smooth handover of new software to the IT support teams.
Your responsibilities will be (but not limited to):
Elicit business requirements for new systems and system changes
Communicate to the Retail Operations required identified changes to systems procedures requirements
Resolve system issues escalated by IT Service Desk Analysts as required
Conduct testing as required for software to be released into production
Ensure the test environment is available for user acceptance testing and co-ordinate resources to complete tests with the relevant business units
Developing and maintaining integrations between systems using the company ESB/Middleware (Dell Boomi)
Assisting in the development of business reports and data extraction use Microsoft tools (eg MS SQL queries, MS PowerBI, MS Excel)
To be successful you will need:
3+ years experience working within a similar role
Strong technical writing skills
Strong MS Office skills
Experience in developing and executing test scripts (including automated test scripts). ISTQB or similar qualifications
Business Analyst experience and strong communication skills
Experience in a retail environment as a business analyst is highly regarded
Ability to interpret technical information and translate in business terms for users to understand
Strong problem-solving skills
Familiar with writing MS SQL queries
Ability to work well in a team
We offer:
Great company and team culture
Free onsite gym & gym classes
Rewards and recognition - we believe in recognising our employees and our outstanding performers through various reward and recognition programs
Generous staff discounts across all reputable brands, incentive schemes and other benefits
If you have a positive and team player approach, who has a strong experience as a Business Analyst, then this is the role for you!
title: Technical Business Analyst - North Ryde

description:
Ongoing Position
Canberra Office
$98,244 - $118,443 p.a. + 15.4% superannuation
The Business Systems Delivery Branch within the Technology Directorate is responsible for the plan, build and delivery of corporate intelligence and national policing information IT solutions for the agency. The branch ensures IT projects are completed on time and on budget, ensuring that IT solutions meet stakeholders’ needs and that the agency’s systems integrate with those used by its partners.

The National Criminal Intelligence System (NCIS) Program will develop a whole of government capability which will give Australia’s law enforcement and intelligence agencies the first truly national and unified picture of criminal activity. The Senior Business Analyst role is responsible for the development and review of business requirements, use cases and user scenarios relating to the development of NCIS and for assisting in the business analysis required to develop the solution capability blueprint and concept of operations.

The Senior Business Analyst will methodically investigate, analyse, gather and review existing and new business requirements to meet client and stakeholder objectives. The occupant of this position will research and analyse specific information systems and technologies relating to the needs of the ACIC and partner agencies and make recommendations for enhancements to proposed capabilities. As partner agencies for NCIS are located across the country, applicants should anticipate domestic travel.

Contact Officer: Sophie, 02 6268 7187

This is a position of trust. The occupant must satisfy and abide by the Commission’s security requirements, which include Australian citizenship. The occupant must also satisfy a rigorous security assessment by the Australian Government Security Vetting Agency and is required to gain and maintain a NV1 clearance. In assessing suitability for employment the ACIC conducts a pre-employment screening process. This requires the applicant to complete a pre-employment screening form for the purpose of character and background checking, and a psychological assessment.

description:
The Implementation Business Analyst provides effective technical coordination, supporting the implementation of the Education Department EMS system. In this capacity the position provides technical services, advice and analysis, identifies and addresses issues and emerging needs, and leads the business analysis of assigned ICT projects. The position also performs system and integration testing and prepares test plans, data and reports, contributes to software application development or enhancements, provides training and mentoring, and produces technical documentation and functional specifications. A key function for the role is in the delivery of efficient technical support for the administration, implementation or evaluation of recommendations and change requests. In this capacity the position analyses and reports on costs and benefits, and provides recommendations that underpin business operations and planning processes.
Special Conditions
The successful applicant is required to gain a Department of Human Services (DHS) child-related employment screening prior to being employed which is required to be renewed every three years before expiry. The incumbent will be required to undertake Responding to Abuse & Neglect (RAN) full day/online training course every three years. For all other Special Conditions please refer to the Role Description.

Requirements
Applicants are required to submit a CV, the Application Cover Sheet, Pre-Employment Declaration, and a written statement of no more than 1500 words. Written statements should address the criteria outlined in the Role Description. Applicants should include the name, address and contact number of three (3) current referees, one being your current line manager.
Special Notes
Please note this is a contract / term vacancy until 30 June 2021.
Enquiries
Oshim Somers
8226 2537
oshim.somers2@sa.gov.au
Application Instructions
All applications must be submitted online.

description:
Senior Business Analyst
 - 00006KE4
Senior Business Analyst
Full Time Fixed Term Opportunity
RC Grade 6 ($120,237 to $133,322) plus 9.5 % superannuation
Convenient Central Station Location
The opportunity
We have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Business Analyst to join our NSW TrainLink Regional Rail Fleet Project team. The Senior Business Analyst will play a key role in driving analysis and engagement with business stakeholders to transform public transport across regional NSW through the delivery of a new next generation fleet.
The Senior Business Analyst will be responsible for the determination and documentation of key business requirements and specifications to support business readiness and business improvement opportunities, including concept of operations, information systems, practices, procedures, and organisational change.

Application of modelling and analysis tools, methods, frameworks and standards will be required to assist in the determination of project and business operating outcomes, as well as a collaborative approach to working with internal and external stakeholders to ensure engagement, understanding and agreement.
This role will report to the Regional Rail Associate Director Operations Planning and Readiness.
We are looking for a Senior Business Analyst with demonstrated analytic, conceptual and problem solving skills, as well as proven experience building and maintaining positive relationships with stakeholders and excellent communication skills.

For more information on this position, view the role description here.

About us
NSW TrainLink is proud to connect people and communities throughout NSW and encourages people to choose us because we are a better way to go.

We provide intercity, regional and interstate rail and coach services for customers travelling between Sydney and the Hunter, Central Coast, Blue Mountains, Southern Highlands, Illawarra and South Coast regions, as well as Regional services around NSW and to Brisbane, Canberra and Melbourne.

Each year our customers take more than 35 million journeys with our safe, reliable and comfortable trains with on board facilities.

Benefits
NSW TrainLink offers rewarding work and employee benefits with opportunities for career progression, learning and development, health and wellbeing, and work-life balance. Other benefits include:

Free travel on Government trains, buses and ferries

Join NSW TrainLink for the opportunity to shape the future and make a genuine difference for the people and communities of NSW by providing a world class rail system.
Our commitment to Diversity
Great people come from all walks of life and at Transport for NSW we are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible workforce which reflects the community and the customers we serve.

Essential requirements
Appropriate tertiary qualifications from a recognised tertiary institution or equivalent experience
Please note: successful candidate will need to undertake background checks and criminal record checks.

How to apply
To apply for this position, please submit a resume and brief covering letter (no longer than two pages) addressing the targeted questions in the section below.
For more information on how to apply for a role in the NSW Public Sector please click here or for more information on NSW TrainLink please click on link provided.
For any enquiries, please contact Dyana Rifai on 02 8574 3100 and quote 00006KE4.


Applications close: 11:59pm on Sunday 4 November 2018.

For permanent positions in the NSW Public Sector, you need to be an Australian Citizen or Permanent Resident. For most Temporary jobs, you need a visa that gives you permission to work in Australia. To be considered for these roles you must be 18 years of age. Applicants will need to complete merit based selection activities and will be subject to satisfactory medical, drug & alcohol and criminal record checks as part of the selection process. Please note that an eligibility list may be created for this position, and position(s) of the same classification that subsequently become vacant may be filled using this eligibility list (where the vacancy is within 60 minutes travelling time). Transport for NSW is an equal opportunity employer. Women and people with a disability are encouraged to apply.
Location Sydney Region-Sydney City
Work Type Full-time
Number of Positions 1
Total Remuneration Package: RC Grade 6 ($120,237- $133,322), plus employer's contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading.
Contact Dyana Rifai - 02 8574 3100
Closing Date 04-Nov-2018
Job Category Analyst
Organisation Transformation
Key Application Responses
1. Outline your experience in ‘Business Analysis/Process Modelling’ to define and document complex business requirements and specifications for large scale transformational projects.

2. Describe an example where you have worked collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders to ensure engagement, understanding and agreement. How did you build these relationships?
title: Senior Business Analyst

description:
9-month contract with respectable Financial Services organisation in the CBD working mostly on merchant acquiring projects.

The Company
Are you deeply passionate about understanding and translating customer needs into actionable development plans? If so, we want to hear from you. Our client is looking for a highly motivated IT Business Analyst, who combines exceptional technical understanding with brilliant communication and social skills. You will work with a well-known and respected Financial Services organisation who are located in Sydney's CBD.
The Role
This exciting role will challenge and energise you with a diversity of functions including analysing and reviewing business, technical, and functional requirements. You'll work in close partnership with the development team to invent and analyse product requirements to meet business goals. Tap into your creative flair as you craft comprehensive user stories and profiles, and develop innovative and highly usable solutions for new product requirements. The opportunities for collaboration are tremendous as you partner with designers on wire-frames, interactions and user flows, and work with development and QA teams to test and implement new corrections and improvements.
Your Skills & Experience
Degree in IT, Computer Science, Engineering or related field.
Financial Services experience, ideally merchant acquiring experience.
Strong documentation skills.
Exceptional knowledge of usability and application performance considerations.
Brilliant attention to detail and proactivity.
Impressive interpersonal skills to work with and contribute to a team environment.
About you
You are ambitious, highly motivated and you bring energy and enthusiasm to a role. Your time management skills are exceptional and you can seamlessly switch between tasks as needs demand. You offer innovative solutions, and have the business insights to know what will work in a commercial environment. You have the confidence to collaborate with business leaders and the natural leadership to mentor and inspire a talented team.
What's on offer?
A challenging and rewarding role that will expand your skill set and advance your career.
A highly energised workplace where excellence and achievement are rewarded.
A bright and talented team.
Opportunities for professional training and development coupled with ongoing mentoring.
A company that fosters a flexible workplace and encourages work-life balance.
Robert Half Ltd is committed to equal opportunity and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of categories protected under local law.

title: Business Analyst

description:
Take part in a number of exciting initiatives within our Asset Management Technology team. This great opportunity allows you to work as a Junior Technical Business Analyst in the private equity space.

In this role, you’ll work closely with the business to gather requirements and priorities for upcoming projects. You’ll devise and implement solutions that leverage our eFront platform to meet business needs. In addition, you’ll work in a DevOps environment assisting them and providing support in all activities.

This role is well suited for a business or support analyst with development experience, or a developer who enjoys working closely with the business. Prior experience with tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, cloud technologies and eFront will be highly beneficial to your success in this role. You’ll ideally have experience with Front Script (SAS), VB, .Net and Oracle database.

If you are an individual that thrives in fast-paced environments, utilising your professional communication skills to provide solutions to complex business cases, please apply via the link below or contact Manny Wahidi at manny.wahidi@macquarie.com

The Corporate Operations Group (COG) brings together specialist support services including workplace, human resources, market operations and technology. COG's purpose is to drive operational excellence through business-aligned services with a focus on quality, cost and risk. COG comprises the following divisions: Business Improvement and Strategy, Business Services, Human Resources, Market Operations, and Technology.

Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

We facilitate a range of flexible working arrangements within our teams. Talk to us about what flexibility may be available. Our Technology Returner program is an opportunity for you to re-integrate yourself into the workforce following an extended professional career break. Find out more and apply at https://www.macquarie.com/au/about/careers/jobs/returner-program

Find out more about Macquarie careers at www.macquarie.com/careers

description:
Our Business Analysts are an integral part of our Business Improvement service offering. We are currently seeking Senior Business Analysts within the IT and Telecommunications area with consulting backgrounds who have a range of analytical skills and hold a track record of delivering outstanding results and meeting critical timeframes. The ideal candidate will have excellent interpersonal & communication skills and possess the ability to build strong relationships and rapport with clients and key stakeholders.

Is this you?
 We are seeking skilled professionals who are passionate about generating meaningful change for clients and who are keen to belong to a company committed to bringing out their best, and supporting them along the way.
Business Analyst with 10+ years’ experience

Business Consulting background preferred

Experience in Networks, Network Technology, System Integration and/or Application Upgrades essential

Immediate start preferred


To be successful in this role, you must possess the following skills:

Strong communication skills –excellent oral, written and visual communication skills, with the ability to tailor your style to suit the audience you are working with.

Stakeholder Management & Organisation Skills– the ability to identify stakeholders and to influence others to reach a desirable outcome or agreement. You should hold exceptional organisational skills, enabling you to work in complex environments

Analytical skills – you should be able to analyse and interpret data, demonstrating your ability to identify business and functional requirements.

Business Process Mapping/ Re-engineering - Ability to document, map and develop business processes.

Relevant Industry experience – IT and telecommunications, specifically within Networks, Network Technology, System Integration and/or Application Upgrades

Strong Australian Industry experience

What can Terra Firma offer you?


Our people and our culture make Terra Firma a unique and awesome place to work

We value your ideas and reward you with a collegiate atmosphere full of opportunities

You will have access to global best practice frameworks including IIBA, PMBoK, ProSci and TOGAF. Our staff are also encouraged to enrol in our in-house training programs or gain external accreditations.

We have mentors who are industry recognised experts.

All our consultants have access to Employee Assistance Program for Physical, Psychological, Financial and Nutritional support

Through our alliance with a large corporate travel organisation, we are able to offer our consultants access to discounted travel and insurance

But most importantly, we offer you the opportunity to live our values with us: Pride & Passion, Collegiality and Adding Value!

We are ALWAYS on the lookout for people with the skills and personality to join us.

To begin your new career with us apply to the link below or call our careers team on 03 8611 5099 for a confidential discussion. We look forward to hearing from you.

description:
Principal Business Analyst
 - 00006J4F
Job Title: Principal Business Analyst
Job Grade / Classification: Clerk Grade 11/12
Salary: Upto $160,189/-
Employment Type: Full-time, Permanent Role
Location: 320 Pitt Street, Sydney (relocating to Parramatta end of 2019)

Agency overview
The Department of Planning and Environment (the Department) is the lead NSW Government agency in planning for a growing NSW. The Department is going through an exciting period of organisational and operational change.

The Department's vision - "Planning for growing NSW: inspiring strong communities, protecting our environment" - provides the benchmark for our partnership and leadership approach to engaging and working collaboratively with key State and Local Government, community and industry stakeholders to deliver better outcomes in the areas of planning, local government and the environment.

Learn more about what it's like to work at the Department on our LinkedIn page.

About the Role:
In your new position as the Principal Business Analyst, you will lead the Office of Housing Coordination’s evaluation of initiatives, project management and program improvement under the Government’s Housing Affordability Portfolio to develop high impact reports which will inform the cabinet. You will liaise with local councils, NSW Treasury, Premier’s office, EPMO, EPLM and other agencies, as well as working closely with the Reporting and Coordination Manager and the project team.

You will form part of a collegiate, helpful and friendly team, led by approachable supportive senior management.

Essential requirements:
Tertiary qualification in a relevant analytical discipline and extensive equivalent experience.
Significant experience in project or program evaluation.

To be successful in the role, ideally you will have:
Experience in project or program evaluation in the Public Sector, either as a provider or purchaser of evaluation services

Please read the following documents prior to preparing your application:

Role description
Application Guide
Applying for a role in the NSW public Sector

Our commitment to diversity and flexibility:
At the Planning and Environment Cluster, we believe a diverse and inclusive workforce contributes to the success of our business and are committed to ensuring that our workforce reflects the communities of NSW.

We understand that flexibility means different things to different people and are committed to offering flexible work arrangements where and when possible.

Good to know:
A Recruitment Pool may be established for future temporary and ongoing roles with similar focus capabilities. The Recruitment Pool may be available to hiring managers from DPE and other NSW Public Sector agencies over a 12-month period.

To Apply:
Complete all the questions in the online application. Two of the questions will require you to provide specific examples from your experience (400-word limit per question). These questions are shown below. Do not address these in your cover letter

Q 1. Discuss the main challenges when delivering high quality evaluation of complex programs and how these challenges may be addressed, using case studies from your own work experience. Describe your approach to ensuring the delivery of high quality evaluations on time and within budget.

Q 2. Please share your experience in project or program management in a large agency where multiple business units are leading key aspects of the initiative. What was your specific role, how did you win support and what were the outcomes?

The information provided in your application needs to show how you meet the focus capabilities and other essential requirements of the role. (Refer to the role description for details about the capabilities and the associated behavioural indicators. The role description also lists the essential role requirements.)

Applications Close: 5th Nov 2018 (11:59pm AEST)

Should you require further information about the role please contact; Vincent Ogu at (02) 9274 6111 (or vincent.ogu@planning.nsw.gov.au ) if you have any enquiries regarding the recruitment process please contact Emmen Saeed at Emmen.Saeed@planning.nsw.gov.au

If you are viewing this advertisement on LinkedIn, please click ‘Apply’ to access more information about this role via the I Work For NSW website.”

Work Type Full-time
Number of Positions 1

title: Principal Business Analyst

description:
The current opportunity
Perform the analysis and process mapping required for the successful execution of key projects and improvements in the Superloop Group.
Act as the intermediary between end-users and project teams to ensure that business and user requirements are accurately scoped and delivered across all projects.
What we can give you
Work here for the same reasons our leaders work here; it’s not just a job for us:
Work with and learn from some of the industry’s legends – we are here to buck the status quo
Be part of our ongoing success story as our growth begins to take-off
We know when to work-hard but we really know how to play-hard
Casual and relaxed environment – ditch the corporate attire
We’re a progressive technology company – flexible working arrangements are assumed
Career progression, personal and professional development opportunities as we grow and evolve
Opportunity to be part of the innovation and continual improvement of our processes and systems
High performing traits
Strong ability to converse with both end-users and employees at all levels of the organisation
Good understanding of all aspects of the systems/software development life cycle
Technical knowledge of system design, IT infrastructure and database concepts is an advantage
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Sound ability to analyse, isolate and interpret business needs and develop appropriate technical solutions
Sound technical specification writing & documentation skills
An appreciation of both IT and business strategy
Strong customer service focus
Knowledge of business process re-engineering
Excellent professional communication skills, both written and verbal
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to build constructive working relationships
Ability to easily pick up information and apply knowledge
Capacity to be adaptive to change or new procedures
Ability to work on a number of complex tasks with attention to detail
The position
Analyse and deliver business process initiatives, either managing some components of mid-sized initiatives or all components of small initiatives
Meet with user groups to gather and analyse end user requirements
Analyse workflow to create process maps and isolate areas of potential improvement. Develop functional specifications that design and document desired outcome of system enhancement/development
Produce technical specifications to communicate user requirements in technical terms to analyst programmers/project team
Coordinate User Acceptance Testing to ensure the overall efficiency, functionality and user friendliness of system enhancement or development
Prepare material and provide training and assistance to end-users following implementation
Work as a crucial component of a project team responsible for enhancing existing systems or developing new systems
Architect and design solutions that improve the efficiency, service and profitability of the organisation
Assist in the deployment and training for solutions and projects
Facilitate continuous system and process improvements to enable Superloop to better service internal and external customers more effectively
About you
The successful applicant will have
3-5 years experience in a similar Business Analyst role
Experience in operating within PMO standards and procedures
Solid technical and operational background
Excellent client-facing and internal communication skills
Experience in facilitation of requirements gathering workshops and sessions
Change management experience working within a PMO is considered highly advantageous
About Superloop
Founded by Bevan Slattery in 2014 and listing on the ASX in 2015, Superloop started out as an infrastructure company designing, constructing and operating carrier-grade dark fibre networks throughout Australia, Singapore and Hong Kong. Superloop has since made a number of strategic acquisitions, including Cinenet, ApexNetworks, BigAir Group, SubPartners, GX2 and NuSkope which expands our competitive capabilities into international submarine connectivity, fixed-wireless, cloud & managed services and cybersecurity.
At Superloop the customer is at the centre of everything we do. We strive to always provide an exceptional customer experience from first contact all the way through to contract renewal. We do this through delivering future-focused products, fully supported by our capable and driven teams.
We’re a fast-paced and growing company with a start-up feel. We’re led and mentored by industry veterans who love technology and pushing its capabilities to the limits. Each and every one of our valuable team members are dedicated to being at the top of their game and hungry for success. Being part of a team like ours gives you the fantastic opportunity to take ownership of your work and to be truly innovative; in fact, we encourage it!
So, what now?
If this sounds like a role you’d be perfect for and a team you want to be a part of, apply now!
Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted. While we do enjoy working with recruitment agencies, we ask that you do not contact us about this vacancy.

description:
The Business Analyst role within Service Victoria is responsible for influencing stakeholders in workshop facilitation, negotiation and influencing key project stakeholders to discover, derive, and define business needs. You will provide leadership and guidance to cross functional agency and project teams to elicit, define and document current state requirements in the form of business process maps, process flows, user stories and business rules.
Reporting to the Product Director you will work across Service Victoria's business and technical areas to undertake complex independent analysis to identify, evaluate and quantify issues, identify options and recommend solutions.

In this position you will demonstrate:

Exceptional skills in requirements, gathering and analysis
Outstanding stakeholder engagement and influencing skills
Ability to think strategically and challenge the status quo of how things are currently done
Demonstrated experience in process analysis

The closing date for this position is midnight on Monday, 5 November 2018.
This position is only open to applicants with relevant rights to work in Australia.
How to apply: Apply before the advertised closing date via the http://careers.vic.gov.au website

All applications should include:

a resume
a cover letter which addresses the key selection criteria

Other relevant information:
Employment of successful candidates will be subject to a National Police Check.
DPC actively promotes diversity, inclusion and an equal opportunity workplace. We welcome applicants from all diverse backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and people with disabilities. All roles at DPC can be worked flexibly, however it may differ from role to role. We work for the people of Victoria by helping the government achieve its strategic objectives. We do this by supporting the Premier, Deputy Premier, Special Minister of State, the Ministers for Aboriginal Affairs, Equality, Multicultural Affairs and Veterans, as well as the Cabinet.
DPC is proud to participate in Recruit Smarter, an initiative of the Victorian Government to address unconscious bias in recruitment practices. For more information on Recruit Smarter, please visit www.vic.gov.au/recruit-smarter or call 13 22 15.

description:
Job posted:
17/10/2018
Applications close:
28/10/2018 (Midnight) 7 days remaining






Today
Job Description
The Department of Economic Development, Jobs, Transport and Resources (DEDJTR) is the Victorian Government’s lead agency for creating the conditions to sustainably develop the Victorian economy and grow employment. Our role is to increase jobs, investment, exports and opportunities; stimulate innovation, competitiveness, and confidence; and support sustainability. The Department is committed to building a culture where we say 'yes' to flexible work arrangements, and support ways of working that help employees balance work and home life. The Department is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applicants from a diverse range of backgrounds. The Department strongly encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people. The Department offers reasonable adjustments for applicants with disabilities on request.

$95,275 - $115,276 (Plus Superannuation)
Fixed Term (to June 2020)
Usual hours of work: Full Time (flexibility may be available)
Usual work location: Melbourne CBD (flexibility may be available)
The Resources Division within DEDJTR develops policy, programs and regulation to enable investment and generate jobs through sustainable development of the State's earth resources, including extractives, minerals and petroleum.

Reporting to the Manager, Business Quality and Management Systems (BQMS), the Systems Business Analyst is a key member of the BQMS team working closely with internal and external stakeholders to develop future state options for the Earth Resources Regulation branch.

Key accountabilities include:

Addressing change requests raised within the established Salesforce environment though evaluation, analysis and documentation of current process and systems and working with the business to understand requirements and timeframes
Identify process improvements and manage the collection, analysis and evaluation of data to support process and system alignment
Actively participate in project teams providing system and data analysis expertise and assist in addressing key issues / risks.
Manage and drive quality management ensuring system changes are tested and implemented
To be successful in this role you will have proven high-level systems analysis experience within a Salesforce environment combined with the ability to manage change requests including identifying solutions and developing system requirements. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills will be required to develop effective working relationships with a diverse range of internal and external stakeholders. The ability to prioritise and deliver outcomes within a complex environment, often with tight timeframes will be required. Knowledge of Salesforce Classic and Salesforce Lightning is highly desirable with a completed Salesforce Administrator certification an advantage.

For a confidential discussion, please call Praveen Mathew on 8392 7189.

Successful candidates will be required to undergo a National Police Records Check prior to commencing employment with the Department.

For further information on the position, please see the attached position description. To apply, please click the ‘Apply Now' button below.

Applications close at midnight on 28 October 2018.

Please note: When submitting your application online, there will be questions pertaining to a number of the position's Key Selection Criteria to which you are required to respond. The generic online form may ask you to provide the responses to all of the KSC. At this step in the online process, please only upload your resume and cover letter (there is NO requirement to address all of the KSC) and move on to the last screen where you will be asked to submit responses to the specific questions only". Complete these specific questions to complete your application.

title: Business Analyst

description:
Business Analyst Lead
 - 00006KGO
Be part of a proactive team oriented environment and forward thinking organisation
Be an influencer and future proof Sydney’s road network
Parramatta location, close to public transport.
The opportunity

Roads and Maritime IT Services is embarking on a digital transformation and deploying new ways of working across it business. Enhancing the provision of a best in class IT systems to enable effective operations this period of change will see you joining a team of skilled IT professionals and work with some industry leading technology.

We are seeking a Business Analyst Lead to join and become an integral part of our Business Services/Information Technology team within RMS

As the Business Analyst you will be responsible for driving high level analysis and facilitating strategic advice to support IT project decision making, planning, resourcing and delivery across a portfolio of complex initiatives. The role acts as the pivotal link between stakeholders ensuring business needs and requirements are understood by all solution delivery stakeholders.
Proven experience with managing a team of staff is crucial to this exciting opportunity as you will become the lead of a team of business analyst’s across the cluster. You will lead and manage the delivery of detailed analysis of the business environment, people, processes and systems to capture business requirements accurately and facilitate the development of business solutions that address business needs.

You will identify improvement opportunities and work with the IT team and the business to lead continuous improvement in business analysis capability. Using your excellent verbal and written skills to articulate to the relevant stakeholders best practice techniques will be a key part of this opportunity.

To be successful in this role you will be a process driven individual who enjoys working in a collaborative environment where you can become a key player in the digital transformation journey of RMS

Essential requirements

Tertiary qualifications in Information Technology, Commerce, Project Management or other relevant qualification and/or equivalent experience with strong experience in a business analyst lead role.
Extensive and demonstrated experience conducting analysis of business needs across a complex portfolio of initiatives and experience interpreting and translating analysis results into insightful, clear and succinct technical specifications and requirement documentation.
Strong knowledge of and extensive experience in the application of contemporary business analysis best-practice frameworks such as BABOK, Object Oriented Analysis & Design (e.g. UML), and business architecture (BPM, CBM, capability mapping, etc.).

The salary for this position is USS 11 ($135,443 - $144,521) per annum plus superannuation and leave loading.

Please click here to view a copy of the role description.

About us

Roads and Maritime Services is one of Australia's leading public sector agencies, with more than 5,800 employees and an annual budget of $6.5 billion. As part of Transport for NSW we are responsible for implementing strategic and essential frontline services to the people of NSW who use roads, harbours and waterways.

We offer diverse and challenging career opportunities for professional and technical specialists, trades, and people interested in making a difference to transport operations and road safety in New South Wales.

Benefits

When you join Roads and Maritime Services, you become part of a forward-thinking organisation that offers generous working conditions, flexible working options and a real commitment to developing your skills.
For more information on Employee Benefits at TfNSW please click here.
How to apply

To apply for this position, please submit a resume and brief covering letter (no longer than two pages) which addresses:

a) How your skills and experience suit the role, and
b) Your most significant and relevant career achievement.

For more information on how to apply for a role in the NSW Public Sector please click here or for more information on site Roads & Maritime please click on link provided.

For any enquiries, please contact David Pickles on 0406 655 242 and quote reference 00006KGO

If you encounter technical issues please contact I Work for NSW Support Team on 1800 562 679 (Mon-Fri) or support@jobs.nsw.gov.au

Information Technology staff in impacted areas will have nine days to apply for positions. Impacted Applications close: 11:59pm, Sunday 28 October 2018.
Applications close: 11:59pm, Thursday 1, November 2018.

Number of Positions 1

Contact Kristie Steers - 02 8574 3871
Closing Date 01-Nov-2018

Organisation Business Services
