description:
About the opportunity: We are looking for a Business Analyst who also has Salesforce experience to join our Deloitte Solutions product team. Our team are focused on bringing innovative B2B digital products to the market, within professional services.This is a rare opportunity to further your experience within a unique setting – the best of a large corporate and a start-up venture.Key responsibilities: You will be sitting within the product team where the bulk of the role will see you working with product managers, technical team members and business stakeholders.While the Salesforce work will only take up a small percentage of your time, when those skills are called upon, you will be the subject-matter expert and need to bring it all to the table.BA: Work with key stakeholders to gather requirements and identify opportunities for product and process improvements. Translate business and customer needs into language and format that can be clearly understood by technology team members.Collaborate with members of the product team and business stakeholders to refine, implement, test and deliver product features that solve customer and business problems, within an Agile environment.Monitor existing product features to gauge effectiveness and identify improvements.Ensure the development team is creating solutions that align with the defined business value.Work with product managers to manage the backlog.Salesforce: Implement changes to the Salesforce environment.Have an understanding of user licences, roles, profiles, hierarchy and security settings.Be cognizant of workflows, functions and configurations within the Salesforce.com environment.Receive new/changed requirements for views, reports, dashboards and campaigns from the business users and implement within Salesforce.Assist sales and finance management to monitor activities, trends, sales and leads.Build and manage report folders for reps to improve sales efficiency.Communicate system changes to senior business users.Desirable experience: 5-7 years’ experience working as a business analyst.Ideally a technical background with some development experience.A passion for technology and being part of best-practice product development.Ideally have exposure to design thinking and an Agile environment.Be energised by collaboration and possess a learning and growth mindset.Someone who doesn’t just know ‘what’ to do, but is interested in and knows the ‘why’.Strong analytical skills, including the ability to interpret customer and business needs.Tertiary degree in technology related discipline preferred.About the team: We are a start-up venture within the world’s largest and leading professional services firm. We launched less than a year ago and are growing rapidly.We are a B2B shopfront for accessing online 24/7 self-serve professional services in digital app form that companies could only previously access through traditional consultants and manual processes.We are a pack of creators, curators and disrupters within the professional services industry.Visit our shopfront at www.solutionsbydeloitte.com.auWe are wholly owned and backed by Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Australia.At Deloitte, we pride ourselves on having a team of diverse, high performing professionals who are talented, supportive, inclusive and social – they are at the heart of our success.

Our aim is to ensure that all our people feel comfortable to bring their whole selves to work, and as a result, create a workplace that encourages the true spirit of 'And different'From day one you’ll be considered part of the Deloitte community and our development and career progression framework will help you develop the skills and capabilities you need to succeed – in every sense of the word. Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu is the DTTL member firm in Australia (“Deloitte Australia”). “Deloitte” is the brand under which tens of thousands of dedicated professionals in independent firms throughout the world collaborate to provide audit, consulting,financial advisory, risk management, tax and related services to select clients. description:
Key outcomes/Accountabilities


Plan and undertake research and development projects and activities to identify issues, recommend changes or improvements to ensure the optimal operation and performance of business systems.
Analyse business processes and identify alternative solutions, assessing feasibility, and recommending new approaches.
Help establish requirements for the implementation of changes in the business process.
Investigate operational requirements, problems, and opportunities, seeking effective business solutions through improvements in automated and non-automated components of new or changed processes.
Identifies potential benefits, and available options for consideration and works with customers/users in defining acceptance tests.
Assists in the analysis of stakeholder objectives, and the underlying issues arising from investigations into business requirements and problems, and identifies options for consideration.
Perform various analyst functions to assist the business and project teams with system integrations, ETL's, data cleansing, data migration and reporting.
Assist with manual testing and UAT, following relevant procedures and test scripts.
Develop, review and update system documentation.
Develop and maintain extensive knowledge of key QBCC processes and systems.
Engage with business areas to prepare proposals to meet business intelligence (BI) requirements.
Provide exceptional customer service to all staff of the Commission and external customers.

Candidate attributes
*

Experience in program processes, procedures and methodologies gained from similar complex information technology and business process re-engineering projects.
Experience as a Business Analyst preferably working in an agile environment with the proven ability to hit the ground running thrive in a challenging and complex environment where priorities will frequently change.
Knowledge and skill in the operational use of computer applications, and in particular, applications for recording, analysing and reporting data.
Excellent communicator, collaborator, negotiator and relationship builder across a broad range of stakeholders through both written and oral with confidence.This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Australia License.
title: Business Analyst

description:
Provide high level advice using advanced oral and written communication on issues affecting the Department of Child Safety Youth and Women and the Queensland youth justice system for internal, state and national stakeholders, and to inform strategic direction and policy implications.
Lead the design and implementation of performance reporting frameworks, business intelligence reports and dashboard analytics to support performance monitoring across the youth justice system and meet agency reporting requirements.
Lead the development and implementation of standards and methodologies for measuring the effectiveness of policy, programs and practice initiatives, and to reconcile contractual provisions with data analysis requirements.
Lead the design and implementation of monitoring and evaluation frameworks, research plans and associated quantitative and qualitative outcome measurement and reporting infrastructure.
Lead and coordinate complex analyses, modelling of future system demand and scenario modelling to test the feasibility of proposed system and legislative changes.
Develop and maintain effective governance arrangements and linkages between stakeholders to achieve high level program outcomes and evaluation objectives.
Represent the department on cross-government committees and working parties to inform decision-making in the development of strategic policy directions, inter-departmental information management and sharing, and national performance reporting strategies.

Is this role for you? Please consider the following capability requirements.
To be successful in this role you will be required to demonstrate capability in the following areas:

Technical skills in the use of statistical software packages to design and validate complex data analysis requirements; ability to conceptualise and design datasets and related analysis infrastructure and resources; perform statistical analyses using scripts; intersect existing data files for analyses; undertake multivariate statistical analyses (ie multiple regressions); conduct geo-spatial analyses; evaluate the effectiveness of programs and policies; have knowledge of the justice system, in particular Youth Justice, and related information management systems (Technical/role specific)
You analyse and interpret information to inform decision makers (Supports strategic direction)
You maintain focus on quality to achieve outcomes (Achieves results)
You provide courteous, prompt and professional service to clients ments (Supports productive working relationships)
You take personal responsibility for accurate completion of work within timeframes and quality require (Displays personal drive and integrity)
You explain complex information using language appropriate for the audience (Communicates with influence)This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Australia License.
title: Principal Business Analyst

description:
The purpose of this role is to provide highly skilled analysis, specification, design and workflow
services that create solutions for new and updated product functionality.
Provide highly skilled analysis, specification and design services which communicate requirements
for new and updated functionality across the Ultradata product suite.
Gather requirements via analysis of information from multiple sources to understand requirements
and design appropriate solutions to meet business needs.
2. POSITION SUMMARY
The duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:
1. Undertake banking market trend analysis and recommend potential product enhancement or
new product functionality to meet evolving client and market expectations.
2. Research and monitor the latest trends and technologies and provide suggestions on how they
can impact the functionality in our product offerings.
3. Undertake required analysis and functional specification and make recommendations for the
design of new and enhanced solutions offered by the Ultradata product suite.
4. Develop reference documents that specify, for example, requirements and business rules, work
flows, functional design, user interface designs and database design, depending on the nature of
the assigned project.
5. Develop sound client relationships and revenue generating opportunities through the provision of
specific fee-based consulting activities related to current and future product functionality to meet
client business requirements.
6. Analyse client and prospective client requirements, matching those with Ultradata products and
services, disseminating that information to the appropriate internal and external client
representatives.
7. Assist Sales, Client Services and Marketing teams to define and deliver key messages in
relation to how Ultradata products and services apply within the financial services market we
serve.


8. Brief Marketing to assist in the preparation of product release information regarding the business
benefits and drivers behind Ultradata products and services.
9. Deliver product and functionality overviews to wider Ultradata team to ensure knowledge of new
and updated products is shared.
10. Define how Ultradata products and services can be best demonstrated to new and potential
clients in order to present key business benefits.
11. Develop, maintain and manage relationships with clients to enable them to be successful in the
selection and application of Ultradata products; this includes the delivery of targeted
presentations and demonstrations to clients and prospects.
12. Undertake consulting assignments as allocated by Design from time-to-time.
13. Analyse, develop and implement systems and programs to capture, structure and disseminate
information about Ultradata products and its functionality. Disseminate knowledge within
Ultradata of existing and new products via a range of techniques such as seminars, workshops,
training sessions, printed collateral, knowledge base, frequently asked questions etc.
14. Participate in the provision of programs to improve the knowledge and talent collateral of clients
and Ultradata employees on the functionality and application of existing and new Ultradata
solutions.
15. Grow client capability to utilise Ultradata products (existing and new) with a post project analysis
of how design could be changed for the benefit of clients.
16. Responsible for dealing directly with development to design the required solution and produce
the required functional and non-functional documentation.




3. QUALIFICATION, SKILLS, COMPETENCIES AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED
Qualifications:
• Relevant Tertiary qualifications (Computer Science/Information Systems
Business, Commerce, Economics) and/or extensive commercial experience.
Experience:
• Proven experience as a Business Analyst.
• Prior experience in working in banking and with technology.
• Exposure to working in a software development environment would be
advantageous.
• Previous experience writing business requirements and documentation.
• Experience with analysis and management of legislative changes impacting
financial products an advantage
• Business solution design experience is desirable.
Competencies:
• Ability to provide creative and commercial solutions using new and evolving
technologies into the banking industry.
• Demonstrates a passion for new technologies.
• An ability to deal with people at all levels within and external to the
organisation
• The ability and desire to contribute ideas and take ownership of assigned
tasks.
• The ability to work autonomously and in a team.
• Ability to manage priorities and time to meet assigned goals and deadlines.
Skills:
• Strong understanding of banking products and systems
• Ability to problem solve and generate commercially viable solutions
• Highly developed interpersonal skills, including well developed consultation,
liaison, verbal and written communication skills.
• Strong experience in elicitation techniques and competent in requirements
gathering skills.
• Strong presentational skills and comfortable presenting to both external and
internal audiences.
• Strong attention to detail while retaining to ability to see the big picture
4. DECISION MAKING AUTHORITIES
Continuous improvements and suggestions for doing so are an expected part of this role.
title: Business Analyst

description:
Business Analyst – PMO Team

We now have an exciting opportunity for a talented Business Analyst to join the PMO team on a 12 month contract at our Macquarie Park office. The primary objective of this role is to successfully manage assigned business analysis deliverables of a programme of work designed to deliver on this strategic objective.

 Responsibilities
Produces the business analysis deliverables assigned to them as required, e.g. the business analysis plan, process maps, requirements documentation, requirements traceability matrices, use cases and scenarios, procedures, reports on outcomes and recommendations.
Plans and performs business analysis activities as required, e.g. information gathering, process analysis and design, requirements elicitation, current state analysis, gap analysis, and workshop design and facilitation.
Adopts the firm’s project delivery framework and ensures that good business analysis practices are maintained.
Proactively identifies and manages project risks and issues related to their deliverables.
Collaborates with programme managers, project managers and work stream leads to achieve the project objectives according to scope, time, cost and quality expectations.
Works with the Change & Communication work stream to identify and understand change impacts on the business.
Reports to the business analysis work stream lead on status, including issues and risks, and collaborates with others to manage interdependencies.
Participates in team meetings and reports on status when the business analysis work stream lead is unable to attend.

SKILLS, EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS
Skills, experience and qualifications :



University degree qualified.
Business analysis or process improvement certification, e.g. Six Sigma, Certification of Competency in Business Analysis (CCBA), or similar.
Substantial, recent experience working as a business analyst.
Demonstrable experience in working on cross functional business improvement initiatives.
Strong analytical and lateral thinking skills.
Strong documentation and process modelling skills.
Proven ability to communicate to all levels both verbally and in writing.

GROUP / TEAMCorporate Services
GROUP / TEAM DESCRIPTION
Our Corporate services group is comprised of a number of teams from the firm's central management functions, which support key activities both within the firm and in the external market. They coordinate common initiatives, improve communication and drive greater efficiency across our operations. These teams are Legal Operations, Management Services, Pro bono and citizenship, Internal/external communications and the Business Services Programme Management Office (BSPMO).

Legal operations

In response to the needs of clients, we have combined specialist skills that provide a range of critical business support services for our clients and their in-house lawyers, notably legal project management, pricing, research, innovation and contract automation services. This single integrated team, called Legal Operations, is a ‘single place’ where our clients and partners can go to access these services. As well as aligning to the needs of our clients, we aim to provide clients with greater certainty on commercial outcomes in matters (price, budget) and greater efficiency in delivery (time, cost and scope). Additionally, we bring innovation, automation and process improvement in our service to clients, both to drive efficiency and build opportunities to transform the client's business and operating environment. Our goal is to make Legal Operations easy to access for our clients and partners, give them a consistently positive experience, and provide exceptional service that meets and anticipates their needs.

The team is led by Ian Gilbert as the Director of Legal Operations, based in our London office.

Management services

This team is formed of a number of partners and consultants who provide leadership in developing our management and strategic direction, and in spearheading key strategic initiatives. Within this team, you’ll be supported by our strategy and planning team, which provides analysis to inform decision-making, develop business plans and project manage agreed initiatives and strategic reviews.

Pro bono and citizenship

Within this team, you’ll focus on:
providing pro bono legal services to members of the public through legal and community centres, and sponsoring legal clinics in association with law facultiessustainable development, working with non-governmental organisations, supporting rule of law initiatives, and training on behalf of local bar associations in African and South East Asian countriesbuilding community through financial and in-kind support to community partners with a focus on those organisations that promote access to justice and opportunity; andreducing environmental impact, including targets for reducing energy and carbon, food waste, recycling and encouraging more environmentally friendly travel options

Internal/external communications

These teams are responsible globally for advising on and supporting our communications activities in all media, both internally and externally, and including the development of our communications strategy and new communications initiatives.

Business Services Programme Management Office (BSPMO)

The BSPMO manages an extensive portfolio of global firm-wide projects, including new systems and major transformation programmes. Services offered include programme/project management, change management and business analysis.
ROLE TYPEBusiness Services
CONTRACT TYPE
Maximum Term Contract
WORKING PATTERNFull Time
DIVERSITY & INCLUSION
We aim to have a diverse, innovative culture where high performance, client focus and highly engaged people are our differentiator and where we celebrate the uniqueness of our people. Our firm is made up of people with a range of experience and backgrounds. We strive to ensure that our inclusive environment means our people feel valued and able to perform at their best by being their authentic selves at work. We know that our future success not only depends on being innovative and progressive in the changing legal market but, most importantly, on our people feeling engaged.
title: BUSINESS ANALYST – PMO TEAM

description:
Efficient business analysis and elicitation techniques
Maintain relationships with internal and external stakeholders
Join an organisation that invests in your career

About The Role
Role Location: 347 Kent Street, Sydney NSW 2000
Role Type: Permanent (40 hours per week)

As Business Analyst, you will work with project stakeholders to analyse and synthesise information, understand the organisational context and complete business analysis activities, and ultimately elicit, document and manage the requirements throughout the project or program end to end, and other analysis activities such as testing, process mapping and change transition. Working within the stakeholder engagement framework for the project, you will communicate these requirements to key stakeholders to ensure a clear understanding of the project’s or program’s objectives and benefits.

About You
To be successful in this role, you will ideally bring the following:
Strong business analysis experience and/or related technical experience
Detailed knowledge of business analysis tasks, experience in elicitation techniques and competent in requirements gathering skills
Solid understanding of project management lifecycles, disciplines and procedures. Demonstrated knowledge and experience in working on mid to large sized projects (preferably some domain knowledge of impacted business units)
Can appreciate difficult problems and work autonomously on tasks with a medium complexity, works collaboratively as part of a team and clearly represent consolidated findings

About ANZ
At ANZ, everything we do boils down to ‘why’ – our purpose – to shape a world where people and communities thrive. We're just as focused on seeing our people thrive as well as our customers. We'll give you every opportunity to develop your career.

We are responding faster to changing customer requirements, focusing on the things that matter the most, energising our people, eliminating waste and reducing bureaucracy.

A happy workplace is a thriving one. So in order to attract and keep the best talent, and say thanks for the hard work, we make sure all our employees are rewarded.

ANZ recognises the value of an inclusive and diverse work environment. We take pride in the diversity of our people and encourage applications from diverse candidates. Our recruitment decisions are based on the key inherent needs and requirements of each role, and candidates are selected based on their unique strengths and characteristics.

We work flexibly at ANZ. Talk to us and let us know how this role can be flexible for you.

To find out more about working at ANZ or to view other opportunities visit www.anz.com/careers. You may apply for this role by visiting ANZ Careers and search for reference number AUS090469.

title: Business Analyst - Insurance

description:
Convenient Milton location
Award-winning organisation with national presence
Flexible work arrangements and excellent work/life balance
Who are we?
Transmax is a full-service Intelligent Transport System (ITS) solutions provider that develops, supports and deploys the international-award winning ITS software platform - STREAMS®. We partner with road authorities to provide creative solutions to deliver improved travel outcomes for millions of people every day.
We truly value our employees and understand that recruiting talented people is merely the first step in building a skilled, experienced and enthusiastic workforce. We are committed to providing an environment whereby people have access to flexible work arrangements and are given the freedom to grow and experience both personal and professional development to achieve job satisfaction.
Your new role:
You will play an integral role in one of our multi-disciplinary development teams and define and deliver new features and functionality to STREAMS®. You will work with internal and external stakeholders to elicit, refine and clearly communicate customer needs so the development team can build effective solutions. This role requires excellent communication and analytical skills in order to effectively collaborate with users, technical experts, development teams, and senior leaders.
Requirements
You:
If eliciting requirements, solving problems and ensuring customer happiness is what makes you tick, then this is the role for you. Ideally you will be a certified Scrum Master with an in-depth understanding of agile development principles. Furthermore, if you have a few years’ experience working in software development within government - you will be viewed favourably.
Qualifications/ Experience:
Essential:
Bachelor's degree in an appropriate field, or equivalent industry experience
Solid analytical and creative problem-solving skills with the ability to focus on details while maintaining the “big picture”
Experience with requirements gathering, user stories and working alongside developers, test analysts and solution architects
Experience facilitating meetings, workshops, presentations, and training
Desirable:
Experience as a Scrum Master or Product Owner
Knowledge and/or experience using JIRA
Knowledge and/or experience with the Scrum framework
Experience with C#, C++ or Java programming languages
Experience with repository tools e.g. Git
Benefits
In addition to a competitive salary, we provide a positive working environment, flexible working hours, TOIL days, we are understanding and assisting of personal career plans and development, we provide weekly morning teas which are full of delicious nibbles and most of all, we are a company that wants to see nothing more than the success of our own staff.
If this has sparked your interest, and you feel like you'd be a great fit, we'd love to hear from you!
To apply, please submit your CV and a cover letter outlining your experience and suitability for the role.

title: IT – Business Analyst

description:
Join a collaborative and high performing team in our Corporate Asset Finance Division as a Business Analyst! In this role, you will have the opportunity to work across multiple projects that involve review and analysis of system changes whilst also contributing to project specifications across multiple stakeholders.

Using your problem-solving skills, you will provide options and recommendations to various stakeholders, whilst coordinating testing and assisting in release management. Your exceptional stakeholder management will be key to your success, as you will establish effective relationships with stakeholders of all levels.

The ideal candidate for this role will be an individual with full cycle business analysis experience, with Asset Finance experience highly regarded. You will champion the entire process including tasks such as, mapping, scope definition, data mapping, testing implementation and user training. In addition, your high attention to detail will be beneficial in identifying task dependencies and determining appropriate milestones to ensure successful delivery of all tasks.

If you are someone that thrives on working in a fast-paced, ever changing environment, please apply via the link or email Manny Wahidi at manny.wahidi@macquarie.com.

For more information about careers, please visit www.macquarie.com/careers

Corporate and Asset Finance Group provides innovative and traditional capital, finance and related services to clients operating in selected international markets. With offices in Australia, New Zealand, Asia, North America and Europe, Corporate and Asset Finance specialises in:

leasing and asset finance
tailored debt and finance solutions
asset remarketing, sourcing and trading.
Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.
title: Business Analyst

description:
Lead Business Analyst – Project Management, Finance – EFS Project (12-month max term contract)
Take the next step in your career and join the Finance Project Management team as the Lead Business Analyst. If you have a background in financial services, demonstrated experience in business analysis, and project delivery with an emphasis on a flexible, proactive attitude, please apply today.
As an experienced Business Analyst, you will join Macquarie’s Financial Management Group as part of the Project Management business.
In this challenging role, you will be involved in the Economic and Financial Statistics project, working to deliver accurate reporting, sourced from multiple business systems via a central repository. You will engage with project managers, business subject matter experts, data owners and technology systems owners to deliver solutions. You will own the requirements from inception to delivery for new and refined requirements and identify and investigate unexpected behaviours and patterns in input & output data, determining whether those will drive business or system changes. You will work closely with the technical analysts and developers to ensure business requirements are correctly translated into technical outputs. You will document and own business acceptance test cases and execute detailed data-testing, validate results against documented requirements and manage, review and analyse testing issues and identify options and recommendations. Finally, you’ll document target business processes and manage your internal stakeholders and their engagement.
This is an exciting opportunity which will bring you direct exposure to senior business stakeholders who will challenge and provide you with variety in your role, as well as opening future opportunities to develop your skills with guidance from team leads.
Your technical skills and qualifications will include experience working on projects in the financial services industry. You will also have a proven track record of delivering project outcomes, a flexible and proactive, evidence-based solution-oriented approach, and proven experience as a Business Analyst ideally working on Regulatory Change projects. A familiarity with Data Modelling especially with APRA taxonomy and/or Axiom would be highly advantageous as well as being experienced and comfortable with interpreting large volumes of data. Experience working with Agile would be advantageous and strong experience in project documentation and experience in all stages of the project life cycle including analysis, design, building and test support and implementation is required in order to be considered for the role.
If you have a growth mindset, are curious, have the ability to learn and adapt quickly, as well as adhere to change easily then apply today. For more information please contact me at Adina.bambur@macquarie.com.
The Financial Management Group provides financial, tax and treasury services to all areas of Macquarie. The group is focused on providing strategic analysis and advice to Macquarie's businesses and senior management, managing Macquarie's funding, liquidity and capital position, ensuring Macquarie continues to meet regulatory and compliance obligations and managing Macquarie's corporate communications and investor relations.
Find out more about Macquarie careers at www.macquarie.com/careers
Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.
title: Business Analyst - Project Management, Finance - EFS Project (12 month max term contract)

description:
Join our Commodities and Global Market Group and work within our Central business team. Central is dedicated to working with businesses and support areas in our Commodities and Global Markets Group to ensure that businesses operate efficiently and effectively to meet strategic goals. The team helps find solutions for operational, commercial and strategic issues facing the business. We’re seeking a highly skilled Business Analyst bringing an expertise in financial markets. The position is immediately available and for an initial six month maximum term contract.

You’ll take responsibility for managing the information gathering, documentation and analysis process. From this analysis you will be expected to determine the most effective way to structure and represent this information for your stakeholders. You may need to implement an analytical tool, although this is not a key requirement or capability. As a global business, you will be expected to build your knowledge and understanding of our activities as well as, importantly, our regulatory obligations. Experience in organising, attending or running workshops will be included in your remit, as well as gaining buy-in at all levels to ensure obligations are mapped appropriately.

We believe you will need 4-6 years’ experience from working in financial services, although this contract may suit a legal professional who has covered financial services engagements but now not looking to remain in practice or in a formal legal role. It’s important that you have an understanding of financial instruments and trading activities and the regulatory requirements that impact on these activities. You’ll be driven by working with and analysing material, often unstructured, and turning it into a format and deliverable application as well as be able to demonstrate a strong focus in understanding policy and practical implementation. An important component will also be to build relationships with business teams and Macquarie-wide stakeholders.

With appropriate tertiary qualifications and work experience as noted above, other key attributes will be your project planning and implementation management skills, the ability to analyse issues and find solutions to complex issues, as well as to work independently, yet work to the wider team project deadlines

If you would like to be considered for this opportunity, please apply on line but submitting a covering letter and concise resume as one Word or PDF-formatted document.

For more information, please visit www.macquarie.com/careers

Commodities and Global Markets provides clients with an integrated, end-to-end offering across global markets including equities, fixed income, foreign exchange and commodities.

Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

We facilitate a range of flexible working arrangements within our teams.

Talk to us about what flexibility may be available.

description:
Four-month contract with possible extension.
ASAP start.
Located in Brisbane CBD.

As one of the Australia's largest providers of human resources solutions, Chandler Macleod has a proven track record of unleashing potential in people and companies. For over 40 years Chandler Macleod's recruitment business has connected leading-edge projects and employers with outstanding business professionals.

Our client is a large federal government organisation. The branch you would be working for strives for innovation and identifying emerging trends and issues. This organisation is located in Brisbane CBD and seeking a Senior Business Analyst for a four-month contract with a possible extension.

Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with others to clearly define and clarify business needs to create an action plan, solution report or business case for consideration of senior staff.Liaise with a range of stakeholder to understand, gather and analyse their core requirements and concerns in order to meet their needs and the department's business objectives.Facilitate and lead communication across business units with a range of key stakeholders and represent the department at a range of internal and external forums.Produce and review business analyst artefacts and documents that may include risk analysis, scope modelling, problem tracking and sequence diagrams.Prepare, perform and coordinate elicitation requirement techniques such as brainstorming, workshops, prototyping, observation or interviews, and confirm or report on results.Prepare, review and contribute to clear business and stakeholder requirement documentation including prioritising, organising and verifying the requirementsSpecify and model requirements through analysis using textual statements, matrices, diagrams and formal models.Contribute to contract and procurement activities that may include Request for Tender (RFT), Request for Quotes (RFQ), evaluation criteria or cost estimates based on business requirementsManage and mentor staff including coaching and guidance to build knowledge and capability.Develop clear and defined work plans and timeframes for self and team in the context of business priorities.

Role Requirements:

Knowledge of Microsoft SharePointKnowledge and understanding of Business Analysis Body of Knowledge, business analysis techniques and tools as well as relevant business principles and practices.Proven ability to understand the audience and context to effectively tailor communication and communication style.Proven ability to perform high level research, analysis, apply logic and creativity to problem solve.Proven ability to collaborate, negotiate with and influence staff and stakeholders to achieve optimal outcomes.Demonstrated strong system and lateral thinking with a cognitive view.Demonstrated prioritising competing tasks and work collaboratively to deliver quality outcomes.

For more information on this role, please contact Madeline Travers on 3003 7709 or apply within.

Please note you must be an Australia Citizen to be eligible for this role.

description:
As part of our regulatory reporting portfolio, we are looking for a Technical Business Analyst to support us with the delivery of some regulatory initiatives.

You will play a critical role, helping us to hit delivery timelines and to develop, unit test, as well as deliver regulatory reports using Axiom Controller View. In this role you will be responsible for gathering business requirements and translating these into technical report designs. You will prepare and facilitate workshops and document outcomes and risks, whilst working closely with other teams to ensure everyone, as a collective, is reaching the desired delivery outcome and meeting regulatory requirements.

This role requires you to bring several years of experience as a Technical Analyst, coupled with strong experience in Axiom Controller View development and configuration. As a Technical Analyst you will be able to demonstrate a working knowledge of APRA, PRA, EBA or MAS regulations. You will possess sound stakeholder relationship management and communication skills as well as Agile experience. This role would be benefitted by your development experience with Axiom objects such as DataSource, DataModel, Portfolio and Aggregations.

If this role sounds like a suitable fit, please apply via the link below or contact Lucy.Glover@macquarie.com.

The Corporate Operations Group (COG) brings together specialist support services including workplace, human resources, market operations and technology. COG's purpose is to drive operational excellence through business-aligned services with a focus on quality, cost and risk. COG comprises the following divisions: Business Improvement and Strategy, Business Services, Human Resources, Market Operations, and Technology.

Find out more about Macquarie careers at www.macquarie.com/careers

Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

title: Technical Business Analyst

description:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Are you a business analyst looking for your next career challenge? Do you have experience automating business processes or a background in process mining? Leverage your skills and experience and become a part of our consulting team where you will have the chance to work on a wide variety of exciting and meaningful client projects.
As a consultant, you will play an active role in building our business and work to demonstrate the positive impact our software can make to our clients’ organisations.
With opportunities available either in Sydney, Canberra and/or Melbourne, you will engage with existing and prospective clients to identify, capture and model a broad range of business functions to enable cross-functional improvements using our Business Management System.
Additional responsibilities include:
Train and mentor clients in the use of Holocentric products
Work with pre-sales, partners and other modelling practitioners to develop and deliver effective solutions
Depending on experience, act as client/project lead at times and contribute to the implementation of solutions relating to project management, change management, business planning, and compliance and risk management
ABOUT YOU
To be successful in this role you will possess the following:
3 - 5 years Business Analysis experience within a project delivery environment
Strong knowledge and experience in Business Process Analysis, Requirements Definition and Management, Change Management
Exposure to project estimation
Client facing experience
Ability to engage with a broad range of stakeholders
Proven ability to articulate complex problems in simple terms
The following skills are also highly desirable:
Knowledge of or experience using Holocentric products or similar software tools
Experience with visual modelling
Demonstrated experience and understanding of robotic process automation technologies
Lean Six Sigma knowledge
WHY HOLOCENTRIC?
We are committed to building excellence and work hard to provide a workplace that encourages and supports our people. We have a highly collaborative and social team environment with open offices, Friday drinks, offsite company kick-offs and team building activities. We offer competitive salaries and as we grow and evolve opportunities for career and professional development plus a real ability to help shape our product future. We also have a share options scheme so you can participate in the success of our business.
We don’t believe in fixing people in rigid positions, but rather seek to match interest and capability. If you like a challenge, want to deliver exceptional results and seek to reach your potential, we’d like to hear from you!
DO YOU WANT TO BE PART OF SOMETHING BIG?
We are not your average software company. We have big dreams for our business and our people. So join us on our journey as we seek to fulfill our ambition of becoming a leading Australian software company!
To be considered for this role, you must be an Australian Citizen. You must hold an Australian Government Baseline security clearance or be eligible for security clearance.
If you want to make a difference and be part of a team that takes pride in helping other organisations improve their business performance, then please apply with your resume and covering letter to jobs@holocentric.com, telling us why you would like to join us.
title: BUSINESS ANALYST CONSULTANT

description:
Business Analyst 4-Ops-18000WYE

Preferred Qualifications

Overview:
The Food & Beverage Global Business Unit (FBGBU) is a newly formed Global Business Unit that was spun off from the Hospitality Business Unit (HGBU) in Fiscal Year 2019. We are embarking on a new path and are looking for high energy, enthusiastic individuals to facilitate continuous improvements around tools and processes. Looking for innovative thinkers that are comfortable working outside the box. Need to be passionate about initiating changes that are good for the business and seeing it through completion. Must be comfortable working in a complex, fast paced environment and have the ability to work across organizational lines as well as different lines of business in a partnership role

General Description:
This business analyst will sit within the sales operations group for the newly formed Food & Beverage Global Business Unit (FBGBU) focused on the Asia Pacific region. This role will focus on supporting the F&B Sales Teams in understanding and effectively using the Oracle sales processes and Tools. Regional liaison to the FBGBU Sales Operations in relating policy and best practices to Sales Team. Occasional evening and early morning hours to participate in global meetings as needed.

Responsibilities:
 Develop a deep understanding of the FBGBU sales processes and systems (with a focus on territory planning, pipeline management, forecasting and sales compensation). Develop a deep understanding of the FBGBU sales processes and systems (with a focus on quoting, ordering and approvals). Establish strong relationships with other key GBU groups (finance, business planning, and operations) as well as with the broader Oracle support groups (e.g. finance, Global Sales & Consulting Operations, HR, Global Incentive Comp, Deal Management, Legal, other regional sales ops teams) Collaborate with Corporate functions, Central GBU Operations, and Regional teams to assess local processes to eliminate complexity and inefficiencies. Partner with regional FBGBU sales teams to understand operational challenges and implement resolutions to identified issues Assist FBGBU field sales teams in understanding Oracle’s standard practices, policies, and tools Work with Sales teams and Finance to support accurate sales forecasting, effective pipeline management and reliable sales credit allocation. Support field enablement efforts Support implementation of new Oracle processes and systems including communications and enablement
Qualifications: 5+ years work experience in Sales or Business operations roles Outstanding organizational and problem solving skills. Ability to focus and set priorities. Ability to work in a rapidly changing international environment. Service orientated and a team player Ability to work under time constraints and deadlines. Excellent communication skills in English both spoken and written. Experience with systems used by Oracle Sales (e.g. Sales Cloud, SI, DAS, CPQ, etc.) is an advantage

Detailed Description and Job Requirements
Provides programs to improve operational efficiency, consistency, and compliance in support of the organization*s financial and tactical business objectives. Provides business practices and processes. Develops, communicates, and trains the organization on business practices and processes.

Serve as a liaison with other divisions such as Finance, Contracts, HR, Legal, Shared Services, Accounts Receivable, Purchasing, and Risk Management in an effort to ensure accurate and timely transaction processing. Collect, input, verify, correct, and analyze data to measure key performance indicator actual versus business objectives. Provide updates to management regarding budget to actual, informing them of deviations and opportunities. Provide management with economic impact and compliance issues surrounding key business decisions and/or deals. Communicate Oracle Business Practices to the organization and monitor process and approvals for full compliance. Drive implementation of new processes and procedures.

Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. Ability to collect, organize, and display data in spreadsheet format. Follow-through skills necessary to get information from internal and third parties and have data errors/omissions corrected. For this, relationship management skills strongly desired. Strong written and verbal communication skills. 8 plus years relevant work experience.
title: Business Analyst 4-Ops

description:
Deloitte Digital: Colliding the discipline of Deloitte with the power of creativity.
About the team
Who says work can’t be exciting? At Deloitte Digital, the worlds of business, creative, and technology intersect to transform the way we work, play, and communicate.
Our vision is simple: Empower clients to reimagine how they connect and engage with their customers. We provide clients with a full suite of digital services, covering digital strategy, user experience, content, creative, engineering and implementation across mobile, web and social media channels.
We employ over 400 people, comprising many of the country’s most talented online strategists, designers, engineers, marketers, copywriters, consultants, business analysts and quality assurance professionals. The integration of our passions and talents enables us to build more than just a website. We build new business capability by creating the right balance of creativity, communications and technology.
How are we different? Our difference comes from our diversity. We bring many different perspectives to our clients’ challenges and opportunities. We have the business acumen of a strategic advisor; the design capability of a creative agency and the engineering depth of a technology firm. Furthermore, we can shape our broader range of capabilities into an integrated solution for the more transformational projects requiring expertise in areas such as operations, human capital management, risk management and data analytics.
About You
Our studio in Canberra is growing as we cater for the rapid increase in demand for transformational digital services, due to recent policy developments and whole-of-government initiatives, that create new momentum for change within the public sector. Digital disruption has truly moved from the edges to the core of the Canberra economy!
We like working with bright, talented people who share our passion for all things Digital. With us, you get the chance to work on a variety of projects with some of Australia’s largest and most iconic organisations. Our projects are often high profile – leading, shaping and changing the way the local industry does digital.
The scope of work is always diverse – our strategy is centred on developing solutions for:Mobile applicationsInternet / IntranetCustomer experience designSocial mediaDesktop applicationsTechnology architecture and developmentSystem integrationManaged solutions

Skills / Experience Required
You will have had experience working in multi-disciplinary teams to undertake discovery required for digital transformation projectsYou will be comfortable conducting research activities – interviews, surveys, and desktop researchYou will have had substantial exposure to developing quantitative and qualitative analysis to inform research findingsYou will possess extensive design process experience to support a range of activities, including but not limited to service design, experience design, and UI designYou will possess extensive business analysis and requirements development experience on a range of complex engagements, and be comfortable supporting these activitiesYou will have a passion for developing reports and other project artefacts, and be expected to apply Deloitte consulting methods and tools to solve client business problems
Deloitte Culture
We are innovative and different because YOU are… we pride ourselves on our team of diverse, high performing Deloitte Professionals who are talented, supportive, inclusive and social – and who are at the heart of our success. Our aim is to ensure that all our people feel comfortable to bring their whole selves to work, and as a result, build a workplace that encourages the true spirit of 'And different'.
From day one at our firm you’ll be considered part of the Deloitte community and our development and career progression framework will help you develop the skills and capabilities that will set you up to succeed – in every sense of the word. At Deloitte, we assume that you perform other roles within your life…you could be a student, a teacher, a passionate hobbyist and a caring family member. We recognise the importance of balance and embrace agility, understanding that this means different things to each and every one of our employees.
Next Steps
If this sounds like an exciting career challenge, that aligns with your personal goals and expertise, we want to hear from you. Check out our YouTube page and social channels for further insights into life at Deloitte Digital. In the meantime, we look forward to receiving your application.
The minimum salary offered for this role is $70,000.
title: Consulting - Deloitte Digital Business Analyst

description:
Business Analyst - Enterprise Digital-SYD0006WR
Flexible work options - work smarter in a way that suits your lifestyle
18 weeks paid parental leave - for mum, dad & foster carers
Work within state of the art offices in Sydney's Barangaroo
The Opportunity
At PwC, we help Australian businesses, not-for-profits and governments create value and improve the way they work. From improving healthcare, to creating smarter cities and igniting Australia's start up industry, you'll build trust in society and solve important problems.

About the team
PwC's Enterprise Digital team specialise in solving problems and pain-points for businesses. We work with clients to build and deploy cutting-edge technology and bring greater automation to business processes. The team is not traditional consultants. It's a group of technical account managers and software engineers with a deep background in technology and problem solving.

Come and join the exciting, agile team! No formal IT training required, just a passion for technology and the willingness to support clients bring the digital age to life!

Some exciting projects include:
GPS tracking a major mining services company to minimise FBT and maximise fuel tax claims
Automating tax sensitisation of GL accounts to make accurate, timely and efficient tax classifications
Deploying our machine learning platform, Swift, around the world.
Automating the preparation of income tax calculations through our Tax Automate platform.
Continuous feature development of our global client engagement platform, Engagement Centre, to streamline corporate compliance.
Success does stem from a positive attitude, hard work and going the extra mile, but that's not all!

You will:
Have strong experience as a Business Analyst, and an ability to advise clients as to how to increase the likelihood of project success. You will also play an active role in client development, contributing to the strategic direction of the business.

Requirements of the role include:
Proven track record as a Business Analyst on large, complex projects.
Experience facilitating workshops with or interviewing business and technology stakeholders.
Experience in identifying impact on the organisation, end user, and customer in designing effective solutions.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills combined with initiative and an enthusiastic and energetic approach are essential.
Experience in operating in effective program governance structures, routines and reporting.
Propensity to predict client needs, and identify opportunities where we can support them in executing their strategies.
Javascript framework experience is strongly beneficial, in particular with React JS.
Knowledge of HTML or Adobe Suite is valuable.
About you
The brief is simple...

You have a solid background in a similar role, and demonstrate passionate for solving complex problems. You thrive in a collaborative and innovative culture and want to join a firm that values problem solvers, the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and key stakeholders.

Sound like you? Read on.

What we offer
Working for Australia's largest professional services firm you'll join a creative and collaborative team that delivers meaningful outcomes for a wide range of clients and access a global network spanning 157 countries.

Our culture and benefits are the reason why we were recognised as Australia's number one workplace by LinkedIn. Our state of the art offices embrace the very best technology has to offer and each person has access to flexible work options. Our dress policy is flexible too - you choose what you wear based on the kind of work you do with your team and clients.

Fostering an inclusive culture and embracing differences is at the centre of everything we do. At PwC, you will be empowered to be yourself and work with people from different backgrounds and points of view to achieve things you never thought possible. Get involved in our employee-led diversity networks (cultural, disability, LGBTI or gender equality) and benefit from our best-in-class policies such as 18 weeks maternity/paternity leave, flexible work and gender equity.

Up for a challenge? We are committed to helping our people unleash their passion and potential. Hard work does not go unrewarded and industry best coaching, mentoring, training and development are ready and waiting. If you have a genuine desire to make a difference and want to surround yourself with like-minded, talented and driven individuals who strive to do the same, apply now.

PwC is committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce. Our Reconciliation Action Plan sets out our commitment to increase Indigenous employment. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Australians.

Jane Boyle is the Recruitment Manager for the role. As the team experience high volumes of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all.
Job Technology & IT
Primary Location Sydney
Job Type Full-time
Referral Amount 3

description:
Dermapenworld is seeking a talented Product Manager/Business Analyst to be able to turn conceptual ideas into business requirements and technical solutions.
This role requires a highly organised, confident communicator who appreciates effective product design, creating change within the company by implementing business solutions both in workflows and Digital platforms, the company is expanding rapidly in the very dynamic worldwide Medical Dermatology/Aesthetics market place.
The role includes:
Setting up projects, decide the best approach and structure
Facilitating workshops to capture project objectives, map out requirements and design a viable solution
Champion the product vision and nurture understanding amongst the team
Technical support within the company for its new generation of products
Be the person that converts marketing concepts into technical solutions
Product Manager of the company’s digital platforms
Working with Marketing, Logistics, Accounting, manufacturing to turn Business requirements in technical formats and solutions.
Reporting to Head of marketing and CEO
Requirements
You will have:
Experience in roles to uncover objectives and converting them into technical solutions
Willingness to take on and lead a variety of projects spanning design and/or technical implementation, Technical support worldwide
Experience setting high-level tasks and working with a cross-functional team to break them down into stories and acceptance criteria
Hands-on experience working in cross-functional teams; interacting with and encouraging productive dialogue between designers, developers, third parties, clients and users to achieve desired business outcomes
Excellent communication (verbal and written English)
Pragmatic planning, delegation and multi-tasking skills
A High level of practical and technical understandings of G-Suite platform and applications.
An advanced high level of competency in the MS Word, Excel, Power Point platforms
It would be great if you also have:
Understanding of and appreciation for User Centered Design, Lean Product Development and Agile teams
Experience working within a software company environment
Experience working with Sketch, InVision, Autopilot, Teamwork, JIRA or similar design/project management tools
Experience working with remote teams
Understanding of Digital Marketing practices/terminology
Experience being involved in cross-channel campaigns
Benefits
We work in a modern office space in Terrey Hills, so would be ideal for those professionals living in the Northern Suburbs as it provides an easy location to access with onsite free parking. We operate in a relaxed professional environment, however there is no end to the variety and challenges that a fast-paced growth market provides.
Our team consists of a small group of highly motivated individuals that both have ownership interests along with members that pride themselves on success by achieving growth initiatives. There is always help at hand to overcome a challenge. We're a passionate bunch and never short of ideas and opinions.
We'll offer the right candidate a competitive salary, based upon your prior experience or demonstrable expertise in the field.
If you're as passionate about analysing business challenges and creating awesome technological solutions that provide real benefits, get in touch with a cover letter and your resume. If we select you to move forward we'll arrange short telephone call to find out a little more about you. All being well, we'll invite you to our offices for a chat in person.

description:
Gravity is a design and innovation consulting firm with a vision for disrupting the traditional consulting domain. We are powered by our Innovation Lab, where we challenge established ways of addressing business complexity through business design, service design and product design.

StrategyDotZero is Gravity’s proprietary platform intended to disrupt the way strategy is designed and executed across organisations. StrategyDotZero is a cloud-based application that takes a systemic and collaborative approach to strategy design and execution focussed on strategic alignment, capability improvement and enterprise business performance management.

description:
Job Description:
DXC Technology (NYSE: DXC) is the world’s leading independent, end-to-end IT services company, helping clients harness the power of innovation to thrive on change. Created by the merger of CSC and the Enterprise Services business of Hewlett Packard Enterprise, DXC Technology serves nearly 6,000 private and public sector clients across 70 countries. The company’s technology independence, global talent and extensive partner alliance combine to deliver powerful next-generation IT services and solutions. DXC Technology is recognised among the best corporate citizens globally. For more information, visit www.dxc.technology

As a Business Analyst, you will work closely with the webPAS Offering Manager to ensure that Offering features, functional and technical requirements are accurately defined, documented, prioritised and communicated to all relevant parties. This will also be done by assessing each Roadmap Item and understanding the business drivers and values to both the Customers and DXC.

 Responsibilities:
Provide knowledge of the offering or portfolio, support pre sales work and ongoing product development
Working with cross multi-disciplinary and functional teams
Lead, identify, define and document detailed business requirements and functional content features needed to meet requirements.
Assist in defining solution services and map these to standard business processes
Provide analysis and document business requirements and processes to specify application behaviours into quality Business Requirement documents
Provides input into developing and modifying systems
Facilitates meetings with clients to gather and document requirements and explore potential solutions

Key skills and experience:
Proven experience in business analysis, and business process modelling methodologies
Experience working on Business projects within large, complex, enterprise environments
Minimum 3 years’ experience in the healthcare IT industry
Functional understanding of existing healthcare software
Strong technical skills with a proven ability to translate and document stakeholder needs into business and solution requirements
Experience developing process maps, scenarios, and use cases and user stories
Strong relationship management skills including facilitation, listening and negotiating
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Bachelor's degree in business administration, information systems, or related field (preferred)

This is an outstanding opportunity for a highly-motivated individual to draw upon their experience and further their career with an organisation that is truly committed to ongoing career development and success.

About Us
UXC, CSC and HP ES have come together to create one of the largest IT services companies in Australia and New Zealand - DXC Technology.
As part of the DXC group, DXC Consulting provides its employees with an unrivalled opportunity to work with the best clients and IT consultants, as well as the best tools, technologies and expertise in the industry.

We pride ourselves on high quality execution, providing opportunities to work within a variety of clients and industries and recognising performance and commitment. We're passionate about what we do, and we strive to make a positive impact, not just on the lives of our clients and candidates, but with our colleagues too.

DXC Consulting is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

description:
Digital Business Analyst-SYD000752
Flexible work options - work smarter in a way that suits your lifestyle.
18 weeks paid parental leave - for mum, dad & foster carers.
Opportunities available in both Sydney or Brisbane

Looking for an exciting, diverse and challenging new role with a global impact? Join a newly formed technology team in Australia's largest professional services firm that delivers cutting-edge digital products and automation solutions for our Assurance practice.

The Opportunity
At PwC, we help Australian businesses, not-for-profits and governments create value and improve the way they work. From improving healthcare, to creating smarter cities and igniting Australia’s start up industry, you’ll build trust in society and solve important problems.

The Assurance Innovation Lab is a small team of highly experienced designers, developers, data scientists and analysts who are responsible for delivering digital products and automation solutions to PwC’s Assurance business across the Asia-Pacific region.

We partner with subject matter experts across the business to advise on, design and develop technology-enabled solutions that help to transform the way we deliver assurance services to our clients.

Our Assurance business delivers a broad range of financial audit and risk advisory services. Our teams work with clients to help them protect and strengthen every aspect of their business, from people to performance, strategy to systems, and business plans to business resilience.

The Role
As the Digital Business Analyst you will be responsible for partnering with our client-facing teams and business subject matter experts to facilitate requirements gathering workshops, deconstruct processes and identify methods for standardising the way that they are delivered.
On a day-to-day basis you will be:
Facilitating business process analysis workshops with client-facing teams.
Applying human centred design principles in the design of products, services, and internal processes.
Deconstructing and documenting user stories, features and requirements in product backlogs.
Translating business process flows into repeatable workflows and business rules.
Partnering with designers and developers in the Digital CoE to help translate business needs into technical development requirements.
Facilitating engagement with business teams, including support during test planning and execution.
Actively participating in daily team stand-ups.
Participating in firmwide business analysis forums and communities to share ideas and contribute to our body of knowledge.

About you
The brief is simple...

Applicants must be able to demonstrate the following key capabilities and behaviours:
Exceptional problem-solving and critical thinking skills, an analytical mindset and outstanding attention to detail.
Strong presentation and facilitation skills in large group settings.
Experience applying design thinking methods and human centered design principles to solve business problems.
Strong experience writing user stories, business requirements and functional specifications.
Experience documenting processes using Business Process Model and Notation (BPMN).
Ability to understand complex technical requirements.
Ability to work efficiently with remote teams using collaboration technology.
Ability to identify issues and solve complex problems as part of a team.
Ability to remain calm when under pressure and meet demanding deadlines.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Experience working in Professional Services, Financial Services or Consulting environments.

Ideally, you will also have:
Experience developing low fidelity user interface wireframes.
Experience working on projects that follow an Agile Scrum methodology.
Experience documenting user stories, features and requirements in an Agile work management tool such as Microsoft’s Visual Studio Team Services (VSTS).

Sound like you? Read on.

What we offer
Working for Australia’s largest professional services firm you’ll join a global network spanning 157 countries that delivers meaningful outcomes for a wide range of clients.

Our culture and benefits are why we’re LinkedIn’s number one Australian workplace. With state of the art offices and premium technology, each person has access to flexible work options. The dress policy is flexible too – you choose what you wear based on the work you do with your team and clients.

Fostering an inclusive culture and embracing differences is at the core of everything we do. PwC empowers you to be yourself and work with people from many backgrounds to achieve things never thought possible. Get involved in our employee-led diversity networks (cultural, disability, LGBTI or gender equality) and benefit from our best-in-class policies such as 18 weeks maternity/paternity leave, flexible work and gender equity.

Up for a challenge? We’re committed to helping our people unleash their potential. Hard work doesn’t go unrewarded and industry best coaching, mentoring, training and development are ready and waiting. If you hold a genuine desire to make a difference and want to surround yourself with like-minded, talented and driven individuals who strive to do the same, apply now.

PwC is committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce. Our Reconciliation Action Plan sets out our commitment to increase Indigenous employment. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Australians.

Sam Thomas is the Recruitment Manager for the role. As the team experience high volumes of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all.
