description:
Workstream Specialist

Alchemy Recruitment Consulting is pleased to announce a new vacancy for a Workstream Specialist to join our prestigious mining client on a 12-month contract. In this role you will be working from Brisbane and supporting a project team responsible rolling out new maintenance strategies across multiple mining operations in Australia.

In this role you will provide support to the Maintenance Strategy Program assisting project managers with analysis, value approvals, tracking and reporting for allocated projects – primarily coal fixed plant maintenance projects.

Key accountabilities:
Produce value estimates in accordance with company guidelines for all project benefits - cost, availability, culture and safety.
Facilitate progression through approval processes by proving quality analysis, supporting information and timely engagement of approvers.
Facilitate the development and tracking of project schedules to enable progress reporting
Assist in the collation of project progress reports for business stakeholders
Review project value estimates produced by others and facilitate progression through approval processes.
Ensure tasks related to value calculation, tracking and reporting are included in project schedules and support project managers with progress updates and escalation of risks and issues.
Produce project value reporting by collating and reviewing all project benefits, comparing to plans/budgets and undertaking variance analysis.
Compile value trend information and provide advice regarding corrective actions.
Develop reliable project value estimates for budget and forecast purposes.
Provides value estimates information and guidance to impacted company Assets to assist with the preparation of budgets and forecasts.
Communicate and present on value realization as appropriate including weekly updates in value tracking system.


About you

With significant exposure to business change projects, you will have substantial experience in analysis, tracking and reporting across multiple projects within a fast-paced environment. Your ability to work with project teams, PMO, and Finance resources, along with your knowledge of financial analysis tools and methods, will enable your success in this role. Your attention to detail and proactivity are evident at all times.

Skills required
Experience undertaking value analysis (or equivalent financial analysis) across multiple projects in a program environment.
Highly developed oral and written communication skills.
Ability to work as an effective team member as well as an energetic individual.
Ability to support project managers with project reporting requirements.
Ability to execute tasks independently with minimal guidance.
Great organisational skills to handle multiple projects simultaneously under tight deadlines.
Proven ability to engage senior stakeholders.
Excellent working knowledge of MS Office products.
Ability to work to tight timeframes in a complex and demanding environment.
Ideally, you will have:
Minimum 3 years financial analysis and budgeting experience
Experience in a program environment in a large global organisation
Highly proficient in SAP and BI reporting
Highly proficient in developing MS Excel financial models
Highly proficient in developing MS Powerpoint packs
Professional Accounting and/or Project Management qualifications are desirable
Proficient in developing MS project schedules
title: Workstream Specialist / Business Analyst

description:
We are a large and fully integrated infrastructure business chartered with a responsibility that is pivotal to the success of Queensland and its people. Our culture is one based around safety and performance.

We are looking for an experienced Senior Business Analyst to join our Portfolio Management Office in Brisbane. The purpose of this role is to strengthen existing datasets and refine/develop underlying processes within the projects function for the projects being delivered by Queensland Rail.

Key responsibilities will include:

Develop, manage and implement a data dictionary across the projects function for all underlying systems currently in use.
Coordinate with internal and external stakeholders on both system/data requirements and ensuring the consistent application of data definitions.
Identify gaps in existing processes, and engage necessary stakeholders to develop and implement a revised process which addresses these gaps and/or risks.
Perform first line assurance spot-checks of newly revised processes to ensure that the new process is effectively embedded. Where deficiencies are identified, provide coaching to staff to address concerns.
Monitor integrity of data stored within project systems to identify areas for improvement or potential risks that require remediation.
Draft business and data requirement documentation for project systems, including managing consultations and communications with internal and external stakeholders in relation to these requirements.
Build relationships with Queensland Rail business units, external providers and Queensland Rail staff in order to streamline necessary approvals and documentation for refinements to both data and processes.
Input and extract data from Asset, Project and Operational Management systems.
Perform adhoc data analysis in support of senior leadership requests.


The successful applicant will possess:

Previous experience working at the Senior Business or Finance Analyst level

A strong ability to extract and interpret data from multiple systems and translate this into management information
Advanced stakeholder engagement skills with the ability to bring multiple stakeholders together for a common goal

A strong work ethic and the ability to function successfully within a team environment

Exposure to a range of Project/Portfolio Management Software (prior working knowledge of SAP would be advantageous)

This is a 12 month contract position based within our Brisbane CBD office, working Monday to Friday, 38 hours per week. The salary on offer for this role is $103,995 + Super.

The recruitment and selection process for this position might require shortlisted applicants to undertake Psychometric Assessment, Pre-Employment Health Assessment and background checks that might also include Criminal History and Credit Checks.

Queensland Rail is an equal opportunity employer and encourages women, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disabilities and people from non-English speaking backgrounds to apply for this position.

Apply to position number 72227 by clicking onto the "Apply" button. Please submit a resume and covering letter outlining relevant experience by 5pm on Thursday 25th October 2018.

To learn more about this Queensland Rail career opportunity call Michael Becker on (07) 3072 2599.

description:
Our Asset Management division is seeking an Analyst to focus on User Access Management in our Sydney office for a 12 months fixed term contract.

You will be responsible for maintaining application inventories which list all business applications owned, or in use by, the group and co-ordinating user access and application reviews.

You will work with various business teams and support staff globally assessing new applications and business initiatives, coordinating with support areas to ensure all applications are included in the User Access Management plan. You will also be involved in business analysis activities for the design, definition and implementation of refined IAM controls across the Asset Management division, including onboarding of prioritised applications to our IAM governance platform (SailPoint IIQ). This position will suit a Business Analyst with knowledge of financial markets, systems and processes.

To be successful in this role you will have previous experience in a similar position and possess the ability and drive to operate autonomously. Outstanding verbal and written communication skills are expected as is the ability to engage and build relationships at all levels, particularly when under pressing and time-driven circumstances.

If you believe you present with the required skills, please apply now.

Macquarie Asset Management (MAM; formerly known as Macquarie Funds Group) is a full-service asset manager, offering a diverse range of products including securities investment management, infrastructure and real asset management, and fund and equity-based structured products.MAM comprises the following three divisions:
Macquarie Infrastructure and Real AssetsMacquarie Investment ManagementMacquarie Specialised Investment Solutions.

Find out more about Macquarie at www.macquarie.com/about

Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

We facilitate a range of flexible working arrangements within our teams. Talk to us about what flexibility may be available.
title: Business Analyst - User Access Management

description:
Why become a Business Analyst at Noggin?

Here at Noggin we're smart, innovative and we like to get elbows deep in solving some of the world's most challenging problems. We use the best tools and methodologies available and we are constantly looking for ways to improve.

As our Business Analyst, you will work as part of a talented, pragmatic and collaborative team. You'll have the opportunity to work end-to-end on chunky, complex projects across a variety of industries and verticals.

You'll ensure we run effective workshops with the customer; gather and document clear requirements; design and build practical solutions; and finally test these thoroughly before moving into user training and client hand-over. So, if you're looking for a role where you can do interesting, challenging, impactful work alongside exceptional people – we're the right place for you.

What does it take to be a Noggin?

You are a Tertiary qualified, experienced Business Analyst who has hands-on experience engaging with clients, eliciting user requirements and developing great software implementations from this. You love diversity - of work, people, ideas and projects so you're looking for an opportunity that will challenge you in different ways.

Throughout your career so far, you've developed an ability to articulate complex user stories and technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. You are methodical in your approach, and pride yourself in developing clear, accurate and succinct documentation and artifacts throughout the project life-cycle.

You strike the perfect balance between creative and pragmatic and you're able to come up with innovative solutions to complex and varied business problems. Not only this, but you get a kick out of seeing your software configurations being successfully used and delivering awesome outcomes to your clients and users.

What does success look like in this role?

Within your first 3 months, you will be fully up to speed with Noggin's software, systems and processes and you will be working effectively as part of the project team on a number of projects.

Within your first 6 months, you will be confident in your ability to engage with clients around our solutions. You will run workshops, document user requirements, design solutions as well as take these through config and testing with limited guidance and input.

12 months and beyond, you will be self-managed and accountable for the solutions you deliver. Plus you're a knowledgeable and valued member of the team who has started to take on some mentoring responsibilities to guide new employees who come into the business.

To apply, please use the online application link. For further information or to arrange a confidential discussion, please email talent@noggin.io.

Please note, you must have valid and unrestricted work rights for Australia to be considered for this role. No Agencies Please.
title: Business Analyst

description:
Australian Unity is a national health, wealth and living mutual company providing products and services designed to help people thrive. More than one million Australians have created a brighter future with us. We are a mutual organisation with 280,000 members, more than 7000 employees and generating more than $2 billion in revenues per annum.

Your Role

An exciting permanent full time opportunity has become available within our newly formed Customer, Digital & Technology (CDT) function for a Senior Agile Business Analyst. Reporting directly to the Head of Agile Delivery, you will be part of an enthusiastic team working on a number of digital and process automation initiatives.

You will work with an agile mind set, facilitate discovery workshops and agile ceremonies and develop suitable user stories and artefacts required by your team. You will influence behaviours, liaise and negotiate with key stakeholders across the organisation and will contribute to thought leadership in the team. In addition, you will offer technical guidance across the application and solution development lifecycle to ensure alignment to Australian Unity’s strategy and desired customer outcomes.

To be successful in securing this role you will have:
Extensive business analysis experience with proven stakeholder mgmt. skills
Experience of running and facilitating customer journey, process mapping, design and inception workshops.
Experience in leading and working with one or more project teams
A high level of EQ together with strong people skills and the ability to work in an unstructured environment
Solid cross-functional experience in complex Business and IT environments working as a Senior or Lead Business Analyst
Domain experience in Health Insurance, Banking, Aged Care businesses will be an advantage
Experience working on large scale, multi-disciplinary projects focusing on business change, internal IT and infrastructure
Excellent communication, stakeholder management and influencing skills
Strong Agile knowledge and demonstrated experience in facilitating customer journey workshops, inception sessions and requirement gathering sessions
Experience of working with Human Centred Design, Lean process methodologies and Six Sigma highly regarded
Experience of working with Automation tools like RPA will be a bonus
CBAP certification and relevant qualifications highly regarded
Excellent written and verbal communication skills


Your work at Australian Unity will be focused on helping others to thrive, and so we seek to create a work environment that supports you to thrive in your career. We operate with commercial principles and with a strong social purpose to create community value. The culture at Australian Unity is one that truly operates from its values of Bold, Warm and Honest and we are keen to connect as a priority with those who align with this.

Join us and thrive!
[Not translated in selected language]
title: Senior Business Analyst

description:
Computershare Plan Managers (CPM) is the division within Computershare responsible for the end to end process that provides daily delivery of administrative and client services to the Plan Manager clients and their individual employee share plan holders. CPM is the largest provider of Employee Share Plan management services in Australia and manages the share plans for over 100 clients covering approximately 2,000,000 employee share plan participants.

Role:
The Process, Knowledge & Risk team is responsible for the following areas:

Change and Process control
Knowledge & Training, including Organisation Development
Risk, Quality & Compliance functions

Reporting to the Senior Manager of the Process, Knowledge & Risk team, this role is responsible for the identification, analysis and effective management of continuous improvement initiatives across all of CPM.

On a daily basis you will look at how to reduce cost and risk from business, find efficiencies and support and implement change management. Each day will be varied and involve conducting business analysis, sitting with the CPM teams to look at how they do things and engaging with stakeholders to find solutions to identified problems.
The successful candidate will be someone who has a proactive attitude, enjoys working autonomously and welcomes the opportunity to create change and influence departmental direction. You will be an excellent communicator and problem solver as your ability to engage and influence stakeholders will be the key to success in this role.
Key Responsibilities include (but not limited to):

Undertake analysis of current and ongoing business process and task management to identify opportunities for cost and risk reduction. Provide high level cost benefit in analysis of business improvement recommendations
Identify stakeholder roles and responsibilities required to execute the continuous improvement initiatives
Support delivery of and review the effectiveness of continuous improvement initiatives
Contribute to larger projects impacting CPM but managed by other parts of the business or complete individual self-contained initiatives
Promote a culture of change by proactively and effectively managing change through continuous improvement
Build and maintain effective lines of communication with all relevant stakeholders in relation continuous improvement initiatives.
Use stakeholders to obtain relevant input and feedback on continuous improvement initiatives being undertaken.
Document initiative benefits, risks, requirements and action plan.

To ensure your success in this role you will bring:

Experience in project management (continuous improvement initiatives)
Experience in managing limited resources and conflicting deadlines
Excellent Microsoft Office skills including advanced Excel knowledge

Desired Experience:

Experience in relation to the employee share plan industry
Experience in relation to the share registry and financial services industries

The benefits:

Work for a large global corporation (over 15,000 employees) with the opportunity for career progression
Great discounts and benefits across a variety of companies and access to our Employee Share Plan
A wide variety of internal training courses supported by our Learning and Development team
A supportive working environment, with friendly peers and management
Easy access to public transport, bicycle and walking paths, with an onsite Gym, Café and games room
To apply, please click on the 'Apply' button below and follow the application process.

We want every person who joins our team, every customer and every supplier to feel welcome. We see diversity as a source of strength - the more perspectives we have, the better equipped we’ll be to meet the demands of our diverse global customer base. We believe in equality for everyone, regardless of age, ethnicity, gender identity, race, religion, disability or sexual orientation. Please visit our website to read about our Diversity and Inclusion Policy.
| CERTAINTY | INGENUITY | ADVANTAGE |
title: Business Analyst (Business Improvement)

description:
Manages the elicitation and management of requirements across the system development lifecycle. Provides guidance to new clients and existing customers in the preparation of the requirement documents to ensure that the characteristics of the functionality is well defined, clear and understood by customers as well as the internal organization.


Manages on going contractual relationships and the operational delivery of services to clients for an account or group of accounts.


Serves as the primary point of contact with clients and ensures client satisfaction.
From a business and system requirement perspective supports design, development, testing, deployment and transition for less complicated functionality into operation when required.
Builds and maintains strong client relationships and provides day to day client advice.
With guidance designs solutions to clients ensuring that SLA’s (service level agreements) and KPI’s (key performance indicators) are met.
Provides basic user training on new functionality and handles user queries regarding system functionality.
Elicits, writes and reviews with a more senior colleague detailed business and system requirements from business owners and stakeholders.
Writes and produces detailed functional specifications for others.
Assists others (or guides the technical writer) in production of operational and user documentation including release notes.
Responds to unresolved production support issues and participate in analysis and resolution on behalf of the business.
Under direct supervision, provides input and insight into administration of project schedule, scope of work and budget, ensuring that operational teams and subcontractors understand client requirements.
Communicates client requirements to operational teams and subcontractors.
Promotes the organization’s capabilities to clients, identifying where possible sales opportunities which are forwarded to the account managers.
Education Required: Degree qualified in Computer Science, Business/Finance or related discipline, or equivalent work experience.
Experience Required: At least 3years.
Special Qualifications:
Nasdaq is an equal opportunity employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, color, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information or any other status protected by applicable law.
title: Senior Business Analyst

description:
We Offer Challenging Work with Real Meaning

The work we do at Cochlear helps people with hearing loss to connect to others and live full lives. Whether you are involved in designing devices, manufacturing quality products, providing services to customers or supporting business processes, the work at Cochlear is mentally stimulating and emotionally worthwhile.

Due to expansion in this department we are seeking a Senior IT Business Analyst to join our Global IT team in Sydney and provide support to the APAC region. In this role you will partner with business to define the requirements and solutions and propose process and efficiency improvements. The main responsibilities of this role include:

Defining and documenting business requirements based on user needs, estimating cost and changes to existing applications, systems & platforms
Developing business cases, justification and cost analysis and presenting them to the business and IT stakeholders
Defining functional, non-functional and transition solution requirements and managing the solution delivery lifecycle
Evaluating new technology solutions, preparing gap analysis reports and providing recommendations on their fit with current and desired business processes
Reviewing and improving existing business processes
Supporting Program Managers and managing some low complexity projects
You Bring Your Skills and Experience
As we grow, we are looking for people with highly specialised skills who share our passion for changing the lives of our customers. To add value to Cochlear in this role you'll be able to demonstrate the following skills, experience and attributes:

Degree in Business, Commerce, Computing, Engineering or equivalent
Knowledge of project management methodologies
Experience working in a mix of technology environments, preferably incorporating integrated digital platforms including e-commerce
Demonstrated experience in identifying, researching, evaluating and recommending new solutions.
Experience working in a global organisation supporting APAC region
Experience in managing IT projects
Strong business analysis background and documentation skills
Good problem solving and analysis
Excellent communication, stakeholder management and influencing skills
Demonstrated critical thinking
To help us attract and retain people with the right skills we aim to pay competitively and offer flexible benefits such as salary continuance insurance, salary sacrifice options, novated leasing, employee support services, Cochlear Advantage employee discount program, educational assistance (conditions apply) and flexible work policy.

To apply for the position please complete the application form online. Once you complete your application, our comprehensive recruitment process includes:

Application reviews
Interviews
Capability assessment
References
Confirmation of qualifications and work rights
To keep up to date on the status of your application, log into our recruitment portal at any time.

Take the first step towards a career with Cochlear. A career you can be proud of. Apply online today.

#cochlearcareers

description:
Bring your Financial Markets experience and help us implement a large scale project, giving you exposure to a variety of our Commodities and Global Market businesses, products and systems.

In rolling out a new business function, Central Rates Management[MM1] on a new Rates Management System, you will help to add efficiency and transparency to the large and logistically-complex task of assembling all of the required rates to accurately value the team’s substantial and diverse trading book on a daily basis.

You’ll be involved in analysing legacy systems rates collection / creation processes, translating required rates outcomes into Rate Management Systems configurations, identifying and specifying functional gaps in the system, validating & testing migrated rates processes, as well as co-ordinating wider testing of the system configurations with stakeholders outside of the team.

You will also be involved with documenting the Rates Management System configurations for broader corporate visibility and approval, contributing to the daily operations of production and taking action to comply with the team’s Rates governance framework. You’ll also regularly be tasked with reporting and tracking progress against a detailed rollout project plan, seeing you work closely with business teams as well as IT developers to ensure the veracity of systems functionality[MM2] .

You will need to bring an appropriate tertiary qualification in a Commerce, Business or Finance discipline and knowledge of financial derivatives is essential, as is relevant experience in a business analyst capacity; preferably in new business implementation within financial services. If you can read Linux script and Python, this will be very highly-regarded. We’d like you also to have gained some experience in risk or operational control/technology function.

We work in a rapidly-changing business environment so it��s important that you retain high levels of detail and accuracy in your work. There will be both quantitative and qualitative aspects to this role so being able to solve a variety of issues is essential. You need to be commercial in your approach, able to work in a team and present as confident and outgoing to build strong working relationships at all levels.

If you feel this challenging and dynamic role in a global business will provide you with outstanding career and development opportunities, then we’d be pleased to hear from you. With a strong performance in the role, the opportunity may exist to transition to a full time position at the end of the contract.

To apply, you’ll need to submit a covering letter and concise resume. Please note: applications without a covering letter will not be considered.

Find out more about Macquarie careers atwww.macquarie.com/careers

Commodities and Global Markets provides clients with an integrated, end-to-end offering across global markets including equities, fixed income, foreign exchange and commodities

Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

#LI-AT

description:
Reporting to a Principal Systems Engineer Lead in a team of Business Analysts, System Engineers and Solution Architects, the role of this position is to define, specify and document systems solutions for new or on-going projects for customers of CTS Australasia. Learning, understanding and providing assistance for technical matters relating to new and existing systems is key to this position . The role will also be required to provide engineering support to development, operations teams and take ownership of engineering issues .

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:
To provide business analysis and systems engineering leadership for new and ongoing projects
To maintain good relationships with Company staff, Customer representatives and other stakeholders
To take the lead on technical presentations, discussions and workshops with the customer
To liaise with customers on project requirements and requested variations
To analyse and capture user requirements using requirements management tools
To elaborate and define system and sub-system requirements from user requirements
To work directly with Software and Test Engineers in order to deliver and develop solutions
To assist with the integration of solutions both internal teams and external vendors
To ensure that solutions comply with appropriate standards and, legislation, and stakeholder requirements
To develop functional specifications and related deliverables from user, system and sub-system requirements
To assist in the production of Solution Architecture and System Architecture documents
To maintain and review engineering and technical documents and work products
To ensure project, development, and test teams are remain properly appraised of requirements and system solutions
To provide systems advice and direction for testing of relevant system and sub-systems for developed solutions, and prepare testing documentation and materials where necessary
To work with engineers and service staff to refine systems and processes associated with a new, significant variation orders

General Duties and Responsibilities:
Comply with Cubic’s Quality Management System
Comply with Cubic Occupational Health, Safety and Environment policies and procedures
Comply with security in accordance with established policies and procedures of the organisations
Comply with Cubic Human Resources Procedures
Other duties as requested

Minimum Job Requirements:
Degree in system, software or electrical engineering or related discipline (or equivalent experience)

Desirable:
Post graduate study in Systems Engineering or related area
INCOSE Certification
Project Management certification

Skills/Experience/Knowledge
7+ years experience working in a software driven technology environment
5+ years experience at a team level in development or technology integration across complex technology solutions
3+ years experience in dealing at customer interface level
Experience at a team level in development or technology integration teams
Formal Systems Engineering Experience
Familiarity with Software Development Life Cycles using both Waterfall and Agile approaches
Familiarity with expressing system designs using UML or other modelling language
Ability to troubleshoot and debug technical issues
Knowledge of relevant engineering standards and relevant “Health and Safety” legislative requirements
Experience of working in a formal project structure following ISO 9001 processes
Project experience with software development projects

Desirable:
Experience with automated fare collection systems, including customer facing and back office technologies
Solid SQL, data management and relational database skills
Data modelling and system design using formal notations
Project co-ordination experience
Human factors knowledge and familiarity with HMI considerations
Knowledge of embedded devices and technology, and engineered IT system solutions
Knowledge of ticketing or similar applications involving large networks of unattended/passenger-operated devices
Knowledge of relevant standards in systems engineering domains such as INCOSE, ISO/IEC 15288, EIA-632, or Mil-Std 499, or business analysis domains such as IIBA BABOK
Worked with NFC, contactless smartcards, credit card personalization bureaus, payment systems and retail networks
Familiar with standards such as ISO 27001, PCI

Personal Qualities
Willingness to learn with an open mind.
Self-motivated with an ability to work autonomously but also be an integral member of the Engineering Team
Ability to liaise effectively with project teams, project managers and the Customer
Ability to communicate well, both verbally and in writing, with good presentation skills
Commercially aware and able to protect Cubic’s business interests while striving to deliver superior products and services
Ability to learn and be a system reference expert
Aware of software development best practice and able to apply standards and procedures effectively
High level problem solving skills
Excellent system level understanding of complex systems
Ability to occasionally travel both intrastate and overseas
The ability to work well under pressure in a variety of situations

Condition of Employment:
Successful outcome of a National Police Check
Worker Type:

Employee
title: Senior Systems Engineer/Business Analyst

description:
Why become a Senior Business Analyst at Noggin?

Here at Noggin we're smart, innovative and we like to get elbows deep in solving some of the world's most challenging problems. We use the best tools and methodologies available and we are constantly looking for ways to improve.

As our Senior Business Analyst, you will work as part of a talented, pragmatic and collaborative team. You'll have the opportunity to work end-to-end on chunky, complex projects across a variety of industries and verticals.

You'll ensure we run effective workshops with the customer; gather and document clear requirements; design and build practical solutions; and finally test these thoroughly before moving into user training and client hand-over. So, if you're looking for a role where you can do interesting, challenging, impactful work alongside exceptional people – we're the right place for you.

What does it take to be a Noggin?

You are a Tertiary qualified, experienced Senior Business Analyst who has significant hands-on experience engaging with clients, eliciting user requirements and developing great software implementations from this. You love diversity - of work, people, ideas and projects so you're looking for an opportunity that will challenge you in different ways.

Throughout your career so far, you've developed an ability to articulate complex user stories and technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. You are methodical in your approach, and pride yourself in developing clear, accurate and succinct documentation and artifacts throughout the project life-cycle. In addition to this, you've also had the opportunity to provide other (less experienced) BA's with mentorship and guidance.

You strike the perfect balance between creative and pragmatic and you're able to come up with innovative solutions to complex and varied business problems. You get a kick out of seeing your the work that you and your team do, make a genuine impact on the lives of your users and clients.

What does success look like in this role?

Within your first 3 months, you will be fully up to speed with Noggin's software, systems and processes and you will be working effectively as part of the project team on a number of projects - taking the lead on the BA work.

Within your first 6 months, you will be confident in your ability to engage with clients around our solutions. You will run workshops, document user requirements, design solutions as well as take these through config and testing with limited guidance and input. Additionally, you'll be in a position to lead and guide others around Noggin's software implementation methodology, systems and processes.

12 months and beyond, you will be self-managed and accountable for the solutions you deliver. You'll have successfully helped develop and coach our Business Systems Analysts into full-fledged Business Analysts. You're a knowledgeable, valued member of the team who is well-liked and respected and you're on the path to becoming a BA team leader as part of your own career development.

To apply, please use the online application link. For further information or to arrange a confidential discussion, please email talent@noggin.io ( talent@noggin.io ).

Please note, you must have valid and unrestricted work rights for Australia to be considered for this role. No Agencies Please.

description:
As the Lead Business Analyst you will lead a team to deliver initiatives that enhance AGL's omni-channel customer experience while delivering a positive commercial impact.
After a period of successful activity, the Improvements Team are now in creative ideation phase. During this pivotal time your ability to successfully articulate business benefits of the team's developments will be important to your and your team's success. Additionally, you will take end-to-end accountability for overseeing all analysis activities from ideation to delivery.

Your key responsibilities will be to:
Facilitate ideation all the way through to delivery
Perform and manage your own business analysis activities
Support the team and ensure produced BA artefacts are produced in a consistent fashion across the entire team
Provide leadership and support to your team of direct reports
Create Lean Canvases and articulate the benefit metrics that support the business case
To be successful, you'll have:
Demonstrated experience as a Senior or Lead Business Analyst as well as experience in both agile and waterfall methodologies
Multiple instances of proficiently delivering complex, large initiatives end-to-end in an agile environment
Demonstrated experience of lean agile techniques
Exceptional stakeholder management skills with demonstratable strengths in influencing and conflict resolution
Advanced ability to think independently, and diplomatically challenge assumptions
Additional experience as a Team Lead or a formal mentor will also set you apart from the pack

What's in it for you?
You'll be working in an A-grade building with state of the art activity based working facilities. Being supported by our new flexible ways of working. We call it Smarter Working.

You'll get the opportunity to work with some of the most engaged and innovative in the business. Being exposed to more opportunities to advance your skills and career.

Working in a company the size of ours the sky's the limit for your career aspirations and we're focused on investing in you.


About us
It truly is an exciting time to be part of AGL Energy as we lead the way in generating sustainable energy solutions for all Australians.

With a heritage of over 175 years and listed in the top 50 companies on the ASX, AGL offers a genuinely diverse, safe and supportive work environment, where "actions not words" fosters a culture of achievement and personal development.



Come with us on a journey of exploration and creativity, doing the same things differently, better, faster by encompassing innovation and passion for a more sustainable world.
title: Lead Business Analyst - Improvements

description:
Work type: Permanent Full time
Location: Aust - VIC Metro
NAB is looking for a Senior Business Analyst in the CRM Service

We are one of Australia’s biggest banks – but we know that life’s about more than money. It’s about the connections we share with our customers, and the great things we can do to make life easier for them.

That’s why we’re so driven to do great things in the tech space. NAB is rapidly building a top-notch engineering capability and culture; adopting FinTech start-up mentality and financial innovation. We are working more agile than ever, so that we can deliver a great banking experience to our customers.

Within our CRM domain we’re looking for a Senior Business Analyst to join our Customer Relationship Management Service and to help deliver our Enterprise CRM system utilising Salesforce. Our goal is to deliver a world class CRM that bankers will embrace and that will enable our bankers to provide quality customer whether on the road or in the office. You’ll be applying your analytical skills to make our CRM Go Live activities and DevOps a smooth ride!

Would you like to be part of a high performing and agile program team to roll out the Salesforce platform across the bank?
We believe if you are passionate about agile business analysis and quality release management you would enjoy the role of a Senior Business Analyst in the squad of engineers to uplift our release process and DevOps in the CRM Service. For us, Engineers are the primary sources of knowledge and information in any technology field or domain. As a Senior Business Analyst, you would help us to make our monthly releases smooth and pleasant experience for the entire program team.

Just like your colleagues, you are continuously learning. Your proactive and results-oriented attitude ensures that you always strive for the best. You work in a cross functional team, and together we can take each other to new heights.

If you think this is for you, we invite you to apply for this role.

What you need:

4+ years of business analysis experience with a desire of simplification and automation
Strong experience and understanding of key release management activities and ability to manage those activities in a fast-paced environment
Immaculate attention to detail
Ability to deliver high quality user stories for engineers to uplift DevOps and release processes
Strong analytical skills and proven track record solving difficult problems
Outstanding social and communication skills
Motivated self-starter who can work independently and drive solutions
Experienced in Agile / Scrum projects
Desirable skills & knowledge:

Experience in CRM platform (Salesforce/MS Dynamics)
Background in cloud-native architecture
Experience with test-driven development, test automation & continuous delivery
Experience with DevOps tools such as Git Hub, and Jenkins would be considered an advantage
Main Activities:

Work with the team of engineers and engineering managers to improve internal release stakeholder engagement
Manage and drive release activities within CRM Service together with DevOps and Automation Lead
Raising change ticketsTracking required release documentationManage UAT sign offs
-Run PIR and “Go -No Go” meetings
Release status reportingSend out release communications for the internal delivery team
Support Engineering Managers to assess and understand dependencies between releases
Manage and update Release Calendar and physical Release Board to embrace agile delivery
Document user stories for technical DevOps features to help technical team to deliver fast and simple way
Just as important as all the above technical skills is your willingness to arrive every day with an open mind and passionate outlook, your ability to have fun, step outside of your comfort zone and be part of NAB’s journey to become a top-notch engineering organisation.

We offer:

Fast paced environment, with leading edge technology and innovation
Work in a collaborative environment with highly talented and motivated colleagues that are passionate about knowledge sharing
Salary confirming to market standards
Flexible working policy
Are you keen to know more or apply? There are plenty of opportunities awaiting you!

(You need to be a citizen of Australia or New Zealand, or hold a permanent residency visa to apply.)

At NAB we support workplace flexibility. Have a chat to us about how this can work for you…
title: Senior Business Analyst

description:
We're looking to hire an experienced Ecommerce Business Analyst to join our Melbourne Office. You will be one of the first BA team member in Australia, following growth in the region, although will be an intrinsic member of the global team.
The role requires proven experience in delivering high quality ecommerce solutions to our clients. Working knowledge of at least one ecommerce platform such as Hybris, Demandware, Magento, EpiServer, Websphere Commerce is essential. A strong retail background is also highly desirable.
You'll be working with the client stakeholders, internal technical team and related third parties to analyze, design and document technological solutions to meet the business objectives. You'll also be responsible for representing the business in all internal stakeholder project meetings and will be a key member of a professional team.
The role covers the full project lifecycle from the elicitation of business requirements through to user acceptance testing and implementation of the system/s. The objective of the role is to elicit the business requirements and to deliver business requirement specifications that meet the client objectives for the project and support the team through to delivery.
You will need to be comfortable and confident in working autonomously, with limited guidance at times due to time differences.
Requirements
Essential Experience & Knowledge
Experience in leading discovery workshops
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Excellent requirement documenting skills in the form of use cases, user stories and functional specifications
Understanding of the full eCommerce product life cycle
Working knowledge of at least one of the ecommerce platforms e.g Hybris, Demandware/Salesforce Commerce Cloud, Magento, EpiServer, Websphere Commerce
Proven track record in software development environments and experiences of end to end project lifecycles
Experience of testing the developed solution to ensure it meets requirements and client expectations.
Proficient in co-coordinating with offshore teams and vendors.
Familiar with MS Outlook, Word, Excel, Visio and Project.
Degree educated or equivalent
Desirable Experience & Knowledge
Understanding of Web Standards
Knowledge of project management tools and methodologies e.g. MS Project/Prince 2
Technical understanding of multi-tier Java platform architecture
Basic Project Management skills to manage small change requests and projects
Exposure to the software testing process including the preparation of test plans, execution of test scripts is an advantage.
Worked with business tools e.g Visio or similar
Exposure to issue management and collaborative tools e.g. Jira, Basecamp, Confluence
Benefits
Relaxed working environment, forward thinking company with growth prospects, great location in Melbourne, 25 days annual leave per year.
title: eCommerce Business Analyst

description:
Senior Business Analyst - Fuel
Norwest Location

An excellent opportunity to drive, develop, and grow as part of our passionate dedicated Fuel leadership team within an exciting new standalone business
Innovative, Critical & Strategic Enterprise Business analysis
Solution Assessment & Validation
Business Change and Impact Analysis
Business Information Analysis


About Us
The Woolworths Fuel business is one of Australia’s largest fuel and convenience retailing networks with 534 operating sites across Australia.
Now entering a new and exciting phase, we are setting up the Fuel business to stand alone in the retail fuel sector to pursue its own growth agenda supported by a strengthened dedicated leadership team and highly competitive fuel supply and wholesale food agreements.
Joining our passionate and committed Fuel team for this next chapter offers the unique opportunity to be part of shaping our new identity, creating better customer experiences and driving the future of fuel and convenience retail.

About this role
This pivotal role within the new Woolworths Fuel business, ensures that end-to-end Processes and requirements are analysed, documented and negotiated to reflect the most critical components that can be delivered within a reasonable delivery cycle. This will be an opportunity for the successful candidate to gain incredible insight and experience across a broad range of projects being undertaken within the business.
In this role you will:
Investigate and analyse business problems or opportunities which contribute to improvements in business processes, policies and information systems.
Work on multiple concurrent projects and initiatives to derive requirements and processes which best meet the needs of all stakeholders.
Liaise with stakeholders/customers to elicit, prioritise, validate and document requirements, which form the basis of change to business processes, policies or systems.
Recommend business solutions that enable the organisation to achieve its targeted business outcomes and deliver business value.
Support the provision of concept and feasibility analysis, and business case development
Work with Architecture, Technology, and Change teams to deliver business solution requirements to support business strategy.
Works with Business Stakeholders and Project Managers to ensure that solution requirements can be deployed into the business in a way that is sensitive to and fully compatible with business operations.
Contribute, Support, coach and mentor the Business Analysis community towards best industry practice.


About You
To be successful for this role, you should have the following:
Solid business analyst experience within a large company
Relevant tertiary qualifications or IIBA or ESI Certification or equivalent
Experience in BPM and Process Improvement
Certified Scrum Master, Analyst or Product Owner
Experience in an Agile, hybrid Agile or on-line environment
Demonstrated Stakeholder and Project management capability
Demonstrated Negotiation and Influencing capability
Ability to challenge the status quo
Able to work independently and as a team in an environment of ambiguity and complexity
Oracle and Microsoft Dynamics environment desirable



If you think you have what it takes and want to be part of one of the most exciting journeys in Australian retail, apply now.

Want to connect? We’re also social! - connect with us at #WOWcareers through LinkedIn #LI, Facebook, Instagram or via www.wowcareers.com.au
title: Senior Business Analyst

Suggest alternate solutions to meet or improve the desired objectives based on best practices and industry solutions and influence the desired outcomesVerify that the user requirements are achievable, prepare specifications and obtain sign off. description:
The Opportunity

McColl’s currently have an exciting opportunity for full time Graduate Business Analysts to join our team, based in Geelong. The successful applicants will have direct exposure to management and clients through all areas of our business.

The Role

Reporting directly to the General Manager this position will be primarily responsible for undertaking analysis of operational data to produce efficiencies and contribute to improvement in company profitability through timely and accurate reporting.

To be successful in this position, ideally you will:

Be able to demonstrate proven problem solving skills.
Be practical and analytical.
Have proficiency in MS Excel techniques.
Have the ability to communicate with various personnel across the business.
Be currently studying or have recently completed a Business or Logistics degree.
A high level of computer literacy and attention to detail.


McColl’s can offer the successful applicant:

The opportunity to use your existing knowledge for your personal development.
Career growth within an expanding company.
Ongoing job training.


If you are interested in this role please forward a copy of your current Resume and Cover Letter to hr@mccolls.com.au or alternatively hit the APPLY NOW button.



Apply Now
title: Graduate Business Analyst

description:
What will you be doing?

Our clients range across the Financial services sectors, and the engagements are diverse and varied, so you could be on site assisting in the enablement of a digitisation strategy, identifying the way clients are going to be serviced in the future, or working on ensuring the security of customer data. And that’s just the start!
Is this you?
We are seeking skilled professionals who are passionate about generating meaningful change for clients and who are keen to belong to a company committed to bringing out their best, and supporting them along the way.

You are excited by the diversity that consulting offers

You are confident of your abilities to build and manage stakeholder relationships at all levels

You can quickly adapt to new environments and comfortably grasp new tools and concepts

You enjoy the challenge of problem-solving and thrive on innovation and creativity


What skills do you need?

You have extensive experience as a Business analyst, can elicit and document business and/or functional requirements in a variety of settings and manage these through the business lifecycle.

You have strong Business Process Mapping/Re-engineering skills and are able to interpret this data to elicit the best outcome for clients

You will have experience in the Financial Services sector

You may have worked in the markets, digital/online, cards/payments, risk or compliance areas

You have demonstrable understanding of banking, wealth management and/or superannuation

You may have, or be well on the way to having, a certification in Business Analysis


What can Terra Firma offer you?

Our people and our culture make Terra Firma a unique and awesome place to work

We value your ideas and reward you with a collegiate atmosphere full of opportunities

You will have access to global best practice frameworks including IIBA, PMBoK, ProSci and TOGAF. Our staff are also encouraged to enrol in our in-house training programs or gain external accreditations.

We have mentors who are industry recognised experts.

All our consultants have access to Employee Assistance Program for Physical, Psychological, Financial and Nutritional support

Through our alliance with a large corporate travel organisation, we are able to offer our consultants access to discounted travel and insurance

But most importantly, we offer you the opportunity to live our values with us: Pride & Passion, Collegiality and Adding Value!


We are always on the lookout for people with the skills and personality to join us. So to begin your new career with us apply to the link below or call our careers team on 03 8611 5099 for a confidential discussion. We look forward to hearing from you.
title: Business Analysts - Financial Services

description:
Grant Thornton Australia is growing and growth brings career opportunities for a Business Analyst to join our internal project management office to support a wide-ranging business transformation program. The role is a blend of both Business Process Analysis and Consulting, and has a strong focus on process improvement, standardisation and gaining efficiencies through the use of technology.

You will be responsible for working across the entire project lifecycle, providing support to the project management team as required. In this internal client-facing role, you will engage directly with key business customers and senior decision makers, helping evolve high-level strategic ideas and general concepts into well-defined, actionable initiatives.

You will be across multiple domains with an initial focus on core line of business service delivery systems and process automation. A willingness to learn new domains and build an understanding of end-to-end business processes and associated technologies is essential.

As this is a fast paced change environment, we are looking for someone who thinks on their feet, is flexible and adaptable, and able to develop structured solutions from ambiguous situations. The ability to critically analyse current state and challenge the status quo to develop optimised business processes and systems will ensure your success. Your responsibilities will include but not be limited to:

Working with senior business stakeholders to help define ‘To-be’ future state visions for processes and systems via focussed workshops and structured discussion
Lead and drive the analysis of new or modified business processes and capabilities, liaising with business SME’s to perform analysis and gather a consolidated set of requirements
Identify and understand business problems and the impact of the proposed solution on operations of the organisation
Documentation and management of requirements and/or user stories that can be understood by the business stakeholders and development resources through the project lifecycle
Documentation of functional solution designs that deliver on business requirements
Assistance with development of project business cases and other project documentation (objectives, scope, desired outcomes, guiding principles, approach, etc)
Development of external RFP documents and critical assessment of vendor responses
Creation of structured work plans and estimates for elaboration and implementation phases
Engaging with implementation partners to for design and implementation services
Working with the IT and other Support Services teams to continually improve delivery processes, tools, and templates
Engage in and promote professional development and training opportunities (internal and external) for all team members
Ensure all documentation and knowledge systems are reviewed, maintained and updated regularly
You’ll be agile, responsive and bring innovative ideas to the table. This role would suit someone who is looking to take the next step in their career as a business analyst by beginning to work with executive level stakeholders and decision makers, and contributing directly to successful delivery of key business transformation efforts, with the following attributes:

Minimum 5 years overall experience in Business Analysis and/or Process Improvement roles involving technology
Tertiary qualification and/or relevant experience within the Business Consulting/Professional Services, IT or Finance/Accounting field
Analytical & Problem solving skills with the ability to use & interpret information from multiple systems/sources
Demonstrated success in facilitation of requirements gathering sessions with diverse and senior stakeholders
In-depth knowledge of Business Analyst suite of tools (e.g. process mapping, workflow design, user stories, use cases, gap analysis, wire-framing, preparation of business case, functional/non-functional requirements, user acceptance testing scripts)
Understanding of ERP solutions in a professional services/accounting business
We recognise the importance of flexible work options and family friendly work practices in maintaining a diverse, adaptive and high performing workforce able to meet our current and future business needs.

If you’d like to know more or arrange a private and confidential discussion about this role, click Apply Now.

Only direct applications will be accepted (no agencies please). Please note that we have not engaged any recruitment agencies to represent us for this role.

If you experience any technical difficulties applying please contact the Grant Thornton People & Culture team on GTTalentScouts@au.gt.com

Position Description
title: Business Analyst

description:
Osborne Richardson are the recruitment experts in Australian Local Government roles and have been asked, by our major Local Government partner in Western Melbourne, to assist them find another great employee. We are seeking an outstanding IT Business Analyst to take on an initial 6 month contract with the very high potential of ongoing work thereafter.

About the role

This business analyst role will lead the end-to-end business analysis of the initiatives based on Melton City Council's Business Analysis Framework. This BA framework requires Melton's business analysts to perform end-to-end business requirements management and analysis which includes but not limited to the following activities:
Facilitating business problems or opportunitiesImpacts analysisCurrent process state analysisProposed process analysisSolution options analysisRisks and issues analysisEngaging vendors and service providers to solicit informationAssist with Cost /Benefits analysis and payback analysisDocumentation of business processes (this includes process mapping and documentation)User Acceptance TestingAssist with documentation of IT feasibility reports and business casesAssist with organisation change management analysis

Skills and experience

This role will suit a business analyst who has solid experience in a business-centric environment, with solid experience and skills in the following areas:
As Is and To Be process analysis, gaps analysis, solution analysis, requirements analysis, risks and issues analysis), incl. documentationManagement of stakeholders with various backgrounds and business needs (incl. external stakeholders such as software & hardware vendors and service providers).Working within a specific methodology / framework.Time managementExcellent communications skills and teamwork.The candidate must have positive attitude and the ability to receive as well as provide feedback from and to various stakeholders.
We have been asked to keep an eye out for candidates with extremely strong experience and skills in:
Business case development & Presentation SkillsFeasibility studiesProcess MappingRequirements analysisWorkshop facilitation and interviews to gather informationFacilitation of user acceptance testing (Uat)
If you would like to hear more about this role please feel free to call Owen Millar on 0414 706 605 or email owen.millar@osbornerichardson.com.au
title: IT Business Analyst

description:
Join ASX 100 Finance Leader – Australia's Most Loved Bank!
Suit experienced Corporate Business Analyst – Brisbane Based
Awarded Best Relationship Business Bank 2017 at the industry’s premier Business Banking Awards hosted by RFi Group


About us:
Join one of Australia's top 100 listed companies where our vision is to create Australia's Most Loved Bank! We support a flexible workplace and have a collaborative team environment. You will be part of an energetic and high-performing team in Brisbane.

The wider BOQ Business looks after the Banks Commercial Lending, Equipment Finance, Specialist Lending, Trade and Financial Markets. The client relationships are held across many segments which include Branches, Brokers, Business Banking, Corporate, Health and Retirement, Property and Agribusiness and are serviced by teams throughout Australia. BOQ Business is recognised for our excellence in Relationship Banking and have recently received awards from the AB&F as well as East & Partners.

Your new role:
As the Corporate Business Analyst, you will be an integral part of a Corporate Portfolio and provide support to a high performing Corporate Relationship Executive by managing all transactional and loan processing activities, including writing and providing recommendations for credit submissions and periodic reviews. You will require a strong understanding of financials and be able to analyse and interpret cashflows and industry information. Furthermore, you will be responsible for all ongoing compliance and reporting activities for the portfolio. This role is a spring-board for your career progression into the sophisticated world of corporate banking.

What's involved?

Providing lending support across a complex portfolio supporting the Corporate Banking team.
Assist with preparing corporate lending submissions by critically analysing and interpreting financial statements and identifying industry trends.
Provide exceptional customer service to the specific customer base and refer sales opportunities to the Corporate Relationship Executive.
Attend customer interviews with the Corporate Relationship Executive where appropriate to gain additional knowledge of customers’ businesses and requirements.
Establish and maintain effective relationships with customers through the delivery of excellent service.
Oversee and manage all covenant monitoring and compliance requirements.


About you:

As a natural problem solver, you will relish the opportunity to demonstrate your proven track record of credit analysis and pick up new complex concepts with ease. Naturally, you will possess strong organisational skills and attention to detail, coupled with your ability to multi-task and liaise with various stakeholders. Your proven analytical skills will be complimented by your ability to thrive in a fast paced and demanding environment.

What will set you apart?

Highly self-motivated with strong work ethic
Previous banking experience – including exposure to Commercial and Corporate lending
Background in Accounting or Audit or Corporate finance
Ability to critically analyse and interpret financial statements and identify industry trends
Knowledge of the Credit Code and Privacy Act
Background tertiary qualifications in Accounting and Finance / Commercial discipline preferred but not essential
Ability to demonstrate sound judgement and problem solving
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal
Team orientated with a desire to build a career within Corporate Banking.



Be part of the journey for BOQ and enjoy

Discounted financial products
Salary packaging options
Purchase annual leave
BUPA Corporate Plan


How to apply:

To apply for this role please follow the links

The Bank of Queensland is committed to diversity and an inclusive workforce. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

BOQ is a member of the Australian Bankers’ Association and has subscribed to the Conduct Background Check Protocol (Protocol). Under the Protocol, from 1 October 2017, BOQ will contact any previous employer/s who are also part of this association to provide a Conduct Check of any potential employee.

If you are successful for a role with the Bank of Queensland, it is a condition of employment that background screening is completed to ensure that the Bank complies with its obligations under the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter Terrorism Financing Act. These checks may include, but are not limited to: identity, verification, reference checks, criminal background checks, immigration checks, verification of academic qualifications, bankruptcy checks.
Required Skills

Required Experience
