description:
Full time, ongoing opportunity
Business Analyst specialist
Level 6/7 L6 $78,222 - $82,729 L7 $85,729 - $95,237
The University of Western Australia (UWA) is ranked amongst the top Australian universities and a member of the prestigious Group of Eight research-intensive universities ranked among the top 100 universities in the world.

About the work area

UWA is making significant investments in the Information and Technology Services to enable its strategic direction and goals. UWA is also looking to utilise technology advancements to expand its services and create new and innovative teaching and research models.

Robust, flexible, integrated and agile enterprise architecture, information and technology services are vital to enabling the university strategic objectives.

The Role

The Process Engineer and Business Analyst in the Student Information Management System application support team is responsible for assisting with the functional maintenance of Callista and the implementation and testing of any upgrades. A key aspect of the position is liaising with stakeholders to ensure that the functionality of the system continues to meet their needs and coordinating the development of solutions for new business requirements. This includes analysing business needs, designing solutions and implementing new Callista functionality or locally developed system enhancements.

About You

You will be a highly motivated Analyst with the ability to communicate across all levels and to build strong working relationships. Your expertise in Student Information Management Systems (such as Callista), or experience with other large similarly complex enterprise applications, including the ability to write SQL, will enable you to hit the ground running as a contributing member of the team.

To be considered for this role, you will demonstrate the following:

Tertiary Qualification in a business discipline.
Knowledge of Six sigma, BPMN or equivalent.
Substantial experience in a Business Analyst role or a role requiring business process re-engineering and improvement in large and complex organisations.
Substantial experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modelling, testing and verification and methodology development.
Experience in establishing testing strategies and plans, business cases and investments options modelling at an appropriate level.
Highly developed listening and interpersonal skills, and analytical and problem solving skills.
Be highly self-motivated and directed, with an ability to effectively prioritise and execute tasks with the ability to work concurrently on multiple projects or assignments.
The ability to communicate and build positive stakeholder relationships managing competing priorities whilst remaining fully customer focused.
Knowledge of the Higher Education sector is desirable.
Closing date: Friday, 9 November 2018

Application Details: Please apply online via the Apply Now button. Applications should include a current resume and should also address the selection criteria.
title: Process Engineer and Business Analyst

description:
Our Company

Tabcorp is a world-class diversified gambling entertainment group and an ASX50 company.

In December 2017 we combined with Tatts Group and now operate the iconic brands Tatts,

TAB, NSW Lotteries, Golden Casket, SA Lotteries, Keno, Sky Racing and Sky Sports Radio. We also deliver leading gaming services and products through Tabcorp Gaming Solutions, MAX and Ebet.

Our 5,000-plus strong team is as diverse as Australia itself. Our people drive familiar brands which ignite passion and excitement in millions of Australians.

This leadership is reflected in who we are. If, like us, you’re a passionate, positive playmaker and you want to use your talent to create amazing outcomes, we’d love to hear from you.

Role Snapshot/Role Summary

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Technology and with a dotted line to the GM your role will act as the key interface between the development teams and the business units across Technology. You will assist with process improvement, streamlining the communication and flow of information. In addition, you will also assist with reviewing existing operational and support processes, helping to identify opportunities for improvement.

The role will focus on

Collaborating with stakeholders to elicit requirements that solve customer’s problems innovatively
Demonstrable experience in agile ways of working and the ability to drive adoption within a team
Facilitating workshops to map user journeys and well versed in using tools to achieve this
Influencing and operating as a genuine trusted advisor
Shaping the design and delivery of specific solutions through proactive consulting
Building strong business relationships based on trust and delivery. Maintain and foster relationships with all Gaming Services stakeholders, including those throughout the business unit, across the organisation, and external suppliers and customers
Providing outstanding customer service and experiences, own and take action on issues effectively and efficiently
Promoting and enabling an environment of positivity, self-empowerment/improvement and development
Assisting with improving process, streamlining communication and the flow of information, providing clarity and responding to requests for information
Working with the Technology team you will leverage your strong understanding of the use of scripts, database queries, and possess an ability to read developed software
Our Ideal Person

You will have accredited tertiary qualifications in the relevant field, with 5+ years’ work experience within a large commercial environment with demonstratable experience evaluating and documenting business and software requirements to a high level of technical detail. Expert knowledge of all aspects of system implementation, both in-house and customised package solutions will be highly desirable. In addition, you will have a continuous learning mindset and an ability to reinforce this amongst the team.

When you join our team, you’ll be able to take advantage of a range of benefits including flexible working arrangements, leadership and development programs and community programs.

Tabcorp is committed to creating an inclusive workplace where all our people feel valued for their unique qualities and have a sense of belonging. If you need assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact tabcorprecruitment@tabcorp.com.au
title: Senior Technical Business Analyst - Gaming Services Technology

description:
Job Purpose
The Business Analyst role will be working closely with the account managers, clients and delivery managers to prioritize road-map release requirements relating to the Financial Advice products.
The successful candidate will have experience working with financial advice software, a good understanding of para-planning and solid regulatory and legislation knowledge.
The role will be responsible for all aspects of the analysis and requirements definition from initial "t-shirt sizing" through to detailed impact and change analysis. It will require the ability to converse with business and technology resources, both internally and on the client side.
The candidate will be working in a lean, distributed agile environment with a strong focus on delivery. The role will ultimately be responsible for ensuring the delivered changes meet the business needs.
The candidate must be capable of working independently and collaboratively with colleagues, clients and partners

Responsibilities and Accountabilities
Analysis and defining the business and functional requirements clearly and without ambiguity, inclusive of any necessary supporting material
Facilitate, lead and document the outcome/actions of workshops with key internal and external stakeholders
In depth understanding of the product with respect to its overall structure, business use, functionalities and related technologies
The role bridges the gap between Business and Technology to ensure the technical solution solves the business problem
Validate test plans, scenarios and cases to ensure adequate test coverage across happy path, edge case and negative scenario testing
Validate test outcomes to ensure business requirements are delivered to standard
Ensure identification and appropriate escalation of risks and issues related to delivery status, scope and backlog progress
Support client queries and issues ensuring timely and clear updates are provided to the relevant stakeholders


Skills and Qualifications
Knowledge of financial planning process and common financial planning strategies across Financial Advisers and Para-planners
Diploma of Financial Planning or similar qualification (desirable)
Detailed, clear and concise communicator
Basic understanding of COIN and Provisio
 Domain Experience Preferred:
Sound Financial Planning and competitor knowledge
Prior exposure working with Advice systems
Familiar with Australian financial advice regulatory and legislative environment
Sound technical knowledge
 Skillsets Required:
Team work
Communication
Prioritization and time management
Problem solving
Management of day to day challenges
Able to produce clear documentation
title: Business Analyst – Financial Advice

description:
If you’re a smartphone user then you are part of an ever more connected and digital world. At Amdocs, we are leading the digital revolution into the future. From virtualized telecommunications networks, Big Data and Internet of Things to mobile financial services, billing and operational support systems, we are continually evolving our business to help you become more connected. We make sure that when you watch a video on YouTube, message friends on SnapChat or send your images on Instagram, you get a great service anytime, anywhere, and on any device. We are at the heart of the telecommunications industry working with giants such as AT&T, Vodafone, Telstra and Telefonica, helping them create an amazing new world for you where technology is being used in amazing new ways every single day.



In one sentence

Understands business needs. Assesses the impact of those needs, capturing, analyzing and documenting requirements and providing high level solutions that leverage product capabilities and best practices in order to produce an optimal solution. Communicates and implements recommended solutions.



What will your job look like?

You will work with the client's business to shape the business requirement in a tangible form. He should understand telecom industry well to also advise Telstra on the use cases and the potential domains that will have an impact. and you feed this information to the service designer.
You will have the opportunity to reflect customer needs by gathering business documents and technical requirements.
You will be a key advisor for customers based on product capabilities and best practices, leveraging reuse where applicable.
You will design holistic and integrated high-level solutions that fit customers' business needs, production operability and budget.
You will participate in and/or leads formal and informal reviews with stakeholders, applying knowledge and experience and providing technical perspective and support.
You will be responsible for communicating the solution with customers' business and IT personnel. Will be expected to explain the new details of new solutions and their impact on business processes.
You will ensure that the customer understands the solution and receive responses to all open questions and action items.
You will support the customer during the scoping phase in a specific domain up through and including customer sign off (for example, COP process for various customer types and products, EPC lead for all product models and designs, etc.)
You will prepare solution-related documents and specifications. Configures the solution, and creates, executes and maintains accurate and detailed test plans for testing when applicable.
You will support the resolution of configuration/ implementation related issues if and when they arise.




All you need is...

Business Analyst works with the client's business to shape the business requirement in a tangible form. He should understand telecom industry well to also advise Telstra on the use cases and the potential domains that will have an impact.
Business Analyst feeds this information to the service designer.

Basic Skills:
Degree in Computer Science or Industrial Engineering & Management - Information System
At least 5 years of business analyst/PDM experience in Telecom domain
Customer-facing experience – ability to present the Amdocs solution using various methods (presentations, demos, and so on)
Must have strong and solid background of telecom network technologies
With sufficient technical knowledge to understand high-level architecture and technical requirements around OSS Telecommunication solutions



Why you will love this job:

You will be able to use your superior business analyst skills to make a significant impact on high-level solutions that best produces the optimal product solution.
You will be a key member of a global, dynamic and highly collaborative team with various possibilities for personal and professional development
You will have the opportunity to work in multinational environment for the global market leader in its field
title: Business Analyst

description:
Job Description
Are you passionate about leveraging data to deliver actionable insight that impacts daily business decision of Amazon? Does the prospect of dealing with massive volume of data excite you?

Amazon is seeking an outstanding Business Analyst to join Amazon Australia’s operations team, in transportation. Our team is responsible for planning & execution of Amazon’s transportation network in Australia. Amazon has culture of data-driven decision-making, and demands business intelligence that is timely, accurate, and actionable. During our day to day operations, tons of data is generated which is leveraged to make important business decisions.

Our ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, relishes working with large transactional volumes and big data, enjoys the challenge of highly complex business contexts (that are typically being defined in real-time), and, above all else, is a passionate about data and analytics.

As a Business Analyst, this individual will be developing SQL/ETL queries, accessing data warehouse, creating automated reports through macros, and creating relevant KPIs and metrics for performance of transportation and supply chain operations. This role will publish daily/weekly/monthly performance reports as needed; and will give us business insights based upon data to further improve our operations.

A successful candidate knows and loves working with business intelligence tools, is comfortable accessing and working with big data from multiple sources, and passionately partners with the business to identify strategic opportunities to deliver results. This individual must have an internal drive to answer “why?” questions, excellent analytical abilities, strong technical skills, as well as superior written and verbal communication skills. S/he will be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, able to think big (while paying careful attention to detail), and enjoy working in a fast-paced dynamic environment.

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in technical field
Experience working in SQL and writing queries
Experience with developing reports from Tableau preferred
Proficient in MS Excel (macros, pivot tables, vlookups, hlookups, etc.)
Should understand business context and creating KPIs/Metrics as per business needs
Excellent communication skills in English
Preferred Qualifications
Work experience in Transportation environment
Knowledge of statistical programming language (e.g., Python, R, etc.)
Master’s degree in Computer Science or related technical field
title: Business Analyst

description:
Business Analyst (Senior) & Consultant (Current)
One Dot is looking for a full-time Senior Business Analyst and Consultant to come and help us meet our customers’ needs!

Location: Brisbane or Sydney

Role Overview
Combining IT and business knowledge, the world of IT consultancy demands a broad range of skills. Our consultants work in partnership with clients, advising them on technology, processes and project management in order to meet their business objectives. Our consultants provide strategic guidance to clients with regard to technology, IT infrastructures and enabling major business processes through enhancements to IT.
They also provide guidance during selection and procurement, as well as providing expert technical assistance. IT consultants may also be involved in sales and business development.
Requirements
Multi-skilled and versatile
Strong analytic capability
Ability to transform ideas to developed concepts
Strong background in business analysis
Strong documentation skills:
Business Requirements Documentation
Technical Specifications Documentation
Business Process Design and Re-Engineering
Agile and Scrum experience
Knowledge of Software Release Management process and practices and the SDLC
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to all levels
Ability to work on multiple projects in parallel
Create use cases/features/epics/user stories/acceptance criteria

Qualifications
Bachelor degree (preferably in an IT related discipline)
Industry certification (PMBOK, BABOK, CSM, CPO, SPC, Prince2…)
Minimum 5 years as a business analyst

Requirements (Nice to have) (Not Required)
Atlassian and JIRA
SAFe (Scaled Agile)

What’s in it for you?
Flexible hours.
Supportive Team
Opportunity to learn new technologies and tools
Diverse portfolio of clients to work with
See our client list to learn more about the clients you will work with

Role type: Full-time
To Apply: Send resume to projects@onedot.com.au
title: Business Analyst (Senior) & Consultant

description:
Role: Senior Digital Business Analyst North Sydney location - Brand new offices with great views Nimble yet effective and highly skilled team Understanding of API and Integration This role is to join our Digital Solutions & Analysis team where you'll work on digital and cross-business delivery projects working closely with the relevant Digital Project Manager. In this role, you'll work within one or multiple project teams focused on implementing functionality enhancements across the company website, company app and other digital platforms. Project teams usually consist of UX Designers, Visual Designers, Copy Writers, Frontend and Backend Developers, Content and Technical Producers, SIT and UAT test teams working with business SMEs and other stakeholders. The perfect candidate: The role will see you: Engage with the Business Analyst's to elicit requirements and drive required change into the development team Identify and analyse areas for improvement relating to the systems, process, and workflows Provide expert technical advice to the business analyst's in improving business efficiencies, through technology Day to day administration, maintenance of IT related systems used within the organisation You will bring to the role: Proven experience in projects, full knowledge of SDLC, in an Agile environment A knowledge of financial services Very good understanding of client server architecture, cloud Experience in a business systems / technical analysis role is essential Proven experience in business driven development and translating these into system features Testing appetite a must Come and work for the best in the industry, using cutting edge technology and deliver some game changing experiences for our customers.

Do you have what it takes? Click the "apply" button now! Contact jbidwell@siriustechnology.com.au for more information
title: Business Analyst | North Sydney | Perm | Growing Company

description:
As the Business Process Analyst you be will mapping and reviewing current process across several streams of a large program to identify inefficiencies and bottlenecks. You will also be working on some change management activities in regards to recommendations on process improvements.

To be successful in this role:

5 years experience working as a business/process analyst
Lean 6 Sigma certification highly regarded
Experience as a Business Analyst with a finance focus
Experience using business process modelling tools
Excellent communication skills - written and verbal
title: Snr Business Analyst - Process Analysis

description:
Short Summary:
Utilise your expertise to be a subject matter expert to our internal and external business partners in shaping solutions for RACQ’s digital application software
About the Company
RACQ exists to make a positive difference to the lives of our 1.7 million members now and into the future. We embrace the value of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where the backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our employees help us innovate, make better business decisions and better serve our members. We live by our values of generosity of spirit, being of service, inspiring trust and dedication to excellence and have a real sense of pride in what we do.
Join us during an exciting time of growth. Our vision to create a new force in banking for Queenslanders has further broadened our range of products and services which includes roadside assistance, insurance, travel and lifestyle.
About the role
The purpose of this role is to liaise with Stakeholders to obtain, analyse, communicate and validate requirements for changes to business processes, policies and information systems. Understand business problems and opportunities in the context of the requirements and effect solutions that enable the business customer to achieve their goals
Duties

Deliver member-centric solutions supported by clearly identified member benefit both direct and indirect.
Follow and foster Agile methodologies in the delivery of all work
Prepare clear and succinct process maps of current and reviewed work and systems procedures
Analyse the business requirements to support re-usable process elements and report on results
Analyse the impact of changes to process elements and report on results
Implement processes to suit business requirements
Prepare appropriate documentation for new or changed process workflow models

Technical Capabilities:

Tertiary qualification relating to Computer Science or Information Technology discipline or equivalent experience
Business acumen and industry knowledge with a strong understanding of business processes and products
Capabilities in:
Variety of database platforms like Oracle, SQL Server, DB2
Advanced facilitation and workshop skills
Influence others to share influence and goals
Use of process modelling tools
Agile development methodologies, practices and principles of the SDLC
Good working knowledge in:
System development lifecycle and project management practices
Application support and relevant business & IT trends
Change management practices in a parallel development environment
The appropriate operating system environment and its related tools and utilities

Benefits

Campus work environment with onsite-parking and café
Free Roadside Assistance and up to 25% off RACQ insurance products
Access to health and wellbeing benefits, including Employee Assistance Program, yoga, fitness bootcamp and more!
A wide variety of travel, accommodation, retail and automotive discounts
Work for an organisation that is always striving to do better and be better
Be part of a diverse team with a learning culture




How to Apply
If this sounds like you, please APPLY NOW. For a confidential chat, please contact Meenu Arora on 07 3666 9308 or email at meenu.arora@racq.com.au
All applicants will be contacted to advise of the outcome of their application. Please keep an eye out for email updates from us. Applicants may be required to complete video interviews, psychometric testing, and/or a criminal check
Please note, we do not accept third party or emailed applications.

Work Locations
Eight Mile Plains 2649 Logan Road Eight Mile Plains 4113
title: Business Analyst | Technical | Digital Project

description:
Our client, a well-established and reputable organisation is looking for a Business Analyst with Lean qualifications for a long-term contract opportunity. Under broad direction, and working closely with key stakeholders, this position is responsible for a full range of business analysis activities, including business process modelling, business case development, requirements elicitation, developing and documenting effective business requirements and system specifications relating to Business Improvement initiatives.

Below are the essential and desirable criteria.

Qualifications in Lean and significant experience applying Lean
Experience in developing and implementing business process improvements
Demonstrated ability in problem-solving, priority setting and working to deadlines
Experience in Agile delivery approaches
Relevant and current industry certifications in business analysis and training (Microsoft, ITIL, AIBA) or
Significant experience in business analysis roles, and an ability to demonstrate well developed business analysis competencies.
Demonstrated experience in contributing to the development of business cases, cost benefit analyses and budgets for projects.
You will also almost certainly live in Adelaide or be prepared to stay here
What's Next?
If you are available for your next Business Analyst long-term contract opportunity, then click the Apply Now button and submit your CV in Word format. For more information please contact Finite on (08) 8224 3800.

description:

description:
Finance Analyst/Junior Business Analyst required to join this high-performing finance team on an initial 12-month fixed term contract to over secondment.

About the role

You will become part of a close-knit team that is focused on improving and optimising business processes. Reporting into the Commercial Manager, you will work with operational stakeholders to improve reporting, build dashboards and create efficiencies within the finance function to allow the business to make better commercial decisions.

This organisation is renowned in the market for not just encouraging but championing change and offering opportunities to internal staff wherever possible. If you add value in this role, there are a number of lateral moves across the business you would be in prime position to secure.

Your new manager describes the culture of this team as collaborative and supportive, saying that a team player would fit into this environment above anything else.

About you

Although at least 3 years' experience within operational analysis, accounting or management reporting is ideal for this position, beyond that, all our client is looking for is a quick learner with a curious mindset with a drive to succeed. Excel skills are also a bonus and you must have a keen interest in process improvement/optimisation.

What's next?

This business will be looking to hold interviews as soon as possible, so please apply below or contact Charlotte on cstone@walkerandersen.com for further details. We look forward to working with you.
title: Finance Analyst/Junior Business Analyst

description:
The Company
Our client, a homegrown Australian success, operates within the highly innovative and lucrative medical devices industry. Locally, they are the market leaders, and with plans to continue their growth at 20% year on year, their story is a true testament to an organisation that is built on dynamism, work / life balance and the continued recognition of the efforts of its staff.
The Role
Sitting in a larger Finance team of 25 and reporting directly to the FP&A Manager, this Business Analyst role has been scoped to provide the business with useful insights into their performance and recommendations for business growth. More specifically this will involve:
Partnering with Sales Directors in allowing them to drive forward the revenue of a specialist division of the business
Analyse sales deals to maximize profitability
Enhance sales, profit and performance reporting
Lead on an array of projects to improve efficiency
Building and maintaining models to assist the business with its strategic decision making.
Working with the FP&A Manager to help the business grow its bottom line and the business’s market share
Manage the cashflow, forecasting, reporting and P&L analysis
Act as the lynchpin between this hugely profitable sales division and the finance team itself.
This is a genuinely exciting opportunity for someone looking to step up into a true business facing, value-add role.
Your Background
To be considered for this role, you will need to have worked in a product based environment and have
Worked with non-finance staff in helping them to understand what drives their sales performance
Experience with a systems implementation (ideally Navision)
Strong to advanced Excel skills with SQL and Jet highly regarded
CA / CPA qualified would be ideal, but not essential
Able to work in the Northern Beaches Sydney
If you are keen to find out more about this position, please contact Patrick Ashton at Richard Lloyd on 02 8324 5645, quoting reference 4525 or click on 'apply now' below.

Please submit your CV in Word format and note that due to the high volume of responses we receive only suitable candidates will be contacted.

title: Business Analyst - Process Mapping

description:
About Us

Western Health manages three acute public hospitals: Footscray, Sunshine and Williamstown Hospital. It also operates the Sunbury Day Hospital, Transition Care at Hazeldean and a range of community based services along with a large Drug and Alcohol Service. We care for a culturally diverse population of more than 800,000 people. We have more than 6,700 employees who are driven by our values of ‘Compassion, Accountability, Respect, Excellence and Safety’ (CARES).

Our continued growth will see the completion of a new purpose built, multi-storey Joan Kirner Women's and Children's Hospital.

About the Role

An exciting opportunity for a Business Analyst is available within the Financial Planning & Analysis team at Western Health. This position is based at the Sunshine and Footscray Hospital.

Reporting to the Manager of Financial Planning & Analysis, you will provide business planning, performance reporting and financial analysis services to support key stakeholders across various business units within the organisation. Specifically to understand business needs, assessing the financial impact of operational initiatives, capturing, analysing and documenting requirements and then supporting the communication and delivery of those requirements with relevant parties.

Your excellent verbal and written communication skills will enable you to effectively present business ideas, financial data and performance analysis to a wide range of audiences. Your superior stakeholder management and interpersonal skills will allow you to work seamlessly with the finance team, operation mangers, divisional directors and executive directors of WH. You must have extensive knowledge of business management including budget development, forecasting, costing, analysis, and reporting. Your positive, and “can do” attitude will ensure you are well fit into the energetic and productive FP&A team.

Essential Criteria

To meet the requirements of the role you must hold tertiary qualifications in accounting, commerce or other finance disciplines with CPA or CA designation preferred. Experience at senior levels within health services would be an advantage but not necessary.

Benefits

We offer a wide range of benefits such as:
Work-life balance
Professional development and career advancement opportunities
Salary packaging including novated vehicle leasing
Onsite fitness clubs
Culturally safe and respectful environment
Access to an Employee Assistance Program
Culture

At Western Health, we value our employees and provide them the opportunity to grow and develop. Our teams are friendly and supportive, ensuring we deliver a safe, person-centred and connected patient experience. Western Health is an equal opportunity employer committed to attracting and retaining diversity in our workforce. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

Agency enquiry is not required at this stage

All appointments are made subject to a satisfactory Police Record Check, an Immunisation status clearance and (if applicable) a working with children’s check.
title: Business Analyst

description:
About HelloFresh

At HelloFresh, we want to change the way people eat. Over the past 6 years we've seen this mission spread beyond our wildest dreams. Now, we are the leading global company in the expanding online recipe kit delivery market.

So, how did we do it? Our weekly recipe boxes full of exciting recipes and lovingly sourced, fresh ingredients have blossomed into a community of inspired, energised home cooks that expands across the globe. We are one of the fastest growing meal kit businesses and are active and growing in 10 different countries across 3 continents.

If you would like to join an energetic and highly motivated team and work in a dynamic, high-energy, high-growth field where you can really have an impact and make a difference every single day then join us and become part of developing a global fresh food champion.

Job description

You will…

  • Be part of the Growth marketing team to develop HelloFresh’s activity
  • Manage some core marketing channels, from strategic set-up to roll-out
  • Track performance, analyse key KPIs and monitor budget allocation
  • Identify gaps in opportunities and processes to optimise campaign performances
  • Work autonomously and with initiative. As a start-up we need you to drive yourself!

Mandatory requirements

You have...

  • Ability to turn analysis into impactful business decision and operational roll-out
  • Very good understanding of KPIs and an analytical mindset
  • Strong skills in Microsoft Excel, and a logical way of working
  • Previous experience (1-2 years) in high intensity business environment
  • Attention to detail and a proven ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines
  • Great communication skills (written and spoken) to give recommendations
  • SQL and willingness to learn is a big plus

You are…

  • Passionate about our business and obsessed with food!
  • Data, strategy and growth driven
  • Proactive, ambitious, and assertive: you take ownership of your work and think beyond the scope of a given assignment
  • Excited to work in a fast-paced and innovative environment
    Must have permanent rights to work in Australia - Full time Position

description:
Mercer’s Superannuation Administration team is currently seeking an Business Analyst to join their Sydney based team with a focus on various superannuation legislation or business projects to support the Mercer Standalone industry and Mercer Super trust fund administration business. This opportunity could suit someone with a background in superannuation as a business analyst, senior administrator, team leader, compliance that is interested in moving into more of a regulatory specialist role

Responsibilities
Research and understand legislative or business change, analysing the impact of the legislative change on administration processes, procedures and systems
Develop or assist in developing agreed best practice solutions including investigating and analysing data and consulting with stakeholders to develop solutions
Document and review project requirements including preparing or reviewing business specifications, system requirements/changes, test plans, updates to procedures, letters and forms, to accurately complete the project requirements
Attend business wide project team meetings, provide input and ensure delivery of action items to required timelines. On smaller projects – deliver and manage your allocated tasks
Develop communications including articles for our monthly newsletter and provide training and support for business users as required.
Qualifications Skills and Experience

Essential
Solid background 5+ yrs. superannuation experience within fund administration or business analyst
Strong analytical, process and problem solving skills with a solid technical understanding of superannuation benefit designs
Effective communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to plan and meet deadlines
Ability to work autonomously and within a team environment
Attention to detail
Strong interpersonal skills with ability to build and maintain relationships with internal and external stakeholders
Preferred
Superb, Calibre, Sonata system experience
Pension administration experience
Mercer is a global leader in talent, health, retirement and investments. Mercer helps clients around the world advance the health, wealth and performance of their most vital asset – their people. Mercer’s 20,000 employees are based in more than 43 countries and the firm operates in over 130 countries. Mercer is a wholly owned subsidiary of Marsh & McLennan Companies (NYSE: MMC), a global team of professional services companies offering clients advice and solutions in the areas of risk, strategy and human capital.

If you have a desire to work for one of the top professional services companies and have the skills for the job then APPLY to Philippa Martin now by following the link below or calling +64 9 928 3115 for a confidential chat

******Applications will only be accepted from candidates who have the appropriate approval to work in Australia. Successful applicants will be required to complete background checks prior to commencement of employment.

Mercer is an equal opportunity employer committed to embracing a diverse and inclusive work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people regardless of their gender, marital/parental status, ethnic origin, nationality, age, background, disability, sexual orientation and gender identity.

title: Junior CRM Business Analyst

description:
About Us
UniSuper is one of Australia’s largest superannuation funds, and is run solely for the benefit of its members. For more than 34 years, UniSuper has been managing super for people employed in the higher education and research sector. UniSuper currently invests around $68 billion on behalf of 400,000 current and former higher education and research employees.
UniSuper is facing many of the challenges other businesses face in this digitally driven, changing world that we work in. We have a purpose to support our higher education sector members in assisting them with future retirement goals and a focus on enabling them to have a seamless experience when they engage with us.

About the Role
This role will be responsible for requirements gathering from the business regarding the Salesforce CRM, and analysing these using modern ways of agile working. You will be tasked with identifying, analysing and documenting the business processes and workflows, with a real emphasis on identifying opportunities for streamlining and improving these practices.

You will be working closely with a small ‘agile scrum’ team including an experience designer, product owner and development team to ensure the use of the latest and most suited Salesforce functionality to solve business problems.

A key part of the role will be liaising with an array of project stakeholders to ensure external needs are met, whilst promoting the best practice use of Agile techniques.
Identify and implement continuous improvement opportunities right across the team.

About You
You will present with a wealth of end-to-end Agile project experience, being able to deliver features from inception right through to final completion and delivery. You will have garnered strong fully functional BA skills, ideally within a CRM space (Salesforce would be highly advantageous), and possess deep relationship building and interpersonal skills with internal and external stakeholders.

You will be able to ‘roll up your sleeves’ and setup and run workshops and training facilitation sessions, with clear and confident communication techniques, and high attention to detail.

Most importantly, you will have a mindset of ‘getting the job done’ and be able to converse with senior stakeholders and present solutions to problems.


What We Offer You
At UniSuper, we offer competitive salaries, flexible and diverse working environments, and have modern offices in the heart of the CBD.

We also offer a range of paid volunteer days to support charities, discounted gym membership schemes, seated massages and discounted movie tickets.
When you also include an additional 3 days paid leave over the Christmas and New Year period and a chance to work with a great team of people, we feel we have great environment.
If you feel you have the experience and skills required for this role, please apply!

Please note: Successful applicants will be required to complete a Police Check prior to commencement of employment, and all job offers are subject to completion of satisfactory reference checks.
title: Senior Business Analyst - Salesforce

Danielle Barton

description:
Leverage your Corporate Systems expertise and be instrumental in initiating and driving business process transformation
Don't get lost in the back office. Join a team that collaborates with every department in the business
With a market capitalisation close to $1.8 billion, TechnologyOne is Australia's largest publicly listed software company, providing solutions to around 1,000 customers in Australia, New Zealand, Asia, the South Pacific and the UK

How you'll make a difference...

Our business is supported by an exceptional Corporate Systems team who work to deliver continual improvement of IT applications and infrastructure across the organisation.

As an IT Business Analyst you'll take ownership of key business areas and collaborate with managers to gain a comprehensive understanding of their requirements; and then take action to simplify and transform their business processes by using IT applications and tools.

What you'll be doing...

Ensure systems administration activities (user access assignment, business system availability monitoring, system change control) are being carried out by the system owners
Understand and map business use of corporate and information systems to identify improvement opportunities, reducing the overall complexity of the environment
Provide application support for issues related to the corporate TechnologyOne enterprise suite
Contribute to the continuous improvement of business process and information systems
Keep up-to-date with changes and development of the TechnologyOne enterprise suite and business systems
Provide advice on the selection of any new business systems, and changes in business processes and methodologies, and integration between business systems and the TechnologyOne Production environment

Your Talents...

Experience working with and administering corporate systems
An ability to analyse internal business processes and problems and develop innovative solutions using our technologies
Excellent communication skills
An ability to rapidly learn new systems

Who we are…

TechnologyOne (ASX:TNE) is Australia's largest enterprise software company and one of Australia's top 150 ASX-listed companies, with offices across six countries. We create solutions that transform business and make life simple for our customers. We do this by providing powerful, deeply integrated enterprise software that is incredibly easy to use. Over 1,000 leading corporations, government departments and statutory authorities are powered by our software.

We pride ourselves on providing our people with earned recognition through career progression, competitive salaries and a supportive environment. We double in size approximately every 5 years so career opportunities abound. Everything is about to change. Are you ready?

We value creativity, innovation and people with an entrepreneurial spirit. See us in action at Hack Day!
Applicants must have the right to work permanently in Australia

description:
Prospa, Australia's #1 online lender to small businesses.

We are a visionary FinTech leader that changes the lives of under-serviced small business owners in Australia. We build innovative and easy to use financial products that help small businesses achieve their dreams, by providing fast and easy funding pathways around their business challenges.

We are proud to say that on our journey so far we have helped over 12,000 small business customers across Australia, injecting over half a billion dollars into the Australian economy, and counting.

Prospa is extremely passionate about its people. Their diversity, skills, and passion are the foundation of what we deliver to our customers. Our people, in turn, are driven by our values.
Obsess About Customers - We don’t just listen, we hear what’s important.

5* Trustpilot Customer Rating (9.8/10)
Be Bold, Open and Real - Have the courage to take smart risks.

Winner - 2017 FinTech Australia ‘Finnie’ Award for ‘Best Leaders’
Day 1 – We’re driven by the start-up mentality.

Winner - 2018 Financial Times High-Growth Companies (Asia Pacific)
Deliver Value Fast – We celebrate outcomes not process.

Winner - 2015 Deloitte Tech Fast 50 (Almost 7000% growth in three years)
Simplicity – The work of a true genius is making the complex simple.

Winner - 2017 Fintech Business Awards ‘Lending Innovator’
One Team – Success comes from embracing different perspectives.

4.6* Glassdoor Staff Happiness Rating & 2018 Aon Best Employer

Our Risk Insights & Solutions team is responsible for measuring, monitoring and controlling risks originating from the business.

The key focus areas of the team are: Building sophisticated risk rating systems for credit underwriting, pro-active portfolio management, credit risk reporting and audit.

As Risk Business Analyst you will join the RI&S team providing support across a vast range of credit & risk related areas such as process mapping, audit and fraud prevention.

Key activities include:

Being a single point of contact & owner for the end to end process related documentation; specific to risk management

Responsible for understanding business requirements and translating them in bite sized specs

Being able to work in an agile environment & actively participate in various agile ceremonies, such as scrums & working in cross functional teams

Creating, maintaining & updating a thorough framework for audit & review of applications in the credit portfolio

Preparing thorough training packs to share the learnings from the audit & review exercise

Responsible for designing and imparting training to the wider operations staff

Oversee the fraud prevention & operational risk functions within credit & risk.

Responsible for credit administration activities such as: Delegated Lending Authority framework, credit policies and procedures, etc.

Responsible for iteratively improving technical & business specification documents



Essential Qualifications, Experience & Skills:


Should hold a degree in commerce / finance

Minimum of 3 years relevant work experience in financial services; banking or credit lending preferred

Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint & Visio)

Basics of SQL / ability to query a database is desirable

Eye for detail and strong believer in documentation

Able to analyse data, present and communicate findings and generate recommendations and insights.



Competencies and Personal Attributes:
Should be enthusiastic and willing to work with different stakeholders

Attention to detail and ability to articulate effectively is a must

Ability to organise resources – stakeholders time, their consent, common understanding of cross-functional teams and being able to derive the desired outcomes



Come and join us
We offer a unique opportunity to shape and contribute to a flourishing, fast-growing business as an integral part of a highly engaged team with great perks and a fun workspace.

Achieving our vision to change the way small business owners experience finance requires a diverse group of passionate, creative and innovative people. You can find out a bit more about working at Prospa here.

description:
A prestigious global organisation is looking for a Senior Business Analyst who also has Salesforce experience to join their product team. This team is focused on bringing innovative B2B digital products to the market, within professional services.

This is a rare opportunity to further your experience within a unique setting – the best of a large corporate and a start-up venture.

Key responsibilities:
You will be sitting within the product team where the bulk of the role will see you working with product managers, technical team members and business stakeholders.

While the Salesforce work will only take up a small percentage of your time, when those skills are called upon, you will be the subject matter expert and need to bring it all to the table.

Business Analysis Skills required;
Work with key stakeholders to gather requirements and identify opportunities for product and process improvements.
Translate business and customer needs into language and format that can be clearly understood by technology team members.
Collaborate with members of the product team and business stakeholders to refine, implement, test and deliver product features that solve customer and business problems, within an Agile environment.
Monitor existing product features to gauge effectiveness and identify improvements.
Ensure the development team is creating solutions that align with the defined business value.
Work with product managers to manage the backlog.
Salesforce:
Implement changes to the Salesforce environment.
Have an understanding of user licences, roles, profiles, hierarchy and security settings.
Be cognizant of workflows, functions and configurations within the Salesforce.com environment.
Receive new/changed requirements for views, reports, dashboards and campaigns from the business users and implement within Salesforce.
Assist sales and finance management to monitor activities, trends, sales and leads.
Build and manage report folders for reps to improve sales efficiency.
Communicate system changes to senior business users.
Desirable experience:
5-7 years’ experience working as a business analyst.
Ideally a technical background with some development experience.
A passion for technology and being part of best-practice product development.
Ideally, have exposure to design thinking and an Agile environment.
Be energised by collaboration and possess a learning and growth mindset.
Someone who doesn’t just know ‘what’ to do, but is interested in and knows the ‘why’.
Strong analytical skills, including the ability to interpret customer and business needs.
Tertiary degree in technology related discipline preferred
Demonstrated success delivery of complex projects
Demonstrated Analytic skills
Experience in Consulting, Professional services or corporate services.

description:
At Boston Scientific you will find a collaborative culture driven by a passion for innovation that keeps us connected on the most essential level. With determination, imagination and a deep caring for human life, we’re solving some of the most important healthcare industry challenges. Together, we are one global team committed to making a difference in people’s lives around the world. This is a place where you can find a career with meaningful purpose – improving lives through your life’s work.
About the role:
The role of IT Systems Analyst is to work with users across the business to assess technology needs and system requirements to improve efficiency. You will be required to liaise with stakeholders including the sales and marketing teams, functional teams and external stakeholders.
In this role you will be responsible for leading the roll out and implementation of new business application modules and releases. You will ensure that all system and related management processes meet and adhere to compliance and regulatory requirements.
What will you be responsible for?
Consulting with users, management and vendors to assess technology needs and system requirements.
Works closely with product owners in documenting user stories and product backlog management
Assist the business in utilizing information systems to improve efficiency. Make recommendations for new systems or upgrades of current systems that will best meet the customers and company requirements.
Oversee all stages of application development from gathering requirements and researching options, design and testing, to rollout and maintenance.
Manage communications between technical staff, vendors, and internal customers to ensure the smooth running of applications.
Manage issues to ensure they are resolved efficiently following established change control procedures.
Identify training needs of end users; develops and provides the necessary training materials to meet those needs.
Ensures that system & related management processes meet all applicable compliance and regulatory requirements.


What are we looking for in you?
Bachelor’s degree with experience in business process and system analysis
Understanding of the software development lifecycle and methodologies
Salesforce.com experience is desirable
Ability to identify and implement process improvement opportunities
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Exceptional organizational & time management skills


About us
As a global medical technology leader for more than 35 years, our mission at Boston Scientific is to transform lives through innovative medical solutions that improve the health of patients. If you’re looking to truly make a difference to people both around the world and around the corner, there no better place to make it happen.
It’s personal… We understand that choosing the right place to work is an important decision. It’s not just about the company; it’s about finding your purpose and a place to grow.
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified.

Job Segment: Medical, Business Analyst, Consulting, Law, Information Systems, Healthcare, Finance, Technology, Legal

Identify and document current business processes to create baseline understanding of current situation and processes.

Demonstrate up-to-date expertise in Information Systems and apply this to the development, execution and improvement of the Strategic Program.
Support and align efforts to meet Strategic Program needs.
Lead or participate in multiple Strategic Program streams by completing and updating program documentation; managing program scope; adjusting schedules when necessary in line with agreed program management governance arrangements.
Provide leadership to team members and peers by collaborating with others; articulating ideas and viewpoints to senior management, peers and others; managing resources; driving the resolution of issues; and holding self and team accountable for results
The successful candidate will have;
Strong project management, ability to successfully manage multiple tasks at any given point and possess strong relationship building skills and communications skills

ESSENTIAL SELECTION CRITERIA

Recent Project Management qualifications in any of the following PMBOK, Prince2 or equivalent Certification from a University
Minimum 3 years’ experience in project management: including completed the full cycle, business analysis, business case, user requirements and technical requirements development
Demonstrated a knowledge of all project phases
Application development experience and understanding of ASP, .Net, Microsoft SharePoint & 365, Google Apps, HTML, & XML ( in ICT infrastructure, desirable)
Solid structure systems analysis and business analysis experience
Ability to build use cases and create business cases for Executive approval
Experience in creating tender documents for third party vendors
Assessing technical documents to ensure that the architecture meets the application requirements
Budget, cost tracking and payment management experience
Highly developed oral and written communication skills
Excellent interpersonal and group communication skills
Initiative and ability to work independently
Superior skills in problem solving and analysis skills
Ability to explain the complex technical information in simplistic terms
Ability to document technical environment and configurations
Internal service delivery skills and experience including technology support
DESIRED SELECTION CRITERIA

Bachelor Degree with major coursework in Computer Science, Information Technology or closely related field
ITIL (Information Technology Infrastructure Library) Version 3 Foundation Certificate
Previous experience in the Education industry
Knowledge of the Catholic School system and faith
To apply, submit your resume and cover letter addressing the selection criteria to hr.recruitment@syd.catholic.edu.au.

WORKING WITH CHILDREN CLEARANCE

This role is classified as a child related work and therefore we require a working with children clearance to be completed prior to your commencement with us.

Applications close: 26 October 2018

description:
Our government client based in Parramatta is currently looking for a Business Analyst to join their team on an initial 9 month contract.

The role focuses on establishing process and protocols to improve the quality, governance and use of its data and information to inform evidence based decisions across all level of the organisation. The role also involves the increasing need for defined and easy processes to support the sharing of data and information with other agencies and focus on building an information and data capability to support users across the enterprise.

The Analyst role is critical in the development and delivery of the information management capability and governance working with the IM team and business stakeholders to develop business and customer requirements, mapping and testing practical and easy to understand processes and protocols in relation to various initiatives in the Information Management and BI roadmaps. This includes supporting the Information Asset Register, Information Management Standards, Information Sharing, Business Glossary, Master Data Management and Reference Data Management.

Key Functions

 Contribute to the development and analysis of business systems, data, processes and procedures to support good information management and governance across the organisation

 Oversee the implementation of information management procedures, policies and roadmap, including providing training, monitoring compliance and reporting on outcomes.

 Research practical and conceptual issues and recommend and implement improvements

If you would be interested in hearing more, please apply today and relevant candidates will be contacted within 24 hours for a confidential discussion. #LI-EG1 #LI-96

description:
As a Business Analyst within our Infrastructure and Real Assets team, you will gain exposure to our funds and managed accounts which have investments in an interesting local portfolio of investments including Hobart Airport, Axicom (communications towers), Genesee & Wyoming (transport), Endeavour Energy (utilities), Land Services South Australia (registries), Paraway (pastoral) as well as offshore investments across Europe and the US.

This role will provide you with an opportunity to build a career in funds management with a focus on fund operations across our unlisted funds and managed accounts in the infrastructure, agriculture and real estate sectors. You will be involved in the full life cycle of each of our Infrastructure and Real Assets funds, including the capital raising process, ongoing fund management and reporting to the fund’s governing body and investors, whilst working closely with asset managers, transaction teams, legal and finance teams as well as fund investors both within Australia as well as globally.

We would expect you to have at least two years’ experience at a top tier firm in investment banking, accounting, management consulting or law, coupled with a tertiary qualification in finance, commerce, economics or a related discipline. You will have strong financial modelling and Excel skills, or demonstrated aptitude in mathematics and excellent verbal and written communication skills.

If you have a strong understanding of business issues and a commercial mindset, apply now. For a confidential discussion please contact Marion Harris on +61 2 8237 7833 or email at marion.harris@macquarie.com.au.

For more information, please visit www.macquarie.com/career.

Macquarie Infrastructure and Real Assets is a leader in alternative asset management worldwide, specialising in infrastructure and other real asset classes via public and private funds, co-investments, partnerships and separately managed accounts. Its client base is primarily institutional investors, including global pension and superannuation funds, other institutions and governments. The division is recognised for its expertise over the investment lifecycle, with strong capabilities in investment sourcing, investment management and investor relationships.

For more information please see: www.mirafunds.com/

Macquarie Asset Management (MAM; formerly known as Macquarie Funds Group) is a full-service asset manager, offering a diverse range of products including securities investment management, infrastructure and real asset management, and fund and equity-based structured products.

MAM comprises the following three divisions:
Macquarie Infrastructure and Real AssetsMacquarie Investment ManagementMacquarie Specialised Investment Solutions.

Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

We facilitate a range of flexible working arrangements within our teams. Talk to us about what flexibility may be available.

LI-AT#
title: Business Analyst/Executive, Macquarie Infrastructure and Real Assets, Macquarie Asset Management

These tasks will be led by an in-house Test Manager to start but the candidate is expected to be able to work autonomously within a short period of time.

description:
Deloitte Digital: Colliding the discipline of Deloitte with the power of creativity.
About the team
Who says work can’t be exciting? At Deloitte Digital, the worlds of business, creative, and technology intersect to transform the way we work, play, and communicate.
Our vision is simple: Empower clients to reimagine how they connect and engage with their customers. We provide clients with a full suite of digital services, covering digital strategy, user experience, content, creative, engineering and implementation across mobile, web and social media channels.
We employ over 400 people, comprising many of the country’s most talented online strategists, designers, engineers, marketers, copywriters, consultants, business analysts and quality assurance professionals. The integration of our passions and talents enables us to build more than just a website. We build new business capability by creating the right balance of creativity, communications and technology.
How are we different? Our difference comes from our diversity. We bring many different perspectives to our clients’ challenges and opportunities. We have the business acumen of a strategic advisor; the design capability of a creative agency and the engineering depth of a technology firm. Furthermore, we can shape our broader range of capabilities into an integrated solution for the more transformational projects requiring expertise in areas such as operations, human capital management, risk management and data analytics.
About You
Our studio in Canberra is growing as we cater for the rapid increase in demand for transformational digital services, due to recent policy developments and whole-of-government initiatives, that create new momentum for change within the public sector. Digital disruption has truly moved from the edges to the core of the Canberra economy!
We like working with bright, talented people who share our passion for all things Digital. With us, you get the chance to work on a variety of projects with some of Australia’s largest and most iconic organisations. Our projects are often high profile – leading, shaping and changing the way the local industry does digital.
The scope of work is always diverse – our strategy is centred on developing solutions for:Mobile applicationsInternet / IntranetCustomer experience designSocial mediaDesktop applicationsTechnology architecture and developmentSystem integrationManaged solutions

Skills / Experience Required
You will have had experience working in multi-disciplinary teams to undertake discovery required for digital transformation projectsYou will be comfortable conducting research activities – interviews, surveys, and desktop researchYou will have had substantial exposure to developing quantitative and qualitative analysis to inform research findingsYou will possess extensive design process experience to support a range of activities, including but not limited to service design, experience design, and UI designYou will possess extensive business analysis and requirements development experience on a range of complex engagements, and be comfortable supporting these activitiesYou will have a passion for developing reports and other project artefacts, and be expected to apply Deloitte consulting methods and tools to solve client business problems
Deloitte Culture
We are innovative and different because YOU are… we pride ourselves on our team of diverse, high performing Deloitte Professionals who are talented, supportive, inclusive and social – and who are at the heart of our success. Our aim is to ensure that all our people feel comfortable to bring their whole selves to work, and as a result, build a workplace that encourages the true spirit of 'And different'.
From day one at our firm you’ll be considered part of the Deloitte community and our development and career progression framework will help you develop the skills and capabilities that will set you up to succeed – in every sense of the word. At Deloitte, we assume that you perform other roles within your life…you could be a student, a teacher, a passionate hobbyist and a caring family member. We recognise the importance of balance and embrace agility, understanding that this means different things to each and every one of our employees.
Next Steps
If this sounds like an exciting career challenge, that aligns with your personal goals and expertise, we want to hear from you. Check out our YouTube page and social channels for further insights into life at Deloitte Digital. In the meantime, we look forward to receiving your application.
The minimum salary offered for this role is $70,000.
title: Consulting - Deloitte Digital Business Analyst

description:
As a Business Analyst within our Infrastructure and Real Assets team, you will gain exposure to our funds and managed accounts which have investments in an interesting local portfolio of investments including Hobart Airport, Axicom (communications towers), Genesee & Wyoming (transport), Endeavour Energy (utilities), Land Services South Australia (registries), Paraway (pastoral) as well as offshore investments across Europe and the US.

This role will provide you with an opportunity to build a career in funds management with a focus on fund operations across our unlisted funds and managed accounts in the infrastructure, agriculture and real estate sectors. You will be involved in the full life cycle of each of our Infrastructure and Real Assets funds, including the capital raising process, ongoing fund management and reporting to the fund’s governing body and investors, whilst working closely with asset managers, transaction teams, legal and finance teams as well as fund investors both within Australia as well as globally.

We would expect you to have at least two years’ experience at a top tier firm in investment banking, accounting, management consulting or law, coupled with a tertiary qualification in finance, commerce, economics or a related discipline. You will have strong financial modelling and Excel skills, or demonstrated aptitude in mathematics and excellent verbal and written communication skills.

If you have a strong understanding of business issues and a commercial mindset, apply now. For a confidential discussion please contact Marion Harris on +61 2 8237 7833 or email at marion.harris@macquarie.com.au.

For more information, please visit www.macquarie.com/career.

Macquarie Infrastructure and Real Assets is a leader in alternative asset management worldwide, specialising in infrastructure and other real asset classes via public and private funds, co-investments, partnerships and separately managed accounts. Its client base is primarily institutional investors, including global pension and superannuation funds, other institutions and governments. The division is recognised for its expertise over the investment lifecycle, with strong capabilities in investment sourcing, investment management and investor relationships.

For more information please see: www.mirafunds.com/

Macquarie Asset Management (MAM; formerly known as Macquarie Funds Group) is a full-service asset manager, offering a diverse range of products including securities investment management, infrastructure and real asset management, and fund and equity-based structured products.

MAM comprises the following three divisions:
Macquarie Infrastructure and Real AssetsMacquarie Investment ManagementMacquarie Specialised Investment Solutions.

Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

We facilitate a range of flexible working arrangements within our teams. Talk to us about what flexibility may be available.

LI-AT#

title: PERMANENT - Business Analyst

description:
Bengalla Mining Company is a joint venture with a strong track record of achievement. Our focus is on maintaining strong safety, productivity and profitability results. We have a very collaborative team culture and a highly professional and rewarding work environment.

Operational since 1999, Bengalla is located in Muswellbrook in the Hunter Valley, and supplies international markets with approximately nine million tonnes of thermal coal per annum. Bengalla is an open pit coal mine offering a residential lifestyle. The development consent for the operation provides the ability to mine through to 2039. We pride ourselves on the professionalism with which we pursue our goals and our strong links into our community.

The Opportunity

We are currently seeking a highly experienced Senior Business Analyst to work on site within the Commercial team in an influential role directly contributing to the continued success of the Bengalla Mine. Reporting directly to the Commercial Manager, you will provide critical analysis of all capital requests, value propositions and support the capital approval process.

Your responsibilities will include:
Providing mine management with timely and accurate business analysis of the strategic options for value propositions
Managing the request for capital spend across all departments on site and providing a risk analysis to the originators of the capital for major maintenance, expansion and equipment hire or purchase
Leading the business planning process and through effective written communication have an influence over the annual operating plan and forecasting process
Providing a timely analysis of options with reasoned recommendations and risk assessments supporting the spending of capital
Interacting with internal customers to ensure proposals are defined, relevant data and information are identified and appropriate options explored
Identifying the areas of continuous improvement and providing business analysis support
Working in a team comprised of IT, Accounting, Procurement and Commercial Experts, you will be provided with a rare opportunity to work alongside a group of diverse peers with hands on interaction across all departments on site.


Qualifications and Experience

Along with your extensive knowledge of the mining industry, you will have the technical confidence to understand capital applications and business improvement projects. Exhibiting yourself as a clear and innovative thinker, you will have a proven track record of successfully communicating through written reports based on your analysis and the ability to influence at all levels of the organisation through your recommendations. To be successful in this role, you will have the following qualifications and experience:
Relevant tertiary qualifications (Business, Finance) and/or previous experience working in an Operational focused technical role (ie: Technical Services, Senior Engineer, Geologist, or Mine Planner) with proven commercial experience;
Solid industry experience in Mining operations;
Proven experience with financial modelling and forecasting;
High-level Computer skills relating to data manipulation;
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills;
Previous exposure to budgeting and planning software preferably Pulse and Xeras;
Effective report writing, strong communication skills and ability to influence at all levels.

What we offer

Bengalla values its people and their contribution to the operation. Our well-established employee benefits program offers choice and flexibility to enhance the lifestyle and wellbeing of our team. description:
SENIOR BUSINESS ANALYSTS (S48)
STRATEGY & ARCHITECTURE
PARRAMATTA 6 months plus extensions
FinXL IT Professional Services is an established innovative Australian company providing technology enabled business solutions and consulting services across a number of industries including Telecommunications, Commercial, Government and Finance.

FinXL is looking to engage 2 x Senior Business Analysts for business and consulting services for our high-profile NSW Government clients for an initial Six (6) Month contract, extensions are very likely.

The role will work closely with the Strategy and Architecture teams (reporting to the Enterprise Architect) formulating a 5 year transformation program that involves business and technical transformation of compliance and regulatory services. As a Business Analyst you will assist in providing current state understanding and target state process re-engineering input to the first phase business case of a multiple year program

Business Process Definition, Functional Analysis and Optimisation
Assist the Enterprise Architect (Business) in meeting with key business stakeholders to understand business needs, gather information, analyse and document regulatory processes.
Assessing the efficiency and effectiveness of existing business operations to establish a base for developing improved structures, processes and systems.
Perform Function Point Analysis on documented processes for business case input.
Analysing workflow to create process and information models and identify areas of potential improvement.
Support the Architecture office in analysis of system functionality to create process and information models and identifying areas of potential improvement.
Develop appropriate use cases to assist early assessment of platform option suitability and opportunities for digitalisation.
Maintain accountability for quality analysis and documentation that is the foundation on which future systems are developed.
Contributing to business case development that will describe and justify the parameters of technology change initiatives.
ICT Solution Development
Producing functional specifications to communicate user requirements in technical terms for approval by senior management, Project Managers and Solution Architects.
Reviewing functional specifications and solution concepts developed by vendors that describe the desired outcomes of system development, integration or enhancement projects within agreed policies, standards and architectures to ensure these solutions meet the business requirements.
Contributing to business cases that describe and justify the parameters of technology change initiatives.
Support the development of test strategies, plans, scripts and assist in SIT where applicable in conjunction with project test resources.
Skills and experience required
5-8 years relevant Senior Business Analyst experience with a specific focus on process elicitation, documentation using BPMN notation and process re-engineering.
Ability to work in public sector environment undergoing organisational change, and be skilled at stakeholder management and process definition using BPMN notation.
Must have very sound written and verbal communication skills and be adept at coordination and delivery of workshops with staff unaided.
Sounds like you? APPLY TODAY and call Matt Franke (02)82436808 but hurry as appliactions close midday Friday 12th October
