description:
Senior/Lead Business Analyst
Business Transformation Program, Agile thinking and future focused
Large Government Organisation – Business Focused BA roles
6 -12 months contracts – 6 open roles – Excellent $$$ per day rate on offer!
Melbourne / Geelong
Work life balance with Flexibility
Adaps has been scouted to source Senior Business Analyst for a large government organisation to work on large business transformation project in Melbourne.
Client is mainly focusing on:
Business transformation program
Experience working on projects with Digital transformation initiatives (Highly desirable)
Agile thinking and future focused
RFQ (Request for Quotation)
Vendor management
Business problem solving skills
Decommissioning
Your new role
The Senior Business Analyst role is to provide business analyst services to support the delivery of Strategy. The Senior Business Analyst role is to engage with the business to understand the business context and the business case for change. The will work with the business to define outcomes and benefits, elicit, document and model business requirements.
The person in this position is responsible for but not limited to;
Engaging with the business to understand the initiative context and business case for change in order to assist identification of business objectives and required outcomes
Identifying key business requirements through consultation with the business, formal analysis and assessment of needs
Facilitating discussion with stakeholders and vendors to understand their issues, needs and expectations
Working individually or in a team of business analysts to develop and model business requirements, process models and use cases in accordance with best practice business analysis frameworks and methodologies
Undertake business impact analysis in support of organisational change management
Assist with benefits realisation planning
Identify opportunities, make recommendations and implement improvements to processes, systems and work practices.
Implementing Requirements Traceability using the defined methods and tools throughout the project lifecycle to ensure delivery of quality outcomes.
Contributing to the preparation of User Acceptance Testing (UAT) plans & scripts, and lead/support the business representatives in the conducting of their UAT
About you
You will be passionate about the new direction of Client Strategy thrive on the opportunity to be instrumental in the organisations significant change and transformation.
You must be able to work with and influence people across entire organisations and beyond. Some of the skills and experience you will possess include but not limited to;
Proven experience as a Business (non-IT) BA (minimum of 5 years)

description:
Well Known Australian Brand

Based in South Melbourne

About Our Client
We are currently looking for a Lead Business Analyst to join a well-known and respected Australian brand. Our client is established for their successful business and people orientated service. They have an immediate need for a Lead BA to join their team.

Job Description
The successful applicant will be responsible for:

Lead facilitation of Agile ceremonies like daily stand-ups, grooming sessions and other sprint ceremonies, and coaching teams on Agile tools and techniques. Work with Delivery Leads to determine capacity and capability of the teams and help with release/ sprint planning.
Actively participate in the agile delivery community sharing and re-applying skills and knowledge, and bring in best practice across the organisation.
Actively remove roadblocks for the team and escalate external issues to delivery lead. Track team metrics like Sprint Burndown, velocity, cycle time etc.
Take the lead in ensuring that business priorities are reflected in sprint planning
Lead a team of business analysts, by providing leadership and competency guidance for business analysts in the completion of their initiative delivery duties.
Demonstrated experience in leading workshops with senior stakeholders and technical teams.
Facilitate ideation and inception workshops together with Delivery Leads and PO's.
Use of appropriate language for the intended audience in clear English, from a both non-technical and technical perspective
Able to facilitate requirement gathering workshops with PO's, business stakeholders, architects and technical resources to elicit requirements and clearly articulate business needs. Use innovative approaches that satisfy stakeholders and demonstrate their buy-in.
Active ownership of the Product Backlog and support in Sprint planning ceremonies with prioritised stories. Support Delivery Lead in reporting on status of the release/ backlog.
Collaborate with stakeholders and work with the Digital Team to deliver initiatives through structured planning and leverage Agile delivery principles.
Facilitate traceability of the requirements through design, build, testing and deployment
Facilitate competitor analysis, market research, brainstorming/ discovery sessions, research, and options analysis.
Leverage a range of industry analysis techniques, to suit the needs of the specific project activity.
The Successful Applicant
The successful applicant will ideally possess the following:

Minimum of 3 years cross functional experience in a Business and IT environment working as a Business Analyst or Lead Business Analyst.
Previous experience working in Finance, Banking or Health Insurance.
Prior experience with capability uplift, establishing governance framework, processes and best practices.
Ability to coach, develop and mentor others
Demonstrated experience in providing thought leadership, collaborative input to Digital Delivery Team, mentoring, coaching and training colleagues, team members and direct reports.
Coaching team members and external stakeholders on the benefits of a lean, agile and adaptive organisation
Ability to manage multiple tasks and deliverables at the same time.
Experience working on business change, internal IT, infrastructure related projects and working with stakeholders at all levels within an organisation.
Experience dealing with senior Product Owners (and stakeholders), System Architects, Developers, Testers, Design Teams, Customer and User Experience experts, to drive business solutions that align with project objectives.
Ability to recommend technology, process solutions to improve business performance.
Use of formal documentation methodologies (such as UML, BPM, Use Cases & User Stories)
Ability to document User Guides and Change Management processes.
Ability to effectively manage multiple project streams/tasks of varying complexities, meet deadlines and work well under pressure.
Ability to seek business opportunities to streamline processes with automated solutions, both internally and externally.
Must have experience using JIRA for managing backlogs and driving reporting.
What's on Offer
An exciting opportunity is available for a Lead Business Analyst to join a well known and respected Australian brand based in South Melbourne.

Contact:
Anita O'Hara

description:
Employment Type: Permanent Full Time
Position Classification: Health Manager Level 3
Remuneration: $110,961 - $126,496 per annum
Hours Per Week: 38
Requisition ID: REQ72326

Please note: To be eligible for permanent appointment to a position in NSW Health, you must have an Australian citizenship or permanent Australian residency.

South Western Sydney is an exciting, interesting and dynamic place to live and work. South Western Sydney is home to a mixture of metropolitan and rural communities which is culturally diverse. South Western Sydney has a very significant Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Community, especially in Campbelltown, Wollondilly, Camden, Wingecarribee and Liverpool.

Transforming Your Experience is SWSLHDs key strategy to positively transform how our patients, consumers, staff and communities experience our organisation and services. Our vision is that our care is always safe, high quality and personalised and all our staff are supported and empowered to achieve their full potential. SWSLHD upholds the CORE Values – Collaboration, Openness, Respect and Empowerment. The Transforming Your Experience Strategy provides us with a clear direction for working together to deliver safe and high quality health services and build the health of our communities – now and into the future.

Equal Employment Opportunity
South Western Sydney Local Health District is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and people with disability are encouraged to apply for all internal and externally advertised positions. If you require assistance, please advise the contact person at the time of your application.

Where you'll be working
Liverpool Hospital is the major health service for South Western Sydney providing services to the local government area of Liverpool City Council as well as district services to residents and visitors in the area. It also provides a range of statewide services in areas such as critical care and trauma, neonatal intensive care and brain injury rehabilitation.

Liverpool City and South Western Sydney is home to people from diverse cultures, religions and languages, making our community vibrant and exciting. We are situated in one of the fastest-growing regions in Australia and sit within an education and health precinct which includes the Ingham Institute of Applied Medical Research, a Clinical Skills and Simulation Centre, the Clinical Schools of the University of NSW and University of Western Sydney, Sydney South West.

What you'll be doing
The purpose of the Senior Clinical Analyst is to provide the clinical program and projects with clinical and business expertise to integrate the new solutions into effective and efficient clinical and business practices and ensure that the change activities support delivery of a safe, sustainable solution and that maintains patient safety and quality.

Actively involved in co-ordination of requests to ICT, facilitation of workshops, benefits analysis, lifecycle management, process reviews and improvements, options analysis and reporting.
Selection Criteria

Demonstrated extensive experience managing the review and analysis of ICT business and clinical processes in services within a large health or hospital organisation.
Demonstrated experience in conducting business process redesign, documentation of workflow, data flow analysis diagrams, benefits realisation and change management documents.
Demonstrated ability to manage stakeholder expectations and to confidently achieve high quality outcomes while adhering to government policies and organisational practices within a structured delivery framework.
Extensive experience in supporting delivery of business outcomes, to time and expected levels of quality, including the ability to manage risks and issues within a project.
Excellent time management skills and a proven ability to show initiative including a "can do" attitude and a personality that finds ways to work around obstacles.
Demonstrated ability to identify and solve problems when and where required with only minimal guidance from senior management.
Strong negotiation skills and ability to work within multidisciplinary teams and key stakeholders both internal and external to the organisation to achieve desired outcomes.
Knowledge of project management and computer systems including PRINCE2, proficient in Microsoft Visio, Project, PowerPoint, Word and Excel.


Need more information?
 1) Click here for the Position Description
 2) Find out more about applying for this position
For role related queries or questions contact Randolph Egan on Randolph.Egan@health.nsw.gov.au or on 02 8738 6074


Applications Close: 04/11/2018

Interview Date Range: 05/11/2018 - 09/11/2018
title: Senior Business Analyst(Health Manager Level 3)-Liverpool Hospital-Perm F/T

description:
6-month contract with possible extension
Brisbane
Large government organisation
Responsibilities
Proactively manage key stakeholder relationships, and lead and conduct workshops and meetings as required to define business processes, and ensure improved outcomes.
Obtain formal agreement from stakeholders on the scope of requirements (including business focused user stories) to establish a base line on which delivery of a solution can commence.
Where required, initiate communications between stakeholders, acting as a single point of contact for defined groups and facilitating open communication and discussion between stakeholders.
Assist and prepare project stakeholders business cases which define potential benefit, options for achieving these benefits (through development of new or changes processes) and associated business risks.
Take responsibility for investigative work to determine business requirements and specify effective business processes, through improvements in information systems, information management, practices, procedures, and organisation change.
Contribute to organisational change through recommended improvements to existing business processes, practices, procedures and information systems.
Provide a high level of expertise in establishing and documenting ICT business and system requirements through a range of structured research and analysis techniques including, but not limited to facilitated stakeholder workshops, surveys, client meetings and industry reference reviews.
Analyse and document business processes and related ICT requirements and take a lead role in the development of ICT system requirements specifications, including logical design.
Conduct investigations at a high level for strategy studies, business requirements specifications and feasibility studies.
Apply and monitor the use of required modelling and analysis tools, methods and standards, giving special consideration to business perspectives.
Apply and utilise business modelling methods to ensure results oriented deliverables in a way that can be recreated and used as a corporate knowledge resource available to project level initiatives and executive decision making.
Develop conceptual models of business processes utilising appropriate modelling techniques to develop end to end service mappings.
Act as a subject matter expert in the development of business architecture framework, tool suite selection and design and methodology development.
Actively participate in the management of client expectations in a limited resource development environment with competing priorities
Required Skills

Minimum of 5 years’ experience in a Senior Business Analyst role or a role requiring business process analysis and improvement.
Experience in business process reengineering/redesign and implementation.
Experience in change management.
Exceptional problem-solving capabilities with a focus on simplification.
Experience in recording process metrics.
Experience working with senior level stakeholders.
High level written and oral communication skills and excellent organisational skills.
Ability to work effectively with little supervision and as part of a team in the design, preparation and delivery of solutions to clients.
Experience writing user stories and use cases.
Experience understanding business process dynamics and the change management process.
Demonstrated experience in managing relationships with stakeholders, clients, customers, engaging necessary subject matter experts and resources to achieve mutually beneficial business outcomes.
Demonstrated experience with investigative work to determine business requirements and specify effective business processes (including business focused user-stories), through improvements in information systems, information management, procedures and organisational change.
Demonstrated experience in identifying and validating multiple requirement types such as Business, systems, configuration and concept and experience modelling business processes using Business Process Modelling Notation (BPMN).
Demonstrated ability to analyse business cases, which define potential benefits, options for achieving these benefits through development of new or change processes and associated business risks.
Demonstrated well developed communications, interpersonal and negotiation skills, including demonstrated experience in conducting workshops and maintaining positive relationships with stakeholders, ICT operators and other service providers.
Please send your CV in Word format to cvs@synergyplacements.com.au.

Tender closes on 25 October 2018. Statement of suitability to be completed on 24 October 2018.

You will also be collaborating with the wider organisation including Sales, Support, Developers, Technical Writing and Quality Assurance throughout the development process to ensure the product is functionally complete and well-engineered.

description:
Exciting permanent opportunity!
Melbourne based, excellent package with bonuses $$$
Superannuation, Pensions and Wealth Management experience is essential!!
This is a pivotal business role and your communication and Agile delivery will be of paramount importance. The candidate must have experience in multiple areas of business analysis and is able to exercise professional judgement to independently complete most tasks. Copes with complex business problems through deliberate analysis and planning. Achieves great results on less complex tasks without supervision.

A key function of this role will be to create both a tactical and long-term road map of changes, that need to be made so that function to have fit for purpose IT systems. This role will be responsible for creating and delivering the documentation standardised the IT delivery method.

The main responsibilities for this role will be broad and not limited to:

Lifecycle Management
An excellent critical thinker. They look at a problem from multiple perspectives, challenge assumptions and guard against flaws in the reasoning of their stakeholders and themselves.
Strategy Analysis - Considers the relationship between client solutions and our internal enterprise and product strategy. Examines how project goals support client strategic objectives.
Considers the relationship between client solutions and our internal enterprise and product strategy. Examines how project goals support client strategic objectives.
Deliver a quality solution by the required date
Assist with technical solution design
Provide estimates for effort and cost
Provide quality documentation (including test cases, technical specifications and user/admin guides)
Thorough scripting & testing for all system changes or resolutions (including unit, integration, regression and performance testing)
Support users during UAT
One-on-one system training with users when required
Where appropriate, provide a standard solution for a requested change
Some practical experience to lead and manage tier 2 & 3 projects/initiatives to successful completion
Professional Experience

Senior Business Analyst in the role typically have 8 - 10 years of formal business analysis experience, working with project teams of more than 10 people. Experience of working with internationally distributed teams is useful. Experience working within an Agile delivery environment is also be an advantage.
Practical Mastery

Stakeholder analysis including RACI
Use case modelling and documentation
User story development including acceptance criteria
Business Rules modelling and documentation
Process modelling including BPMN
Business domain modelling
Workshop facilitation
Traceability management


Domain Knowledge

Superannuation and pensions
Funds management
Wrap platform operations
Other financial services
Software platform implementations
Additional qualities

The Senior Business Analyst has excellent written and verbal communication skills. They create stories about the business that form a foundation for shared understanding. Concepts and terms woven into the story often form the new language of the business.

The Senior Business Analyst is collaborative. Their work involves facilitating connections between different business groups and delivery roles to understand needs, design solutions and analyse impacts. This often requires careful negotiation and consensus building.

Qualifications

The following qualifications will be highly regarded.

Certificate of Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) from the IIBA
Formal training in business analysis fundamentals
Higher education degree


The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 8 -10 years as a Senior IT Business Analyst, have very good skills within the communication and documentation space. The focus in this position is the business analysis, effective communication skills and a real team spirit!

For this satisfying and challenging position, apply now or call Kuldish Kaur on 0413 69 5070 for an informal discussion.

Please be aware that we will only be responding to candidates who have the right to work in Australia and who we feel best match the requirements stipulated by our client.

Please apply now for immediate consideration, screening to take place next week with interviews ideally being held the week commencing 08/10/2018. For further questions only please call Danielle on 02 8296 9826.

Job Description
The Finance Business Analyst will sit embedded within their department and will be finance ambassador to ensure they keep on track with budgets, project costing and business proposals. The work will be split between setting and managing the monthly department budget including on-going variance analysis, providing financial due diligence to business case proposals to ensure financial viability, as well as monitoring the cost benefit realisation as projects evolve.

An exciting opportunity to be a part of a global technology services company to provide optimal business outcomes in a large scale insurance project. There is potential for a long term contract extension beyond the initial 6 months.

As the Senior Business Analyst you will be initiated in providing expertise advisory on a large scale complex project. The ideal candidate will have a strong experience background working within the insurance domain.

Responsibilities

As the Senior Business Analyst you will be:

Develop and maintain strong internal customer relationships with key project and business leaders to define and understand the strategic objectives of their programs and projects.
Translate and/or map business requirements to project deliverables and project activities.
Maintain traceability between business requirements and designs (whether prepared internally or externally).
Define system interfaces and processes based on a thorough understanding of end-to-end solution.
Identify through design, system interfaces and change process to meet end to end requirements.
Establish and manage processes that provide timely, effective and value adding analysis, forecasting, reporting and monitoring of defined processes.
Provide insightful commentary and recommendations on project status, trends and independencies to key stakeholders through the analysis and synthesis of complex and disparate project reporting data.
Follow up and communicate with project managers and stakeholders on the level of understanding and compliance to governance reporting quality standards and project methodology.
Requirements

As the Senior Business Analyst you will have:

5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst
3+ years working within the insurance domain

Experience working within an agile framework

Business Requirements

description:
Increasingly rare Perth based mine accountant/ business analyst role with some site travel. Focus on operational performance.

The Company
Mid-tier miner where the operations are as efficient as ever and continue to outperform prior year production results. The company has a very stable management team both in operations and corporate office. With a relaxed, yet professional approach, the team environment is one that is fiercely protected. Going beyond your job description is the rule, not the exception and helping hands are everywhere to be found. In return, you are able to work reasonable hours with flexibility, remunerated generously, and treated like and adult, all in a CBD location.

The Role
As a mine accountant, you will take responsibility for site financials, closely monitoring key KPI's, delivering meaningful commentary to the business and corporate. Your previous site based experience will gain you the respect of the team immediately, and allow you to business partner with the mine GM and full site leadership team. The role is diversified and will have full P&L responsibility for the site. The role reports directly into the business and into the finance team.

About You
Bring your mining/mining services experience to the table and be rewarded with a great opportunity to shine in a Perth based team. You have demonstrated an ability to deliver timely and accurate financial information, along with value added commentary in a similar setting. You will have demonstrable experience in delivering cost savings and problem solving skills. Ideally you have been a mine accountant in order to be considered for the shortlist.

How to Apply
Please indicate your interest in this unique opportunity by providing your cover letter and CV, attention Briony Gibson through this advert or through our website at www.fourquarters.com.au. Shortlisting will commence immediately, so do not delay in securing yourself a new position with growth opportunity built in. Your application will be held in strict confidence. Sponsorship/Relocation is not available on this occasion. Work rights in Australia are required.

For additional opportunities to advance your career in 2018, please visit www.fourquarters.com.au or contact your local Australian office (Perth, Sydney, Melbourne).

description:
Global software vendor - Best known for their solutions in Automotive finance
BA focus on the financial systems running the loan and lease portfolios
Fintech industry will guarantee future growth
Specialist Software provider - Automotive and Equipment Finance
North Sydney Location
Working with Global client base


Company: Is a leading global provider of Automotive Finance and Equipment Leasing software to banks and finance companies. Their product range is end to end, from origination through receivables management, collections and financial management.

Opportunity: Due to the conquest of new clients in Australia and Overseas, coupled with the massive raft of legal, compliance and accounting standard changes. There has been a massive increase in projects, which they are seeking full time / permanent Business Analysts.

Role: Is a permanent role working with Asia pacific clients on both new functionality and/or new client system migrations. There have also been a number of new client appointments made overseas which is likely to lead to business travel for work.

Globally there has been a huge amount of legal, accounting and other compliance changes that the software needs to respond to and this is not expected to reduce any time soon. As such the bulk of the projects focus upon the back end receivable management systems that carry the assets and interact with the accounting GL. Little activity is anticipated with the Contract acquisition side of things.

With 100% of the client base being Finance companies and leasing businesses, the role will be a Subject Matter Expert on all Asset finance products as you develop client solutions considering Tax, finance legislation, accounting standards using terminology the clients understand.

Along with being a leasing and finance subject matter expert, this role will be managing stakeholders both internal and with clients, to ensure delivery within the required deadlines. With the success of new client wins, customer satisfaction is critical though the SDLC process.

Requirements: We are seeking to discuss this role with candidates who best demonstrate the following skills and experience:

Subject Matter Expert level knowledge of equipment finance and leasing products
Tertiary qualifications in accounting or a related discipline are preferred
Past business improvement experience, ideally including IT system changes
Previous experience to building complex financial pricing models is highly regarded
Strong stakeholder management and communication skills


Questions relating to your application may be directed to Simon Bird on (02) 8920 1855. All applications are confidentially held until otherwise discussed.

BUSINESS ANALYST / SENIOR BUSINESS ANALYST / PROGRAM MANAGER / SDLC / FP&A ANALYST / INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY / SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT / AUTOMOTIVE FINANCE / LEASING / ASSET FINANCE / EQUIPMENT FINANCE / PROJECT MANAGER / CONSUMER FINANCE / COMMERCIAL FINANCE / BANKING

description:
3 month contract (extension options)
QLD Government
Brisbane CBD
I am currently recruiting a Senior Business Analyst with a background in Business Intelligence to work with the Department of Education on the implementation of their Business Intelligence Services.

Project Overview
Strategy and Performance, Business Intelligence Solutions are running a number of Business Intelligence (BI) projects with the aim to improve the information provision to business unit management, executives, and regional offices by establishing a BI reporting platform as well as integrating and automating existing monitoring and reporting systems.
The Early Childhood Reporting Intelligence System Project aims to provide user friendly reports and modern data visualisation dashboards that allow different business units to have a consolidated view of disparate data sets.
The Online School Data Profile Project main objective is to provide a contemporary reporting solution that enables agile delivery of SP products in an online and interactive environment.
The Corporate Reporting (Power BI Implementation) Project scope is to deliver BI services (both internal and external to the organisation) and base cloud services to support Power BI in the cloud.
Position Overview & Description
The successful candidate will:

Liaise with business stakeholders to identify, design and document requirements for metrics and data visualisations for a School Data Profile.
Provide support to multi-skilled teams and act as a bridge between business and technical stakeholders in defining and developing critical metrics and reports.
Provide a high level of expertise in establishing and documenting ICT business and system requirements through a range of structured research and analysis techniques including, but not limited to facilitated stakeholder workshops, surveys, client meetings and industry reference reviews.
Where required, initiate communications between stakeholders, acting as a single point of contact for defined groups and facilitating open communication and discussion between stakeholders.
Coordinate project delivery by participating in design reviews and walk-throughs to communicate systems designs and validate proposed solutions.
Actively participate in the management of client expectations in a limited resource development environment with competing priorities.
Excellent verbal and written communications skills to effectively communicate and collaborate with a range of internal and external stakeholders.
Ability to communicate insights and recommendations to senior leadership.
An understanding of Power BI data visualisations, and BI tools.
Experience in interactive data visualisation design is preferable.
An understanding of basic statistical techniques.
A good understanding of data visualisation principles.
Ability to learn new business and data analysis techniques independently.
Have general systems and application development knowledge.
Have good problem solving and critical thinking skills.
This role closes on the 27th September 2018. Apply now!

Graham Eather - 07 3232 2300

description:
A prestigious global firm seek a Technical Business Analyst to join their highly regarded projects team with excellent career growth opportunities.

Do you have a technical background & an interest in data and want to work for a company at the forefront of technology in a team with an awesome culture?

If this sounds like you and you want to work in state of the art offices in the heart of the CBD, then hit the Apply for this job button now!

They are:


As a highly prestigious international finance firm, they have a focus on hiring the best technologists on the market, but more than that, people who fit their genuinely collaborative, supportive & driven culture.

You'll enjoy working in premium CBD offices (arguably the nicest in Sydney), with amazing views, fantastic facilities, onsite gym, library and paid breakfasts & lunches (prepared by their chef).

With a friendly, personable & very knowledgeable manager, you'll gain exposure to finance & trading, guaranteed bonuses & wonderful perks.


You are:


You’re a Junior to mid-level Technical Business Analyst with around three to five years of experience & a highly analytical approach to working through problems and coming up with solutions.

You come with solid experience working with data and know how to find information, analyse it, then piece the puzzle together.

The tools you use are up to you, it may be Python, SQL, Excel etc. and you’ll ideally be able to do some back-end testing.


The role:


As a Technical Business Analyst, you will partner with technical & business teams to analyse processes and recommend, implement, and/or support technology based solutions that align high level project goals.

Working in a small projects team of four, you’ll have the opportunity to progress into project management in the longer term, move into different teams (risk, back-office etc.) or move into data analytics.

The work in this role will be varied and will span across all parts of the business, with some emphasis on market data.

Requirements / Skills / Experience:


Curious nature & ability to ‘investigate’ situations to find the information you need
Skills to understand, analyse, diagram and describe complex distributed systems, processes and high level data flows
Able to analyse and document business processes and use cases, diagram system topologies
Able to leverage knowledge of the software development life cycle to enhance the analysis, coordination and maintenance of tasks
Some back-end testing
A few years of experience providing application and/or systems implementation and technical business analysis / task management
Strong analytical/problem solving skills

description:
Well Known Australian Brand

Based in South Melbourne

About Our Client
We are currently looking for a Senior Business Analyst to join a well-known and respected Australian brand. Our client is established for their successful business and people orientated service. They have an immediate need for a Senior BA to join their team.

Job Description
The successful applicant will be responsible for:

Lead facilitation of agile ceremonies like daily stand-ups, grooming sessions and other sprint ceremonies, and coaching teams on agile tools and techniques. Work with Delivery Leads to determine capacity and capability of the teams and help with release/ sprint planning.
Actively participate in the agile delivery community sharing and re-applying skills and knowledge, and bring in best practice across the organisation.
Actively remove roadblocks for the team and escalate external issues to delivery lead. Track team metrics like Sprint burndown, velocity, cycle time etc.
Be an active member of the team and help in mentoring team members
Take the lead in ensuring that business priorities are reflected in sprint planning
Demonstrated experience in leading workshops with senior stakeholders and technical teams.
Facilitate ideation and inception workshops together with Delivery Leads and PO's.
Ability to break down complex business problems into Epics, Features and stories to clearly articulate requirements. And be able to elaborate user stories, define meaningful acceptance criteria, RAIDs, non-functional requirements etc.
Use of appropriate language for the intended audience in clear English, from a both non-technical and technical perspective
Able to facilitate requirement gathering workshops with PO's, business stakeholders, architects and technical resources to elicit requirements and clearly articulate business needs. Use innovative approaches that satisfy stakeholders and demonstrate their buy-in.
Actively collaborate with team members to refine, manage and communicate business requirements.
Active ownership of the Product Backlog and support in Sprint planning ceremonies with prioritised stories. Support Delivery Lead in reporting on status of the release/ backlog.
Collaborate with stakeholders and work with the Digital Team to deliver initiatives through structured planning and leverage agile delivery principles.
Facilitate traceability of the requirements through design, build, testing and deployment
Facilitate competitor analysis, market research, brainstorming/ discovery sessions, research, and options analysis.
The Successful Applicant
The successful candidate will ideally possess the following:

At least 3 years cross functional experience in a Business and IT environment working as a Business Analyst or Senior Business Analyst.
Previous experience working in Banking or health insurance.
Financial Reporting experience.
Prior experience with capability uplift, establishing governance framework, processes and best practises.
Ability to coach, develop and mentor others.
Coaching team members and on the benefits of a lean, agile and adaptive organisation.
Ability to manage multiple tasks and deliverables at the same time.
Experience working on business change, internal IT, infrastructure related projects and working with stakeholders at all levels within an organisation.
Experience dealing with senior Product Owners (and stakeholders), System Architects, Developers, Testers, Design Teams, Customer and User Experience experts, to drive business solutions that align with project objectives.
Ability to recommend technology, process solutions to improve business performance.
Use of formal documentation methodologies (such as UML, BPM, Use Cases & User Stories).
Ability to document User Guides and Change Management processes.
Ability to seek business opportunities to streamline processes with automated solutions, both internally and externally.
Must have experience using JIRA for managing backlogs and driving reporting.
Desirable to have exposure to enterprise testing tools and conducting UAT testing with the business.
Experience of working with Human Centered Design concepts, Lean process methodologies like Six Sigma is a plus.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Extensive experience with facilitating workshops and working with diverse user groups from a business and technical perspective.
Excellent problem solving skills.
What's on Offer
An exciting opportunity is available for a Senior Business Analyst to join a well known and respected Australian brand based in South Melbourne.

Contact:
Anita O'Hara

description:
Leading state government department
Contract through June 2019
Please call Renee Clayton or Riley Osborne on (07) 3232 9146
About the Role

The purpose of this role is to provide specialist expertise to enable the successful delivery of a large scale, complex Information Management (IM) and Information and Communication Technology (ICT) Program to deliver an exemplar Operating Model.

Leading state government department requires a Principal Business Analyst with demonstrated experience in a similar role in a complex organisation or preferably gained in a healthcare environment. BABOk and ITIL Foundation Certification are considered desirable.

Key Responsibilities

Conduct workshops to understand current state, gaps and define the future state end to end operating processes for the ieMR Target Operating Model;
Key project deliverables: understanding current workflows and development of future state workflows, process mapping, designing the solution and end to end operation processes to meet stakeholder requirements, testing, assisting in designing training approach, assisting in deployment (if required);
Lead the analysis of business requirements and system requirements and provide strategic expertise to staff and management to ensure requirements are aligned ITIL and best practice;
Analyse and solve complex system problems to provide innovative solutions to business requirements in the delivery of support to the client and completion of project work in required timeframes; and
Contribute to effective, client focussed teamwork by developing an understanding of the roles and duties of team members within the team and across the project and working collaboratively to achieve outcomes with a commitment to quality and customer service.
Mandatory Qualifications / Professional Registration / Other Requirements

This position requires:

At least five years’ experience working as a business analyst within an ICT project delivery team;
Proven experience delivering business analysis capability in an ITIL environment, highly desirable;
Extensive knowledge of Business Analysis methods, techniques and tools; and
Knowledge of the IT industry and related areas including trends and challenges;

description:
A prestigious global firm seek a Technical Business Analyst to join their highly regarded projects team with excellent career growth opportunities.

Do you have a technical background & an interest in data and want to work for a company at the forefront of technology in a team with an awesome culture?

If this sounds like you and you want to work in state of the art offices in the heart of the CBD, then hit the Apply for this job button now!

They are:


As a highly prestigious international finance firm, they have a focus on hiring the best technologists on the market, but more than that, people who fit their genuinely collaborative, supportive & driven culture.

You'll enjoy working in premium CBD offices (arguably the nicest in Sydney), with amazing views, fantastic facilities, onsite gym, library and paid breakfasts & lunches (prepared by their chef).

With a friendly, personable & very knowledgeable manager, you'll gain exposure to finance & trading, guaranteed bonuses & wonderful perks.


You are:


You’re a Junior to mid-level Technical Business Analyst with around three to five years of experience & a highly analytical approach to working through problems and coming up with solutions.

You come with solid experience working with data and know how to find information, analyse it, then piece the puzzle together.

The tools you use are up to you, it may be Python, SQL, Excel etc. and you’ll ideally be able to do some back-end testing.


The role:


As a Technical Business Analyst, you will partner with technical & business teams to analyse processes and recommend, implement, and/or support technology based solutions that align high level project goals.

Working in a small projects team of four, you’ll have the opportunity to progress into project management in the longer term, move into different teams (risk, back-office etc.) or move into data analytics.

The work in this role will be varied and will span across all parts of the business, with some emphasis on market data.

Requirements / Skills / Experience:


Curious nature & ability to ‘investigate’ situations to find the information you need
Skills to understand, analyse, diagram and describe complex distributed systems, processes and high level data flows
Able to analyse and document business processes and use cases, diagram system topologies
Able to leverage knowledge of the software development life cycle to enhance the analysis, coordination and maintenance of tasks
Some back-end testing
A few years of experience providing application and/or systems implementation and technical business analysis / task management
Strong analytical/problem solving skills

This is a great opportunity - To apply, please submit your CV via the portal by clicking the APPLY for this job button below.

You can also contact Erinn Brukmann on 0422 154 366.

South Bank Location | Health | Digital Imaging Informatics | RIS | PACS

Initial contract until June 2019 paying $800/day

Our client, a large complex organisation within the Health industry, is currently seeking to engage a Principal Business Analyst (Imaging Informatics) until 30 June 2019.
The Digital Healthcare Strategic Program includes a range of ICT initiatives that support achievement of the Digital Strategy. One key project within the Program is the Imaging informatics Project, focusing on the replacement of the medical imaging technology solution; including the Radiology Information System (RIS) and Picture Archiving and Communication System (PACS).
The objectives of the Imaging Informatics Project, is to ensure the legacy RIS/PACS is replaced with a modern medical imaging and multi-disciplinary solution, capable of supporting paediatric medical imaging functions such acquisition, workflow, storage and the viewing of multi-disciplinary images.

Reporting to the Project Manager, Imaging Informatics, the Principal Business Analyst prime responsibility is to lead, manage and undertake the identification, analysis and documentation of current state and future state business processes and requirements, including business process modelling, within a large and complex ICT environment, ensuring the delivery of valued, integrated and effective business solutions to program/project(s).

Manage system design, specification, configuration, unit testing and maintenance of solutions
Consult with and provide expert advice to the business owners in relation to ongoing enhancement and development of corporate system applications.
Lead, support and mentor business analysts and senior business analysts in analysing and providing effective solutions to complex system problems
Provide strategic and expert advice to management on application and associated issues and initiatives including risk and issue identification and management.
Manage system updates and upgrades, including the development of functional specifications and other solution documentation, and business cases for system maintenance and enhancements.
Initiate, influence and maintain relationships with team members, other project teams, stakeholders and client groups to develop and maintain effective working relationships and the integrity of the overall integrated solution.
Contribute to effective, client focussed teamwork by developing an understanding of the roles and duties of team members within the team and across the organisation, and working collaboratively to achieve outcomes with a commitment to quality and customer service.

description:
If you have initiative, experience and a desire to produce outstanding results, we want to hear from you.

This is a fantastic opportunity for a talented and motivated digital BA to be part of the team working on a high profile mobile projects for key clients.

You will be responsible for the gathering and qualification of business requirements and the creation of all associated documentation. You will work as an integral part of an agile project team to deliver apps that are truly great.

What the role involves

This is a great opportunity to showcase your digital BA skills and apply it to mobile software development.
Liaise directly with key business users and stakeholders to gather and understand their requirements and work with design and development resources to build a solution to meet those needs
Elicit and document all business and technical requirements
Work with mobile product owners to prioritise, estimate and manage functionality within the product backlog
Create formal user stories based on functional and nonfunctional requirements, and coordinate with development and test teams to ensure all relevant scenarios and business rules are captured.
Effectively communicate with a range of stakeholders throughout delivery to ensure a common and consistent understanding of the project's functional requirements
Undertake competitor and market analysis as required
Input into the creation of user flows and user personas
What we are looking for

Demonstrated experience across the software development lifecycle
Solid background in Business Analysis with a focus in digital-related projects, preferably mobile related (iOS and/or Android)
Extremely strong stakeholder engagement skills
Experience using Agile methodologies to document requirements, such as writing stories in BDD format
Experience using development workflow tools such as JIRA, Mingle etc.
Commercially savvy and proactive
Demonstrate excellent decision making and judgment skills
Demonstrate high levels of integrity and professionalism
Formal education in computer science or related field
There are some key non-technical attributes that are important to us

Passion for mobile technology
Basic understanding of software service layers
Positive, proactive and team-oriented attitude
Desire to learn and share with the team
Enthusiasm towards the role and in general the app development industry
High attention to detail
We are smart thinkers. We solve complex challenges and provide complete solutions for businesses, big and small. From design thinking, leading mobile apps, cloud and analytical insights, digital marketing, to web design. Arq Group is Australia’s leading digital partner.

#LifeatArq

Our people are our greatest asset. Curiosity is in our DNA. Courage is in our hearts. And collaboration is at our core. “Our Ways” set us apart from others in how we deliver to our customers and work together. From wellness programs, learning and development, social calendars to coffee machines, and more. We've got something for everyone to be themselves. Did we also mention how much fun it is to work with other Arqadians? And yes, it is true; we love what we do. Join Arq Group and find your space to (change).

At Arq Group, we unleash the possibilities between business and people.
title: Digital Business Analyst

description:
Top Newcastle location
Permanent role with an immediate start
Fast paced, growing company with a great team culture
About the Company

As a leading company within their field this client has been growing and now encompasses a number of businesses across Australia. They are now seeking to begin a transformation program in order to use technology to differentiate themselves and implement a new core system. This will assist in providing the highest level of customer service and business processes to meet their diverse needs of their client base.

About the Role

This is an excellent opportunity for an experienced Senior Business Analyst to work with a significant CRM implementation within the IT team. You will work as the conduit between senior stakeholders, core business units and the project team to elicit information, define requirements, provide business analysis, outline solutions and business project initiatives.

You will define and communicate the key requirements, principles and models that describe the business process and practices - current and future state, to enable evolution where appropriate and support continuous improvement. Further to this you will work with the technology partners to configure the solution so knowledge of data extraction, modelling and reporting would be required.

Your ability to be resourceful, think conceptually and proactively form professional relationships with executives, managers, subject matter experts and end users is critical to the success of this project. You will actively engage with end users and stakeholders in clearly documenting, base lining and tracking requirements through to implementation and user training.
This is a permanent role, with an immediate start based in Newcastle. There may be some travel required to other locations across Australia.

Skills & Experience Required

Qualifications in Information Technology and Business Analysis (BABoK)
Significant experience working as a Business Analyst covering CRM Implementation Projects (SAP/Oracle/Microsoft Dynamics)
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills allowing you to work productively with a diverse range of stakeholders
Capacity to manage relationships with vendors as well as internal stakeholder expectations
A continuous improvement mindset with the ability to deal with changing priorities
Like to know more?

To submit your application, please apply online using the appropriate link below. Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please contact Clare Weir on 02 4927 2223, quoting Ref No. 2Q/04915.

Your interest will be treated in the strictest of confidence.
title: Senior Business Analyst - CRM

description:
Newly created role within an industry leader

Established Tech Business with solid growth

About Our Client
Founded 30 years ago, EMS B&K are a dynamic global technology business with offices in Denmark, Spain, Taiwan & the USA, providing real time environmental monitoring to a global portfolio of clients across a diverse range of industries including: International airports, Resources, Power Transmission & Transport.

With their market leading algorithms developed over 15 years they are widely acknowledged as being experts in their field enabling their clients to maximise their business operations within environmental constrains while minimising the environmental impact of their activities

Job Description
Partnering with operational and financial stakeholders both internally and externally you will report directly with the CFO creating and presenting analysis to the executive team that will help steer key business decisions, duties will include:

Assisting in the creation, production and improvement of board reports
Partnering with and presenting analysis to internal Executive leadership and senior JV stakeholders
Carrying out Sales, pricing and volume analysis
Offering financial support for future M&A activities
Creating and improving forecasting and cash modelling
Taking a lead role in business and financial process improvements
The Successful Applicant
Your passion and experience partnering with senior operational and financial stakeholders performing critical business and financial analysis, will be rewarded with a highly diverse role that will influence environmentally critical decisions globally. You will be a highly motivated and driven analytics professional with previous experience partnering with and presenting complex financial and business analysis to senior stakeholders. Additionally, you will possess:

Full CA/CPA qualification
Strong influencing skills
Experience working in a similar role within a commercial environment
Demonstrably strong MS excel skills, experience creating VBA looked upon favourably
Experience partnering with senior stakeholders across finance, technology and sales departments essential
What's on Offer
Operating within a dynamic, fast paced environment your work will influence key commercial business decisions while offering you the opportunity to demonstrate and develop your analytical and business partnering strengths as a key member within a market leading organisation.

Contact:
Jack Betton
title: Business Analyst - Global Technology - Partner with Senior Stakeholders

description:
My federal government client is seeking several experienced Business Analysts with exposure to or hands on experience in MS CRM Dynamics projects!

Duties:
Developing business/system requirements
Mapping of current and future state business processes
Identification of business and process improvement
Conducting, performing and documenting a comprehensive gap analysis.
Assist in developing the acceptance criteria for any new solution(s).
Assist in user acceptance, system, penetration and end to end testing, including developing the required testing scenarios as required.
Assist in conducting thorough business analysis and in developing a suite of BA artefacts such as entity relationship diagrams, business process diagrams, operating models, use cases, class diagrams and more.
Decommissioning Legacy Systems
Systems integration across back end systems
Configuration in Dynamics 365
Skills and experience required:
Minimum 3+ years’ experience as a business analyst
System analysis for decommission of legacy systems
Experience in workshopping with business for eliciting business needs and requirements.
Developing and formalising business requirements as good quality user stories in line with the AGILE framework.
Experience in developing and formalising current states models, future states models, business process models, standard operating models, entity relationship models, class diagrams and comprehensive end to end multiple level process diagrams.
Experience in Systems integration across back end systems
Ability to develop, maintain and nurture excellent relationships with fellow team members and business stakeholders.
Experience in Dynamics 365 functionality/configuration specialist is highly desired
Australian Citizenship is required - Baseline Security Clearance is an advantage.

To be considered for this role, respond to this advertisement or contact Ilahna at AUREC on 02 6162 9611.
title: CRM Dynamics Business Analyst

description:
I am working with a large aviation organisation to find an SAP Business Analyst.

This is an initial contract until 30 June 2019. This role can be located in either Canberra, Melbourne or Brisbane

You will have proven experience of at least 8 years in analysing and mapping business process in all aspects of ICT projects. You will also have:
SAP Business Analysis experience - which must include SuccessFactors experience
Knowledge of the aviation industry (highly desirable) - in particular, Airport and airline operations
To have your application considered, you will:
Be either an Australian citizen or a Permanent Resident
Have SAP Business Analysis experience - which must include SuccessFactors experience

If this role sounds of interest to you, please APPLY NOW. Or for more information, please contact Aimee Goff on aimee.goff @igniteservices .com
title: SAP Business Analyst - SuccessFactors
